Endar Spire - Command Module
Bastila's escape pod's already gone, so there's no reason for us to stick around here and get shot by the Sith. Now come on - there'll be time for questions later!
You made it just in time! There's only one active escape pod left. Come on, we can hide out on the planet below!
I'm a soldier with the Republic, like you. We're the last two crew members left on the Endar Spire.
Be careful! There's a whole squad of Sith Troopers on the other side of that door! You need to find some way to thin their numbers.
You could reprogram the damaged assault droid to help you, if you have enough repair parts.
Or you could use computer spikes to slice into the terminal and use the Endar Spire's security systems against the Sith.
First, make sure you have a stealth field generator equipped on your belt. You can't use your stealth skill without one.
But be careful. There's a Sith patrol just down the corridor. Use your STEALTH skill to sneak past him.
Bastila's escape pod is away - you're the last surviving crew member of the Endar Spire! I can't wait for you much longer; you have to get to the escape pods!
You're the last Republic survivor on the Endar Spire! You have to get off the ship!
This is Carth Onasi on your personal communicator. I'm tracking your position through the Endar Spire's life support systems.
How do I know I can trust you?
Who are you?
[Security Lockdown. Access code required.]
[Security Lockdown. Hostiles in close proximity. Access denied.]
Bastila's not here on the bridge - they must have retreated to the escape pods! We better head that way too.
STAR WARS Knights of the Old Republic is a real-time turn based game. Each time you issue a command to a character they will carry out that action over the course of a three-second round.
Pressing a button multiple times won't make you perform commands any faster, but it will put that command into the action queue that appears to the left of the portrait of the selected character.
At the start of the next round the character will perform the next action in the que. You can have up to 3 commands in your action que.
Remember, it can take up to 3 rounds, or 9 seconds, for the last command entered into the action queue to take effect. If the queue is full new commands will overwrite previous commands.

You're injured! You better use that medpac you equipped in your quickslot. First, you have to select the character you want to use the medpac on.
Press the [WHITE] button to unpause.

Use the black button to cycle through the party members until you see your portrait highlighted at the bottom of the screen, then press the corresponding trigger to use the item in the quickslot.
Press the [WHITE] button to unpause.
Press "A" when the desired target is highlighted, then press the white button to unpause the game. You will throw your grenade once the action resumes.
Combat uses a pause and play system. Press the white button to pause and unpause the game so you can issue commands to your characters.
While paused you can still use the D-pad and black button to cycle through targets and party members.
Any commands you issue to your party while paused will go into an action queue. When you resume gameplay the commands will fire in the order you selected them.
The game is paused right now. In pause mode, set up your main character to throw a grenade at one of the Sith Troopers. Press "BACK" to resume the game after you issue your commands.
We'll be fighting in close quarters on the bridge. You better equip a melee weapon before we go through that door.
Just press [START] to bring up your menus and go to the EQUIP screen. Then set up items in your quickslots the same way you would equip weapons or armor.
During normal gameplay, press the left or right trigger to use the corresponding quickslot.
Highlight one of your quickslots and press "A" to bring up a list of available items. Grenades, medpacs and similar items can be equipped by highlighting the desired item and pressing "A".
Using a quickslot from the main screen does not pause the game, and is more convenient than using the EQUIP or INVENTORY screens. Everyone in the party shares the same two quickslots.
The bridge is just beyond that door. You better equip your melee weapon. There isn't much room on the bridge, and it's suicide to use a blaster in close quarters.
Your melee weapon is made using a cortosis weave. It's strong enough to stand up against anything, even a lightsaber.
Remember, you can access your map and other important menus by pressing the [START] button. Then use the triggers to scroll to the MAP screen.
Use the left trigger to scroll to the MAP screen. This shows your current location and the direction you are facing, as well as notes marking important locations in the area.
The corridor branches off. You better check your map to make sure we're going the right way!
To use a computer simply target the terminal and press "A". This will bring up a computer screen with a list of commands you can enter at that terminal.
Just target the computer and press "A" to slice into it.
The higher your computer skill, the less spikes it will take to override the system. The number of spikes to perform an action is displayed beside each command.
Sometimes you will select an option that is not possible. In this case you will get a message saying "SPIKE REJECTION". You will not lose your spikes in this case.
Okay, the maintenance droid is here, but he's damaged too! Don't worry, you can use your droid repair skills and some repair parts to fix him.
Switch to me and use my repair skills on that disabled droid. Maybe I can reprogram it to ram the door open for us.
Maybe you can use your repair skill to reprogram that disabled droid to ram the door open for us.
To use your repair skill on a disabled droid, target the droid and press "A". This will bring up a list of actions you can program in, and the number of repair parts the choice will require.
Simply target the disabled droid and press "A" to get the repair options to appear. Fixing droids uses up repair parts.
The harder something is to repair or reprogram, the more parts you need. The higher your repair skill, the less parts you need.
The door's jammed! It must have been damaged during the attack - we'll have to figure out a way to get past it.
Switch to me and use my computer skill on that terminal to see if I can override the system and open the door.
Use that computer terminal to see if you can slice into the system and order up a maintenance droid to fix the door for us.
We have to get to the bridge.
This is Carth Onasi - the Sith are threatening to overrun our position! We can't hold out long against their firepower! All hands to the bridge!
That was Carth contacting us on our portable communicators. He's one of the Republic's best pilots! He's seen more combat than the rest of the Endar Spire's crew put together.
If he says things are bad, you better believe it. We have to get to the bridge to help defend Bastila!
Now that the door's open you better take the lead again.
Target the door using the thumbsticks or the triggers. When the targeting circle is focused on the door, you'll see the icons in the ACTION MENU at the bottom left of the screen have changed.

If the character you control has the security skill it will appear in the action menu. Use the D-pad to scroll up and down to select the SECURITY option, then press "A". If your skill is high enough, the door will open.
Use the D-pad to cycle through the action until SECURITY is highlighted, then press <abutton>. Remember, the SECURITY icon only appears if you're controlling a character with the SECURITY skill.
That door's locked. I don't have the codes to open it, but switch me to the party leader so you can use my security skills to slice into the access panel and open the door.
That door's locked, and I don't have the codes to open it. You'll have to use your security skill on it if we want to get past.
To use an item like a medpac - or to use a feat, skill or Force power - you'll need to know how to use your ACTION MENU.
The [START] button bring ups the menu screens you used before. Use the triggers to cycle through until you reach the EQUIP screen. It shows a portrait of the character you currently control.
Use the triggers to bring up the shared party INVENTORY screen. There is no limit to the number of items your party can carry. Special plot items are stored in a separate inventory.
Your entire party shares the same inventory. There is no limit to the number of items you can carry. If you drop an item from your inventory it is gone from the game.
Use the D-pad to highlight a desired item in your inventory and see its description. Press "A" to use this item on the character you are currently controlling.
You can only use items - like medpacs - on the character you are controlling. You can cycle through the party portraits with the black button to change the character you control.
When you press the [START] button the game will unpause and return to the main screen. Items will activate in the order that you selected them from your inventory.
I've got a feeling that won't be our last battle with the Sith. Good thing we have medpacs to heal our wounds. It might be a good idea to use one now before our next battle.
Now that the door's open you better take the lead again.
You always control the leader of the party. You can switch who is the party leader by pressing <blbutton>.
Press <blbutton> now to switch me to the party leader, then use me to open the door. Simply target the door, then press <abutton> to open it.
Okay, let's move out.
Because of the attack this room is in lockdown, but don't worry - I've got the override codes. You'll have to use me to unlock the door.
You can access your journal, map and other important menus by pressing the [START] button.
You can then pull the left trigger to scroll through the menus listed on the tabs at the top of the screen.
The QUEST screen displays the entries in your electronic journal, including important quest information. Pressing "A" brings up more details about a highlighted entry.
You will hear a message alert whenever you get a new entry in your journal. Check the map and journal entries in your personal datapad before we continue, then talk to me again.
I've uploaded some information into your electronic journal.
Take a look at your journal before we go on. We need to be prepared for whatever the Sith throw at us.
Use the EQUIP screen to equip the armor and weapons from your inventory. You can access this by pressing the [START] button on your controller.
Use the D-pad to cycle through your inventory slots. The menu on the right displays items you can equip in each slot.
Press <abutton> to select an inventory slot, then scroll through the available items and press <abutton> to equip one.
Remember - press [START] to access the EQUIP screen and pause the game. Pressing [START] again will unpause and return you to the main game. Speak to me after you equip your items.
Come on, we have to hurry! The Sith might already be boarding the ship to try and capture Bastila.
Put your equipment on so we can get out of here.
Now that you have your equipment you need to speak to me again. Use the triggers to cycle your targeting circle until it's on me then press "A".

Kashyyyk - Czerka Landing Port
Observation: You should have brought the Wookiee Zaalbar, despite the smell. He would have knowledge of this place, master.
Answer: Agreed, but he is the most familiar with Kashyyyk. That is a simple fact.
Retort: "A long time" is still more frequent than "never," which is how many times the rest of us have been here, master.
Hmph. Maybe we should have brought the Wookiee out. This place looks... untamed.
Are you afraid of the wild, Mandalore? Are you a coward?
Mandalorians are not cowards! We're just practical.
It is always good to know as much as possible about a world, and to have a reliable guide. Perhaps we should get Zaalbar to accompany us.
As you will.
A reliable guide through the intricate complexities of another culture can be invaluable.
Perhaps you should reconsider leaving Zaalbar behind. This is, after all, his homeworld.
Is this about power, then? You would rather make a decision for the sake of making it than make it wisely?
I am only suggesting that both we and Zaalbar would benefit from his company while on Kashyyyk. You do want to find the Star Map, don't you?
We know very little of this planet. I also sense that Zaalbar has much that is unresolved here... it may be beneficial to aid him in this respect.
The Wookiee was looking pretty agitated back in the ship. You think it's wise to leave him unattended?
I agree, but he could prove useful. He'd certainly know the place. And I wouldn't mind keeping an eye on him.
He looked like there was something he needed to do. Besides, we don't know this planet. He could prove useful.
Good or bad, he's got to have some interest in Kashyyyk. I'd rather have him with us.
Zaalbar should be here. He shouldn't miss this. He needs to know he can come back here.
I'm not saying that I know better than you, but this is Zaalbar's home. Don't you think he'd know some things?
Besides, he's got things here he needs to take care of.
I can't talk for Big Z, but believe me, he should be with us. He's got... unfinished business here.
Kashyyyk... my home. I should have prepared you for coming here... but I don't know if I've prepared myself.
Don't mock me, this is hard. Mission may have told you I was taken from here by slavers... but there is more.
I didn't leave Kashyyyk voluntarily. Mission must have told you how I was fleeing slavers... but there was more.
I am an exile. The slavers on Kashyyyk only took me after I was forced to leave my village home, 20 years ago.
Then stumble blindly. I won't speak of it again until it is in your face.
My brother made deals with the slavers and allowed them to get a foothold. I found out and attacked him.
The fight was stopped, but my father did not believe me when I told him about my brother's actions.
I was made an exile, disowned by my home and people. I should not be here. They will not accept me back.
The slavers are still here... this dock is theirs. I doubt anyone has risen to try and fight. Nothing has changed.
I just hope I can prove myself to my people. It will be difficult to make them listen. I just don't know.
When I attacked my brother I was so mad... I used my claws. You don't understand what that means to a Wookiee.
Our claws are tools, not weapons. To use them in battle is to become an animal. It is madness without honor.
I am forever a madclaw in the eyes of my people. Nothing I say is to be trusted. They were right to cast me out.
I don't have much hope.
I decide who comes or stays on the ship.
He has been away a long time.
I decide who comes or stays on the ship.
What do you mean?
I decide who comes or stays on the ship.
What do you mean?
I decide who comes or stays on the ship.
What do you mean?
I decide who comes or stays on the ship.
What do you mean?
It's a little late for warnings, fur ball.
Prepared me? What do you mean?
I don't care, I'll learn what I need myself.
Why were you forced to leave?
That's enough. I'll learn the rest on my own.
Time has passed. Things will have changed.
Why didn't your father believe you?
We'll deal with that if we have to. Let's go.
Don't bother me. You're on your own here.
I'm not paid to talk. Take it to the captain or the stiffs in the office.
I just carry a blaster. The captain does the talking.
Talk to the captain, not me.
Still here? Why do you keep bothering me? All our services are up near the docking area.
Fine then, move along.
Make it quick. I'm no information booth. Talk to Janos in the Czerka office.
Hold here, spacer. Czerka Corporation doesn't recommend traveling in wild Edean. Katarn attacks are especially bad right now.
Wookiee hunters usually keep numbers down, but I think they leave certain areas infested, just hoping a Czerka guard will get killed.
I won't stop you, but you leave this area at your own risk. We're here to protect the company, not you.
Go to Janos for company policy. I just man the gate to make sure people like you know you're on your own on the other side.
I don't talk to Wookiee-lovers. Get rid of your rug and maybe I won't have you shot.
I don't take kindly to threats. Don't test me, spacer, we've more than enough firepower to bury you here.
That's right you will. Now get moving.
Make it quick. I'm getting tired of you.
[Success] Ah, you ain't so bad. Was there anything else you needed?
[Failure] What are you doing? Are you making fun of me? Don't push your luck, fool.
What's to tell? They're big, powerful, difficult, and worth the most when caged and shipped off this forest-covered rock.
You're not some anti-slaver, are you? If so, go talk your crud somewhere else. I've seen guards ripped to shreds. They're animals.
Watch yourself out there. There won't be any rescue missions if you go missing.
Not anymore. Look, you want to know why the Wookiees are acting compliant, you go ask them.
When they rip your head off, we'll fish it out of the Shadowlands and give it a proper burial. How about that?
Shipped as slaves to work as soldiers and heavy laborers in Czerka camps, no doubt.
That's horrible! You wouldn't talk like that if Big Z was here!
You're the Wookiee-lover, why don't you tell me about them? I'm sure you're real close friends.
Grraarrr!
Keep your pet on a leash or you'll be wearing him. I've no love for these animals. I've seen guards ripped to shreds.
Never mind. I'm leaving.
I have questions for you.
I'm going past you. I paid the landing fee.
Don't get in my way. You'll wind up dead.
What can you tell me about Czerka Corporation?
Maybe I should just let him rip your arms off.
Yes, yes, you're big and tough. I'll leave.
I meant nothing by it. Could you answer my questions?
Should I care? You are nothing to me.
[Force Persuade] You haven't warned me. I'm a nice person. You like me.
[Persuade] I'm just trying to get my bearings. I don't mean any harm.
What do you know about the Wookiees?
That's all. Goodbye.
So the Wookiees are fighting back?
You're probably here with the new restraining collars. I'm not handling another shipment without them.
Three restraining collars failed on the last shipment. The buyer was not pleased.
You'd think they'd be grateful to leave this barbaric place.
I wasn't aware we were giving tours now. Leave me.
Speak with the director if you need information. I only deal with volume buyers.
I don't have time to deal with you.
I don't deal with individual buyers. I'll have my broker contact your people.
Please leave me. I've contracts to decipher.
Hello again. Czerka Corporation is seeing a lot of return business these days. We are the only company offering Wookiees.
Welcome to Edean. I trust you will find our facilities pass inspection. Czerka Corporation is very efficient.
Please, take any inquiries you have to director Janos. I must continue my work.
Farewell.
I'm sorry, but director Janos will see to your questions. I must continue with my work.
I'm conducting experiments on various samples of indigenous plant life. There may be untapped pharmaceutical resources here.
Of course, that will take some time, and the Wookiees are a more immediate source of income. Please, I must return to my work.
There's no call for that. I'm just a glorified lab technician. Please, the assignment is difficult enough.
Take your concerns to Janos. He's the one that runs things here. Not me.
You have nothing to be proud of, fool.
I'm sorry, I don't understand Wookieespeak. Shyriiwook, I think it's called? What did the Wookiee say?
I didn't say that!
What are you doing? Stop this!
Call him off! I don't have anything to do with what happens on this planet. I'm just a glorified lab technician!
What was that about? I don't like being used for your amusement.
Grrr... I remember.
I don't have much hope of that.
I suppose so... but their presence here is no joke.
I'm not sure I can answer. Janos is the spokesman for Czerka Coporation at this outpost.
I just work here in the lab. I... I don't have anything to do with the taking of slaves.
I don't have to justify myself to you. I do good work here. If you're looking for trouble, go somewhere else.
I'm just an employee. You'll have to take your concerns to Janos. He's the voice for Czerka Corporation on this outpost.
Czerka Corporation calls the planet Edean, and no, I don't understand the language. The local Wookiee leader has made it so we don't need to.
Wookiees are unable to speak basic, but for the last decade the residents of all local villages have been trained to understand it.
I understand he works very closely with Czerka Corporation. He wants his people to work well with us. It eases tensions.
It helps ease tensions. They are less hostile towards us if they understand what we say.
And it makes my people more desirable as slaves.
What did he say? I don't usually have a translator I can ask.
Just leave me alone. I don't want any trouble. The guards are trigger-happy as it is.
I can't talk now. I've got to pack. They'll be on us soon!
Goodbye for now.
I want to ask questions about this planet.
I'm asking you. Answer my questions, peon!
What is your job here?
You'll talk as long as I say, understand?
He wants to rip your legs off and beat you with them.
See? He's furious. I can barely control him.
Don't question me. Remember your life debt.
I'm just scaring him. Maybe he'll learn something.
What? Don't you want these fools to fear you?
Ignore him. I have some questions for you.
He said you have nothing to be proud of working for Czerka.
Whatever you say. I have some questions.
How convenient. All the benefits with no guilt.
Why don't you do anything to stop it?
You work on Kashyyyk and don't understand the language?
Why would a Wookiee leader do that?
What good would that do?
That knowing Basic just makes his people better slaves.
Watch yourself. We don't need anyone agitating the locals.
Take a walk, spacer. You don't look like a big buyer to me.
If you've business with Czerka Corporation, take it to the director's office.
Keep walking. This ain't no holiday port of call.
Czerka Corporation should burn down some trees. Make room for some swoop races.
This assignment is the worst in the galaxy.
You want to arrange a purchase, go talk to the director in his office.
Move along, spacer.
I think you'd better talk to Eli directly. He's the boss... for the time being.
Greetings to you. Something I can get for you?
Kindly direct your inquiries to me. Matton is merely an indebted employee. His opinions don't amount to much.
That Thaylian bog-slime. Do you know that I have been here 36 days, slaving to pay a debt in good faith?
All for nothing. He killed my crew... who knows where my ship is. Well, there's your pay, Eli. Blaster fire, and keep the change.
Well, I could have shot out his legs and let him crawl around for a while, but I consider this far more merciful.
What did you expect I'd do? Besides, he'd have killed me. He couldn't have risked me telling everyone he was a cheat. He'd have no business.
Well, there's not much for me to do but stay here. I've no ship, so I may as well make a few credits.
I suppose it does, though maybe I should keep it up for a while on my own. I've no ship at the moment anyway.
It'll probably take a while to convince Eli's suppliers that I'm the new boss, but eventually I'll buy my way off this rock.
That's the idea. Actually, I should toss you a few credits for helping me out. Take them... maybe even spend them here.
What do you mean? I don't need to go hunting Eli's family or anything. I've seen justice done.
All right then. Here, I should toss you a few credits for helping. I appreciate what you did.
[Success] Working here when I was trapped was hell enough. Staying here now is just foolish. I don't want to be seen as weak.
[Failure] I'd rather move on, you know? I don't want to be mad about this for the rest of my life. I can make this work.
[Success] You know, maybe you're right. Why should I bother with this remote hole? This isn't the life I wanted.
I see your point. I'll leave his shop like his corpse. I'll take what I want, buy passage on a ship, and never look back except to spit.
Here, take this. Thanks for reminding me about how he misused my trust. I'll make sure it never happens again. With anyone.
Well, that's your opinion, I guess, but I still owe you for helping me. Here, take a few credits with you. Spend them here, if you like.
Safe flying to you. Hope to see you again.
All right then. Actually, I feel I owe you something. Here, take a few credits. If you spend it here, all the better. I think things are looking up.
Hello again. Welcom back to Eli Gand's outpost, now under new management. What do you need?
Right you are.
Thanks for your help, friend. I'm getting off this planet as soon as I can. I'll pay my own way, too. No more debts to anyone.
No more trusting anyone, either. I've learned what that gets you.
Did you have to kill him?
What will you do now?
I suppose that closes his little outpost here.
And you won't owe anyone a single credit. Good luck.
If it were me, I'd wipe out all memory of him.
Never mind. Goodbye.
Fine, fine. Just show me what's for sale.
[Force Persuade] Remember your hatred. Don't trap yourself here.
[Persuade] It's not enough. This store was his life. Let it rot.
Sounds like a boring choice to me. Goodbye.
In that case, let's see what's for sale.
I don't want anything right now, thanks.
You're still here? I'd never be so forgiving.
Let's see what you have for sale.
Hello again. What can I do for you, most valued customer?
Valued until you can't pay. Watch your credits.
You hurt me, Matton. It is the debt of your crew that keeps you here, not me.
So, new spacers have come to wild Kashyyyk? Please, look well upon the wares of Eli Gand. I live to serve your needs.
Just be sure to pay cash. The interest on his loans will drain you like a Deluvian fatworm on a Hutt's backside.
First off, Hutts are ALL backside. Secondly, I don't much like the comparison. No need to get personal. It's just business.
Poor fellow, he's been waiting for his friends to return with my money for a standard month now. Ah, but you don't need to hear of this. What can I get you?
See you soon, I hope. Always open.
We're always open... for now, at least.
Enslave? I resent that. Simply fair business. This man's fellows left without settling their debts, so he must make up the difference.
I know, I know, it's standard trading rules. I just want to know where my crew went. I was only gone for two days. This isn't like them.
Yes, very sad that they would abandon you, especially while you were doing me a favor and helping repair one of my freighters.
You think you know someone, and they turn out to be a cheat. Oh, not like you, Matton. You honor your deals. A word is a bond in trade.
Of course. I am here to serve.
Oh, it isn't about the amount. After all, as a skilled mechanic, Matton is worth much more than what is owed. Especially on this remote planet.
Oh, you flatter me, Eli. I guess we're best buddies now.
*ahem* As I was saying, it's a matter of principle. I am nothing if not honest in my dealings, and I demand the same.
He will be free to go when his friends turn up and the debt is paid. I honor my deals. Let no one say otherwise.
Thanks, but no thanks. No offense, but there's no point in exchanging debt to Eli with debt to you.
Besides, he is a hard worker. I'd prefer to keep him.
Ah, it happens from time to time. Credits are scarce out here, and not everyone is as honest as Mister Dasol here.
You'll get your money. My crew will be back.
Of course they will. Until then, however, I can make use of you as a mechanic. Very rare to find skills of your kind out here.
No, they're not. An honest man is pretty scarce, too, wouldn't you say?
An honest man and a good mechanic. Seems like you got a favorable trade, sir.
Something about this whole situation stinks worse than an overcrowded ronto stable! What kind of friends would just abandon a crew mate?
I don't concern myself with what goes on past this landing port. The Wookiees are *ahem*... very difficult to deal with. No business sense.
He means they don't tolerate cheats.
No, I mean they don't respect the finer points of a good business plan. Give and take. That is why the Czerka Corporation simply takes.
You'd have to take your questions to Czerka Corporation, and the Wookiees themselves. I keep to myself.
It is difficult indeed to deal with those you oppress and enslave.
No business sense? You mean they don't like to be cheated out of all their belongings and freedom.
You mean they don't tolerate cheats!
I know I'll be leaving soon. it's too unstable now. Maybe I could talk my way into dealing with the Wookiees, but it's risky.
Yeah, it turns out Wookiees don't want to be slaves. Like most people.
That's enough, Matton.
<< Enter text here >>
Of course. You are in a hurry.
Certainly, though my stock may be a little thin. I'm having trouble with a trade contact on Korriban.
Have a look, but if you see kolto, the price is not negotiable. My prices have risen like everywhere else.
Yes, maybe I have something of interest. I know your tastes are fine. I recognize you as race champion of Manaan.
Where? Ah, you mean the lower forest? I don't pay attention to what these Wookiees call it. A droid you say?
What... what kind of droid?
Now, now, Matton, it's likely just some old service droid lost by the Czerka Corporation. I wouldn't waste my time on it.
I really want to see this thing. This sounds very odd.
You get excited over hearsay. There is no droid, no proof of anything. Get back to work.
What? I'd really like to see this droid.
You startle my friend here needlessly. He has work to do and I won't have any more talk of this upsetting him. Understand?
I doubt it. I don't even want to look at it. I deal in trade of goods, not garbage.
Droid head? On Kashyyyk? Let me see that!
It is nothing, I'm certain. Eh... just garbage from the forest floor.
Mere rubbish? It's D-A02, the repair droid from my ship! What was this doing in the forest?
Eli, you snake! You said my crew jacked the ship without paying the repair bill!
Oh, there will be a reward, all right. Eli! You told me my crew jacked our ship without paying the repair bill!
Well... that is... eh... it's not how it looks. You see, a good mechanic is hard to find and...
And what? I thought I owed you! You tricked them into the Shadowlands and killed them all while I fixed your freighter in orbit!
Now keep your head, Matton. It was just business.
This is business? Maybe in Hutt Space, but not here! Not with me!
You outsiders even cheat each other! No wonder you give no thought to my people!
Whatever your Wookiee is saying, he's not helping diffuse the situation. This is just a simple business matter.
I've no business with you. I'll be going.
Do you always enslave your debtors?
I want to go back to my other questions.
How much debt buys a man's life?
Perhaps I could settle some of his debt?
Do your debtors have a habit of running off?
What do you know of Kashyyyk?
What do you mean by that?
Let me see what you carry.
I found a droid in the Shadowlands. Is it yours?
It recorded a very suspicious incident.
It had been damaged in some sort of ambush.
Could it be worth something?
I found this droid head. Can I ask you about it?
It recorded an ambush. Someone yells Eli's name.
What do I care? Is there a reward?
Greetings again. How can Czerka Corporation serve you during your visit to Edean?
I'm sorry, but I have no information on that. Are you sure you meant to come here? This world is very primitive.
Czerka Corporation has branches in many systems, mostly concerned with weapon production for personal and ship-mounted use.
Of course, the many outposts on this world are only concerned with bio-aquisitions.
G5-623 is the numerical designation. The galactic Basic name is "Edean," chosen by corporate ballot among stockholders.
At any rate, "Edean" is more pleasing than "Kashyyyk." The language of the dominant indigenous species is quite crude.
In fact, a translation droid must usually be placed with them, but their physical strength makes up for the inconvenience to the owner.
An endless array of dangerous creatures, it seems. The great trees harbor any number of dangers below.
We've detected odd energy signatures on occasion, but exploration is costly amongst creatures even more difficult than Wookiees.
We send expeditions, of course, but they come back with little, if they come back at all.
Odd energy signatures? Have you ever checked those out?
It would seem you are already acquainted with this world, given your choice of traveling companion.
I have been away for a very long time.
You let the beast speak for you? You allow it more liberties than most of our customers.
I've a very limited number of things I can say. What do you wish to discuss?
Very good, feel free to inspect our operation here, but I would advise against going too far from the main landing area.
The planet is still very much untamed, and we do not send out patrols for lost tourists.
Oh, just say the word!
It's not up to you. This planet is not a member of the Republic, and its backward citizens hold no rights.
I'm sorry you are offended, but this operation is very humane. Even the Wookiee leadership knows it is more beneficial to work with us.
Besides, even if you did do something drastic here, the Czerka Corporation has other outposts on Edean. It would change nothing.
Humane, you call it? Beneficial? Sounds like a bunch of excuses, if you ask me.
It's not our place to judge, Carth. As he said, it would change nothing anyway.
Are you saying you approve of this?!
Of course not. I would gladly end it, had I the power. However, we are here for other reasons, if you will recall.
Slavery under any guise should not be tolerated!
For material goods, I would suggest you speak with the general vendor near the docking area. He keeps his store well-stocked.
They charge fair value for mundane goods and armor. If it is weapons you want, you will need to deal with the Czerka representative. That would be me.
If you're here to purchase local species, however, you must wait for a licensed Czerka Corporation trader to return from deliveries outside the system.
Aren't you here to take delivery of a Wookiee thrall? There are few other reasons to visit this barbaric world.
We do things as humanely as possible. There are other outposts, but the operation is very lean overall.
He means that they are slavers. They take my people from their homes and sell them to the highest bidder.
Your current Wookiee seems displeased with the situation, but I fail to see a concern. You seem to be a satisfied customer.
It is not me, personally. I merely represent Czerka Corporation at this outpost. There are other directors at other stations, of course.
Arrangements have been made with the Wookiee leadership. Harvesting is handled as delicately as possible, relatively speaking.
Ah, a very difficult thing to stage. I commend you for it. So much easier than relying on restraining collars.
Do not demean the life-debt! Do not!
I must warn you that you will be blamed for the actions of your Wookiee. Please... call him off.
I am merely a servant of the corporation! The Wookiee leadership is in agreement! Harvesting is made as delicate as possible!
Please! It is not my decision! It is... an acceptable practice, I assure you!
I will answer if I can.
Now, there's no c-call for that. It is a simple matter, really. We supply arms in exchange for a supply of healthy Wookiees.
We are kept profitable and an agreeable leader is kept in power. It keeps the process from becoming a constant firefight.
I believe his name is Chuundar. I don't deal directly with them, thank goodness. Far too brutish.
I don't know why you asked me these questions, but it doesn't matter. Chuundar is unquestioned as leader. Our operation is quite secure.
RrrrraaAAAARRRR!!!
[Success] I can tell you about the agreement. We supply arms in exchange for a supply of healthy Wookiees.
[Failure] It's not good policy to talk about our corporate strategy. I'm sorry, but I can't say any more.
[Success] If it will ease your temper, I will give specifics. We supply arms in exchange for a supply of healthy Wookiees.
Commentary: The meatbag speaks without clarity. Detail this agreement or the master will splatter your organs all over the floor!
Maybe you should start talking, or I might decide to get a little... restless.
[Force Persuade] You wish to tell us more about this agreement with the Wookiee leadership.
[Force Persuade] You wish to tell us more about this agreement with the Wookiee leadership.
[Force Persuade] Hmph. 'Harvesting'. Tell us about this agreement with the Wookiee leadership.
Please, follow me to my office in our information center. We will discuss your needs and how Czerka Corporation can serve you.
I greet you again. Will you accept the terms of landing at this outpost? We are quite far from any similar services.
Greetings to you. Err... while I am pleased to welcome you to planet G5-623, I do not see your ship on my docking schedule.
The Czerka Corporation will see to your needs, of course, but there will be a 100 credit docking fee. In advance, I fear.
I respect your... obvious determination, but I can't allow you to remain unless you pay the proper fees.
The Czerka Corporation appreciates your cooperation, and hopes this will not devolve into a... violent matter.
W-we are not unarmed here! We have many guards and security droids. If we can control Wookiees, we can control you.
[Failure] I fail to see the basis for your arguement. Please, there is no need to be hostile.
This outpost is remote and expensive to maintain. The 100 credits given will ensure that it remains here... for your use, of course.
Upon collection of the correct fees, I will extend what resources the Czerka Corporation can offer. I'm sure you understand.
Very simply put, no. Operation of these remote outposts is an expensive endeavor.
[Success] Perhaps you don't need to pay the docking fee. Any services you need will more than make up for it.
[Failure] No... no I'm... quite certain that you need to pay the fee. It is a mere 100 credits, after all.
[Success] *sigh* Normally I wouldn't do this, but I don't feel like arguing. I'll consider a promise of future business payment enough.
Czerka Corporation protects its interests. If you won't pay, you won't be granted access to the planet and are free to leave.
I will await you here if you change your mind.
That is unfortunate. This outpost will have to remain closed to you until you can secure the credits. I am sorry. Good day.
You are welcome on Edean, trade designation G5-623. Czerka Corporation welcomes your business. We should discuss your interests in my office.
We will also arrange for translation services, for a nominal fee, of course. You'll be encountering a number of Wookiees while here.
I see you have a Wookiee with you. Can I assume you understand their language? For a fee, Czerka Corporation can provide a translator for you during your visit.
Er... very well. It is no concern of mine. I will simply assume you are one of the rare sort that take to languages easily.
Very well, though only the most adaptive people seem to comprehend the Wookiee language, such as it is.
I don't have any experience with that. I just know that only the most adaptive people can understand the Wookiee language.
Now then, please follow me to our information center. I will answer any further questions there.
Well, we are limited in many ways, but I doubt you will find even basic facilities anywhere else in this remote sector.
That is what the dominant indigenous species calls this world, but maintaining this outpost grants Czerka Corporation naming rights in the trade guides.
But, I'm sorry, I really must insist that docking fees be paid before I impart any further services. I must follow proper procedure.
Farewell for now.
I'm looking for something called a Star Map.
I'd like to ask about the Czerka Corporation.
Bio-acquisitions? What do you mean?
Tell me about the planet. You called it G5-623 before.
What else is on this planet?
What did you mean when you referred to a Wookiee's "owner?"
To the owner? What do you mean?
I'd like to talk about the slaving operations here on Edean.
I'm through speaking with you for now.
What's to stop me turning my Wookiee loose on you?
I can't allow this to continue.
Allow it more liberties? What do you mean?
I need supplies. What is available here?
Purchase local species? What do you mean?
I'd think you would need more firepower to keep order.
Disgusting slaver! Why shouldn't I kill you!
Why do the Wookiees tolerate you doing this?
Zaalbar is no slave. He has pledged a life-debt to me.
Why? I should let him kill the lot of you!
I've other questions to ask.
Tell me what you mean or I'll bloody your floor!
What is this leader's name?
[Force Persuade] You want to tell me about these agreements.
[Persuade] Tell me about it. I might be more understanding if I know.
Don't make demands. I'm <FullName>, and I'll land where I wish.
It's easily settled. I'll pay with your blood!
[Force Persuade] I don't need to pay the docking fee. Stand aside!
Docking fee? Why do I need to pay that?
Is the price negotiable?
[Force Persuade] I don't think I need to pay the docking fee.
[Persuade/Lie] I represent wealthy clients. You should let me pass.
I refuse to pay. What will you do about it?
I can't pay you the 100 credits.
Very well, I will pay the 100 credit fee.
I understand more than you can know.
That will not be necessary.
I'm trained in the Force. I'll have no trouble.
What services does 100 credits get me?
Could I get some information about the planet? I thought this was Kashyyyk.
Death to all slavers! Kashyyyk will be free!
The outsiders will pay for how they dishonored us!
At last, we will push them off our beloved Kashyyyk!
The Shadowlands are too good for them! We'll kill them all!
These Czerka animals will die by sword and bowcaster!
Let their blood feed out forests! That will be their payment!
Let no one escape! They must learn the price we place on dishonor!
Kashyyyk will be ours once more!
You are the only outsider that will survive us! We swear it!
Czerka will never come back here, we will make certain!
We will remember what happend here. Slavers will not take us again.
If another company comes to Kashyyyk, they will find it impossible to do what Czerka did.
It will be a long time before we allow ourselves to be as weak as Chuundar made us.
Your presence is tolerated because of how you helped us, outsider.
Thank you for your assistance, outsider. I doubt we will meet another of your kind like you.
We will guard this landing place from now on. Yours is the only ship that will be allowed to dock here for a long time, outsider.
Our work here could be very important if any effort was put into it.
Local fauna is amazing. If I could isolate why the trees grow so big, it would be worth more than a thousand Wookiee slaves.
I think Czerka is missing an opportunity here. The forest could teach us so much.
The payoff from research is too much of a risk for Czerka to spend much money on it. Slaves are proven commodities.
There is so much to learn about this planet, but they keep us cooped up in here.
I do my job and keep my mouth shut. Maybe I can do some good if I stay out of people's way.
Don't bother me, now. I've got twice as many Wookiees to process as usual.
Hey! Don't get too close to the cages. Even these cowed Wookiees will take your arm off if they get the chance.
Heh, if we keep exporting at this rate, the only planet in the sector with no Wookiees will be their home world.
You know, I hear Czerka has negotiated to increase its presence here by six more outposts.
I heard the Wookiee leader is saying we can increase the number of slaves we take. I think Czerka will be here a long time.
I hear the Wookiees seem to be cooperating even more than usual now. Czerka can pretty much do whatever it wants.
Hey, business is better than ever. These animals will pay our way for years.
Hey, we just got word that shipments will be increasing. This Chuundar really knows how to do business.
You know, every Czerka outpost is expected to double the number of Wookiees they take in the next year.
Wookiees settle down a lot once they're caged.
It took ten days for news of Taris to reach me. They don't tell us anything.
I guess I should be grateful I'm on Kashyyyk. I could have been posted to Taris.
All those people on Taris dead. First I heard the whole planet was gone, but even just the city is sad.
Have you heard where the Sith might be headed next? I don't even know why they targetted Taris.
We get the occasional private trader from Korriban through here, but not recently. I wonder what's up.
Have you been by Korriban recently? The Sith there aren't planning on taking their trouble off-world, are they?
I heard something about trouble with Sith on Korriban, but as long as no cities are being destroyed, they can do what they like.
I don't mind being on a backwater planet when I hear about the trouble places like Korriban get.
You look a lot like the winner of the Manaan races. I bet that opens door for you.
I heard some rookie took the big prize at the Manaan swoop races. I guess anyone can win now that Taris is gone.
Is your ship equipped to get the major planetary broadcasts? I heard the Manaan races were pretty good.
Are you... no, there's no way a swoop champion is on Kashyyyk. No way.
If we don't get another shipment of kolto, we'll have to start using local herbs for healing. Then we'll hurt *and* stink.
Bring those Selkath here see if they think we need kolto. They'd start shipping it out quick, I bet.
This planet is the worst assignment to have with a kolto shortage coming up.
Czerka is making us put a deposit on standard issue kolto packs. I know the cost has gone up, but come on.
Another time, human. I wish you well on this world.
Greetings again to you, human. It would seem the call of the hunt has brought us both to this troubled world.
I have not been here long, but I can already see I will not be as welcome here as I had hoped.
It was a hard decision, but I felt I had no other choice. I had done a disservice to the apex predator of that world. It was time to go.
While I'm sure you would prove an interesting hunt, I don't track sentient prey. Two-legged animals do a fine job of killing each other without me.
I have come here to seek even greater prey than what we faced on Tatooine, but the climate here is politically cold, and I don't know if I will be allowed to hunt.
Farewell. Perhaps we will meet again. A great hunt on this world would be glorious.
I know that I don't know enough. Even from this docking area I can see this world is a true wonder. My desert-dimmed imagination didn't do it justice.
It's just a shame to see Czerka Corporation here. They lack an appreciation for the wild nature of this world. I don't like having to deal with them.
The native leadership of the Wookiees, of course. This is their world, after all. I can't understand why thy have allowed it to be misused.
There is always the option to fight, even if there is no option to win. Of course, that is easy for me to say, being an outsider.
I would hope they are not complicit in the enslaving of their world, but it is not my place to judge. I have only just arrived.
Perhaps they had no choice.
No, but I wasn't listening for such talk. I'm sorry that I can't help you.
An astute question. Czerka Corporation seems in control here, but they don't care if I wander the Shadowlands, so long as I have paid their docking fee.
Instead, I hope to gain the trust of the native Wookiee population. I'm not here to just kill the biggest thing I can find; I want to understand how they hunt.
Very little. I'm sure they have had enough of off-worlders like the Czerka claiming good intentions. I will simply try to stay out of their way.
I have heard of an off-worlder that has gained respect by living in the Shadowlands for some years. Perhaps I will attempt the same. It could just be hunter tales, though.
Why did you leave your home on Tatooine?
What are you doing here, Komad? Following me?
I have to leave. Goodbye.
What do you know of Kashyyyk?
If not Czerka, who would you prefer to deal with?
I'm looking for a Star Map here. Have you heard anything?
Whose permission are you looking for?
What are you doing to gain their trust?

Kashyyyk - The Great Walkway
I never thought I'd see the big trees. Zaalbar's stories didn't do it justice. This is incredible.
I wish he was here to see this. He'd want to see this, you know?
Can you sense it? The wind... the sound... the smells? I feel it all now that we are away from the spaceport.
This walkway is new, probably built by the slavers, but I remember the trees. My village is not far from here.
Yes, your outsider concerns must always come first. Just remember that this was my home. You are the stranger here.
I must warn you of one thing... I don't know if I will be a help or hindrance to you here. My father was very powerful... a chieftain.
Perhaps his feelings have mellowed, but if my brother had his ear all this time... I may be very unwelcome.
I'm not asking you to deal with anything. I just wanted you to know about potential problems.
Bah, do what you want with this information. I won't say any more about it.
That is what I am dreading. My shame was meant to be forgotten on some far away world. I never thought I'd come back.
I'm sorry, I've taken enough of your time. We should press on.
It is kind of you to offer, but my problems are very personal. I'm not sure if I am ready to deal with them.
I'm sorry, I don't know. It has been so long since I left. I only know the way things were, and many things may have changed.
We're here for the Star Map. Nothing else, understand?
I don't have time for your family squabbles.
We'll deal with that when the time comes.
Is there anything I can help you with?
What can I expect to encounter?
Why do you bother us again, outsider? We have nothing to say to you.
What do you want, outsider? I won't let you follow us on our hunt. Chorrawl is not here for your amusement.
Feh! I'll believe that when our planet is free of you. Your kind are here only to take or destroy.
Why would you listen to me? Your kind have only been interested in caging or killing us.
You can't push me into battle, outsider. I know what happens to Wookiees that are said to be "difficult."
I won't be your trophy, dead or as a slave. Leave me. You have no place here.
You do that. Walk quickly, outsider. Kashyyyk fights back, even if we can't.
Your kind threaten my very planet. I live with it daily. Why should your words now goad me into battle?
No, I won't fight you. At best, my warrior comrades would slaughter you, only for ships to burn our homes later.
Go away, rabid fool. I won't listen to you anymore.
[Success] I... I should answer your questions... yes, perhaps one or two.
[Failure] You Czerka slavers, caring about nothing except what you want... what you can take!
You disgust me. Your scent poisons the air. Your feet foul the ground. Go away, outsider. Go away.
[Success] Hmm... only a moment, outsider. I won't be this patient for long.
Yes, go, and don't expect a friendly welcome if you return. This world is my home, not yours.
I don't concern myself with outsider toys. Search where you will, I'm not wasting my time.
You taunt me with a foolish question like that. How do you think? My people go missing or die.
We can't fight back. Chuundar has bartered to reduce the slaves taken, but if any Czerka die, it increases again.
How has my world fared? It is slowly dying.
Big Z once told me he had seen paradise destroyed by the greed of outsiders. I never understood what he meant until now.
Why do you not do something about this tyranny, then?
Why not do something about it, then?
He is our Chieftain and will be obeyed. That is our way. Whether I trust what he says or not doesn't matter.
In time, someone will replace him. For better or worse, I don't know. That will be for Bacca to decide.
Bacca was our greatest warrior. His ancient sword is the tool of ascension, the mark of a chieftain.
Chuundar no longer displays it, not since he took the role of chieftain years ago. If someone else could produce it...
Bah! I talk like a mere child! This is foolishness.
It truly would take Bacca's Blade for that to happen. Chuundar is the last member of his family.
There were others, but they were marked with madness. We don't speak their names. They are without honor.
The only crazed creature I know of is one of your kind, outsider, not mine. We see him from time to time.
We leave him alone. He has our respect because he has braved the lands alone. Sometimes he helps lone travelers. He is crazy, though.
Our finest warriors hunt the Shadowlands in groups, yet he lives there alone. Avoid him. Madness is to be feared.
Many years. It is impossible to know how many. A decade? Two? Perhaps he can answer your questions. Or kill you.
Hmph! I merely have an appreciation for solitude.
Ha! You claim to be a legend, but I'd know the mad hermit if I saw him. 3-meters tall, with eyes of madness.
Chuundar! Bah! Why should I care if you act for him when he does not act for us?
Hold your tongue. You speak of the Chieftain.
Yes, you would say that. You have lost no one to slavers. Chuundar has bought you.
No, not to you. You are an outsider and only care about our weaknesses. I won't say anything to you.
I am done with you, outsider. Go away. I won't be your entertainment.
I don't mean you any harm.
Could I ask some questions?
Don't test me, Wookiee. I go where I wish.
I will leave you then.
Show me proper respect or you'll regret it!
[Force Persuade] I want you to answer my questions.
[Persuade] Just a few questions. I'm a friend.
I will leave you now.
I seek an ancient Star Map. Have you seen it?
How has Kashyyyk fared under the Czerka Corporation?
What do you think of Chuundar?
How will Bacca decide? What does that mean?
Could a blood relative of Chuundar challenge him?
Do you know of a crazed Wookiee in the Shadowlands?
How long has he been down there?
I am <FullName>, and I act for Chuundar.
Explain what you meant by that.
Well, it seems you are more than I thought. Freyyr has come back, and told me of what you did for him.
My fellow hunters split on what should be done. Some were loyal to Chuundar alone... we had to fight.
Freyyr went to the throne room to challenge Chuundar. I will take you to him now.
Yes, much is about to be decided. Only one can lead us. *Must* lead us. Come.
We follow the Chieftain, whoever that is. If the position is in doubt, we each fight for the side we believe in.
This must be decided quickly or there will be much more bloodshed. Come, it is this way.
I can guide you off the path. We will approach from behind, avoiding Czerka and those loyal to Chuundar.
It is the only way. I'm sorry, but I won't allow you to proceed any other way. This is too important.
Lead on. We should hurry.
You fought each other? Why?
Why should I follow you?
You want to talk, do it with Patrol Captain Dehno. He's the ranking officer in this unit.
We should just say it bolted, or something.
They won't miss one, will they?
Why do they always have to be so difficult?
Well, this means extra duty for sure.
I thought he said shoot. I swear he said shoot.
You know, we're gonna get stuck with the bill for this.
The patrol Captain will speak for us. He's the ranking officer in this unit.
Wow. This is going to look really bad on my record.
What are you doing back here? Look, you got what you wanted, so just let us get back to corralling these animals.
What is it now? If you don't mind, I have important matters to discuss with my patrol.
This isn't good. I can't afford this.
You think I can? Do you know what they get for a healthy one of these things?
We'll work it out later. We've got company.
What do you want, spacer? I'm Patrol Captain Dehno and you're interrupting Czerka Corporation business.
Good. Watch yourself. These old paths are dangerous.
You mean Edean? Backwater world.
There are a few patrols in the lower areas, but I haven't heard what they are after.
The company has branches on many planets. I'm just a Patrol Captain. It's not my job to monitor it all.
If you want quotes on policy, get someone else. I just escort the slaves and guard this area.
This Wookiee slave got a little... rebellious. We had to put it down.
That's right! We had to do it and it shouldn't come out of our pay.
Just shut up, you trigger-happy idiot.
No, of course they don't. Why would you ask me that? Are you doing some sort of snap inspection?
You're trying to get me to admit to incompetence, aren't you? Not going to happen. I stand by my patrol.
This Wookiee got out of hand and *had* to be put down. We'll find another easy enough.
Well... all right then. Carry on. We've work to do here.
Thanks for taking care of that, Captain.
You shut up. I'm not done with you two.
Is that a joke? Who do you think you are?
[Success] I... I think I should pull in some favors and... get us moved off-world, men.
Uh, are you all right, Captain?
Are you questioning my orders? You don't want to do that.
[Success] You make some sense. I wonder, what do you know about what might happen here?
Men, I think we should petition for a transfer. The corporation will survive a fight here, but us frontline guards won't.
If... you say so, Captain.
Yes, I say so. Move out. This place just isn't worth the trouble.
What the...? Blasters ready, men! This fool wants to die!
It... is a bit costly. Look, why are you asking this?
[Success] I... I think I should probably pay you so this stays off my record. Yes, that's best.
Uh, Captain.... what's going on? Is this one of those inspector shake-downs?
[Failure] What are you trying to get away with here? You can't just walk up and start demanding things.
I think this troublemaker needs an accident. In fact, I think this Wookiee attacked this fool and we arrived just a little too late to help.
Uh, Captain, we have blasters. Don't Wookiees use those bowcaster things?
Would you just shut up and shoot?
And who are you to stop us, little man?
[Success] What... you're a Czerka inspector, aren't you! Slimy little... I've heard about these shake-downs.
Give it up, men. If we don't pay this leech we'll get a black mark on our records a sunspot couldn't burn off.
But I, I... if you say so, sir. I don't think we have enough... here.
You are making this difficult. You know, maybe it's too much trouble to pay you. Maybe there's a better way.
Yes, I'm sure it will be. If I see anything on our records I'll have you fed to a katarn. In bite-sized chunks.
Now, if you don't mind, we have a patrol to get back to.
You lied to gain profit from the death of this Wookiee? You may as well have killed him yourself.
So I see.
Uh, if we're done here, we have a patrol to get back to.
You can't justify this. Don't try.
Put it down? You killed him, you mean.
Put it down? You... you murdered him?
You murdered him!
You "put *it* down"? We're not animals!
Careful now... that growl sounded pretty threatening. Keep your slave on its leash or we'll have another accident.
I'm leaving. Never mind.
I have questions about Kashyyyk.
Tell me about Czerka Corp.
My name is <FullName>. What happened here?
Do your superiors approve of you killing Wookiees?
I don't actually care, one way or another.
I won't allow you to enslave or kill another Wookiee.
[Force Persuade] Request a transfer. Move your patrol off-world.
[Persuade] This posting is trouble, friend. Get out while you can.
It doesn't matter. I'll end your miserable life where you stand!
This may cost you more than you know, fool.
[Force Persuade] You want to pay me so this stays off your record.
[Persuade/Lie] You know why. Hand over compensation or this gets reported.
I'll just take it from your corpse then!
I demand more!
That will be fine. Thank you.
Shut up. I do as I wish.
I can't change what they did. Why not profit?

Greetings again, outsider. I will transport you to the Shadowlands if you wish. Chuundar wills it.
Rrrgh. Chuundar has commanded that I grant you access to the Shadowlands. Gorwooken is what I am called.
Walk with care! Only our bravest return from these lands. Your soft feet are a barely tolerated insult.
I will wait. Chuundar bids it.
The descent is long. Be still, or we will attract... unwelcome visitors.
Chuundar said nothing of answering your questions. Be brief.
A few like you are in the Shadowlands, given premission by Chuundar. I don't know why. Only Wookiees should be allowed.
The journeys of my people are very personal. I won't speak of them to an outsider.
You can't. You must live here to understand, to see harmony in the danger. Bah, I waste my breath on you.
[Failure] Eughh... my head hurts... hurry up and be on your way, outsider.
[Success] Ergh... I should tell you about some of us that have gone to the Shadowlands. There have been many...
Latest was Rorworr, and he has not returned in many days. He may have died below, but he was strong and able.
Many have died recently. Chuundar believes one of our own is below, mad, crazed, killing all. I do not know.
We find no bodies to examine. The Shadowlands claim them, I am sure.
[Failure] This isn't for you to know. I'm done talking about it.
[Success] You ask very respectfully. Outsiders never do that. I suppose I can mention some of us that have entered the Shadowlands.
For reasons I do not know, Chuundar allows those of the Czerka to move in the Shadowlands. They kill much.
And there is another, but he has earned respect. He does not disturb our lives or customs. And he gets angry like a Wookiee sometimes.
Urgh... his name hurts my tongue. He has lived alone in the Shadowlands for many years now.
Be brief. I am not your guide.
That would be me. Jolee Bindo. Do I really look so different up close?
No, it cannot be you. You are too frail and old. The other is mad like a crazed tach.
Those that walk the Shadowlands do so at their own risk. It is a test of bravery among my people. A respected feat.
But you come here like the Czerka, with strange weapons. It is so much more than we have, yet you still fear?
You are pathetic. You will get no warnings from me. Prove your worth, to us and to yourself.
They have made Chuundar strong, so we are all stronger, but I do not like them. They are small and hide behind armor.
They would not survive the Shadowlands as a true Wookiee. They are not worthy to be there, but Chuundar wills it.
I'm not ready yet. I'll go down later.
Just unlock the thing and lower me down.
I have a few questions, Gorwooken.
Has anyone else been allowed down recently?
I want to understand why Wookiees revere the Shadowlands.
[Force Persuade] Tell me about any Wookiees that have recently gone this way.
[Persuade] Tell me of the Wookiees so I might show proper respect.
What outsiders are below?
Back to my other questions now.
I want to ask if it's dangerous down there.
What do you think of the Czerka Corporation?
[Having seen Gorwooken use the basket, you understand it well-enough to operate it.]
[You leave the basket as it is.]
[The basket begins to descend into the darkness.]
[I don't need this right now.]
[Go down to the Shadowlands.]
Speak with Chorrawl if you must speak at all. He knows your jagged language best.
Death to all slavers! Kashyyyk will be free!
The outsiders will pay for how they dishonored us!
At last, we will push them off our beloved Kashyyyk!
The Shadowlands are too good for them! We'll kill them all!
These Czerka animals will die by sword and bowcaster!
Let their blood feed out forests! That will be their payment!
Let no one escape! They must learn the price we place on dishonor!
Kashyyyk will be ours once more!
You are the only outsider that will survive us! We swear it!
Czerka will never come back here, we will make certain!
Grrrowwlll!! You are not permitted to pass into the Shadowlands. Only Chuundar may allow you entry.
Speak with Chuundar in the village of Rwookrrorro. He will decide if you are worthy.
Chuundar has said you may pass into the Shadowlands. Gorwooken will lower you down in the elevator basket.
Gorwooken climbed to the basket from the upper branches, but you will have to walk, outsider.
The path is seldom used. There may be vermin nesting along it. Be ready to fight.
By order of Chieftain Freyyr, you are allowed full access to the Shadowlands and our village. You have our thanks, outsider.
Chuundar has said that you can remain here, but watch where you step while in our village, outsider.
Freyyr has returned to us because of you, outsider. You are one of the few outsiders we will allow to remain among us in the village.
GRRROWLLL, stop where you are, outsider. You enter the domain of Chuundar, Chieftain and leader!
He will decide if you are fit to walk the village of Rwookrrorro. You've already soiled our world with what you brought on your ship.
Look about you, fool. You face a legion of Wookiees in their home terrain! It is a losing fight for you.
You will be taken before Chuundar and he will judge your worth, and punishment for the taint you have returned to us.
He is right. There are too many. Please, let us go to Chuundar. He has much to explain.
The choice is made for you already! You make a demand for something you can't alter, can't help!
Chuundar sent us to search it. We found the exile. The nameless mad-claw, once called Zaalbar.
He means me. I am the taint that you have brought back.
Shut up! GROWWLL! You are nameless with dishonor, mad-claw! Yours is a foulness that disgusts me!
Stand aside! This human is with me and I want access to the home of my people!
You have no rights here, mad-claw! This human should not have brought this taint upon our land! You must answer to Chuundar!
There is no refusing. If you will not walk, we will bind you. Shall you be carried through the trees like a child?
RRaaaghh! Enough! The mad-claw from your ship is already before Chuundar. Come!
RRaaaghh! Enough talk! You and the outcast mad-claw will be taken to Chuundar now!
You will not take me anywhere, mongrel!
Take me to Chuundar. I would speak with him.
My ship? What do you mean by that?
Who gave you access? You had no right!
And if I refuse to go see Chuundar?
What does he mean, Zaalbar? What taint?

Kashyyyk - Village of Rwookrrorro
Why do you bother me, human? I don't wish to speak with you.
Leave me, human outsider. I do not wish to speak with you.
Why? So you can better exploit us? Why should I speak with you?
Please, do not bother me again.
You have a Wookiee marked by exile as a slave. If he is your property, he is no Wookiee. Not until he kills you.
I will speak with you a moment, but do not pretend to be a friend. I trust only the word of Chuundar.
I am not a slave. I have made a life debt.
To an outsider? You truly are a mad-claw. Don't taint my ears with your ravings. I'll speak to your owner, not you.
I shall believe that when I see it. I will speak with you, but do not mistake that for trust.
We are threatened everyday. You are just another body in the army we face from all sides, at all times.
No, I will not fear you. Ask what you will, but save your threats. I am numb to them.
I am ashamed that he would ask outsiders to track such a creature. Why couldn't our own hunters remove his dishonor?
If you must be the one, then so be it. Be merciful and quick. A Wookiee without the honor of self-control is a mere animal.
And when you are through, do the same to your slave Zaalbar. His taint is a curse upon us too. Bah, I will speak no more of him.
I don't know about anything like that, but I don't understand you body-bald fools. You are all slavers or crazy.
Our hunters say one of you has been living in the Shadowlands, and that is crazy! I don't know how he survives.
It's probably just hunter-tales, though. No one could live in the Shadowlands for the years he has. No one.
Maybe insanity makes you taste bad. I don't know. You tell me.
We go for ritual, to prove ourselves. Some exiles are forced to live there. What other choice do they have? Slavery?
I know of none. I do not enter the Shadowlands. I only hear stories. Nobody really believes them.
Well, a gifted few, perhaps.
Another of our people is missing. If the slavers were responsible, more would have disappeared. This was just one Wookiee.
It may be that he died in the Shadowlands. If he did, there is honor in that, and he will be mourned.
His friends Woorwill and Jaarak will want to know. If it was not natural, Worrroznor must be told. He is the Holder of the Laws.
Woorwill's home is on the central tree of the village. Worrroznor maintains court on the platform just to the east of there.
What makes it your business? Bah, I have nothing to say. Speak with his friends, if you must.
Woorwill and Jaarak maintain a vigil in Woorwil's home on the central platform on the village.
The body of Rorworr was found. He was a promising warrior. We will mourn him fiercely.
This is no secret to you. For whatever reason, you made certain justice was merciful in this matter.
I still do not trust you, but you have a small measure of thanks for this.
You know this. You made certain his killer was executed. Was it for justice, or just the payment you recieved?
Go on, mercenary, leave me alone. I haven't the money to pay for your loyalty.
What right do you have to question Chuundar? What could you possibly know about us?
Be brief. I tire of this.
Primitive? Our traditions are ancient! There is great order and honor in how we live! Even with our... troubles.
Your interest is surprising. I had not thought an outsider would care. Still, I shouldn't talk of our troubles.
Chuundar is our leader, and deserving of respect. Even with our doubts.
I would not believe you. You are an outsider. You lie. You cheat. You enslave us. There is nothing you could say to make me believe.
[Failure] No, no I don't. You see, your kind are all mad. You don't understand a thing said to you.
[Success] I should tell someone... we whisper it anyway. Everyone wonders about it.
Chuundar has done much. He keeps the slavers from the village, and rules fairly. He keeps order, and keeps us strong.
But... his father was better. Freyyr the Chieftain would not have allowed the slaver docking platforms to be built. That's why he was killed.
Soon after the mad son Zaalbar was sent away. Freyyr seemed to succumb to the same kind of insanity.
It is thought that he died fighting slavers. I like to think so. Chuundar has bravely risen to lead us, despite his troubles.
I don't want to think about this. You test my patience, outsider.
There is no one left that is willing to stand up to the slavers. We wait for the coming of Bacca's heir.
The ancient Bacca was our greatest leader. At his death, he swore that his spirit would live in our true chieftains.
His sword would be the sign, and legends say we have always prospered under those that held it. No longer.
No one has seen the blade for years. It is a foolish hope. We now follow Chuundar. He is sane and honorable.
There is no one. Chuundar is unquestioned. You have seen to that, have you not? Speak no more of it.
You see the dignity of my people? We will overcome.
Don't speak for me, mad-claw. You left in shame. Time has not changed that.
Threatening her may not get you the results you want.
Surely that is no way to gain co-operation from the Wookiees. Some subtlety is not out of the question, is it?
Freyyr is returned to us! The madness of Chuundar will be undone. It is a great day, and I'm told it is becasue of you, <FullName>.
What can I do for you?
And we are glad you did. Thank you. We will be strong again.
You taint yourself with your words. You are a friend to us. Don't ruin it with your crazy outsider ways.
I will answer if I can.
Goodbye then. Thank you.
I don't know about that. You outsiders from away are always looking for strange things. It makes you crazy.
Maybe you should search for that fool living in the Shadowlands. Our hunters say they see him from time to time and sometimes he helps them.
I don't know how he stays alive. Maybe animals won't eat crazy-meat. I don't know.
Madam, I am not a fool. I survive because I am careful.
See, you are all crazy. You can't be him. The hunters say he is a great warrior and fearsome.
Rorworr is missing. He's one of our most promising warriors. I still hope he will be found alive, but no one knows where he is.
His friends Woorwill and Jaarak would like to hear any news. They are in Jaarak's home on the central village tree platfom.
If there was a crime, tell Worrroznor, Holder of the Laws. His home is east of the central village tree.
Woorwill and Jaarak are his friends. You could speak with them. They are in Jaarak's home on the central village tree platform.
Rorworr was missing, but you know that. You caught his killer and showed that justice can be merciful.
Rorworr was missing, but you know that. You caught his killer and made sure he was executed.
I am grateful you have kept order, but the whole matter makes me sad.
And you, Zaalbar, you fought for us even when shunned. All of Rwookrrorro is grateful, and also shamed for the way you were treated.
I am proud of today. Yesterday is forgotten.
I will leave you. Goodbye.
I go where I wish. Will you stop me?
I want to ask you some questions.
Goodbye.
I travel with a Wookiee. I am a friend.
I am not your enemy. I serve the greater good.
Because I demand it! Do not anger me!
Chuundar wants me to find an insane Wookiee in the Shadowlands.
I seek something called a Star Map.
Why do you say we're crazy?
If the Shadowlands are so dangerous, why go?
What exiles live there now?
Any recent trouble other than the slavers?
Who should I talk to if I have information about his disappearance?
Who would know more?
Why do your leaders allow slavers to take your people?
Then I will ask about other things.
I don't give you much thought. You are primitives.
Tell me so I might understand.
What if I told you Chuundar is in league with the slavers?
[Force Persuade] You want to tell me your doubts about Chuundar.
When did Freyyr die?
Who would you rather have as leader?
What do you mean by that? Explain.
I want to go back to my previous questions.
I'm glad I could help.
It was like managing foolish children.
I need to ask you some questions.
Farewell.
I'm looking for a Star Map.
Are there local concerns besides the slavers?
Who do I talk to if I know about this?
Who could I talk to about that?
You are not permitted to enter the rest of Rwookrrorro. Our children live in the upper boughs. You will not disturb them.
You couldn't make the climb anyway. Only a Wookiee has the skill to navigate the wroshyr trees.
I long for the Kashyyyk of old. We had no need of footpaths for outsiders like you.
Rorworr has shamed us when we needed strength. His death will serve as a lesson in the importance of honor.
Your actions are unexpected. Very few outsiders have shown mercy during their stay here.
Jaarak has shamed us. To strike down one of our own... he showed the gall of an outsider.
I do not like that you have seen us at our worst. Jaarak has lost his honor to an outsider.
Do you miss your kin when they are taken from you, outsider? I doubt you feel the same as we do.
Rorworr has not returned to the village. If you took him, outsider, you will pay dearly.
Rorworr was mentor to some of our most promising children. We need his spirit in these dark times.
Rorworr is the latest of us to go missing. I hope your outsider slavers lost many men trying to cage him.
Freyyr will not let slavers take us. Of that, I am certain.
Kashyyyk will rise to repel the slaver threat. Freyyr will see to it.
It is right that Chuundar died. He was tainted by outsider greed.
Freyyr will not let us fall to slavers. He would rather die.
First there was one outsider, then many, and now you walk our village! It's too much!
Chuundar allows you to be here, outsider. You would be dead if he didn't.
Chuundar has grown comfortable dealing with you outsiders. I have not.
I will not speak with you, outsider. You are not worthy.
I am not accustomed to speaking with you outsiders. Some have gotten too comfortable with it, I think.
The shame of Rorworr's actions will haunt us. Justice was properly merciful with his killer.
You surprise me with your mercy, outsider. I wouldn't have thought it possible.
Jaarak's fate would be easier to stomach if an outsider had not profited from it.
Even when serving justice, you outsiders find a way to profit. Leave me alone, mercenary.
Bacca's Blade keep Rorworr safe and Bacca's wisdom guide him home to us.
We lose more of our most promising warriors everyday.
Many are talking of Rorworr's disappearance. It is hardest on the young.
Rorworr has not returned to the village in days. If slavers took him, they had a fight on their hands.
Freyyr has been through much. His wrath will make us strong.
The honor of Kashyyyk is tainted. Only slaver blood will make things right.
Chuundar deserved death. He made us fearful and weak.
Freyyr is back in power! Slavers will learn to fear us now!
It was not long ago that Kashyyyk had no outsider taint.
You will never take me as a slave, outsider. By Bacca's Blade, you will not!
Chuundar may tolerate you, but do not expect the same from all of us.
I won't speak with you, outsider. Chuundar allows too many of you here.
You have been given a task, outsider. Be thankful for your time on our world and do as you have been bid.
Return when Chuundar's task is complete. That is what the Chieftain wants.
The village exit is northwest of here. Once outside, follow the platform to the east until you get to where Gorwooken is waiting.
He will lower you to the Shadowlands, though I would prefer that you were simply dropped. You'll die down there anyway.
Others may speak to you, <FullName>, but I won't. I don't want you here. The sooner you are gone, the better.
If the forest holds any justice you will die down there, as would all outsiders.
You be allowed audience when you return after completing his task. Only then will you have reason.
Great Chuundar has finished with you, <FullName>. You may walk the sacred boughs of our village, but expect no further audience.
Go, and expect no more to be said!
I'll be going then.
I will need directions.
I want directions for what's in the village.
What can I expect to find in the Shadowlands?
I want to speak with Chuundar again.
