Kashyyyk - Woorwill's Home
Why do you return, outsider? Didn't I make myself clear enough? I don't want you here!
You have made a terrible claim against me, outsider. Do what you must with it, but leave me alone.
What I want is for you to leave. If you think you are worthy to take me before my peers, I won't stop you.
An outsider outraged at me! I laugh! You know nothing of me, or how hard any of this is!
That's not for you to decide. You couldn't possibly understand how this affects my people or me.
Do what you must. The Holder of the Laws will decide my fate in proper Wookiee tradition.
What is it you want, outsider? You are not welcome here, no matter what anyone says.
You are an outsider. Your kind have done more damage here than any one of you could ever hope to fix.
You taint us... and bring out the worst in everything. You will get no respect from me.
The casing is mine. It bears my family runes, and markings for each of the creatures I have killed.
Where did you get that, outsider? Did you have someone steal it? Have you sunk to petty theft now?
*sigh* This will end in sadness. Don't say I didn't warn you.
What... what are you talking about? I warn you, outsider, I won't tolerate your lies in my home.
What is going on Jaarak? What are they talking about?
Nothing! Outsider lies! Do not listen to them, Woorwill!
No! Don't say anything else! I can't let you... I killed Rorworr. Tell Worrroznor, Holder of the Laws... he will judge me.
Please... say nothing to Woorwill. Let a trial call me guilty. Let me be the monster, not Rorworr. Tell Worrroznor, Holder of the Laws, in the home east of here.
I have nothing to say to you. Go and learn what you can while bleeding our planet of its people and honor.
Should we ask if they've seen Rorworr? They understand us. Most outsiders don't bother to learn our language.
I will not speak to them and neither will you, Woorwill. I won't allow it.
Good riddance. Don't come back, outsider.
It isn't an easy language to learn, what with all the growls and howls. Big Z told me the whole point was to make it difficult for outsiders to understand.
<FullName> understands much more than most outsiders.
You are no more welcome here than they are, mad-claw. I won't speak to either of you, and neither will Woorwill.
You have been welcomed back, Zaalbar, but your time away has made you blind. I won't speak to this outsider, and neither will Woorwill.
I don't know how to thank an outsider. I never thought it possible. Thank you.
I just wish... that you hadn't seen us at our worst. We can be so much better. We must be.
Don't you want a chance to defend yourself?
You are a murderer. You'll pay the harshest penalty.
I know that you had reason to kill Rorworr.
I'm <FullName>, and I'm here with Chuundar's permission. Show a little respect.
You should show respect. I'm <FullName>. I helped Freyyr back to power.
Do you recognize this bowcaster bolt casing?
I found it on Rorworr's corpse. You killed him, didn't you?
You are Jaarak, aren't you? I know what you did.
Can you explain why your bowcaster casing was found on his body?
Rorworr was dealing with the slavers. I found his datapad.
I wanted to ask you about Kashyyyk.
I must leave.
You're back again? Have you seen... no, you wouldn't tell me. You wouldn't care.
Leave the boy alone. Please.
Just like any other outsider; Half mad and no honor.
I've... I've never spoken to an outsider. I mean, Chuundar makes us learn to understand you, but I've never been this close to one of you.
What are you doing here? Have you come to laugh at us? Come to gloat about how many of us you take? Can you even understand me?
Then why are you here?
Goodbye, I guess.
On... Rorworr's body? Then... then he's dead? But he can't be!
Don't listen to him, Woorwill. Outsiders only lie when their mouths are open, you know that.
No he doesn't! You don't say another thing to him! You want to lie, you lie to me, outsider!
Leave... leave the boy alone. Please. You will want to talk to me.
I'm not sure that I should have said anything to you in the first place.
Speak with me directly, away from the boy. Please.
I think I begin to see what has occurred here. We should speak to Jarak at once.
What? Uh, sure, it looks like... like Jaarak's. I think so, anyway. I'm not sure.
Oh, please don't. I haven't been paying attention to anything since Rorworr went missing. Do you know anything about that?
I hope not. I hope you slavers didn't get him. N-not that you're a slaver. I'm sorry. I'm very tired. I haven't slept much lately.
Stop bothering the boy, outsider! he doesn't need you taunting him.
But what if they know something? Maybe they could help?
An outsider? Help? Look around you, Woorwill. Outsiders do nothing but steal and lie and taint the best among us!
Outsider, you talk to me if you must bother us at all. Leave him alone.
Rorworr? Oh, he's the greatest! He's led hunting parties to the Shadowlands, and even fought outsiders! Slavers... like you probably are.
He's taught me a lot. He said I could grow up as strong as him, that I'd fight you too. I will, too. I will.
I don't know about that. I hear lots of things and I'm not sure what to think anymore.
Warning: And get no closer, hairy organic! I will protect the master from your barbaric ways, I warn you!
We're rather hairless, aren't we?
I don't understand what is going on... but I'm not listening to anything you have to say, outsider. You're trying to confuse me.
Jaarak will... explain what he has said. I know he will. You don't know anything, and I won't listen to you.
You? Why are you here? Haven't you done enough? Jaarak is dead and Rorworr is dead and... and...
Just leave me alone. I don't want to talk to anyone.
Thank you, outsider. You are... like I thought Rorworr was. Please, leave me. I want to be alone for a bit.
I still thank you... I just need some time to think about things.
I go where I want. You'll do as I say.
Quiet you, I'm talking to this one.
I understand you. I'm not here as a slaver.
Goodbye.
I found Jaarak's bolts on Rorworr's body.
You will listen when I talk! I speak the truth!
Rorworr was dealing with slavers. Do you know anything about this?
I want to go over this with Woorwill again.
What do you have to say about it?
Do you know whose bolt casing this is?
You'd better be sure, fool. I found it on your hero's corpse.
This bolt casing was found on Rorworr's body.
Can I ask you some questions?
When did Rorworr go missing?
Who was Rorworr?
I'm <FullName>. I'm here with Chuundar's permission.
I'm <FullName>. I helped Freyyr return to power. I'm a friend.
Jaarak
Woorwill
Exit
Exit
Kashyyyk - Worrroznor's Home
Greetings again, outsider. Please, if you have business here, make it brief.
Well, I must say that you are the first outsider that I have been glad to know. You have surprised me.
Perhaps some of you are capable of honor after all. You are deserving of your reward.
Goodbye. Bacca guide you.
Nothing that you can help with. Rorworr's crime is causing a bit of a stir, but it will pass in time.
Some of us will be disappointed in him, but we have other enemies to worry about.
Did I not explain? As the person that discovered the crime, you were also affected by it.
You would've been given a portion of Jaarak's possessions, but he was innocent. Rorworr, however, was not.
Rorworr was wealthy. His family was taken by slavers, leaving him everything. You get one third of this.
Woorwill receives the rest, if he wishes. He is still upset, but he is young. He will recover.
Hello again, outsider. I... wish you had not seen us at our worst. A murder with no reason... it's unsettling.
Goodbye, outsider. Goodbye.
A few details to work out following Jaarak's death, but nothing that need concern you.
Yes, yes there is. You are to recieve the credit equivalent of one third of Jaarak's possessions.
Woorwill gets the rest. He is the closest to family that Rorworr had left. The others were lost to slavers.
Here, take it. I thank you for your help. Now please, just go.
Hello, outsider. I heard of your arrival. I trust you won't cause trouble in our village? We don't want bloodshed.
Farewell then. Bacca keep you well.
I'm sorry. Like most of the village, I've been preoccupied by these troubled times. I don't really want to speak with you.
Well, not unless you can tell me where young Rorworr is. Do you keep track of slaves taken?
It could be ten days or more. He was planning a hunt, and nobody seems to know when he was leaving.
He is now overdue. I don't know where to start. It is strange...
I don't believe he was taken by slavers. Their slave transports haven't been seen around here.
If it wasn't slavers, perhaps he fell in the Shadowlands... but he knew them well.
I would search for him, but I don't know where to start. My days of hunting the lower forest are behind me.
That would need to be determined. Wookiee justice rewards honor and honesty. You outsiders are a little lacking...
You could. I've never had an offer of help from an outsider. I'll reserve my judgment for when I see results.
I have no way of knowing one way or another. You'll excuse me if I don't take you at your word.
That would depend on the circumstances. We rarely have such crimes here. Wookiee honor does not allow it.
When we have had a murder, the punishment was usually death. There is rarely any justification that would dictate otherwise.
Oh my... that is... very distressing. It definitely seems to suggest that Jaarak helped in Rorworr's death.
I... I can't ignore this. Wait here, outsider. I must address this. I will have Jaarak brought here...
And I hope he can explain this... I really do.
Jaarak... you know why you have been summoned here. As Holder of the Laws, I ask you to explain.
I won't answer. I can't. Worrroznor, must Woorwill be here?
Woorwill has a bond with Rorworr. He is the closest to family that can be found. He is entitled to be here.
Jaarak, please speak. If you are guilty, it means death. This outsider will be given your possessions. Do you want that?
If there were circumstances that led to the attack, perhaps we could consider another punishment. It all depends on what was behind it.
This is a failure of honor. It is very serious. Were there any mitigating factors we need to be aware of?
Good thinking. Jaarak doesn't strike me as the type to murder for no reason.
I urge you caution. This may seem like the right path to follow... but you do not know these people as I do.
That's the law. You discovered the crime, and therefore were also affected by it. You are also a victim.
It's painful to know that another Wookiee could do wrong, so the accuser is repaid, as is the victim's family.
This will be the first time an outsider has received such reparation. I hope it is the last.
I killed Rorworr. I will accept whatever punishment is given. It's better if only my honor is tainted.
You did do it? Why? Rorworr was good and honorable! Why did you kill him?
You only need to know that I did it. The reason is unimportant. Woorwill... I'm sorry.
Nothing? There was no reason? You just killed him? Why! There has to be a reason why!
I'm sorry, Woorwill... I can't give a reason. It was between me and Rorworr, and neither of us will talk.
What? What are you talking about? Liar!
Please... don't tell them anything. Rorworr was admired... they need to believe in him.
I'm old. I'm not important. Let Woorwill and the others have their hero.
Explain yourself, outsider. If you have information that will affect this trial, I must know it.
Don't listen to these outsider lies... please. Woorwill, don't listen.
But... no. No! That's not... that can't be. Jaarak? It can't be...
I'm sorry, Woorwill. I didn't want you to know. So much is against us... you need someone to look up to.
I couldn't let him betray you... betray everyone. Outsiders are enough of a threat by themselves; we don't need traitors of our own.
Well... as Holder of the Laws, I declare Jaarak innocent. I... will see to your release.
How sad. It feels like the right thing to do, but... to destroy a hero...
How awful. Big Z always said how important honor was to his people. It's everything.
A painful end, but perhaps it is the right thing to do. We shall see.
I do. I will take his shame with me. The Rorworr in their memory is a far better one than the Rorworr I killed.
And so he shall. Jaarak, you will be taken from us and cast into shadow. Your hunt ends.
And though we abandon you, may Bacca lead you through your shame.
At least he's going to die like a warrior.
This isn't justice, it doesn't seem right! But... what else could we do?
Big Z says honor was everything to his people. I... guess he's right.
There was pain no matter how this ended. Perhaps this is for the best.
Hmm... let's see if the family insignia is there. Yes, there it is. This belongs to Jaarak. Er... how did you get it?
Goodbye to you.
Can I ask you if anything is happening now?
My reward? What reward?
Goodbye then.
Is there anything going on?
Is there a reward for my service?
I'll be going now.
Can I ask you some questions?
When did Rorworr go missing?
Why do you think it is strange?
Would there be a reward for finding him?
I could look for him.
I am no slaver.
Tell me something. What's the penalty for murder?
I found Jaarak's bolt casing on Rorworr's corpse.
Is there no alternative to death as punishment?
Wait. If he's executed, I get paid?
Jaarak, won't you say anything in your own defense?
Kill him. I found nothing to justify the murder.
Kill him then. Jaarak must *pay* for his crime.
No, Jaarak should live. Rorwill dealt with the slavers.
Jaarak, I won't let you do this. Rorworr was dealing with slavers.
No, I won't let this happen.
Rorworr dealt with slavers. The datapad I found on his corpse proves it.
If that is what you want.
Then let Jaarak die. He murdered Rorworr. It's fact.
Do you know who owns this bolt casing?

Kashyyyk - Hall of the Chieftain
Step forward and address mighty and wise Chuundar, outsider. I don't often allow visitors of your kind.
As you can see, <FullName>, I have brought Zaalbar from your ship. Don't worry, Janos was very helpful. There was no damage done... yet.
You need to realize your situation. I've had climbers watching you since you landed. Taking Zaalbar was easy.
It has, but you couldn't hide him. Your ship carries his scent, his hair. My climbers found him quickly. Others have been watching you.
Did you think you could walk the upper boughs of Kashyyyk and not be observed? I've had climbers watching you, and your ship.
He has become like the slavers. He takes without care.
You have learned from the slavers. Learned to take what you want.
You work alongside the slavers. You are no better than they are!
Big Z! What are you doing here? What's going on?
You are flanked by Czerka slavers! Are they not outsiders? Or have you sold all of Kashyyyk to them!
Ah, brother Zaalbar. You've been exiled a long time. You shouldn't speak in that tone. Things are different now.
You are a mad-claw without honor. You have no voice among your own people. I, on the other hand, am Chieftain.
You are mistaken about your worth. You have no leverage here. I have made certain that my people only listen to me.
You may talk, but no one will believe you. I've had a long time to guide what my people think.
They trust me, the mighty Chuundar. Even with my brother insane and father enslaved, I rose to protect my people despite it all.
Father was enslaved? "Mighty Chuundar?" What are you talking about? You were the runt!
I am no runt! *ahem* Like I said, Zaalbar, a lot has changed in your years away. We will discuss this soon enough.
There will be no fight. You wouldn't survive. The village believes in me. They would rise to kill you.
I also have the protection of Czerka Corporation guards as well. No, you have no chance while I am unopposed.
I haven't killed Zaalbar because he is my brother, and I hoped he and I could come to an agreement. You are irrelevant.
I may be able to put you to use on a menial task. Zaalbar will have to stay here, of course.
It isn't your choice, <FirstName>. I already have him. I have a personal matter to discuss with him. You have other duties.
A simple thing. Another Wookiee has suffered the same fate as Zaalbar, gone mad and been exiled. He now lurks the Shadowlands.
More importantly, he's pestering my Czerka allies during their Shadowland expeditions. It is not good for business.
Zaalbar didn't tell you? He took offense to my trading a few of our people for favors and weapons.
I didn't understand his objection. Imagine the destruction if Czerka Corporation had come in with blasters firing. I saved many lives.
Of course, I also gained weapons, and arranged for certain rivals to be taken. I protected my allies, and my power grew.
I've heard of these Hutt creatures. They sound like smart traders. They would understand what your exiled companion could not.
Each has come to understand the benefit of working with the enemy. Unlike your exiled companion.
Young Zaalbar had no foresight. He couldn't control his outrage. He attacked me with his claws and damned himself doing it.
A few careful stories and everyone called him mad-claw. Even father Freyyr. I easily had him exiled.
I don't know anything about something like that, and I don't care. Your concerns are nothing to me.
We only enter the Shadowlands for ritual hunting. I'd leave the troublemaker down there but he has proven too good at surviving.
He has managed to linger a number of years, cowering in his madness and shame. You are expendable. You will remove him.
I'll allow you access to the Shadowlands. You will track and kill this insane Wookiee, and maybe then you will earn my favor.
Zaalbar stays here to ensure your loyalty. The Czerka would never let me hold you, but they don't care what I do with fellow Wookiees.
No, you won't need him to find your way. Over the years I have had my people trained to understand galactic Basic.
I tell them it's to better understand the enemy. They think it will make the Czerka easier to fight. Actually it makes them easier to obey.
Remember, you can't beat me here. No one would dare oppose me to join with an outsider or an exile.
You are wrong, brother. Someone would.
You are too quick to celebrate. Zaalbar talks of Freyyr, our father. Why, Zaalbar? He ordered you exiled when you attacked me.
No outsider, Zaalbar is referring to Freyyr, our father. Why, Zaalbar? He ordered you exiled when you attacked me.
Do you speak of Freyyr, our father? Why? He was the one that ordered you exiled when you attacked me.
He went as mad as you when he finally discovered the slavers. He dared challenge them alone and has not been seen since.
That was years ago. Let him go, Zaalbar. I rule now. I'll take the Wookiees forward, but there are prices to pay.
No more words, outsider. I've given my orders. I can't hold you here, but Zaalbar will stay until you kill the mad-claw in the Shadowlands.
The guards will let you pass now. Leave the village through the northwest and follow the platform to the south and then east.
You'll eventually see where Gorwooken waits for you. He'll lower you to the forest floor. Go.
Let's go kill something and get the Wookiee out.
Query: Shall I begin blasting, master? We could have your hirsute companion free in no time.
It is wrong to leave him imprisoned here. We should seek some way to free him when we have the chance.
I don't like leaving someone behind, but I guess we don't have a choice.
Then I suppose we have little choice. We should proceed with caution, however.
Don't worry, buddy, we'll get you out of here. You can count on us!
What made you think I wanted this to be easy for you? Besides, you won't need him. My people are trained to understand you.
You don't have much choice. You can flee the planet if you want, but I am keeping Zaalbar here with me.
He'll stay until the mad-claw is dead. The Czerka would never let me hold you, but they don't care what I do with fellow Wookiees.
You can't do that! He can't do that, can he? He can't hold Zaalbar prisoner just because he's Chieftain, can he?
No one will follow a mad-claw. He is merely a nuisance. Besides, he cowers in the Shadowlands. My people know nothing of him.
You test my patience. Do my task or flee to your ship, I don't care which.
Oh, that's just great! Everyone is here now! It's a reunion!
Yes, son. By the blade of Bacca's sword, I've come to end your treachery! No more will you sell your own people!
You have Bacca's blade? So what! I have the hilt, held by each true Chieftain in recent memory! Even you claimed it was all-important!
We both have our ancient trinkets, so who will the people follow now? You? You are old and weak!
Shut up! Both of you! This ends today! I... I will not see Rwookrrorro suffer any more!
W-what?
This is important! If you have advice, say it now.
I... I don't know what to do, <FirstName>. Chuundar has been telling me things... he makes sense... I think. I don't know.
Then there is no other way. Chuundar! You have betrayed our people! You must pay!
That's my boy!
You're too weak to fight, old wook, and I still have Czerka support! We'll see who dies today!
Woo-hoo! Way to go, Big Z!
Wait... isn't that my line?
Could we work together? It would be difficult...
Then so be it! The fighting stops here! I will not have our world destroyed beneath you two!
Perhaps there is hope. What say you, Chuundar?
What do I say? I still have Czerka support. I say you will die! Attack!
Alright! Way to go, Big Z!
Is it the best course?
Are you sure?
Then... then we must go a new way. I'm sorry father. Your time has passed.
Damn right it has! Lay down and die, old man!
I will fight to the last! For Kashyyyk! For... the lost honor of my sons!
Heh, now this is going to hurt some...
Are you sure this is wise? To support a slaver feels... wrong.
Are you going to second-guess everyone?
Of course not. Only the idiots around me.
I... guess he *did* toss you out on your ear, Big Z. What kind of father is that?
*That* is your advice? Side with the slaver? Fine, fine... it's your call.
Well, my mercenary returns. My climbers tell me you did well, <FullName>, although they couldn't follow you the whole time.
Chuundar told me who the mad-claw was. Have you done it then? Have you... killed my father?
That is true. I would have killed you. Besides, the old wook's time is done. Zaalbar has begun to see my side of things.
Not with me, and I doubt Zaalbar will give you any trouble for it. He's coming around to my way of thinking.
So you did it for Zaalbar's well-being? It's possible, but it doesn't matter. Zaalbar has begun to see my side of things.
I avoided his name when I sent you after him, but the pompous old wook must have said something!
You're an inattentive fool if you truly didn't know, but it doesn't matter. Zaalbar has begun to see my side of things.
I've been reminded of how Freyyr cast me out. I see how easily he has been disposed of, himself. We are stronger without him. Chuundar's way is better.
Of course it is. I will make our people strong with outsider weapons and influence. And for you, I shall see that your status is restored... in due time.
I will see to it that you are given what you deserve. Finish with your questions and we will settle our accounts.
Yes, my spies said you found some interesting things down there. Remarkable for an outsider.
So, the insane outsider is real. Interesting. I trust you are removing him? I'd hate to see him come to harm.
Yes, better that he leave. It's hard to blame the Shadowlands for missing Wookiees when he lives down there.
"Ohh... the scary Shadowlands. Nobody comes back from where the old human lives." Bah!
Bah! Save your threats, I'm sick of the forest. And I'm not too fond of what happened here. I'll take the ride.
Yes, and you made a mess of their operation. I am not pleased about that, but I can overlook it.
I will have to make amends to Czerka Corporation on the next slave shipment, but your service elsewhere was worth it.
Did you? You were out of sight from my spies for a long time. Perhaps it was some crashed ship?
Now I think you are just making things up. Nothing is older than the forest, not even we Wookiees.
I might send someone to try and find this ancient computer, but I think you are mistaken. Crazy outsider.
Oh, you're wrong on that count, actually. Not that I would expect you to know that.
My spies weren't too clear in explaining what was going on. I hear they could blend against the background of the forest? Interesting.
I will have my best Wookiees examine the corpses. I'll keep this knowledge to myself, I think. The Czerka need not know.
Yes... in time. I will need time to construct a reason for his glorious return. Until then, I think he should accompany you.
I would prefer that. There is nothing here for me. You have shown me that. So have you, <FullName>.
Yes, yes, you have realized the truth. We will all move forward, and for now it would be better if you left.
Yes, I think it is. But what should I reward you with? I wonder if you know the magnitude of what you have done here?
You've made certain I cannot be challenged. With Freyyr gone, there is nobody to whine about the old traditions. Everyone believes in my way... even Zaalbar.
You've shown me how useless our traditions are, so what is there to want? I'll take Bacca's sword. At least it's still useful in combat.
RRAAAAAAGHGHGH!!! BACCA'S SWORD! NOTHING ELSE!
Uh... it seems Zaalbar has made up his mind, and I agree. The sword has lost it's influence here. Removing it from Kashyyyk will kill the old ways completely.
Perhaps you should not be so self-serving.
Getting Wookiees angry is not a smart thing to do.
My, my. Best to give an angry Wookiee his due, I'd say.
Whoa, Big Z! Settle down! I've never seen him this angry before!
Hmm... I agree with the request. The sword has lost it's influence here, and removing it from Kashyyyk will kill the old ways completely. That would suit my plans well.
The only problem is that I only have the hilt of the thing. The blade was lost in the Shadowlands long ago.
I think I'll leave it for you to sort out. Take the hilt. Find the blade and you should be able to assemble the sword.
Will you? Very well. Here, take the hilt. Find the blade and you should be able to assemble the sword.
And if you don't or can't, it'll still be gone from my sight. I think that takes care of everything.
You are full of surprises. Let me see... this should be a simple matter. Yes, I think... there we go.
Take it. It's harmless in the hands of an exile and an outsider. Freyyr was the true force behind it, and the new generation will forget him quickly. You've seen to that.
That finishes our business. Take care, Zaalbar. We'll welcome you back someday. When I decide the people are ready. Not before.
And you, outsider, you'll understand why I don't invite you to stay. The uncontested ruler of Kashyyyk will not abide troublemakers...
No matter how helpful they may have been. Goodbye.
You're not fooling anyone, ya know.
Leave it alone, Mission. This is what I want now.
If you say so, Big Z.
Oh, yes. Far better to have both the blade and a possible rival as far from Kashyyyk as possible, hey? *sigh* I feel very tired of this place, now.
You are free to leave with my brother, mad hermit. Nothing compels you to remain.
Right you are. I think I'll do just that.
Here, let's get the blade off Father's corpse. I should be able to... yes... I think that does it.
Hurry then. I have other things to take care of.
I trust we have all learned something about opposing me? You risked much by pretending to support Freyyr.
I don't want to dwell on it. The deed is done. You rule Kashyyyk. I will follow.
At last you understand. For your loyalty, I'll see your name restored... eventually. It takes time to make people think what I want them to.
I demand an explanation! You don't want me to get angry!
I thought Zaalbar's presence might cause problems.
What are you talking about? How do you know me?
Why did you think you had to do this behind my back?
You had no right to enter my ship!
Janos allowed it? You must work closely with him.
Ignore him, Chuundar. You are dealing with me now.
A nice nest of lies you have constructed.
If you've made deals with slavers, the truth will get out eventually.
Is there a point to this? If this will only lead to a fight, I'd like to get to it.
What do you want? Why drag us here?
I would not abandon Zaalbar to you.
What is this task?
What happened with you and Zaalbar? Give me your version.
You've a complete lack of remorse for your actions. Like a big hairy Hutt.
Which explains why the Wookiees in this room haven't killed you.
I'm only interested in what I'm looking for. A Star Map.
I want to ask about the Shadowlands.
I'll consider what you've said. I'll go now.
I need Zaalbar with me as a guide.
You see, Chuundar, there *is* someone. Uh... make it good, Zaalbar.
Yeah Zaalbar, you and me!
Who are you talking about, Zaalbar?
Play along, Zaalbar. I will see what I can do.
Don't listen, Zaalbar. It's not worth it.
He makes sense, Zaalbar. Perhaps you should listen to him.
Not yet, HK.
You're a fool. You're making the job harder.
I won't do this. Do your own dirty work.
Keeping Zaalbar makes this proposition even worse.
He's standing against you. The first of many, perhaps?
Let's go back to my other questions.
This mad-claw stands against you. More will come.
Do none of you hairy heaps ever shut up?
Nothing. How do you want to proceed, Zaalbar?
For not being able to speak Basic, you all sure yap a lot.
Quiet down. We'll use this to our advantage.
You tell them, Zaalbar!
I don't care! Just get on with it!
Do you have to fight? Talk it through!
Convince them! Avoid this needless slaughter!
Side with Freyyr. He is the honorable one!
No, siding with your brother would be better.
Without doubt! Chuundar is a slaver!
Side with Chuundar. He has the power here!
No, it's better to side with your father!
Yes! Freyyr abandoned you! "Sorry" doesn't make it better!
I heard that.
I wasn't offered much alternative.
I butchered him. Is there a problem?
Yes. It had to be done. Move forward.
Freyyr was your father? I didn't know that.
Will I be rewarded for my efforts?
I want to ask about what I saw in the Shadowlands.
I met the hermit Jolee Bindo down there.
There were Czerka poachers down there.
Back to my Shadowland questions, all right?
I saw an ancient computer of some kind.
It's been there since before the forest.
There were Mandalorian hunters. Very advanced.
Will Zaalbar have a place here, then?
It's time I left.
Shut up, Wookiee, I'm bargaining!
Wait Zaalbar. I want credits out of this.
I think that would be fitting.
Well, that ends that. Perhaps something else?
I might be able to find the blade.
I have the blade.
Let's go back to my other questions.
Welcome back, <FullName>. Much is happening, but I can spare a moment. Our fight against the slavers will be a long one.
Have you questions? I will try to answer.
Greetings father. It is good to see you again.
Farewell to you. I thank you again.
Yes, goodbye, father.
I am surprised that such a thing escaped my attention. Was their camouflage so great, or was I simply too struck by grief to see anything?
If more are encountered, we will deal with them in short order. My people will never be weak again.
I have no knowledge of anything like that. Wait... there was something...
In my exile I encountered a strange computer in the depths of the Shadowlands. I thought it was a Czerka cast-off.
You might find something of use in it. It was northwest of the area where you encountered me.
Yes, I remember seeing it during my exile. It wouldn't do much for me. I imagine it's some Czerka cast-off.
You are saying nonsense. I'm not sure why you have made this jest but I would ask that you stop.
These are difficult times. I don't want you threatening our traditions while I am trying to unite my people under them.
I will investigate your claims at a more appropriate time. Until then, don't speak of this again.
Yes, Bacca's Sword. It promises a great future for my people in my son's hands.
What did you just say?
I will answer if I can. Be brief.
I see. So the gift of our greatest symbol is not enough for you?
I will let this pass and treat you with due respect for the sake of my son, but *never* speak to me of this again.
[Failure] No I don't, you gorryl slug trail! How dare you suggest that Bacca's Sword is insufficient!
[Success] I... I want to... give you some credits as well. Here... something we salvaged from Chuundar's Czerka bribes.
Yes, I think that is fair. I think. Better not mention it to anyone. It's just between you and me.
By all the lower lands, did you just have the gall to try and sell me the sword I gave to my son? I am outraged!
[Failure] I... I am outraged! Such disrespect! I've seen gorryl slugs with more honor than you!
For the sake of my son I won't have you beaten senseless with your own legs, but I want you out of here!
You want me to talk, you bring Zaalbar. I'll speak out of respect for him, not you!
I did warn you this wouldn't work.
Now you've done it. There's no way you could convince him of that.
Cautionary: As predicted, this Wookiee has reacted poorly to your offer.
Oh boy, now you've done it. No way he'd say okay to that.
Oh, I don't think that will work this time.
Your should not press him too far. It may have unfortunate consequences.
This Wookiee does not like this line of questioning. You'll anger him past reasoning.
Careful. He'll be impossible to reason with if you get him any madder.
Observation: You are angering this Wookiee beyond reasoning. Caution would be best.
Don't push him too much or we'll have a berserk Wookiee on our hands...
Careful, I've seen Zaalbar get this mad too. There's no persuading him when it happens.
Oh, this isn't wise. An angry Wookiee can't be reasoned with.
What? Wait, I won't have you demean the gift of Bacca's Sword by asking for money as well.
I mean it, I don't want to hear you ask my father about this again.
I believe you have taken advantage of my good will. If you wish to talk, bring my son with you. I will speak out of respect for him, not you.
We have done it... I am saddened that it had to come to this, but I couldn't let it continue.
Zaalbar, my son. I am truly sorry. You have suffered a great shame. I was blind. I have no excuse.
I can forgive, father. I have learned a lot over the years.
Returning home has lifted a great weight from my mind... but it has been painful as well.
You have a place by my side, Zaalbar. I would be honored if you would take it.
I... I can't. Not yet. I'm just getting used to being free... and not just from the slavers.
And I have a life-debt. Now that my life is truly my own again, honoring that agreement is all the more important.
Listen to my son! His insight humbles me. Take that good judgment with you and all the planets will come to revere Wookiee wisdom.
We will fight them. It will be difficult, but I swear they won't take another one of my people without bloodshed.
I'll send quick-climbers to other villages and try to rally a defense. We must guard against this ever happening again.
You will be the last outsider welcome here for a very long time. That is a change for the better, I think.
I have not forgotten you, <FullName>. You don't need to make demands. You have done us a great service. Kashyyyk will remember you well past your lifetime.
Perhaps, but before you go, <FullName>, I must see to your reward. You have done us a great service. Kashyyyk will remember you well past your lifetime.
Because of you, I am reinstated as Chieftain. We will return to the old ways, when honor and trust of kin ruled above all else.
I'm not sure there is a reward that accurately reflects the value of what you have done. Our world is changed because of you.
I have a request, father. I have thought about it a great deal. I would like Bacca's Sword.
I have gone through a lot here. I don't think it's too much to ask that I choose the reward.
You should not be so self-serving, lest you fall to the dark side.
Now, you just close your hole, child. It's a shock, I'm sure, but this isn't about you.
Look, Big Z may owe you a life-debt but you've got to cut him some slack!
Well... That is quite a request. I am tempted to say no but... perhaps I should consider it an investment.
Zaalbar, do you understand what this will mean? It is the legacy of our people, held by chieftains... and future chieftains.
I understand. I want this, father. I'll bring it back one day.
I have no doubt. Let the two halves of the blade be made one. My son shall hold Bacca's Sword.
Could they wait? I will answer what I can later, but we need to settle our current business. There is much that needs to be done.
I should be going.
I encountered some Mandalorian hunters in the Shadowlands.
I'm looking for something called a Star Map.
I saw a strange computer in the Shadowlands.
It's older than the forest. It created the trees.
I want to ask about the reward you gave.
Yes, sure, but I've got bills to pay.
Nothing. Let's just go back to my questions.
I want some credits in addition to the sword.
I'm sorry, forget I said anything.
[Force Persuade] You want to pay me credits. Many, many credits.
[Lie] Zaalbar doesn't want the sword. Take it back and give me money.
[Force Persuade] You want to trade me credits for Bacca's Sword.
[Persuade] Credits will help more than this sword. I'll buy better equipment.
What will you do now, Zaalbar?
What will you do about the slavers?
Enough. I want my reward and then I'm leaving.
I think it's time I was leaving.
Zaalbar, shut up. I want some credits.
That would be fitting, I think.
I have a few questions about Kashyyyk, Freyyr.
Chuundar is dead... and good riddance. Speak with my father. He will decide what is to happen now.
It is done. Freyyr... is dead. Speak with Chuundar, he will decide what happens now.
Freyyr will see us through this dark time, thanks to your efforts.
You will be remembered for what you have done.
You are the only outsider permitted in here. It is an honor.
Freyyr welcomes you for what you have done. The Wookiee people are in your debt.

Bacca's Sword

This sword is forever linked to the most revered figure in Wookiee lore, Bacca. A great and wise warrior, Bacca was hunting in the Shadowlands ages ago when an alien ship crashed through the upper boughs of the forest. The tale varies with each telling, but whether he had to fight the inhabitants or just found them obliterated in the wreckage, he understood their coming as a sign. There was life elsewhere in the galaxy, and it might not come to Kashyyyk with peace in mind. Bacca supposedly constructed this weapon from components found among the debris, and over time it became a symbol of leadership. It reminds his people that trust must be given cautiously, and only to those that have earned it. The blade shows no signs of wear, though the leather grip is well worn.
Bacca's sword hilt

This is part of Bacca's Ceremonial Blade, damaged due to the arrogance of Chieftain Rothrrrawr. He underestimated a creature in the Shadowlands (later dubbed the Great Beast), and lost the blade in its hide. The hilt remained in his court, passed to other chieftains. If both pieces could be found, the sword might be able to be reassembled.

I'll scrap you and take what I can.
What systems of yours are active?
Move south and attack hostiles. [<CUSTOM43> repair part(s)]
Move northeast and attack hostiles. [<CUSTOM43> repair part(s)]
What happened to you?

SYSTEMS SHUTTING DOWN.
THIS EMITTER HAS BEEN DEACTIVATED.

CZERKA CORPORATION SYSTEMS
TEMPORARY SONIC FIELD EMISSION NETWORK.
SYSTEMS FUNCTIONING AS NORMAL.

INTERFACE TERMINATED.
RESUMING NORMAL OPERATION.

PRIMARY FUNCTIONS ACCESSED.
SONIC EMISSION FIELD OPERATIONAL.
CHANGE STATUS?
ENTER INDIVIDUAL ACCESS CODE.

NO OTHER OPTIONS AVAILABLE.
TO MODIFY PRIMARY FUNCTIONS REQUIRES INPUT OF INDIVIDUAL ACCESS CODE.

ACCESS CODE ACCEPTED.
TERMINATING SONIC EMISSION FIELD.
THIS NODE WILL REMAIN OFFLINE UNTIL MAINTENANCE RESTORES FULL OPERATION.

SYSTEMS SHUTTING DOWN.
BLASTER FIRE HAS DAMAGED THE EMITTER NETWORK.
Terminate interface.
Access primary functions
Code not available. Alternate access options?
Enter Czerka guard code. Terminate sonic emission.
[The shimmer of a repulsor field is visible before you. It stands in stark contrast with the foliage around it.]
[There appears to be no obvious means of deactivating the field. You'll need to find someone familiar with the area that is willing to help you.]
[This is obviously one of the barriers to your progress that Jolee was speaking of. If he were here, he would allow you to pass it.]
There, you see? Beautifully subtle, isn't it? At least, compared to other Czerka equipment dumped down here.
It's only been here a short while, or the Wookiees would have disabled it. They wouldn't have had an easy time of it, though.
Ah, very well. Young durga-spits like you have no appreciation for details. Now, let's see... how did I do it...
Ahh, there we go. Now keep moving. These are the most dangerous depths of Kashyyyk.
A few surprises wait for us, I'll wager.
You aren't going to ask about it? A repulsor field in the woods and you have no interest?
All right then, uh, how did it go...
There are others, each blocking similar points on certain paths. It is all very calculated. Very precise.
It would have been effective if it hadn't relied on the creatures to be walking. Climbers don't have much trouble getting around it.
I think it was an attempt to block the more dangerous carnivores from wandering freely, but it's not very effective.
It limits us non-climbers, but the creatures of Kashyyyk are very adaptable. You'll see why when we reach your goal.
I can manipulate it for a moment. Let me see... how did the Czerka engineers do it...
Yes, but I don't make a habit of it. The other side is genuinely dangerous.
Here we are again. Shall I bypass the field so we may pass?
Whatever. Just shut it down.
Just shut it down. I'll worry about it later.
Very well. Why did Czerka put this here?
Why place this thing here?
Why did the Czerka place this here?
I trust you can get past it? You said so.
Have you gone past it before?
Yes. Get us past the field.
Hello again, <FullName>. I've heard nothing of your progress, so I will assume there hasn't been any.
I'll take you back to the surface, but you must do Chuundar's task. Don't keep him waiting.
I'll operate the basket, as Chuundar has commanded, but I won't answer your questions while I stand in the Shadowlands.
This place is sacred ground. Many of my kind have proven themsleves here, and many have died as well.
You aren't worthy of this place. I won't speak to you while we're here.
Very well. I will wait here for you to return.
Very well. Just one moment.
You! <FullName>! Our spies say that the mad-claw you were sent to kill is on his way to Rwookrrorro right now!
You should have followed the will of Chuundar! Now you will face his wrath!
Now this is what I live for!
The spies of Chuundar have followed you as closely as possible, <FullName>. They tell me you have killed the mad-claw.
That is not my concern, outsider. I serve Chuundar and no other.
I will take you directly to him. He is waiting in the throne room.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
I'm not ready to go up. I'll be back later.
Just take me up for now.
That mad-claw was Freyyr, Chuundar's father.
Take me up so I can speak with Chuundar.
That's the way! Now prove that wasn't blind luck, you baby!
Well, that was acceptable. You're not quite the commander I'd have accompanied in my youth, but you managed to walk away.
I'm Jolee. Jolee Bindo. Follow me to my camp and we'll talk a bit.
Look, you can follow now or stumble around on your own, but I'm too old to care whether you think I'm babysitting you.
Ah, don't start fawning just yet, I'm too old for it. *Sigh* I...I know a few things, but we can talk about it at my camp.
Why am I here? Hmph. Well it isn't because I like the stink of dead kinrath. Let's move this talk to my camp where the air is better.
Keep close. It's nearby, under a log. Yeah, I live like some burrowing rodent. I fought the Sith... now look at me. Hmph!
Ah, the damnable racket of battle! Watch yourself, even more of these crawling beasts are hiding in the underbrush.
Quit your yapping for now. We'll talk when the company is better. Get to fightin'!
Who are you to give me orders, old man?
You use a lightsaber in battle. Are you a Jedi?
I will, but explain what you are doing here.
Help or don't, just stay out of my way.
What, do I have to fight you as well now?
Who are you? What are you doing here?
Welcome back. I wonder, have you had much luck? Have you done as I asked?
Well hurry up! You don't want to be stuck here as long as I have.
Yes, I could feel it as you walked near. And I don't sense the smell of death on you. You spared them? Interesting.
If you imagined a meaning behind it, I suppose that's good, but I don't think such a trivial thing is any real measure of a person.
Wasn't there? I suppose not, but the environment would say otherwise, if it could talk. No matter.
Yes, I heard the fuss of it. I told you I wanted a non-violent solution, and I had my reasons for it. You should have thought about that.
Czerka Corporation will find the bodies and blame the Wookiees. This may cause more troops to be deployed. That means more disruption.
I'm not pleased, but what's done is done and I'm not here to judge you. Hopefully you'll take care of that yourself.
You're pretty much right, really. Truth be known, I won't judge how you fared... as long as you can LIVE WITH YOURSELF!
Was that convincing? It's been a while since I've been in the company of someone that needed that kind of babysitting.
I know where you want to go. I can get you through to the old paths. This forest hides some strange things.
Yes, of course. Let's get moving. I noticed the old paths some time ago. You probably wouldn't have found them on your own.
There's also a Czerka repulsor field blocking the way, past the poacher camp in the east. I saw it when it was installed, so I know how to pass it.
And on the other side... ancient answers. And perhaps a Wookiee you were seeking. I hope he's in the mood for visitors.
Yes, yes, in the east past the poacher camp. I saw it when it was installed. It's a very effective barrier, but I know how to get past it.
You were here and it needed doing. Besides, dealing with the Czerka is dirty business. I hope you washed your hands.
A good teacher, and I'm not saying I am one, but a good teacher doesn't mash a book in a student's face shouting "learn this bit here!"
If you can't look at the situation for yourself and see the logic behind my way of doing things, you're not the type to understand me anyway.
Besides, you're a little old for that master/student fuss, aren't you? I know I am.
Oh, go bark up a tree. You'll get the same response out of me. Besides, I'm not about to get in the habit of grading you.
I see. You are completely detached. Are you sure you're not a droid? It doesn't matter. A trivial thing like this is no measure of anyone.
Well, perhaps I have a duty to point out what you should have learned from this. Or perhaps... no.
Well, welcome to my home, such as it is. Pull up a stump and be comfortable. We should discuss a few things.
Do you? Well, I'd better not keep you. I mean, I've only spent about twenty years here. Heh. What could I possibly tell you?
Hmph! You don't want to be just another fool with a big impatient chip on their shoulder. That's a dark road, child.
Oh ho, your manner is fearsome. Like the little ullers I shoo from the garden, hissing at what they don't understand.
I'm too old for your posturing, child. If you have questions, then ask them.
Yes, yes. I suppose it's my lot in life, to spend years learning something so that someone else can be impatient to hear it.
I'm sure you are, but you have to take time to listen. Really, you shouldn't try so hard to make new enemies.
You'll have nothing but time if you don't take what help you can. I've been here for many years. I know things. Remember that.
Don't coddle me, child. I'm neither a Jedi nor your master. I'm just an old man that's been lost in the woods for far too long.
My days of glory are behind me, but... perhaps there is something I can do for you. You must have questions.
As I said, if you complete my task and allow me to join your group, I will remove the repulsor field from your path.
I saw them put it in, so only I know how to manipulate it. That knowledge will serve me now. Do as I ask.
Ahh, I thought you would spot that. It's easy to see with Force-sensitive eyes, isn't it? Heh heh. Czerka put it there.
It's a troublesome thing, blocking some access to the lower Shadowlands. That's where you want to go, isn't it?
I told you my price. After you complete my task I'll make it so you can pass the barriers blocking your goal. That's all I will add on the subject.
Now why would you be asking about that, hmm? Don't answer. I knew that had to be why you were here.
Yes, among the Wookiees. Intriguing creatures. I like that they have little patience for bureaucrats.
But of course, even here there are hidden things that manipulate.
*Sigh* Fine, fine, just be brief.
They are not hard to find. Their camp is to the far northeast. Try to get them to leave without too much fuss.
After you finish, I will make it so you can pass the barrier that prevents your access to the lower Shadowlands.
I smell their tach-scent on you. Did you agree to hunt for them? Let me remind you that I do not approve, and you need me.
Go to their camp and get rid of them. When you are through, we can proceed to the lower Shadowlands. Not before.
On the body of Rorworr, I know. His death will not go unnoticed. I have been wondering how this foolishness would play out.
I am no weaponsmith, but someone in the village will be able to identify the owner of that bolt casing. They are very personal items.
It is a very unfortunate matter. It will end in shame and sorrow. You will find Rorworr down here. And more.
I have witnessed a number of happenings, but I have left them for others to sort out.
I wasn't aware I had to be. Look, events like these reveal much about the people involved. I'm well past that introspective tripe.
I'm not saying that outside help isn't needed. I just... well...
I didn't want to make anyone mad while I didn't have a way off the planet. We'll talk more about that momentarily.
Maddened with grief, perhaps, but not crazed. I helped him pass to the lower forests where only a Wookiee could follow.
Some other matters will determine if you can follow. There is a barrier that... well, we'll talk of that more in a moment.
Czerka Corporation was smart to put him in power. He's as good at destroying Wookiee culture as dropping corpses full of Ardroxian Flu.
Will you work for him or against him, I wonder? I will be interested to see.
Uh, sure, how's this: think for yourself. I don't care for politics, and I'm big on letting people figure things out for themselves.
The Wookiees have prophesies of deliverance if you ask them, but for now they follow without hesitation. That is their wish.
Ah, what is there to tell? Jolee Bindo is the crazy old man in the dangerous woods. I'm content with the impression I give.
Why, don't you like what I've done with the place? The creatures here aren't any more treacherous than elsewhere.
Did I? You have annoyingly good ears. It doesn't matter. Those days are gone. Leave them in their graves.
I follow the Jedi Way and I command the Force, yes, and I suppose that makes me as much a Jedi as anyone... but what of it?
I've seen my share of the dark and the light. And frankly, both extremes annoy me. Of course... I have felt the rumblings of change...
Perhaps you will be of some assistance to me after all. Let us discuss what you came here for.
Wait wait wait, slow down. I have to ask something of you. I've got something you need, and you can help me.
We both know why you have come here. The Star Map. That has to be it. There is nothing else here.
The problems of a few Wookiees don't amount to anything before the concerns of the Jedi. No, you are here for the map.
Kashyyyk is an interesting place, more so than anyone suspects. If Czerka Corporation knew, heh, the planet would be a strip mine.
The Wookiees have their legends that they were not always here, but it is more than that. The trees themselves are strangers.
What I'm saying is that there are literally walls in your way, and you won't find what you need without my help... and my help has a price.
You must do a task for me, and then allow me to join with you. I will then remove certain barriers in your path.
Since they began expanding in the Shadowlands, the Czerka have left me alone, for the most part. Until recently, anyway.
A group of them set up camp not far from here. Poachers is all they are. I'd like them removed from this place.
Don't talk back to your elders, child. Look, they know me quite well, and are always on alert when I approach.
The only way I could get rid of them would be violence, which would eventually lead to trouble for the Wookiees.
I want them gone, but with as little fuss as possible. They have already caused enough trouble as it is.
You presumably have a ship. I've seen all I wish to here. Isn't that enough? I mean, I'm really sick of the trees.
And perhaps your destiny might show me something new. You never know.
They are not that far northeast of here. There is usually five in the area, as far as I can see.
The Captain of the lot is the one that earned my ire. Mishandle my garden, will he? Hmph!
I told you, they are destroying the environment. People are mostly annoying, but the balance of nature, *that* needs protecting.
They don't respect this place. They are butchering wildlife and threatening entire species. It's getting under my skin.
The Wookiees could take care of themselves if they wished, but the animals are truly helpless victims.
Yes, yes, I'm an old man that's getting fussy. Call me foolish if you will, I don't care. You still have to do it.
Oh please, this is arbitrary errand work, but such are the requests of the aged. You still have to do it.
Their camp is in the far northeast. Now remember, if I wanted them dead, I'd have done it myself. Find a better way.
Good. Return to me here and we will see how you have done. Shoo. Shoo!
Oh, save it. I know this sounds absurd, but I'm old and entitled to work you around a bit. Besides, the test is simple.
Now, I'm not sure if you'll measure up to my task, seeing as how you've already joined up with the slime I want gone.
Hunting monkey is part of your great plan? I know you talked to the Czerka poachers, and I don't care. I want them gone.
The Czerka poachers, I can smell that scent they use on you. I don't care what you told them, I want them gone.
After you do that, I want to join up with you. Then I'll remove the barrier between you and the lower Shadowlands.
Of course, this won't be a problem for you, since you have already completed my task. Removal of the Czerka poachers.
Ah, and it makes you think I may have the taint of the dark side in me, doesn't it? Ooh. Is that what you are wondering, huh? Ooh.
Well, I assure you, I see more grey than dark or light. I'm just a stubborn old man, tired of the foolishness of others.
Look, we've been through this before. My past is my affair. Get some years behind you and then we'll talk about me.
I think you'll agree that we have more important things to discuss, no?
I've got to get back to my task.
I have some questions I need answered.
I have made certain the poachers are gone.
Enough. Have I passed your little test?
There was nothing to gain by killing them.
Funny, I don't picture you as the "disapproving master" type
You mentioned eliminating barriers? Could we get to it?
Will you help me find the Star Map now?
You mentioned barriers. There's a repulsor field I want to pass.
If you didn't care about the outcome, why have me do this?
You aren't going to tell me what I should have learned?
I kill what I want. Don't argue with me, old man.
It was the most efficient way to stop them.
I couldn't find a peaceful solution. I regret that.
I have better things to do.
Then speak, and I'll see if you can be of use.
Well then, will you answer some questions?
Forgive me, but I am under a tight schedule.
I've no time for your prattling. I'm on a mission.
No offense, but I don't have much time.
Yes, I feel there is much you can tell me.
There's a repulsor field in the east. Do you know how to pass it?
Have you any knowledge of Star Maps?
I need information about problems on Kashyyyk.
I want to ask you some questions.
Can you tell me more about the poachers?
Do you recognize these bowcaster bolts? I found them on a corpse.
Do you know a missing Wookiee called Rorworr?
You aren't being very helpful.
Have you seen a crazed Wookiee in the Shadowlands?
What do you know of Chuundar?
You don't have a recommendation?
I want to ask about you.
Why have you exiled yourself here?
You muttered something about fighting Sith?
But you use a lightsaber in battle. You are a Jedi.
I'm leaving. I have to get moving.
Get to the point, old man.
If you have information, please tell it to me.
Legends? I have real barriers I need to pass.
You are rambling, old man! Get to the point.
I don't understand. Can you be more specific?
What do you want me to do?
Why not just go get rid of them yourself?
Why would you want to join up with me?
Where are they? How many men?
Why do you care if they are here?
I see. So the aged semi-Jedi wants me to get some kids off his lawn.
Well, I'll try to learn from this humble task.
I will look into it.
Can't I just pay you? I hate jumping hoops.
Why should I trust you, you crazy old coot?
I'm honored to help someone of your experience.
This better not mess up any plans I've made.
Who do you mean?
You are difficult to deal with. It worries me.
What do you want? I don't want to get on the commander's bad side, so just leave me alone.
You want anything you'll have to talk to the commander. He's in charge of our harvesting here.
Okay, okay, there's no need to get like that. The Commander just prefers everyone to go through him first.
Why am I here? I'm here because this is where the Commander told me to stand. And that's all there is to it.
I'm just a guard for this emitter. Why couldn't they have just equipped this lump of tech with a blaster and left me at home?
Good. I don't want any trouble.
Are you threatening me? Unless you want a fight with all of us I'd suggest you change your tone.
Besides, enough things down here want to kill me. I don't need to add you to the list.
We're under attack!
I'm not here because I know stuff. I handle a blaster well enough to guard this emitter, and that's it. Talk to the Commander.
What do you want to know about that? It's just one of five or so sonic emitters protecting the camp.
They generate a sonic barrier that allows us to stay in this wonderful location. It keeps the big predators away.
I don't know how it works, really. I just know that if they go down, the camp would be overrun.
What of it?
That sounds like a fair deal to me. Here, use this code to access the one I'm guarding.
[Success] I don't like being here, that's for sure. I suppose you could... take this code and shut down the emitter I'm guarding.
[Failure] It's "friendly" people like you that recruited me into this mess. I'm keeping an eye on you, that's for sure.
[Success] I don't like being here, that's for sure. I suppose you could... take this code and shut down the emitter I'm guarding.
Enough of those emitters go down and the camp will have to move out. But I never said anything.
No more dangerous than walking out on the commander. He'd kill me for disobeying orders.
[Failure] What? No! Get lost! You'll get me killed!
[Success] I... I really need to get out of here. It's too dangerous!
Don't you start with me! I don't know what you said to that other guy, but I'm not risking getting killed!
Now leave me alone before the Commander gets any ideas.
[Failure] Oh no, I'm not getting myself killed! I'm not!
[Success] Maybe you're right... maybe I should make a break for it.
I've helped you all I'm going to. Any more and the Commander will have me shot. Leave me alone.
Good. I don't need the trouble.
Are you threatening me? You're asking for a fight with all of us. I don't need more things trying to kill me down here.
[Failure] What are you talking about? I don't want any such thing! Leave me alone!
I asked you! You'll answer my questions!
I'd rather ask about you. Why are you here?
I'm leaving.
Quit your whining and answer my questions!
Let's just go back to my other questions.
That's too bad. I'm going to kill you all!
I want to ask you some questions.
Let's talk about the emitter you're guarding.
What do these emitters do?
So only the emitters are keeping you here?
Maybe you could help me shut it down? For, say, 200 credits?
[Force Persuade] Tell me how to shut down the emitters.
[Persuade] So, if someone shut them down, you could leave.
You'll answer what I tell you to answer!
This is a dangerous place. Could I persuade you to leave?
[Force Persuade] You want to leave. Make a break for it.
I want to go back to my other questions.
[Force Persuade] You want to leave. Make a break for it.
I'm leaving.
That isn't good enough. I need more, or else.
[Force Persuade] You want to leave. Make a break for it.
You'll do as I say or you'll regret it.
Well that's just great! I don't have the men to keep this location safe!
I'll be back, though! There's money here!
Deserter! Traitor! I'll make an example of you!
That's it! You are dead!
Back again, hmm? Unless you've business with me I suggest you turn around and walk away.
Who are you, another civil merchant like that coro-slime up on the docking ring? This is my territory.
I don't make deals and I don't persuade easily, so go back topside. Mess with my profits and I'll see you dead.
Look, I don't care if you want to play tourist down here, but you behave yourself or we'll have a problem.
I've got a job to do, and I won't be gentle if you get in my way, understand?
He's got no authority with me. I'm with Czerka Corporation. He's just some pet we keep so the locals stay in line.
As long as you don't get in my way, you can wander where you want. I've got a job to do.
So you're playing tourist? That isn't smart. The Shadowlands are all business. Mess around and you'll end up dead.
That said, if you want to make some credits while you're looking to die, I might have a job for you.
Good. I'm not down here to direct traffic.
I don't need this kind of garbage from you. Watch your mouth. I'm the only law there is down here.
If you've got something to say, get on with it. Otherwise, leave me alone. I've credits to earn.
All right, I'm done talking with you. You've got under my skin one too many times! I'll bury you down here!
Just you try it.
Is that old hermit Jolee trying to talk you into doing his dirty work? We've spent too much on setting up just to walk away.
As long the sonic emitters keep the preds away and I've got bodies to guard the perimeter, we're staying right here.
I mean, if I can put up with my own worthless guards complaining about this place, Jolee whining through you is nothing.
If you made it this far you know a fair bit already. What would I be able to tell you?
It ain't easy. We've set up a perimeter of sonic emitters to keep the bigger preds away. It's worked so far.
As long as the emitters are operational, we're pretty much safe. It makes harvesting a lot easier.
Besides you? Besides any number of predators that can kill in seconds? I suppose there's old Bindo.
He's got a camp here somewhere. I'd leave him alone, though. Anyone who'd live down here is just plain crazy.
There's not much else. We've got a repulsor field to the east so not much passes through here now.
What? No, I don't do much of that. It's too much of a headache. I'm in the business of harvesting animals.
Some of the more exotic species have organs that can be removed and put to some surprising applications.
Talk to me about work and maybe I'll tell you more.
I've already told you about that. You agreed to help bring them in.
I'm no nav officer. I work on the ground, and I haven't seen anything like that around here.
Of course, we haven't been much deeper than this. The eastern forest gets even more dangerous.
It's not worth it. You're fighting the plants as well as the animals. Kshyy vines are tough as metal, and grow back fast.
Instead, head office installed repulsor fields to keep the big predators out. Permanent placements too. We'll be fine for years.
I'll take whatever you have. Keep it up and we'll both be rich. At least until we bleed this planet dry, hahaha!
I could use an extra hand. A couple men have gone missing. If I lose many more I'll have to close up shop.
We are hunting the little simians, the tach. They have a gland that acts as a stimulant when powdered.
I figure I've got two or three wealthy years to butcher the lot of them. You want in before I make them extinct?
Hurry up. You're eating into my profits.
I'm hard-pressed to come up with a way for you to stop me. I'll defend this operation if I have to.
I'm warning you, I didn't get this job because of my sense of humor. You smart mouth me again and we'll have a problem.
Hell, I have guards everywhere and a perimeter of sonic emitters. I don't fear anything in the Shadowlands, including you.
Uh, no. I'll be rich by then, and won't need to do it anymore. I don't have to worry about it.
Besides, if there's no more tach, the predators that eat them will die off and we'll have an easier time milking this planet.
I really can't quote a price. Depends on the market. I give fair value for each one, rest assured. That promise will have to do.
Hurry up, I'm wasting too much time on you as it is.
All right then, I'll set you up. First you need to be able to draw them out. It's easy.
I'll spray you with this scent... it drives them crazy. They can't help but attack you, even if it's a hopeless fight.
Then you just carve them up. There's a big fleshy bulb in their brains that you want to scoop out. You can't miss it.
I'd feel guilty if the money weren't so good. Come back here when you've got the glands and I'll pay you.
That crazy old fool is still alive? I suppose he's still upset that we don't all live in little homemade shacks like he chooses.
I've got a job to do here, and there's nothing you or that old coot can do about it.
Are you going to stop me? I go where I want.
Chuundar has given me permission to be here.
I paid the docking fee. Who cares where I go?
I'm leaving.
You're just a Czerka slaver. Nothing special.
I should just kill you. No one will ever know.
What if I want you to leave the Shadowlands?
I want to ask you a few questions.
If the Shadowlands are so dangerous, how do you survive?
Is there anything odd down here?
Are you part of the slaving operation?
I'm looking for something called a Star Map.
I have other questions about the Shadowlands.
You aren't safe with blasters?
I've got some tach glands to sell you.
I've got a tach gland to sell you.
I might be interested in some work.
Back to my general questions, all right?
This wholesale slaughter can't be allowed!
Maybe you should just pay me so I don't shut you down.
Don't you care that you could wipe out the whole species?
What does the job pay?
I have more questions about the job.
I want the job. How do I hunt these tach?
Are you the poachers Jolee told me about?
What?
RRRRAAAAAAARRRRRGGGG!!!!
Run, run!
[Having seen Gorwooken operate the basket, you understand it well enough to use it yourself.]
[You leave the basket as it is.]
[You begin the long ascent to the upper boughs of Kashyyyk.]
[Leave it alone.]
[Raise the basket out of the Shadowlands.]

This was abandoned next to Rorworr's corpse, likely by whoever killed him. Bowcasters and casings are very personal items adorned with family symbols and other marks. It's possible a knowledgeable Wookiee could identify the owner.
Slaver Contract

This datapad card contains a contract to trade weapons for slaves, and a manifest of goods already delivered. It would seem that Rorworr had sold a number of Wookiees previously, and intended to do so again.
Droid Head
Hortuth Berries
Though unpalatable to most outsiders, hortuth berries are an adequate source of nourishment for a number of species native to Kashyyyk.
Crystal Amulet
Tach gland
This gland was cut from the corpse of a tach, a small primate. It can supposedly be powdered to produce a powerful stimulant.
