Kashyyyk - Lower Shadowlands
Life forms detected. Determining parameters. Initiating neural recognition.
Primary neural recognition complete. Preliminary match found.
Begin socialized interface. Awaiting instruction. Greetings. This terminal has not been accessed for quite some time.
Error. Subject displays unfamiliarity to environment. Behavioral reconfiguration will be needed before access.
I am sorry, I did not mean to confuse you. I will answer questions to the best of my programming limitations.
Corruption has resulted in gaps appearing in my memory, and in that of the original installation.
It could be theorized that these gaps are intentional, but I have no information on that.
Error. I can't present a non-presence. Perhaps you could ask other questions and data corruption will become evident.
Accessing. Yes, I have found a Star Map in original system memory. Access is restricted.
Your request requires additional security access. You must be made to match the parameters I have been supplied.
Then you are not worthy of further access. You will be rejected as unsuitable.
Information unavailable. If you have further questions, ask them now. Access will terminate with success or failure of evaluation.
Evaluation commencing. Results will be compared against the pattern in memory. Just act like you should.
You travel with a Wookiee and have encountered complications. Hypothetical: you and this Zaalbar are captured and separated.
If you both remain silent, one year in prison for each of you. However, call Zaalbar a traitor, and he will serve five years, while you serve none.
He is offered the same deal, but if you both accuse the other, you both serve 2 years. What do you do? What do you trust him to do?
I hear what happens on Kashyyyk, and a good deal beyond. Answer the question I have posed.
The temperment of a companion is unreliable at best. You wisely trade the threat of one year or five, for none or two.
In this instance, the Wookiee is unreliable. His family has been a mire of treachery. I judge the answer correct.
You display the proper behavior to match the pattern in memory. Evaluation will continue.
Implied threat matches pattern in memory, but the subject has failed to demonstrate required recognition.
They are already against you. Anything that corrupts your strength and efficiency is against you.
I merely serve to illustrate the proper patterns. You must be guided to think in the proper manner.
This machine certainly seems to want a very specific type of response.
I don't like this machine, or the answers it coaxes.
Are you sure? If you turn, you risk two years, or none at all. If you rely on loyalty, you risk one year or *five.*
Your loyalty is dangerous. Your companion could take the opportunity to benefit by turning on you.
Zaalbar's family is mired in treachery. What loyalty do they know? Your answer is incorrect.
You also killed his brother. You have no guarantee of loyalty from Zaalbar. Your answer is wrong.
You even killed Freyyr, his father. You have no guarantee of loyalty. You have answered incorrectly.
You cannot refuse. Evaluation must continue. You must match the pattern in memory. *Your* memory.
I must match your behavior to the pattern in memory. You must answer truthfully, knowing the consequences.
A superficial change will not match the pattern in memory. You must answer truthfully, knowing the consequences.
I must demand honest acceptance of the proper behavior. That is a condition of my programming.
Intention of hostility matches the pattern in memory, but the subject has failed to demonstrate required behavior.
Access denied. This system will purge the subject as false. Defense mode initiated!
That information is not available to you. It is the pattern that I have been given as a baseline for security access.
The previous incorrect response will be discounted. Future incorrect responses will result in rejection.
Hypothetical: you are at war. Deciphering an intercepted code, you learn two things about your enemy.
A single spot in their defense will be at its weakest in ten days, and they will attack one of your cities in five days.
What do you do with this information? What is the most efficient course of action?
Very good. If you had moved to evactuate the city, you would have alerted the enemy to their lost codes.
Ultimate victory required the deaths of the people in that city. You wisely ignored sentiment in your decision.
Very good reasoning. I will apply it to the rest of the evaluation. You begin to match the pattern in memory.
You achieved the proper result with logic that does not match the pattern in memory. I shall adjust my evaluation.
Hypothetical: remove the ongoing war from the previous example. Consider enemy states to be weak and remote.
With no external threat, your empire stagnates. Your people become complacent and begin to question you.
Same scenario as before; you discover an impending attack, but also a weakness that will come after. How do you react?
Of course you do. It makes the most strategic sense. Your people will rally beneath you against the common foe.
As their eyes turn outward, your rule will strengthen. The trappings of war grant many opportunities.
You have matched the pattern in memory. I recognize you, and will fulfill my designated function.
That information is not available. Soon you will recognize the proper course to follow. The Star Map is yours.
This unit has now completed its primary duty and has finished with the subject. Executing final action.
Activation of Star Map commencing. Parameters reset. Stasis initiated. End communication.
I am programmed to guide, not inform. Soon you will recognize the proper course to follow. The Star Map is yours.
Yes, you are ready. Soon you will recognize the proper course to follow. The Star Map is yours.
But if nothing happens, your people will have no need of heroes. No, they don't see a threat. You have coddled them.
Your empire will be brought down by introspection. You have failed to match the pattern in memory.
No, you can't hide behind the greater morality. This is a single attack. The enemy does not intend a sustained conflict.
There is no war to end. You must choose the outcome based only on its immediate benefits and consequences.
This is no decision. I ask again, do you save your people or abandon them for the sake of the war?
Attempting both will merely dilute your efforts. Would you trade one victory for two failures?
And in so doing, alert the enemy to their broken codes. They would know that their weakness was exposed.
They would reinforce, and the war would go on. You saved thousands at the expense of victory.
You do not match the pattern in memory. Subject has failed to demonstrate the required behavior.
Rrraaagh! You know nothing of me!
This test is not for your companions! You will answer and demonstrate that you match the pattern in memory.
There are measures available. Personality profiling will verify the basic structure of your conscious mind.
With that, I will determine whether you are ready to receive the Star Map, or can be made ready.
You need only ask. It was you that put the restrictions in place. Original system memory is at your disposal.
Error. Data regarding author of the Star Map is corrupted.
I utilize a retro-adapted holocron-interface. Clarify your questions and I will attempt to access original system memory.
Answer will be given within the limits of my programming limitations.
The current purpose of this installation is defense.
Error. That information is not available.
The current function of this installation is defense of the Star Map data, as outlined by you, Lord Revan.
You wanted to delay anyone following you, and verify that nothing had altered your state of mind should you return.
In the event of pattern mismatch, behavioral study and modification would identify and ensure that you remained Lord Revan.
The reason you placed such a measure is known only by you, Lord Revan.
Not since you put the restrictions in place, Lord Revan.
This interface was installed to better access the ancient data stored within the pre-existing system.
The exact date is unavailable. Programming keys indicate no earlier than five years before current Republic standard.
No other information on time of installation or identity of user available. Likelihood of removal by user, 100%.
That information is unavailable, but contact is not required for the execution of my programming. Scanning range of this facility is well beyond planetary boundaries.
Error. Data regarding subject "Revan" corrupted.
Error. Data on "Revan" unavailable.
Sorting by identity. Three attempts by the Wookiee Freyyr, all denied. 152 attempts by human Jolee Bindo, all denied.
Error. List of access attempts prior to these is corrupted. Likelihood of removal by user, 100%.
List of attempts prior to this were removed from memory five years ago, as per your instruction, Lord Revan.
Heh... call me stubborn, I guess. Heh. There wasn't much else to do around here.
Hmm, five years ago? I didn't notice it. This must have been installed in strictest secrecy. It couldn't have been Czerka.
You did, Lord Revan. You constructed it five years ago so you could access the data of the original installation and extract the Star Map.
Error. Corruption. Extrapolating. This utility was built to monitor planet-wide agricultural reformation.
It has since malfunctioned. It can be theorized that the super-growth of Kashyyyk's forests is a direct result.
Malfunction occured 241 years after last builder communication. Last builder communication... 29,642 years before current Republic standard.
Accessing. I will answer as my programming permits.
Error. Records corrupted. It can be theorized that bio-seeding allowed the ecology to remain balanced.
It could be expected that the same energy feeding the trees of Kashyyyk also accelerated the evolution of various species.
No further information is available. There is too much corrupted data.
Bah! The machine is crazy!
Agricultural record indicates this planet was incapable of sustaining sufficient levels of production.
Error. Specific conditions corrupted. It can be theorized that produce was being exported to support a larger demand.
Error. Information regarding the builders of this installation has been corrupted.
No evidence of such a civilization exists in the galactic record.
Well, that is surprising. I doubt any Wookiee would support such a claim. The forest is millenia old.
Kashyyyk is not the result of any machine malfunction. The forest has always been here.
I have been programmed with a very limited field of knowledge, and I must restrict access to only those that fit my allowed pattern.
I can't say. I will try to bring forward the behavior that you need to proceed, as outlined by my programming.
I can't say. Preliminary matching allows for you to be coached.
I can't say. Likelihood of restriction by previous user, 100%.
Begin socialized interface. Neural scan indicates positive identification of subject "Revan". No further testing of the subject is required.
I will brief you as programmed. You are Lord Revan. I am waiting for your request to begin transfer of the Star Map.
Neural scans have matched you to the pattern in memory. There is no possibility of error. You are Revan, and are aware of it.
Behavioral modification would have reinforced the proper mental patterns, as per your instructions programmed five years ago.
I have a Star Map in original system memory. Access had been restricted pending your return.
Match found...? What the... it always muttered something about "rejected patterns" for me.
Yes, there's the thing. Obstinate machine. I've no doubt it holds what you seek, but good luck getting it operational.
Neural scan complete. Analyzing...
Well, it would appear initial assumptions about you were incorrect. Secondary scans during battle have revealed much. Under duress, your emotions were easier to read.
Programming now instructs that I give you what you seek.
I have no regret, only programming. You have fulfilled secondary conditions, and have demonstrated the ability to follow the proper course in time.
[The computer no longer responds.]
Why have you acknowledged me?
What is your purpose?
Who placed this terminal here?
What limitations have been placed in your programming?
What gaps are missing?
I seek information about a Star Map.
What do I need to do to get access to the Star Map?
What if I fail?
What will rejection mean?
You may begin evaluation.
How did you know Zaalbar's name?
I'm unsure what Zaalbar would say. I would accuse him to be safe.
This is distasteful. I'll just take you apart to get the Star Map.
Why pit me against my companions?
Get on with it then.
I trust Zaalbar. I would say nothing, and neither would he.
The choice is mine. I refuse to alter it.
I thought this was an evaluation, not a quiz.
Then I will change my answer.
No, I reject you. I'll just take you apart to get the Star Map.
What pattern are you comparing me against?
Continue with your evaluation then.
I prepare my forces to attack in ten days. I do nothing in the city.
That's right. The deaths of those people would spur my forces on.
The victory is irrelevant. Stopping the war saved many more people.
I let the attack happen.
Why test me? Who have you done this for?
Explain what this was all about.
Give me access to the Star Map.
I stop the attack. I will appear to be a hero.
I do nothing so I can attack their weak spot later and save more lives.
Repeat the question for me.
I subtly reinforce the city while preparing to attack.
I evacuate my people from the city.
Repeat the question for me.
Can I confer with someone else?
How do you know about him? He isn't here.
Zaalbar is here. He can speak for himself.
Could you repeat the question?
How can I match them when I don't know what they are?
What do you mean by that?
Original system memory? So the map is as old as this installation?
I want to ask questions about you and this installation.
I want to go back to my general questions.
What's the current function of this installation?
Defense of what?
How were you to verify my mind was unaltered?
Has anyone else been given the Star Map data?
What's the original function of this installation?
Who installed this holo-interface?
Was there any further contact with the installer of this interface?
Five years ago is about the time Revan passed this way.
But there was an entry at some time?
Who last accessed this installation?
Who built this instalation in the first place?
Let's go back to my questions about this installation.
That is a short period for adaptation of native creatures.
Why was agricultural reformation needed?
If this place was built 30,000 years ago it predates the Republic.
What do you mean by behavioral reconfiguration?
And I don't fit that pattern?
That seems very helpful. Why have I been allowed access?
Do you not know why, or are you restricted from saying?
How have you identified me as Revan?
What would've happened if I wasn't aware?
I want to ask you about the Star Map.
Give me the Star Map now.
What did your scan during the battle reveal?
That's right! Do as I say or you'll regret it!
Why the change? I failed your initial test.
I greet you again, <FullName>. I am humble, hoping you have found the blade of Bacca's sword. Imagine... Chieftain Freyyr... humble.
Please, tell me you have made progress. Having the blade will gain me valuable support.
I hope you can help. I must try to fix what has gone wrong here.
I don't support this action! Think on this, child!
Look, I'm not your nanny-droid, but I just don't think following Chuundar is the best course.
I will try to answer as best I am able.
You have? Please let me see it. I must be sure!
Don't taunt me like that. False hope is a cruel thing.
What? I... I have nothing. I've been here for years. When we have succeeded, I will see you are rewarded.
It... it is! It may not look like much... but it is a very important relic of my people. Tradition dictates that it be respected.
I didn't think I was worthy to search for it, but I realize that was selfish despair. I should have challenged Chuundar long ago.
I will make amends now. I have new hope. You have led me to this. Perhaps that is what the Great Beast wanted.
I will climb to the surface as quickly as possible and try to gather support. You will have to follow on the paths as soon as you can, <FullName>.
When you arrive, we will confront Chuundar in the throne room. My people will no longer be slaves.
I will answer as best I can.
I've never heard of such a thing... but there is something odd down here. A large computer installation.
It's probably just some Czerka cast-off, but you may find something useful. I can't figure it out, myself.
It is northwest of here. I gave up on it years ago.
I tried to access it many times over the years. It would never acknowledge me. I'm no good with such things.
Well, now you are just having fun with me. It's probably just some malfunctioning Czerka cast-off.
Seriously though, if we are to challenge Chuundar based on tradition, I suggest you don't say these things to anyone.
You risk contradicting our most ancient tales. Perhaps this warrants investigating, but not now.
My invisible attackers are a menagerie of my own fears and regrets, so many more than actual beasts that walk.
No, I have not seen the creatures that you mention. I have been... preoccupied.
I... I am beaten. Take my head, Czerka filth. You won't get another chance. So swears Freyyr of Kashyyyk.
Then let my blood feed my beloved Kashyyyk!
Did we come this far only to kill this old wook? I don't approve of this at all.
Hold your tongue, child. I'm not challenging you. I just thought you'd have the smarts to consider every option.
I know he did, but not without reason. The only outsiders he's seen for years have been slavers.
The words of outsiders are tainted with lies. You can't convince me otherwise.
What? Those are my sons. Why do you speak their names? Tell me!
Did he? I'm surprised it took him this long. Very well, do your worst!
To my shame, Zaalbar was exiled and enslaved. Do you dare claim to be my son's owner, outsider?
I suppose it does. I will listen... cautiously. Gullibility has harmed me in the past...
Does he? Then he sees something of worth in you. I will listen... cautiously. Gullibility has harmed me in the past.
If I had seen the lies of Chuundar, he would have been exposed as a slaver. Zaalbar would not have been exiled...
I did not believe Zaalbar's claims; I believed the elder boy, as tradition dictated. The shame of Zaalbar's attack blinded me.
Well, if Zaalbar is back, perhaps Chuundar is worried the people will realize things are not as they seem.
Chuundar has established himself as a leader that succeeded despite the "tragedies" that have plagued his family.
If it was shown that he conspired with the slavers, his honor would be gone. I wonder...
Zaalbar saw it first. He learned that Chuundar was dealing with the Czerka, leading them to our hunting parties.
Chuundar would blame disappearances on the dangers of the Shadowlands. Zaalbar was crazed when he found out.
He attacked Chuundar with his claws. I thought he had gone mad... shed his honor. I was bound by the old ways.
I don't approve of this! Is Chuundar to be blindly obeyed?
Perhaps not. Do what you will. I'm just wondering if Chuundar is the wiser choice of ally.
That would depend on you, <FullName>. You will either kill me or decide that I may yet benefit my people.
There is a way I might challenge Chuundar, but it would take a lot to convince people they have been lied to.
He has a strong web of lies, but if I appeal to the traditions of my people, I might be able to gather support.
There is a legend of a great warrior from the old times. Bacca was his name, and he is greatly revered.
Bacca found a crashed starship, our first hint of life elsewhere. He was a cautious old wook, and feared the taint of invaders.
He constructed a vibroblade from the wreckage. It has long symbolized our independence. Only destined leaders have held it.
I'm afraid not. It was the symbol of our great chieftains for centuries, but it was damaged a generation ago in ritual battle.
That is the problem. It was the symbol of our great chieftains for centuries, but it was damaged a generation ago in ritual battle.
Here in the Shadowlands Rothrrrawr fought the Great Beast. He sought a challenge, but this arrogance got him more than he could handle.
He survived, but the blade of the sword stayed in the creature's hide. Our tales say it was taken because we had become undeserving.
The hilt is still in the court of our chieftain... with Chuundar. If the blade could be found, <FullName>, tradition could cast doubt on his rule.
No, I don't, but better me than Chuundar. He sells his own people for power. Please help, <FullName>. You've brought me hope...
I will stay here and try to think of what I will say to Zaalbar. I have wronged him. I hope he can forgive me.
I will be here. Please, <FullName>, find the blade of Bacca's sword. I must make things right.
Many have tried to hunt this beast, but only a few who have seen it have lived to tell the tale. And none have ever managed to kill the creature.
Many years ago, when I was far younger than I am now, a Jedi came to hunt the creature... a proud and boastful young man. Like many before him, he did not return.
The beast is cunning. It will not appear if there is an overwhelming number waiting to slay it. But if you gather in small numbers, we know how to lure it out.
Fresh blood will draw it out. Before Chuundar's rule put an end to the ritual, fresh kills were often left as offerings in the south of this area.
I will answer, and then ask something of you.
A year later. By then, Chuundar had spread lies of my own madness. I had no allies when I confronted him.
He and his Czerka guards attacked me. I had to retreat to the deepest Shadowlands, but even there they followed.
The old hermit saved me, I think. He clouded their minds for a moment. I have had a long time to hide... and regret.
That's when I first saw him. I helped his pursuers lose him for a moment. Do you remember me now, Freyyr?
Yes, I think I do. I am sorry about attacking. It's been so long since I have offered my trust, or accepted that of someone else.
Exiled? Big Z never told me that! Of course he never said he was royalty, either.
What? Those are the names of my sons! But they are lost to me now: one exiled, the other a traitor!
Hold on a second: Zaalbar and Chuundar are brothers? And you're their father? Wait a minute... does this mean Big Z is some kind of prince or something?
Why do you speak the names of my sons? How do you know of them? Tell me!
More of you Czerka core-rats? Is even the heart of Kashyyyk not free from your kind?
For years I have hid, hoping to someday free my world! I swear you will not take me! I swear!
He is almost feral after all this time. Calm yourself, Freyyr. We are friends. Don't you remember me?
After years in the Shadowlands, I remember only that outsiders are not to be trusted! I'll see you dead!
Well, this may prove difficult.
I'll get back to you. Wait here.
I've decided to kill you for Chuundar!
You mind your own business! I've made my decision.
You are hardly a competent moral guide. Why question me?
Fine, I'll talk to Freyyr and think about it.
I have found the blade of Bacca's sword.
Actually, I was mistaken.
Wait a minute. What's in it for me?
Here, take it. I'm sure it is the one.
Yes, time to take the fight to Chuundar himself!
We should proceed carefully.
I have other questions.
Back to my previous questions.
I'm looking for something called a Star Map.
I found a computer. Know anything about it?
It clamins to be ancient. It created the forests.
Seen anyone hunting down here? Camouflaged attackers?
Chuundar sends his regards. Now die!
Back in line! I'm in charge here.
What would you suggest? He attacked us first.
This seems simple to me. Time to die, Freyyr!
What can I say to prove we aren't enemies?
I'm not here to kill you. Just listen!
That's enough. Just die, you old hairbag!
Do you know Zaalbar and Chuundar?
My name is <FullName>. Chuundar sent me to kill you.
I intend to!
Wait! I came here with Zaalbar.
My name is <FullName>. I came to Kashyyyk with Zaalbar.
It doesn't matter. It proves I am no common Czerka slaver.
No, he follows because of a life-debt.
Why would Chuundar want you dead now?
Go over exactly what happened with Zaalbar.
This bores me. I think I'll just kill you!
I've made my decision. The old fool dies!
You're my moral guide now? That's not your style.
Ah, shut up. I'll ask him a few more questions.
Well, what happens now?
How? Everyone is on his side.
What, a scavenger hunt for some sword? You're kidding.
Where might I find it?
And you still think you are worthy of being chieftain?
I will try to find it. Can you give me any direction?
Describe the creature. Where can I find it?
Actually, I've already found it. I wasn't sure what it was.
Back to my other questions.
So Zaalbar was exiled. When did you learn the truth?
Rrragh... can anyone hear me? Bacca have mercy...
Help! Here... I am dying...
You return? Please, I am dying... can you heal me?
Rrraagh! Great Bacca, let this outsider be different than the slavers... I beg you... can you heal my wounds?
An attack... from nowhere. Please, I need to be healed. Can you?
Please... I need to be healed. I... am dying...
Outsider... like any other. I should expect nothing. Leave me to die... leave...
You must help him! This is not right!
Grrrgh... as you wish...
Please... try to help. Is there nothing... you can do? Please...
We must find some way to help. Anything.
I... I thank you. I would not have expected an outsider to aid me. Perhaps... perhaps you will help again?
My hunting party, all of them, killed without honor. I barely survived. I want the murderers to suffer the same.
You have already fought some of them. How can you claim it is not your problem? They may come for you next, waiting until you put your weapons away, like they attacked us.
I should have known not to expect much from an outsider. I will find them on my own... as weak as I am.
They followed us for a long while. We found bodies to the southwest, and then again further south after the west branch of the path. Their speed was amazing.
They became camouflaged as I watched. What kind of creature can blend so naturally with the background? They were like ghosts.
I've never seen their kind before, not even among the Czerka. You saw them, armored head to toe, yet blending with the forest.
They fought like outsiders, waiting until we were unarmed. They would not attack until we had put our weapons away! They strike like cowards!
I thank you. I will wait here. I am too weak to fight them again, but I refuse to leave the Shadowlands unless vengeance is sated.
Please, if you kill them, I will reward you with whatever I can. They are not worthy of life.
You return... have you found them? Did you kill them all? They were animals in armor, with no honor among them.
I should have expected this from you, outsider. Cowardice disguised. You can walk away, but I will stay and fight.
I am just the kind of target they like... wounded... helpless. I will fight to my last breath. Leave me.
I thank you. These creatures, they have no honor. Let their blood feed the Shadowlands.
Yes... yes I see the trophy helmet from the one that gave orders. Their bodies will not last long in the Shadowlands. I am glad.
The taint of them, their cowardice... the forest will consume it all. I hope this gives my hunting brethren peace.
You have surprised me with your help; don't spoil this meeting with your outsider greed when I would give you a reward anyway.
Yes, they atacked you as well, didn't they? I never thought I would be on the same side as an outsider. It is a strange feeling.
You have acted as a fellow Wookiee would have. Here, take this. It is the symbol of my hunting clan. You served them, so you deserve it.
When you look at it, remember that we reward respect, even from outsiders.
This one is different. This one acts for us.
Don't speak to me, mad-claw. Chuundar must have allowed you to return to Kashyyyk, but I remember you as a mad-claw.
This outsider has shown honor through action. I will grant a reward because of this, not because you attempt to speak for them.
Outsider, you have acted as a fellow Wookiee would have. Here, take this. It is the symbol of my hunting clan. You served them, so you deserve it.
I am not ready to accept your word, Zaalbar. I remember you as a mad-claw. Let me make my own judgment of this person.
Wait... you have helped in avenging my fellows. I must acknowledge that, even though you are an outsider and are not to be truly trusted.
Why should I help you? Why are you worthy?
What happened here?
That is no answer. I refuse to help, weakling.
Don't question me. Remember your life debt.
I don't have the means to help him.
Very well. here, this should help.
I don't have the means to heal you.
I have the means to heal you. Here.
This is not my problem.
Where have they gone?
What can you tell me about your attackers?
I'll look into it.
I'm not going to bother with this.
No, I'll get back at it.
The Mandalorian hunters are dead. I killed them all.
Yes, yes, heartwarming. Where is my reward?
I would have killed them anyway.
I hope it does. Goodbye.
You have interrupted our hunt, interloper. The inhabitants of this world could do little against us, but you appear to be a threat.
Our training here will continue... without your interference.
More than a threat enough for you!
Another Mandalore, is it? Will you draw arms against those you would serve? We'll see who lives this day!
Your butchery will stop here!!
You are nothing! Your people are sheep! I fear no slave! Especially willing ones!
Has something happened to put fire in your people? Are you no longer slaves? It doesn't matter. You will die like the others!

This request is in the Mandalorian language. "A stump disabled the stabilizers on my swoop. I request parts before other systems fail. If the generator goes, my blending field will stop working and I'll be visible to our prey."

Mandalorian Datapad 2

This is a personal log in the Mandalorian language. "This hunt is no challenge. How will attacking unarmed creatures train us to use these Jedi toys? You want new warriors to learn? Watching a comrade lop his own arm off fighting a real opponent would teach more than these pointless battles. I obey, Mandalore, but with protest. The blending field generators on the swoops grant near perfect camouflage. Why only attack unarmed opponents?"

A personal log in the Mandalorian language: "We coddle our recruits! Why train them against unarmed opponents? Pointless slaughter teaches them nothing about being a soldier. I obey, Mandalore, but with protest. The generators on our swoops grant perfect camouflage, so why only attack unarmed opponents?"

This is the helmet of a fierce Mandalorian warrior, taken from a group that stalked the Shadowlands of Kashyyyk for wounded or unwary prey.
Scrawled note

A Wookiee's dying message, it claims he was attacked by off-worlders very unlike the Czerka. They came out of nowhere when his party was unarmed, taking sport in his fear. He died hoping someone takes vengeance on these monsters.

A Wookiee's dying message, it says he was attacked by off-worlders different from the Czerka. They were camouflaged, and attacked only when his group put their weapons away. He died hoping someone takes vengeance on these monsters.
Bacca's Sword Blade

This is part of Bacca's Ceremonial Blade, damaged due to the arrogance of Chieftain Rothrrrawr. He underestimated a creature in the Shadowlands (later dubbed the Great Beast), and lost the blade in its hide. The hilt remained in his court, passed to other chieftains. If both pieces could be found, the sword might be able to be reassembled.

Korriban - Dreshdae
I must be on my way, sentient. My ship leaves very soon.
If you are wise, you will avoid the Sith on this planet, sentient. They do as they wish and many are killed without regret.
Taris has been destroyed. This portends ill for the future, sentient.
There is a building called the cantina which is a place of recreation.
Many sentients come to this planet to attempt to enter the Sith academy. I understand most die in the process. How unfortunate.
I have only recently come to this planet, myself. My apologies if I cannot help you.
This planet is controlled by the Sith. They are the supreme law here, and I suggest you be wary of them.
I must go to the office of the Czerka company. That is where business is transacted.
Excuse me, sentient. I do not think it wise to speak to you.
I am Mika Dorin, manager of this establishment. Is there something you are needing, sentient? The owner of the Ebon Hawk is always welcome in the Dresdae Cantina.
As you desire, sentient.
What would you like to know, sentient?
Could you be more specific, sentient? What manner of Star Map do you seek?
It may be possible, sentient. The only artifacts I have ever heard mentioned are in relation to the Sith and their Valley of the Dark Lords.
There is a place on the surface of this planet called the Valley of the Dark Lords, I believe, where the Sith dig amongst such ruins. Perhaps what you seek is there.
Very little. None are allowed in their ruins other than the Sith themselves, as I understand it.
I am afraid not. The Sith have a passage that leads to their valley from within their monastery, but only they may use it.
The Sith built their academy here to train students. Many go to train there, though I know not why. Most are not permitted to train and many die in their attempt to be admitted.
Many of their students and sometimes the Sith, themselves, come to my cantina. Look around and you will see them. I have little choice as to their presence.
This cantina has been provided by the Czerka Corporation, and it is a quiet place. This is as I prefer it. Elsewhere in Dreshdae it is not always safe or quiet. Dreshdae is run as the Sith wish.
The Sith are not always pleasant in their dealings with others. If I had a say, I would prefer they and their academy were not present here. But I do not.
Of course, sentient. Allow me to offer you a sample of the local ale.
No, nothing.
Just some questions answered.
That's all for now.
Do you know anything about a Star Map on Korriban?
The very old kind. Perhaps the Sith's excavations involve something like it?
The very old kind. Perhaps you know of some ruins on Korriban?
What can you tell me about the Sith's excavations?
Surely there must be some way to go there.
What do you know about the Sith academy?
Anything interesting going on here?
A drink.
I can't wait to get back to the Core systems. This planet is dangerous with all those Sith wandering around.
I hear them Sith are doing some kind of digging up on the planet's surface. How weird is that?
Whatever you do, don't try and land a ship outside of the colony. The Sith will destroy you without a second thought.
Have you heard what happened to Taris? I can't believe the Sith are powerful enough to do that.
The Czerka cantina's the only place to go around here for any real fun.
Are you a smuggler? That's the only way we get some decent goods to buy in this sector.
I hear you arrived on that old smuggling ship... the Hawk, or something like that?
Are you new to Korriban?
You're not here to try and get into the Sith academy, are you? Most of the poor fools who try are killed by the Sith. It's horrible!
There are a lot of young folk who come here hoping to get admitted to the Sith academy here in Dreshdae. Few ever do.
This planet belongs to the Sith. They allow Czerka to run the starport and a few mines, but the Sith are the ones in control.
Err... you're a Sith, right? Excuse me...
*Sigh* I can't wait to get back to the Core systems. This planet is dangerous with all these Sith wandering around.
I hear them Sith are doing some kind of digging up on the planet's surface. How weird is that?
Whatever you do, don't try and land a ship outside the colony. The Sith will destroy you without a second thought.
Have you heard what happened to Taris? I can't believe the Sith are powerful enough to do that.
Yeah, the Czerka cantina's the only place to go around here for any real fun.
Are you a smuggler? That's the only way we get some decent goods to buy in this sector.
I hear you arrived on that old smuggling ship... the Hawk, or something like that?
Are you new to Korriban?
You're not here to try and get into the Sith academy, are you? Most of the poor fools who try are killed by the Sith. It's horrible!
There are a lot of young folk who come here hoping to get admitted to the Sith academy here in Dreshdae. Few ever do.
This planet belongs to the Sith. They allow Czerka to run the starport and a few mines, but the Sith are the ones in control.
Err... you're a Sith, right? *ahem* Excuse me...
I hear the Sith are digging up old artifacts in some valley up on the surface. I wonder what that's all about?
Ah, wish they had a band, here. Place is dull as an asteroid.
There are folk who come from all over Sith space looking to get into the monastery here to be trained. Only a few of them ever get chosen, however.
If you see one of them Sith wandering around outside of the monastery, just look away. They rule this planet and they do as they like.
Just having a drink, friend, minding my own business.
Please avoid the Sith academy... unless you are a hopeful, naturally.
Oh, entertainment can be found at the local cantina, provided by Czerka of course.
You can conduct business at our office, if you wish.
This is a Sith colony. They are the law here. I am here only to protect Czerka interests.
Go about your business, please, citizen.
Greetings and welcome to Czerka Corporation.
Do come again.
Certainly.
Czerka sends freighters to the surface every now and again to ferry artifacts to the Core.
The men are not allowed out of their ships, however, as only Sith are allowed on the surface. Beyond that I really can't say.
[Success] They... they call the site the Valley of the Dark Lords. Ancient Sith are buried in tombs there, along with many artifacts of old... some of great power, apparently.
I don't know anything else. Neither will you, I'm sure... only the Sith students are allowed access to the site.
[Failure] Does it matter? I don't intend to speak of it, regardless.
[Success] Well... all I know is that they call the site the Valley of the Dark Lords. Apparently, there are Sith Lords of old buried in tombs there.
Not much. The Sith are a rather secretive lot, and they don't allow many into the academy. I hear they claim that Korriban was inhabited long ago by other Sith.
But no one truly knows if that's true. The planet is certainly uninhabited outside of Dreshdae and always has been.
Only prospective students. We get many who come here each year, hoping to get picked. Many are simply considered too weak, I'm afraid.
I understand there is one main person amongst the Sith who decides which students are worthy... Yuthura Ban, I believe her name is.
Other than in the academy itself, I'm sorry, I don't know.
That would explain why this place is so creepy. This whole planet makes my head-tails twitch!
A Star Map? We sell navigational components, if that's what you mean.
Well... the Sith have some old ruins that interest them up on the surface of the planet. If this map of yours is there, however, they've said nothing about it.
There truly isn't much to tell, citizen. Dreshdae was established by the Sith, and we arrived to take advantage of some of the planet's mineral wealth.
The only thing that's really unusual about Dreshdae, I suppose, is that the Sith built their academy on the east side of the colony. You don't find those just anywhere.
We do some mining here and are responsible for local shipping and support of the Sith on Korriban.
Our starport is mostly just freighters and such, but we do get many travelers that come here to learn from the Sith.
This office is actually our administrative headquarters for this region. Rather inauspicious, isn't it? We offer good prices here to those traders that keep the colony supplied.
If you're in need of anything, this is the place to come.
Well why not? This is Sith space now, and the company has to survive regardless of who is in charge. The Republic, the Sith, eh... the economy has to keep going.
Now, was there anything else?
Profit at any cost... just like on my world.
I'm not sure what your pet is muttering, but keep a restraining collar on it. It won't last long if it gets loose. Now, was there something else?
You certainly can. Allow me to punch up our stock.
I must say... Czerka is in need of droids right now. That's a mighty fine-looking one you have there...
*angry mechanical spluttering*
I must say... Czerka is in need of droids right now. That's a mighty fine-looking one you have there...
Objection: This unit is not for sale, meatbag.
Errr... yes, of course, no offense meant. Heh. Touchy, isn't it?
Greetings again, citizen. Something you need?
I understand you're receiving training at the monastery, citizen. Congratulations!
Tsk. I suppose you've heard about the destruction of Taris, yes? Awful business, that. Czerka lost a fortune there, not that the Sith care.
Hmm. Aren't you the human who won the swoop race on Manaan? Congradulations and well done! It was most exciting to watch!
It is an honor to have you in our offices. How may Czerka serve you?
If you've come for any medical supplies, I have to warn you that the kolto source on Manaan has been poisoned.
It's a tragedy, considering the war and all... casualties are going to go through the roof. Czerka is pulling all its kolto out of storage as we speak.
Greetings. You've heard of that awful business on Edean, yes? Our corporate outpost there has been destroyed by the Wookiee savages.
This could put back the use of Wookiee labor considerably. We may even have to abandon the planet completely.
Ah, well. What can you do? Sorry... was there something you needed?
Yeah, I sure bet the Wookiees would hate to see ya go.
Well, certainly. Now they are doomed to remain savages forever... or possibly become extinct. Very sad. Now then... was there something you needed?
You make our freedom sound like a tragedy.
I see you got one of your own early. May as well, while you can. Now then... was there something I could do for you?
Greetings. If you haven't heard, there's some trouble over at the academy. A power struggle, most likely, but news is sketchy. So... anything Czerka can do for you?
I'll be going.
Can I ask you some questions about the colony?
How can one reach the ruins on the surface?
[Force Persuade] It is very important that you tell me what you know.
[Persuade] Can't say or don't know?
What do you know about the Sith academy?
Who is allowed in the academy?
Where do I find this Yuthura?
Have you ever heard of a Star Map?
No, I mean as in old ruins.
What can you tell me about the colony?
What does Czerka do here on Korriban?
Czerka works with the Sith?
Can I see what you have to offer?
If you must know, I intend to take the first ship off of this rock. Why should that interest you? I trust you got whatever you wanted from the tombs?
Then leave me be.
She and I were... students together at Dantooine, for a time. We were close, and we shared doubts about the Jedi's ways. I left for the Sith because I thought it would be better here.
It looks like Juhani changed her mind and stayed with the Jedi after all. Your doing, maybe? Anyway... I'm done with the Jedi, the Sith... and with her. Just leave me alone.
Why don't you ask her?
Is there some reason you should stop me from going? Are you afraid I'm going to tell someone you're here? What are you going to do, kill me?
I may have studied with the Sith, but I've no special loyalty to them. You can believe me or not, as you wish.
Fine. Let's end it here, then. It looks like you belong amongst the Sith more than I ever did.
Leave him be! I said that he would not betray you. Just... let him go.
Still sticking up for me, Juhani?
Just... go, Dak.
I already said, didn't I? I don't want to still be around when they start asking questions about you.
Why do you care? I've no intention of opposing you.
Perhaps I'll go back to Dantooine. Or just somewhere where there's no Sith or Jedi, period.
Perhaps... you could go back to the Jedi. I did.
I don't know. I'll think about it. Just leave me alone, Juhani.
Never mind.
How do you know Juhani?
Because I asked you.
What if I said I'm not going to just let you leave?
I suppose not. Just go, then.
How do I know I can trust you not to betray me?
Then I suppose I'll believe you.
Then I'm afraid I have to kill you.
That's exactly what I'm going to do.
Why are you leaving, exactly?
But where will you go?
Those Sith are about. Probably even watching us in here. Don't bet they ain't.
Don't go near that Sith place. They won't let you in, and them Sith will probably shoot you before they look at you.
Most of the merchants head over to Czerka's headquarters if they want to do some trading.
There isn't much to do in Dreshdae except have a drink until your ship's ready to go.
I'm just here on one of Czerka's transports. I don't have no business with you.
I've had two friends killed by the Sith already. It must be some kind of test... I'll survive and make it into the academy, I know it!
You'd better be careful around some of those Sith. They'll eliminate any prospects just to remove a potential future threat!
Do you know where I can find Yuthura Ban? I understand she's the one who determines if you are accepted into the academy or not.
Can you imagine if I actually became a Sith? The power I'd have! I could do anything!!
When one of the Sith thinks you're ready for the academy, he gives you a medallion. I wish I had one of those...
If you're looking to get into the academy, you're going to have a tough time. There's lots of us here trying to get accepted.
Hey! You've got one of the medallions! You've been accepted! How did you ever manage that?!
You are so lucky. You got accepted into the academy, didn't you? I'm beginning to think I never will. *sigh*
I've had two friends killed by the Sith already. It must be some kind of test... I'll survive and make it into the academy, I know it!
You'd better be careful around some of those Sith. They'll eliminate any prospects just to remove a potential future threat!
Do you know where I can find Yuthura Ban? I understand she's the one who determines if you are accepted into the academy or not.

When one of the Sith thinks you're ready for the academy, he gives you a medallion. I wish I had one of those...
If you're looking to get into the academy, you're going to have a tough time. There's lots of us here trying to get accepted.
Hey! You've got one of the medallions! You've been accepted! How did you ever manage that?!
You are so lucky. You got accepted into the academy, didn't you? I'm beginning to think I'm never going to make it.
One of Korriban's primary trade routes went through Taris. Now that it's destroyed, the colony here will have an even harder time of it.
I suppose you've heard about Taris being destroyed? The Republic must have pushed the Sith into it, that's what I think.
The Sith blew up Taris, the entire planet. I guess they must have deserved it... but that's so many people...
Can you imagine? The Wookiee slaves on Edean have gone insane and started attacking the Czerka outpost there. It must be horrific!
One of my friends in Czerka said that they've been driven off Edean by those Wookiee creatures. Barbaric beasts!
I heard something about the Wookiees on Edean suddenly revolting. Do you know anything about that?
The kolto reserves are all gone. That means the casualties in this war are going to become horrifying!
I bet the Republic is responsible for the loss of the kolto on Manaan. Yes they...they just want to keep it out of the hands of the Sith, I'm sure of it.
Have you heard? The kolto on Manaan has been poisoned... completely ruined. That's terrible news with the war still underway.
Aren't you the Manaan swoop champion? I figured you'd have gone to another sector by now, one with an actual circuit up and running.
It's not often I get a chance to meet such a fine swoop racer. You won on Manaan, right?
You look... familiar. Aren't you the one who won the swoop championship on Manaan? Too bad the circuit's dead or you could go pro.
I hear the Sith in the academy are fighting each other. Hope they don't blow it up around themselves, or the colony will go with them!
There's some kind of power struggle going on at the Sith academy, I hear. Nothing unusual for those Sith, I guess.
I suppose you've heard? The heads of the Sith academy have disappeared. Something is going on, I'm sure of it.
Look here, my dear friends... we have a newcomer to our little colony. I don't believe I've seen this one before, have you?
Look here, my dear friends... we have a group of newcomers to our little colony. I don't believe I've seen any of them before, have you?
Looks pretty fresh to me, Lashowe.
That's what I thought. Well, stranger... I don't know whether you're aware of this or not, but here on Korriban the Sith do as they please. And we are Sith.
Quite literally, whether you live or die depends upon our whim. What do you think of that, hmm?
Oh, neither do I. I simply stated a fact. Do you know how many Sith there are in Dreshdae?
Enough to crush this fool! Let's do it, Lashowe!
Beep-beep boop boop.
Is this a raffle? How many guesses do we get?
Do not provoke them, Carth.
Are you mad? Don't provoke them!
Not enough to save your sorry self.
Twelve? No, wait, thirteen!
Nice one, old man.
Thank you. It takes effort to be properly irreverent at my age.
Those are very brave words for such an insignificant person. Do you not realize how many Sith are here in Dreshdae?
Let me kill this one, Lashowe! Let me do it!
Now, now, let's not be hasty. Perhaps our friend here could yet offer up some amusement.
Beep-beep boop boop.
Is this a raffle? How many guesses do we get?
Do not provoke them, Carth.
Are you mad? Don't provoke them!
Not enough to save your sorry self.
Twelve? No, wait, thirteen!
Nice one, old man.
Thank you. It takes effort to be properly irreverent at my age.
Commentary: That's the way to tell the meatbags, master! Charging weapons, just in case. This should be fun!
How precocious. I think this one tried to make a joke, don't you?
I didn't think it was funny.
Neither did I. A brave face, perhaps, but I'm more interested in being amused at the moment, I think.
What do you say? Amuse us. Make us laugh, and we just might consider allowing you to live.
Ahhh, I hate this kind of whining. Do they always have to beg for mercy?
Yeah, let's get out of here.
Very well, boys. I'm sure we can find something more exciting than these... dead fish. Let's go.
Feh...
Commentary: Ohhh, master. I am so disappointed in you right now. No, don't look at me.
Oh? I see. We'll just have to see about that, won't we?
Ha ha! Looks like this one's not afraid of you at all, Lashowe.
Are you going to let us be insulted?!
Oh, get over yourself already. I'm tired of this.
Yeah, this one's got some backbone, at least. Let's go.
Fine. I'll deal with *you* later.
Go on.
I've heard this one before, I think...
Quiet!
And then?
[Failure] Heh! That's the oldest joke in the book.
Well, it certainly didn't amuse us, did it? Try again.
[Success] Hah! Too funny!
Ha ha ha! Good one!
Yes, I suppose that wasn't too bad. Alright then, my friend... you've done as you were asked. Perhaps we will meet again.
It would be more realistic if the commander just shot them both.
Cute. Maybe you should try juggling next time.
Ha ha ha! I like that one.
What?!
Heh... ha ha! I think someone just stood up to you, Lashowe.
Shut up, fool! Unless you want to be next!
Yeah? Anytime!
Stop it, this is boring. Let's just go back to the academy.
Fine, we'll go. As for you... I'll find you later. Trust me on that.
You took an incredible risk. You know that, right?
Be careful! You don't want to provoke them, do you?
Ah, you don't think they're a bit pre-provoked to begin with?
Don't be stupid. We needn't make matters worse.
You couldn't find your backside with both hands AND your friends'.
Well, if you'd seen us before, we wouldn't be newcomers, would we?
Ha-ha! Smart-mouthed newcomers, to boot.
Great, just what we needed. Some punks come to steal our lunch credits.
You should turn around and move along, kid. You don't want the trouble we'd give you.
Look here, my dear friends... we have a newcomer to our little colony. A Jedi, no less. I don't believe I've seen this one before, have you?
I hate Jedi... and these fallen ones are worse! They always get into the academy, and they think they're better than the rest of us!
Look here, my dear friends. We have some newcomers to the colony... led by a Jedi, no less. I don't believe I've seen any of them before, have you?
I don't think there's any need for hostilities.
I think that was a rhetorical question. But nice guess, Teethree.
You can try to kill me. You'd fail, but you can try.
I think that was a rhetorical question. But nice guess, Teethree.
I think that's a lot of responsibility for simple scum like you.
Please don't hurt me! I don't want a fight!
I'm not looking for trouble, but I'm not here to amuse you.
[Persuade] Err... okay. These two Mandalorians are out in the woods...
One of them collapses. He doesn't seem to be breathing and his eyes are glazed. The other Mandalorian takes out his communicator and contacts his commander.
He gasps: "My partner has collapsed! I don't know what to do!" After a moment, the commander responds: "Calm down, I can help."
"First, let's make sure your partner is dead." There is a silence, then a blaster shot is heard. Back on the communicator, the Mandalorian says: "Okay, now what?"
Be careful. You might be heading for more trouble than you can handle.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
It worked, didn't it?
Nice to see the Hawk's still in one piece. Beauty of a ship, that.
Yep. Take care, now.
You sure can.
A Star Map? You mean like a navigation chart?
There's a whole bunch of old Sith ruins up on the surface of the planet. That's why they put one of their academies here, to dig them all up.
If them Sith found a Star Map in those ruins, nobody's ever mentioned it.
Not much. It's a pretty barren planet, to tell the truth. Not of much interest to anyone. Unless you're a Sith, I guess... they seem to think this place is something special.
Probably all them ruins they found on the surface. That's the reason they built their academy here, I guess, to dig all them ruins up.
You don't. Not unless you're a Sith in the academy. They're the only ones allowed on the surface. They pay Czerka to ship things in and out, I guess, but that's all closely monitored.
I don't know. There's all kinds of hopefuls in the colony trying to get in... why don't you ask one of them?
There's people that come here from all over Sith space to try and join the academy. Most of them die, I hear. Pretty gruesome business, that.
Oh, I've seen this little ship before plenty of times. Used to make runs for the Exchange, didn't it? Korriban's nice and remote, the kind of place the Exchange likes.
You don't need to worry about me saying anything. I don't give a whit what you do with your ship. Smuggling's what the Hawk was made for, though.
I knew we'd run into some of Davik's old associates sooner or later. No matter where you go somebody's working for the Exchange!
Oh, nobody special. I just do the routine maintenance work for the ships that come in. I used to see the Hawk here all the time.
Still around the starport, I see. Heading off, soon?
Thanks, I'll be going.
Can I ask you some questions?
Do you know how to reach the ruins on the surface?
What can you tell me about the Sith Academy?
Have you ever heard of a Star Map?
Yes, but much older. Are there ruins on Korriban?
Yes, but much older. Perhaps in the ruins?
What can you tell me about Korriban?
Why do the Sith think Korriban is special?
How does someone get to the ruins?
So how does someone get into the academy?
There's a Sith academy here?
How do you know about the Ebon Hawk?
Who are you?
I have to go.
Ha ha! Once you become a Sith, you can do anything! You can feel the power coursing through you! None of you fools can compare to me!!

In case you're forgetting, partner, they don't exactly want us talking about their business.
Ah, who cares about them? I've seen some of those things they're digging up in those ruins in the valley. Pretty creepy, if you ask me.
Sure thing. Good flying, friend.
It's in a valley on the surface, beyond some mountains to the east. No land route... that's why they have us fly in.
Shows what you know. The academy has a route through the mountain... that's how all their students get to the excavation site.
Well, regardless, the Sith don't let anybody near that valley. Even when we land, they watch us like a Drayberian hawk and want us gone quickly.
Not a chance. You'd be better off sneaking through the academy, if you wanted to go to the valley.
Hah! Now that'd be a sight to see.
Weird artifacts. Looks like alien stuff. Maybe aliens lived on Korriban a long time ago, who knows?
Don't be stupid. I was talking to one of those Sith and he said there are tombs there dating back to when the Sith were here in ancient times.
There were Sith here in ancient times? Sounds like he was feeding you a line. Korriban's only been settled for a short time.
So says you. He said that the planet was settled by the Sith a long time ago, and then they all left or something. Those tombs are really important to them.
Tombs, hey? That makes the stuff they send us even creepier. Wish I didn't have to haul it around.
No. We're not due for another shipment for at least another week.
We used to haul everything to Taris, and the Sith would take it off our hands there. Not sure where we'll be bringing it now.
In a small colony like this, everyone knows everyone's business.
It's better than thinking too much about all the Sith lurking about, here.
The Hawk's been in and out of here for ages. An out-of-the-way starport is a good place for, uh... privateers. Not saying you are one.
Sorry. Hard not to be interested. All we get to do is freighter work, though the Sith certainly provide a lot of that.
Wouldn't make any difference to me. Just wish I had a ship like that, myself. Business is steady here with the Sith, but it's a boring haul.
Nice to see you again. Hold onto that Hawk... it'll do well by you.
Well, forget it. The Hawk's my ship.
What kind of ship do you pilot?
I'll be going.
How would one get to these excavations, exactly?
So no one could sneak into the valley by ship?
What have they been digging up?
Do you have any of these artifacts, now?
Where do you take these things?
Does everyone here know about the Ebon Hawk?
How about you mind your own business?
I'm not a smuggler, if that's what you mean.
And what if I am?

Can I help you?

Greetings, greetings. I see the, ah, Ebon Hawk has returned to tiny Dreshdae, has it? Good, good.
Since you're a regular to our little colony, the docking fee is only 25 credits.
Enjoy your stay in Dreshdae.
Well, we do have to maintain the starport. You can't expect to use our meager facilities and not pay, can you?
[Success] I suppose you are correct. It won't hurt anything if I just let you on through.
[Failure] Of course it's necessary. If you use our facilities, a few credits is not too much to ask, is it?
[Success] Ahhh, I suppose there is no need to charge the owner of the Ebon Hawk any fee, really. I'll open the door for you.
Excellent. Continue on through. Please be aware that the colony is under Sith jurisdiction... I'd advise you to stay out of their way.
What information do you wish?
The ones on the surface? All I know is that only the Sith students go there, sorry.
Unless you're one of the hopefuls who is trying to become a student there, I suggest you avoid it. The Sith are the law here and do as they please. It can be quite... dangerous.
Err... doesn't your computer handle navigation? Beyond that, I really couldn't say.
Well, this is Dreshdae... it's the only colony on the planet. Korriban is a Sith planet, well within their space, though it's not very well-inhabited.
The Sith allow Czerka to conduct some mining here, and the company operates the starport... but otherwise the colony revolves around the local Sith academy.
Czerka is one of the largest corporations in the Core... I'm surprised you haven't heard of it. They have interests in mining all over this sector.
Korriban is actually the location of Czerka's headquarters for this sector. Most business here in the colony is conducted there.
Hmph! Wherever you find the Sith, Czerka isn't far away. Like granite slugs on a sky tower.

Ahhh, I see, I see. Another Jedi come to small Korriban, yes? Good to meet you.
There are many people who come to Korriban from throughout Sith space, hoping to join the academy. Some of them are Jedi who have left the order.

Oh... I... I see. Then... then this is a very dangerous place for you to have come. Korriban is a Sith planet... you know that, correct?
Oh? I thought that would have been why you came here. There is a Sith academy just outside of Dreshdae where they train their students and such.
But enough about that. It is very nice to see that the Ebon Hawk has returned. I have not seen that ship for some time, indeed.
Ah. I assumed you were perhaps a Jedi from the distinctive robes you are wearing. My mistake.
Ah. I assumed you were perhaps a Jedi from the lightsaber you are carrying. My mistake.
Well, ah, from the robes you are wearing, of course. They are quite distinctive.

Tell me about Czerka.

Oh? So... so there's some secret to it after all? I *knew* it!

A Padawan, perhaps, though it makes little difference. I sense enough raw power within you to... well, we shall see.
As I thought. How interesting that they would let one with such power out of their grasp. Or are you here to spy on us? For all the good it would do.
*chuckle* As you wish. Keep your little secrets, human, if you must. Either way, I sense an intriguing amount of power within you.
*chuckle* As you wish. Play your little game, Jedi, if you must. Either way, I sense an intriguing amount of power within you.
Obviously you are a Jedi. One who is very strong in the Force, it seems. So were you part of the order for very long? Did they train you?
No? Why might that be? There is something... odd about you, human, that I cannot place...
And yet here you are on little Korriban, just by accident? I find it hard to believe. If it amuses you, however, I'll play along.
*chuckle* An interesting question, and not one I hear often. For most the benefits of becoming a Sith are quite obvious.
We wield ultimate power, my friend. To be a Sith is to taste freedom and to know victory. Nothing is as glorious as bending the Force to your will.
I would consider that an amusing ploy to try and enter the Academy. Why? Who will you claim to be? Darth Malak, himself?
What about Revan? Revan is dead. You may have a natural gift with the Force, human, but you've no gift for lies.
You know the name? Malak is the strongest of us, and the strongest always rules... at least until one who is stronger can take it from him.
That is our way: survival of the fittest. You are always on guard, always lean for the kill. We promote it, for through this the Sith are stronger.
If a Sith has proven to be weak... and if the time is right. The Force rewards the cunning and the mighty. Step up to the challenge if you dare... or turn tail and run.
It is the Jedi who serve the Force... trying to discern its wishes like frightened old men staring at the stars. The Force serves *us*.
We shape it to our will. We are its master. The Jedi deny their darkness, but we revel in it, we allow it to fuel our strength.
'Corruption' is a word the pitiful use to describe the natural longing for power that they deny. 'Evil' is a word trumpeted by the weak to ease their heart.
It is true that the Force exacts a physical toll on some... but not a single one of them has ever regretted it. Anything else you hear is propaganda.
Hide-bound relics who burden themselves with tradition and with the protection of the weak and ungrateful. They are pitiful and misguided.
Why would you take a gift as glorious as the Force and squander it? Weaken yourself deliberately and shackle yourself to outdated mores?
Our gift has made us superior. It is our rightful place to rule. How can any deny that? Yet the Jedi do so... and call us 'evil' because we do not.
Is the sarkath beast who dominates his jungle evil? The tuk'ata who leaps on the squellbug for the kill? These are things of nature, of the universe.
We are no different from this. The Force is part of the universe, part of the same laws. We were gifted to set us above the rest... to deny nature is foolish.
We make no apologies for the weak. If you cannot clench your fist and know when the moment comes to strike, there is no place for you amongst us.
Of those who come to train, those who are weak return home. If they are both weak and foolish, they die... but it was their choice to come.
You've heard enough, have you? *chuckle* So what is it to be? Are you here to be a Sith or not?
Oh? That is truly a first. Do as you wish, then, human. I'll not stop you.
Is there something you need, Jedi? Make it good, for I have little patience.
You think me a fool? You think I do not recognize robes of the order when I see them?
You are far from the first Jedi who has come here, after all, willing to abandon that decrepit order of yours.
You think me a fool? You think I do not recognize a lightsaber when I see it?
Can you not see that I am busy, human? Ahhh... I see you have a medallion. Where did you get it?
Do not be insolent, human. I asked you a direct question, and I will not be trifled with. Now... where did you get this medallion?
[Failure] You think to lie to me, do you? I would suspect you stole this and killed the owner. Very enterprising of you, I must admit.
We Sith do encourage such independent thinking. You may even be a suitable candidate to join us. That is what you wish, I take it? To become a Sith?
[Success] Oh? Very well. You do seem a fit candidate, though there is... something odd about you I cannot place...
[Success] Oh? By one of the others, no doubt. You do seem a fit candidate for the academy, though there is... something odd about you...
I see. How very enterprising of you, though that is not the normal way that we select our students for the academy.
You again? What do you wish, now?
So I see. How curious that you should come to possess such a thing. Where did you get it?
So one of the others accepted you, even after I did not? You are lucky, human, for I am in a forgiving mood.
But I have already told you your answer, human. Do not bother me further, or I shall become irritated.
So I see, from the medallion you carry. How curious that you possess one. Where did you get it?
You have come back. Good. Are you prepared to go to the academy?
Then come back when you are ready. But do not take long... I *will* leave without you.
Then let us leave. The Master of the Academy awaits you.
I'll be on my way.
Can I ask you some questions?
Are you Yuthura Ban?
Who are you?
Yes, that's exactly why I'm here. Let me join you.
I have forgotten most of my training, it seems.
What difference does it make?
[Persuade] Yes, it does. I wish to become a Sith.
[Persuade/Lie] Yes, it does. I wish to become a Sith.
They are slaves. Don't worry about them.
[Persuade/Lie] Yes, it does. I wish to become a Sith.
[Force Persuade] Yes. You want to accept me into the academy.
No. It doesn't.
Again? I suppose that would interest me, yes.
Yes, it does. I wish to become a Sith.
[Lie] Yes, it does. I wish to become a Sith.
Yes. I'm a fallen Jedi, if you must know.
Yes, but only very little.
No, I don't know what you're talking about.
No! I would never join the Sith!
Maybe. I haven't given it much thought.
Why would I want to join the Sith?
And what if I said I was already a Sith?
What about Darth Revan?
And where does Darth Malak fit into all this?
You kill each other?
But you serve the dark side of the Force, don't you?
But the dark side is evil, it corrupts...
And what about the Jedi?
You don't consider yourself evil?
A lot of the hopefuls here end up dead. That doesn't seem glorious.
I see. About joining you...
Never mind... I have to go.
Yes. I want to join the Sith.
No, I'm not interested.
Why did you call me Jedi?
Why do you want to know?
[Persuade/Lie] One of the other Sith accepted me into the academy.
[Persuade/Lie] It was given to me...
Err... I took it from another student, actually.
Never mind. I'll go.
I have this medallion...
I want to join the Sith.
I would like to know who you are.
Not yet.
Yes, I am.

Korriban - Sith Academy Entrance
You are neither a Sith nor do you bear the medallion of a student of this facility. Please leave at once.
On your way, citizen.
[Failure] I have been conditioned to resist mental persuasion, citizen. Please do not attempt that again.
[Failure] No-one gets inside, citizen. Messages and deliveries must be relayed through official Sith channels only.
It is the device given to one who has been accepted into the academy, but has not yet proved their worth as a student.
If one of the Sith decides you are worthy, you will be given one... which you must then take to Yuthura Ban, who I believe is in the cantina. It is she who decides which hopefuls enter the academy.
You must be admitted to the academy. That decision must be made by a Sith who has already been accepted, here.
The final decision, however, remains with Master Yuthura. I believe she is currently at the cantina if you wish to seek her out. Now go.
Greetings, student. I see you have the medallion that marks you as one of the chosen.
I do not recognize you, however. Have you been accepted into the academy very recently?
I see. And who might your friends be?
So long as the Sith do not object to them, neither will I. They will be your responsibility, of course.
You will want to bring your medallion to Yuthura Ban. She is the one who brings all selected students into the academy for their training.
I believe she can be located within the cantina here in the colony. I suggest you go to her while she is still there, student.
Commentary: And if the Sith do object to us, master, I shall fill them full of new holes!
Aren't we always?
Ah. I trust you will be responsible for ensuring your slaves are not disruptive, then?
Commentary: Disruptive? What does he mean by that? I have never been disruptive, master.
Beep! Beep! Boooop!
Well, besides *that*.
Hmph. Suddenly I'm a convincing slave, am I? Maybe you should have left me on the ship.
I always think we should leave you on the ship, old man.
Don't get smart-mouthed with me, young man. You're not too old to put over my knee.
Grrr... I will not play the part of slave for long. Not even to pass this fool.
If your animal acts up he will be destroyed. This would reflect badly on you, understand?
No more disruptive than our 'master' will be.
What was that?
Oh, nothing.
Ahh... ignore him, sir. He is mentally deficient. And he drools.
Hey!
You again? I told you to locate Yuthura Ban in the cantina. She is the only one who can bring new students into the academy.
You are a student at the academy. You may enter by the door.
I'll be going.
[Force Persuade] You will let me inside.
[Persuade] I need to get inside. I have been sent to speak with the Master of the Academy!
What's this medallion you mention?
How do I become a Sith, then?
No. I have been away for a while.
That's none of your business, soldier.
Yes. Today, in fact.
They are none of your business.
They are my slaves.
Leave me be. Can't you see that I'm busy?
Good. I don't want to miss this for anything, heh...
No you may not. I'm busy amusing myself and I'm not going to miss any of the fun. Now get lost before I teach you a lesson.
Isn't that obvious? You must be very sharp to possess such an astute sense of perception. Obviously deaf, however, since I asked you to leave.
Is there something specific you wanted?
Then I trust you'll leave. I think another one of these fools is about to drop, and I don't want to miss it.
And what if I am?
That is the whole point! Personally, I think it's wonderful fun... those fools actually think that if they stand there long enough, I'll let them become a Sith.
Idiots. A Sith is not a bantha, all endurance and no brains. A Sith would fight for his life, no matter the odds. If these rotgrubs are as stupid as they seem, then they deserve their fate!
Oh, it is. I wonder which one will be the last standing? Should I tell him then that his hopes are in vain, do you think?
Perhaps, but where does it say I should be merciful? There'd be no sport in it, anyhow. I want to see if they are really as foolish as I suspected.
*You* demand? Why would I listen to you? I'll do as I please, and if watching these fools starve themselves amuses me, that's what I'll do.
Oh, it's a test all right. It's a test to see if they're actually fool enough to die. If they don't, however, I certainly wouldn't admit them just for that accomplishment.
Hmm. It is a bit boring standing out here all day, however. I think I'll go for some dinner... it will be fun to think of them while I gorge myself.
They'll still be here in an hour or two, surely. I suggest you run along before I decide to make you part of the fun.
Why not just shoot them where they stand? It would at least be more direct.
Observation: Yes, very efficient. It is what I would do.
That's what I would do.
Of course that's what *you* would do.
He victimizes them, but they are trying to join his vile kind. I'm not sure I would save them.
Oh, what a sweet guy. He should get the Sith congeniality medal.
You should not toy with people's lives!
Disgusting and barbaric. That these men chose to do this willingly astounds me to no end.
Well, you should know better than anyone what some people will do for power, Bastila.
And what is that supposed to mean?
Well, just that the dark side is quite tempting... or so you always say. What did you think I meant?
Never mind what I thought. Just be quiet.
Fine, I'll leave you alone.
Can I ask you some questions?
Are you one of the Sith from the academy?
No, not really.
Are you Mekel?
Nothing. Never mind.
Why are you making those men stand there?
You have to do something about those men! They're dying!
Sounds like fun.
Wouldn't it be more merciful just to kill them?
Then I demand you stop this at once!
So this isn't a real test for them?
I have to stand at attention. P-please... don't distract me, whoever you are.
Th-thank you... wish me luck.
N-no... no, I'm not. I'd like nothing better, however. Th-that's... that's why I'm here.
I... I'm trying to prove my worth to enter the Sith academy, here. We were told that if we stood here long enough... we would be worthy.
We've been here... for so many days. I'm so hungry! Some... some of us have died. But I must be strong, I must! I will keep standing!
I... n-no, please, put it away! I... I can't accept any, Mekel said. He's the Sith... over there, watching us...
I must be strong! Mekel... will find me worthy... soon, I hope...
N-no, I can't! I must get into the academy! Mekel is the Sith, over there, watching us... he told us we have to do this!
Mekel. H-he's the Sith... the one watching us from over there! He... h-he said this was how we would prove our worth...
Seems like not much to do to be worthy of anything. How long you been up to it, boy?
That's madness! How long have you been here?
You... you were talking to Mekel! I saw you! Where did he go? D-did he... did he tell you I was worthy?!
I... suppose he'll come back. Well, then, I'll just have to wait!
[Failure] You... must think I am a great f-fool! Go away! I will get in, I will!
[Success] He... he did? The guard at the door? My final test? At last!
I... I'll do it! I'll prove my strength! AAAAAAHHHH!!
Should I feel bad for him? I don't.
One really has to wonder if all Sith start off this gullible.
Observation: Marvelous elimination of the enemy, master! I applaud you!
You should not manipulate people this way! You may fall!
What are you doing? This man is not even a Sith, in truth. This is beneath contempt.
[Failure] Hah! L-like... like I would believe that! You... are just trying to make me leave! I will get in, I will!
[Success] N-no! Not after all this time! I... oh, this is terrible! I'll have to... go home...
Mother will be so angry! Ooohh...
I don't know if any of these fools deserve second chances.
Hmm. Did you save the boy or just crush his dreams? I wonder...
That was the right thing to do - turn him away from the Sith.
That was a kind thing to do. Better he give up on the Sith while he can.
Somehow I think he'll get over it.
[Failure] You're wrong! I... must wait here to be worthy; you are... just trying to trick me so you will be chosen!
Go now, and t-tempt me no more! I... will be strong!
[Success] What?! I... I've wasted all this time! How could I have been so... foolish! I could have died!
I'll find another way in, I swear it! I'll show him! Thank you!
Just leave me alone. I have to get in the academy!
Fine, I'll leave you to it.
Are you one of the Sith?
What are you doing?
Here, I have a bit of food...
Are you crazy? You have to stop!
Who put you up to this?
No. I'll be going.
[Persuade/Lie] Not yet. He said your final test is to attack that guard.
[Persuade/Lie] He said you should go home. The Sith aren't for you.
[Persuade] Mekel is tricking you. He'll never let you into the academy.
But I -
You'll get your... turn soon enough, fool. And when you do, *Cough* I will be there, laughing as you collapse from... heat exhaustion and Mekel's beatings!
Leave... leave me be! I won't listen to your... manipulations. I... I *will* make it into the academy!
Just... just a few hours longer... just a few hours, surely...
You... you have a medallion! How... how did you... unghhhh...
I... I must g-get into... the academy... must...
P-please... don't hurt me... I am too weak with hunger...
You... talked to Mekel? Have I proved my worth? Did he say anything...?
No, p-please... I... I cannot...
[Failure] I... don't believe you! You just want to... be chosen! But... it will be me! It will be... me...
[Success] Go... home...? I...
[Failure] N-no! That can't be... you're wrong! I... can't have wasted my life...
[Success] Oh... oh. All this... for nothing...
No. I'll be going.
[Persuade/Lie] He said you should go home. The Sith aren't for you.
[Persuade] Mekel is tricking you. He'll never let you into the academy.
