Are they prisoners of the Sith? Are they even still alive? I must know more, human. I must know what has happened to my daughter!
This information is mere bait - the catch yet awaits, human. Once you discover the ultimate fate of my daughter, I will gladly give you the 500 credits I promised.
I cannot officially ask you to enter the Sith base, human. That would be a violation of Ahto City's strict neutrality laws. However, I fear such a brazen act may be the only way to learn the truth.
But entering the base will not be easy. And should you be captured or killed, I will have to disavow any knowledge of your actions.
You shall have no reward from me until I learn the fate of my daughter, human! If you change your mind and discover her fate, you can report to me here to collect your reward.
I wish I could be of more help, human. I will wait here. Return to me when you have something more to report.
I am sorry, human. You have made your relationship with the Sith quite clear. I have no further business with you.
Greetings, human. My name is Shaelas. I have heard it said that you are no friend of the Sith. Is this true?
You like the Sith? You are obviously not the person I am looking for to complete this task.
Your words are strange, human. You claim one thing, then the exact opposite. Perhaps this is what your species calls humor. If so, its appeal eludes me.
However, I believe you now speak the truth about your dislike of the Sith.
You are wise to be so guarded, human. But my sources are rarely wrong, and they have informed me that you are no friend of Malak's people.
Though I suspect we have little in common, human, I share your dislike of the Sith. They have brought grief to my family.
I am not a fool, I know the Sith do not respect our laws as the Republic does. Were it up to me, I would do everything in my power to aid the Republic in the war against Malak.
But intergalactic politics stay my hand. Still, I know the Sith are evil - and I fear what they will do to my people. And what they may be doing now.

Many of the Selkath have vanished, human. Most who have gone missing are on the cusp of adulthood, the youth who will someday lead this planet. My own daughter, Shasa, is among those who have disappeared.
These disappearances coincide with the arrival of the Sith, and I cannot dismiss the connection. The Sith are up to something, human. Something sinister - I can feel it!

I will give you 500 credits if you can uncover the fate of my daughter and the other missing Selkath youth. Not much, but all I can afford. I have no official authority in this matter, and my personal wealth is not vast.
There is no one else I can turn to, human. The Republic agents are too closely watched by the Sith, and the Ahto City authorities cannot act without proof of Sith involvement.

I see, human. Despite your rebuff, my offer still stands - I have nowhere else to turn. Return to me if you obtain information on my daughter and the other missing Selkath youth, and I will reward you as promised.
I cannot imagine where to begin the investigation, though I suspect the Sith did not act alone. Perhaps the off-worlders in the mercenary enclave know something.
If you learn anything, human, report back to me at once. If you uncover the fate of my daughter and the other missing Selkath youth, I will reward you as promised.
Human, I wish to speak with you.
I've decided I've got better things to do than be your errand slave.
I have information for you, Shaelas.
Sorry, nothing yet.
Maybe a few credits could refresh my memory.
Sorry - no credits, no info.
Fine. I'll tell you what I know.
If you want news on your daughter, find a way to get those extra credits.
Very well. I'll tell you what I know.
The Sith are training the Selkath youth in the ways of the Dark Jedi.
Your daughter has joined the Sith.
Your daughter is still with the Sith, Shaelas.
Give me my money and get out of here.
Maybe this datapad will help.
I've convinced your daughter to turn her back on the Sith ways.
Keep your credits, Shaelas. A Jedi has no need of such rewards.
Thank you, Shaelas.
Maybe this datapad will help.
I killed your daughter, Shaelas. Just as I'll kill you if you tell anyone about this. Now give me those credits!
Blah, blah, blah - give me the credits if you want to live.
Your daughter is dead, Shaelas.
Keep your credits, Shaelas. I wouldn't feel right about taking them now.
I'm sorry it had to be this way, Shaelas.
Perhaps this datapad will help.
The Sith hired an Iridorian mercenary to lure the Selkath youth to the Sith base.
Does this mean I don't get paid?
What do you suggest I do?
I will look into this further.
Forget it - I'm not about to break into the Sith base looking for your web fingered offspring!
I'll infiltrate the Sith base, Shaelas.
Not yet. I shall investigate further.
Actually, I kind of like the Sith. They've got style.
What task?
I'm just kidding.
My allegiances are my own business.
The Sith are a blight upon the galaxy!
Just get to the point, Shaelas.
What are you talking about?
Sorry, I'm not interested.
What's in this for me?
I've got better things to do than look for missing tadpoles.
I shall look into these disappearances for you, Shaelas.
You want me to investigate these disappearances?
Manaan should treat us Sith better - their day of reckoning approaches.
The Selkath have forgotten the lesson of Taris. Perhaps we should remind them.
They say everyone on Manaan is equal. But it seems the Republic is a little more equal than the Sith. Neutrality? Ha! That's a laugh!
One day soon the Selkath will pay for the indignities they have inflicted on the Sith!
Your honor, the Republic is clearly in violation of Manaan's laws!
These wild Sith accusations have no basis, your honor. Where is the proof?
I must admit, these charges are hard to believe without proof. If the Republic are using submersibles to explore the ocean floor, surely there would be some evidence.
The evidence has been covered up, your honor - by your own people! I believe high level Ahto City officials are conspiring with the Republic.
You go too far, off-worlder! I will not listen to unfounded charges against Selkath officials in my court!
But, your honor - these charges cannot be ignored!
Enough, my decision has been made. If you find proof I shall reopen this case. Until then, I find no evidence of these alleged crimes. This court is dismissed.
I have no desire to speak to you. I know you have links to the Republic.
We might have a position within the Sith organization for one such as you.
Your offer is pretty good. But I've heard some nasty things about you Sith. Is it true you bombed Taris into dust?
This is war. In war certain distasteful acts cannot be avoided. But ask yourself this - when we win the war, would you rather be against the Sith, or with us?
You make a good point. And I've never turned down a job that pays up front.
Excellent. Report to the Sith Embassy tomorrow for your assignment.
Jolee - coming to check in on an old man? I must confess, I... I would rather you were here to speak to the warden and begin my trial.
Soon, old friend. But we don't want to go to trial until we've got the whole picture.
Ah, I see you're back. Not that I don't appreciate the visit, but I had hoped you were going to speak to the warden so we might begin the trial.
I grow weary of staring at these four bare walls. But I suppose you know what you are doing. You know the role of Arbiter cannot be taken lightly.
Who are you? What are you doing here?
Jolee? What's he doing here on Manaan? Never mind - I'm just glad he's here. So is this some kind of prison break? If it is we won't get very far before the Selkath cut us down I can tell ya.
Well, I guess if you're going to be my Arbiter you'll need to hear what happened. I might as well start at the beginning.
The case is a complete frame-up. Anyone looking at the evidence could see that - or so I thought. But the Selkath seem to think, well that there's enough to go to trial.
There aren't any witnesses. All that evidence against me is circumstantial... and completely flawed.
Very well. I suppose there is still much you must do before the trial.
Once you've gotten enough evidence to go to trial just tell the warden we're ready. The sooner I get out of this cell the better.
Go ahead, ask... ask what you need to. I've got nothing to hide.
Er... OK. What else do you want to know?
How would they know? They weren't there!
I heard some of the witnesses said that too, but I swear she was alive when I left!
I wonder if the Sith have been putting pressure on people to get them to convict me... It wouldn't surprise me at all. They've had it in for me since the war...
You should ask everyone about that... they might admit to helping the Sith under pressure.
So the truth is out. I never meant to kill her, you know. When I found out she was a Sith spy using me to gain information, something inside me just snapped.

She didn't know I had found out, so I waited until she fell asleep and then I... I killed her. Simple, really. But once I realized what I'd done I... I panicked. I contacted those spies from the Republic to help me.
They found the illegal monitoring device that the Sith had planted in the room, altered its recording to hide my part in it and cleared up the evidence. I figured that was the end of it.
It's easy for you to judge me - but you weren't there! You don't know what it was like, realizing what I'd done. But it...but it doesn't matter anyway.
The Sith must have been spying on me and Elassa, trying to make sure she wasn't a double agent. They must have seen the Republic spies getting rid of all the evidence.
And so they planted their own evidence. Elassa must have stolen that Hero's Cross from me long ago and given it to her Sith masters, like some kind of trophy.
I just thought I'd misplaced it. But when the Cross turned up on her body, I knew the Sith had put it there. So now you know the whole story, what are you going to do?
I'm glad you decided to see reason in this. If I'm convicted it could cause trouble for the Republic embassy here on Manaan. And none of us want that, now do we?
But Sunry is a murderer. I'm sorry, old friend, but you are. I... I can't approve of this. You go ahead, however, if that's what you think is best.
You think I'm some kind of monster, don't you? All I did was kill a Sith! How many Sith have you killed? Dozens? Hundreds? Thousands?
I don't see how the two of us are any different. She was a spy! She was using me to get information so Malak's army could destroy the Republic! She deserved to die!

If I confess I'm looking at 20 years in prison! And the Ahto City officials might even place kolto sanctions on the Republic Embassy. Without kolto how can we treat the injuries to our soldiers on the front lines!
[Failure] Oh, That's low - using a Jedi mind trick to extort a confession from me. You might as well beat it out of me, you'd have better luck!
No. I can't do that and put the Republic's supply of kolto in danger. No I won't! Now look, I may have done something stupid, and it may only be worse for my standing by it, but I will not confess.

If you turn me in, the Republic will likely lose its kolto export privileges and then we'll lose the war for sure. Are you going to send all those thousands, millions - like on Taris - to their deaths, just for your sense of 'justice'?
No, I'll rot in here if I have to, but I won't betray the Republic. Do what you have to, but know what the consequences will be.
I hate to say it, but he has a point. The Republic needs that kolto.
And you would propose what? Letting a murderer free on the chance it will help the Republic?
If need be. We are talking about a Sith, remember? I don't approve of what he did any more than you --
But you're willing to overlook it. Are the principles that the Republic stands on so very weak, Carth?
The Republic's principles aren't worth a hill of beans if it falls, Bastila. I'll do whatever I can to save it.
Sunry... this is wrong, and you know it. I am a Jedi... what is it that you expect me to do to defend your actions?
You do whatever you have to, Jolee. I know what I did, but I also know what's at stake, here.
Commentary: The meatbag has a point, master. Killing is often justified, if illegal in the eyes of many.
You're talking about acts of war. We're just defending ourselves! You murdered your girlfriend in her sleep.
That's different, Sunry, and you know it. We don't kill them in cold blood while they sleep.
A Rodian? I didn't know there were any Rodians on Manaan. Oh, except for Tyvark... and this one named Gluupor who was hanging around the hotel all the time.

OK, so maybe there are a whole bunch of Rodians on Manaan, but what does that matter? If he planted evidence at the scene it's a clear sign of a frame-up. He probably took all the evidence of the real killer at the same time.
The evidence of a Sith conspiracy keeps getting stronger, doesn't it? But I suspect there is still stuff you want to clear up.
[Failure] That's a Sith lie! They're trying to embarrass me and humiliate my wife! How dare you ask me that!
Yes, I... I suppose you do. Please, forgive my outburst. This has been a terribly stressful time for me. I... I'm sure there is more you want to ask me.
Then... then you know. Please, don't make a big deal about this. Elora already knew and I... I was going there to break if off with Elassa.
I know it was wrong, but I'm a weak man. Elassa was beautiful and young - how was I to resist her charms? But I didn't kill her! I loved her!
Please, I know I made a terrible mistake getting involved with Elassa, but I was going there to break it off with her.
I did it, but found out later that she was dead. I don't deserve to go to jail just for having an affair, do I? You have to help me prove that I wasn't the killer!
The witnesses are lying! Maybe the Sith got to them - I don't know. But it's a lie I tell you! A hurtful, horrible lie!
[Success] We... I... Oh, no... what must this look like... Yes. Yes we were having an affair.

I guess you could interview witnesses at the hotel where the murder happened. The Selkath already did that, but the fish folk don't have much rapport with off-worlders. Maybe one of them was holding something back.
But I think you'd be better off investigating the Sith themselves. Maybe you could find some proof they planted evidence to frame me - though that might mean figuring out a way into the Sith Embassy.
Anything else I can help you with? I want my Arbiter to be well prepared before we go to trial.
Well I was at the hotel, I admit. And I did meet Elassa there that night. But it's not what you think!
I... I was working with Republic Intelligence. We were pretending to feed information to the Sith while I turned Elassa into a double agent working for us.
It was going well, too... Until she turned up dead...
Hm... maybe the Sith had found out I was turning her and had her eliminated...
But let's look at the facts they've given:
Elassa was brutally killed. Think about that - she was a Sith, trained in battle and I'm just a crippled old man!
My war injuries make it difficult for me to walk even to hold things. See how my hands are shaking! How could I kill a Sith warrior at close quarters? I ask you!
Further: They say they found my Hero's Cross at the crime scene. Would I leave my war medal behind if I killed someone? Even I'm not that stupid.

Obviously the Sith planted the Cross. And what about the lack of forensic evidence? Skin and hair samples, clothing fibers - why isn't there anything like that at the crime scene? Sounds like an obvious frame-up to me.
I hope you can see how the Sith are manipulating the Selkath, and probably even you, to set up this against me! We need to get this over with quickly and clear my name.
Well... you know I was having an affair with Elassa... I went there to break it off that night.
I can tell you it wasn't easy. She is... was... young and beautiful. But I love Elora, and I knew I had to do it. I broke it off as quickly as I could and then left.
I found out later she'd been murdered when the Selkath authorities came knocking on my door...
Jolee! What... what are you doing here?
Elora sent me, Sunry. I'm here to get you out of this mess. The courts went and made us Arbiters for your case.
Just like old times, eh Jolee? You come swooping in out of nowhere to save my tail from the fire.
You saved my wrinkled butt more than a few times as well, friend, if I recall. But there'll be time for catching up later. Right now we need to focus on the case.
Your wife asked me to come. I'm a friend of Jolee Bindo.
I've been appointed as your Arbiter.
I'll be going now.
There's a few things we have to clear up.
On second thought, I will ask something else.
The judges said that you left after the shot was fired.
I know you're guilty, Sunry. I've got the Republic's data recording.
You're nothing but a cold blooded killer!
You should have known the truth would come out eventually.
But the Sith found out the truth, didn't they?
I won't betray your secret. We'll go on with the trial.
I don't know.
You're guilty, Sunry. Confess.
If you confess the court might show mercy.
I suppose you're right. I won't expose you.
Killing your lover while she sleeps is murder - even if she is a Sith!
[Force Persuade] You will confess your crimes. You WANT to confess your crimes.
These are just excuses, Sunry. We both know you have to own up to your crimes.
There was a Rodian who planted evidence at the murder scene.
[Persuade] Were you and Elassa having an affair?
No offense, Sunry. I have to ask.
I know you're lying, Sunry. I found this datapad talking about you and Elassa.
Witnesses saw you at her hotel room, Sunry. You better tell me what's going on.
I need to investigate the case some more. Any ideas where I should look?
Let's go over the evidence.
I don't know how much longer I can stay on this world... The Selkath don't make it easy for us off-worlders.
A friend of mine recently got into Pazaak - you know, the card game. Now he can't stop! It's so addictive!
Wow! Hey, you're the sector swoop champ, right? Too bad about the circuit being so small this year, but still!
The whole swoop racing circuit for this sector has been falling apart since the Sith bombed Taris.
Did I tell you I'm a fan? I saw recordings of some of your races and you're great! Maybe when they get the circuit back up we can really see what you can do!
I hear there's going to be a heavy meteor shower in the Coruscant system this year. Last time this sort of thing happened, they lost one of the orbital stations.
I hear the Czerka Corp. got kicked off Kashyyyk by the locals... Good for them! At least someone's getting something back from them.
There's a lot of credits to be made in the Republic in times like these. If we survive of course...
The fighting between the Republic and the Sith is spreading farther. I wonder how long before Manaan becomes a battleground...
I heard someone attack and killed a lot of the Sith leadership on one of their worlds. Maybe the Republic would actually have a chance... if it weren't for Malak.
I heard the Sith are trying to work on a synthetic version of kolto. I wouldn't be surprised if the Republic was, too.
Manaan may not seem very hospitable, but a surprising amount of trade runs through it because of the kolto trade.
The Selkath have clamped down on kolto exports all of a sudden. No one knows why. If someone did something to offend them, there's going to be trouble I think.
This court hereby finds Sunry innocent of the murder of the Sith Elassa.
Your Honors! No!
Silence!
In addition, this court finds the Sith Empire guilty of conspiracy and obstruction of justice.
Your Honors! No!
Silence!
The Sith Empire is hereby forced to subsidize a portion of Republic purchases on Manaan for a period of the next solar year.
The verdict has been delivered and this trial is now over.
Sunry... I'm so glad...
Elora...
Thank you for saving me. I don't know how I can repay you. Elora and I are going to leave here and get as far away from all this as soon as we can.
I - and the Republic - will not forget what you've done for us. Thank you.
We have done all we could for you, old friend.
Thank you, Jolee! I... I don't know what I would have done if you hadn't shown up!
Don't thank me, thank your Arbiter. I was glad to help.
This court hereby finds Sunry guilty of the murder of the Sith Elassa.
According with Selkath law the proscribed punishment for murder is death.
*sob* Sunry... No...
But due to the extenuating circumstances surrounding this case...
... and to not provoke additional tension between the Sith and Republic elements within Ahto City...
... this sentence is commuted to a life-term in the Ahto City Prison.
No, your honors! I demand the death penalty!

The verdict has been delivered and this trial is now over.

Sunry...

I think the facts in this case are very straight forward: Sunry was having an affair with Elassa. He sought to end it, and the simplest, quickest method given his hatred of the Sith was to simply kill her.
*Ahem* Witnesses saw Sunry fleeing the scene, and material evidence places him there at the time of the murder as well.
I am confident that any informed observation of the facts will lead the judges - your Honors - to this very conclusion.
Indeed. And your closing statements, Arbiter?
Then the court will now deliberate amongst ourselves.

The Sith would not leave the medal of her killer clutched in her hand!

Is there another point you would make?

Very well.
Are you a war hero, Mr. Sunry? You fought in wars against the Sith Empire, correct?
Yeah, that's right. I don't regret it either. The Republic needs its heroes.
Indeed... Would you say that you dislike the Sith? Even... hate them?
Of course I hate them! Trying to take over the galaxy every chance they get! Killing millions of innocents!
Pure politics. Were you in Elassa's room on the night of the murder?
Well, yes I... I was...
I knew she was a Sith, and she would be trying to pump me - for information, of course - so I... I just simply turned the tables.
I was working on her, trying to turn her over to the Republic's side. Trying to turn her into a double agent. But that's kind of ruined now that she's been murdered.
An obviously false story! I have proof here, in the form of data recording, that proves you were, in fact, having an affair with Elassa!

I... I... What's the use now... I had been having an affair with Elassa, it's true. But I had realized my mistake and was going there to end it! But I did not kill her!
I had been having an affair with Elassa on my wife, yes... But I realized how wrong I had been and I was going there to end it!
You were having an affair with a Sith! You wanted to end it quickly and quietly, so you killed her from behind and tried to flee!
No, I...

Do not interrupt the accused!

The Sith Empire is not the barbaric institution you portray it to be!
Be silent, prosecutor. This is a valuable point, that lends some credence to your defense, Arbiter.
I don't know. The medal had gone missing some time ago. I never found out what happened to it.
It's possible the Sith had stolen it and had it planted on the body...
Supposition, your Honors!
True, but it does have merit and deserves consideration.
Of course she was! Why would a young, beautiful Sith woman get with an old cripple like me?

Elassa was a spy and the Sith are framing Sunry.

I think I was a little drunk there earlier, but I'm better now. This Selkath brew wears off pretty fast.

Perhapsh we should make our acquaintensh more intimate. I know a little motel jus' around the corner... (burp) 'schuse me, mish.
Who knows? Who cares? Bad enough them Selkath punks are running around our bashe, making it shtink like fish!.
Shunry... he's goin' away for a loooong time. We Shith made sure of that.
Jus' rumors. Shtuff I heard about making sure them shtupid fish people find the evidence they need.
I don't wanna talk about that shtuff no more. Why don't we shlip away together, darling?
Dunno what yer talkin' about... Mmmm, but you don't need a map to get what I can give ya!
Yesh! One more drink! Jus' what I wash thinking!
Say, you must be new around here. My name is Viglo. You don't look like those Republic scum, and you aren't one of us Sith. So, what brings you to Manaan?
Oh... I get it. I get a little too forward and you want to hold it against me.
Hey, I just thought of something! If I said you had a great body, would you hold it against me? Ha ha ha!
Barkeep, I sense I've offended my lady friend. Bring me another round so I can drown my sorrows in the sweet nectar of the Selkath people.
We Sith are interested in lots of stuff. You'd be smart to keep your nose out of Sith business.
I hope the Selkath fry that Sunry for what he did. Elassa was a real looker, and nobody kills a Sith and gets away with it!
You some kind of historian? You should look to the future, not the past. That's why I joined the Sith. And then I get stuck on Manaan - worst post in the galaxy!
It isn't easy here, you know. Not with all the Republic soldiers walking the streets while we sit and do nothing. Malak should send a fleet in and conquer this whole sector, kolto or no!
But I don't really want to talk about that right now. I'm just here to have a couple drinks and try to unwind, you know?
Sure, pull up a seat. I'll have the bartender ring us up a couple mugs of the local favorite. It's called a firaxian tooth.
Watch out for these - they pack quite the bite. Two or three of these babies and you won't even remember who you are.
Whoa - that's good stuff! Maybe even better than Kessel spice, am I right?
Sure - fire away. It's the least I can do after you bought me a drink and all.

Aw, you want to talk business? I was hoping you wanted to ask something more... you know, personal. Look, I don't want to talk shop. I just want to relax with my drink... which is, unfortunately, empty now.
I better take it easy - I've got a shift tomorrow and I don't want to end up passed out on the floor.
[Success] I suppose one more wouldn't hurt. Barkeep, ring up another round!
[Success] I suppose one more wouldn't hurt. Barkeep, ring up another round!
[Failure] I better not. You don't even want to know what the punishment is if one of us Sith shows up for a shift drunk or hungover.
[Success] I suppose one more wouldn't hurt. Barkeep, ring up another round!
Oh, that's good stuff. Really takes the edge off, know what I mean? Whoa, feeling a little light-headed, there.
Firaxian Tooth - almost as valuable as kolto, right? Ha ha ha! I gotta get this recipe someday. Wonder if I can brew it up right at home? What do you think is in this stuff, anyway?
One more, barkeep! Hurry up, man - this stuff is powerful quick, but it wears off just as fast!
As long as it's not about Sith business, the answer is yes, sweetie! Yes to another round, yes to I think you're gorgeous and yes to anything you want to do together!
Well, you picked a real stinkhole to stop at. Republic soldiers are everywhere, those arrogant Selkath treating us Sith like we're second-class citizens.
I wish we could bomb this ocean world into a desert, but we need that kolto for our Sith troops. Man, I hate this place.
Some of the other soldiers like to go and bet on the swoops on their days off, but this planet is bad enough without mingling with the locals.
Hey, man, clear out. You're cramping my style with the ladies.

Manaan - Ahto East
You're really annoying, you know that? I hate it when people come out of nowhere and start collecting wins.
So, you're trying to break out of the low rounds, hmm? Don't let your one win go to your head. Hukta and I are professionals.
Don't expect a warm "Hello" from me, I don't have much warmth for the racer that outranked me in my round.
Well, hello Sector Champion. You must be proud right now. You'll excuse me if I don't join in with cheers of my own.
What do you want now? I really don't have time for you.
What do you want? I don't waste time with fans, so if this is about an autoprint, forget it. You can buy one when I get more made up.
Leave me alone. I need time to prepare for my races.
What? Are you threatening me? On Manaan? You know how foolish that is, right?
That's better. Hurry up and tell me what you want.
Not here you won't. There are cameras everywhere, looking for just your type. Criminals like you are shipped off instantly.
You're not getting anything out of me on this planet. The Selkath have cameras everywhere. You'd just be locked up for trying.
Go away. Manaan isn't very friendly to bullies.
Don't get snippy with me. I have legions of adoring fans that would rather have my time. Legions!
Well, get it over with.
Don't hurry back.
I know that if you do absolutely anything wrong you get locked up. Seems like fining criminals is a great way to bring in the credits.
I'm surprised they even let us race. Wouldn't want the crowds to get too excited. Excitement make people unpredictable. Or something.
Again? Oh all right, but only if you make it quick.
Of course you do. Everyone wants time with the fabulous Casandra Mateil. There just isn't enough of me to go around.
Yes yes, hurry it up.
Hukta Jax is the only other professional here besides me. He got where he is by making sure everyone knows he's the toughest racer out there.
I don't know any of the other racers. I guess there's Queedle, the local favorite. He won't amount to much.
You need money to compete. Maybe he's got some skills, but he just doesn't have the best bike. It's that simple.
The only other name I know is Queedle. You heard about him taking it all, right? I don't know where he got the speed from.
I don't need to tell you anything. You've beat us all. You're just looking for an excuse to gloat.
Two years, but that's more than enough time to know the secrets behind the sport. It's all about the image you portray.
Hukta is the thug; people like him because he's mean. I'm the pretty one; the one that people want to take home.
Even if we don't win, we're easy to remember. That keeps the fans coming back, so race organizers want us at their tracks.
Local racers don't bring in off-world crowds. They need us. At least, they would if there was still a functioning circuit.
It was, but I can't seem to get a break lately. Hukta has been holding me off, and all he does is run over everything.
But this place is all there is until the circuit recovers from the loss of Taris. It's going to take a while.
Not within reasonable traveling time. I heard there was a start-up on Tatooine, but I'll stick with the legitimate tracks, thank you very much.
Hutts aren't to be trusted. That's all I'll say.
And of course you had to go and take the whole competition. Nothing like getting beaten by a rookie.
And Queedle, what's he doing winning? He's just a local amateur. I'm glad only a small crowd saw him blow past me.
You should know better than any of us. You're the Sector Champion, after all. You tell me if the track is good. Feh!
Wait, you're that new racer. I don't give out racing secrets, if that's what you're asking for.
I'm still upset about losing my ranking to that amateur Queedle. I don't know how he got so fast all of a sudden.
Wait a minute... you're no fan. You're the racer that killed my time. Why should I talk to you?
Wait, no, you're the new Sector Champion, aren't you? You're really cutting into my profits. What do you want?
I don't care who you are or what you do on this track; I'm not saying anything else to you.
Sounds like you need a lesson...
I apologize. I didn't mean anything.
I'll threaten you if I want!
How about you pay me to go away?
Save your attitude. Answer my questions.
I just want to ask a few questions.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Do you know much about Manaan?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Can you tell me about the other racers?
What makes you say that?
How long have you been at this?
What do you mean by that?
Is Manaan a good course for racing?
There are no other tracks?
What do you mean by that?
You don't need to talk to me, racer. I get enough of you on the track. I see you getting wins. Go away.
You got one race, but that means nothing. Go bother another beginner or something, because you are no interest to me.
Go away. You and me, we don't have anything to say about nothing. Go beat someone else's time or something.
Grrr... Sector Champion. Well, that is very nice. Now how about you go away? I got to work on waterproofing my swoop.
What do you want from Hukta now? I don't have time for you or anyone.
Who is you? Hmm? Hukta Jax -that's me- says you should step back, because pro racers like me are important.
So, you leave me alone so's I can get race-ready. It important. Meditation and stuff.
Haw! That's funny! You is new here, so maybe you don't know, but Manaan gots Selkath cameras everywhere. No fighting allowed.
You got to be smart, and know the place good. You is too new for that. You just funny.
Heh, okay, I will answer, but you watch what you say. Hukta Jax don't take threats from nobody.
Yeah, okay, but you keep it short. I got no reason to talk to you.
Yeah, you go then, and leave me alone.
I know that if you do absolutely anything wrong you get locked up. Seems like fining criminals is a great way to bring in the credits.
I'm surprised they even let us race. Wouldn't want the crowds to get too excited. Excitement make people unpredictable. Or something.
What? Again? Ask and leave me alone.
Okay, maybe I say something, or maybe not. Hukta Jax don't give secrets out.
Why? You sure talk when you get going. Maybe we can hurry up and stop soon?
I just know that I am better than all the rest. I'd be better even with more pros here. Casandra is okay, but she is weak and little.
Queedle is here too, but he doesn't got what we got.
He doesn't have the best swoop. He can have skills all over the floor, but if his swoop goes slow, he goes slow, and he goes slow.
There's Queedle too, but he is the worst! I mean, what is he doing winning it all? That is just not right! He's not pro!
You don't need nothing. You beat everybody. I got nothing to tell.
Lots of years. I got my swoop after we raided... I mean, I got my swoop when someone left it to me. It was sad, but happy too.
Nothing, and I 'm not saying any more.
This track is pretty good. It's too wet, but it's on the ocean, so you're gonna have that. Better to hit waves than rocks, I guess.
This track is all there is until the circuit is up again. Taris took the best racers. I suppose there is Tatooine...
I'm not going back to Tatooine ever. Hukta Jax is better than that dust ball.
That's none of yous business, and you stop asking about it. You stop!
I don't like you much, either. You come in and win everything from everybody, but you aren't a pro like me. It's not right.
I don't like the new racers here, though. Queedle stole the top round from me! How'd he get so fast so all of a sudden?
What is I going to tell you about this course? You won it already! Go let someone ask you questions instead.
You that new racer, winning from nowhere, right? I like winning, so you just stay away from my times.
Queedle is the big winner right now. I hate that. He should stay in the beginner races. He's not ready to beat me. It's not right.
Wait! You's the one that beat my time! Twice I get beaten, by Queedle and you too! This is the worst showing I had yet!
You're Sector Champion, right? You only won because I gots distracted by stupid Queedle. He blew my whole strategy.
Yeah, you come talk to me. I got something to say to you, little racer. Hukta Jax doesn't like how fast you go.
I told you once already, and I want you to remember; you don't win the Sector Champion spot. If you do, there will be trouble.
See, back when more people raced, I lost lots more. Now, I win pretty good. I like winning. You maybe shouldn't mess it up.
So I says this, and you listen good. You don't win the Sector Champion race. If you win, maybe something bad happens to you.
I already did it, and I don't regret nothing. You don't know how much I like to race. You don't know what I can do.
You just do as I says and you will stay safe. It's simple.
I am too smart to do something out in the open. Selkath gots cameras all over, and they lock everyone up without questions.
No, I would find you when you don't know it's coming, where no cameras are. You win Sector Champion race, and I hurt you.
Maybe you end up dead first. Maybe it will be painful, too. I don't like when people don't do what they should. You win and you get hurt.
Sure, you think. While you do that, stay away from the course. I's can make things very bad for you.
Then you is smarter than you look. I likes it when people are reasonable. Just stay away from the track.
Then you and Hukta Jax are gonna have problems, I promise you that. You was warned, fair and square.
Sure, you can agree with me. That's the only way this is gonna work, you understand? You do like I say, and you don't get hurt.
Hukta says you earned a big enemy. You should have lost when you was told to lose! Now something's gotta be done!
Not here, because Selkath cameras are watching. I's too smart for that. I get you when you least expect. You just wait.
You'd better show me some respect, piggie.
Just answer my questions, and make it quick.
I just want to ask a few questions.
I'm leaving. Goodbye.
Do you know much about Manaan?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
What do you mean?
How long have you been at this?
What do you mean by that?
Is Manaan a good course for racing?
What's wrong with Tatooine?
When were you there?
You'd regret threatening me, piggie.
You'd never get away with it. Cameras are everywhere.
Try anything and you'll end up dead!
I'll think about what you said.
I don't want any trouble...
I will race, and I will win.
Can't we come to an agreement?
Sorry, but you're too late to recruit me. I've just hired on with the Sith. Of course, if the Republic has a better offer...
I don't have time to sit here and answer your questions. I have to get ready - the Sith want me to report to their Embassy first thing tomorrow.
Hey, keep your lectures. The Sith pay well, and they pay up front. That's all I care about.
Then why are you bothering me? I'm here on Manaan to find work as a mercenary. I'm not here to chat with tourists.
Can I ask you a few questions.
You'd work for the Sith? They're evil!
I'm not a recruiter.
Hello again. There's not much happening here yet. I guess the racers are waiting for the field to fill out a bit.
I appreciate the money you gave me to upgrade my swoop. Come back to East Ahto in a day or so and I'll see if my times can improve.
I'm just waiting for my time to fall. I just can't seem to keep up with the serious racers.
Hello again. I still can't believe the difference a few upgrades make. My score is top of Round Three! I never thought I'd be able to do that.
I'm sure it won't stand as a record for long, but I have to thank you for this opportunity. I appreciate all that you did for me.
Greetings to you, Sector Champion. That was an amazing time you turned in. The best I've seen on this track.
I don't feel bad losing to you, now that I know I'm in the running. Thanks for your help, even if you did win it all in the end.
Before I go any further, though, I have to return the money you gave me. The prize I won covered most of it.
What? Now listen, I want to be grateful to you for this. Don't spoil it. Just take your money back and let's stay on good terms.
There's nothing else to pay! My prize money only covered maintenance and the upgrade cost. I told you I didn't have a lot.
You know, you gave me a chance, but I guess it was all just a trick to try and get more money. Well it won't work, not on Manaan.
You can't do anything because of all the cameras. I'm not wasting time with you. I have a swoop career to plan.
I'll do my best. I owe you a lot.
You did? I didn't. I was worried the whole time. I didn't believe it until I heard my time. Thank you again for all of this..
Thanks, but no, I won't need it. I'll do all right now that I have a chance.
Hello there. You probably want to talk to the professional racers. They are in the Racers' Lounge, the room just to the east.
They don't usually associate with amateur racers like me. I'll probably be giving up soon anyway.
What? That was a bit harsh. I just can't maintain my swoop the way they can. Is that my fault?
All right, I'll answer. I probably won't be racing again anyway.
Well, I'll just keep to myself then. You can go keep company with the other elite if you want. You deserve each other.
Now go away. I've got important things to think about.
All right, but there's no need to be so rude. I just have I've important decisions on my mind.
I'll answer what I can. I don't think I'll be going back out on the track.
See you around the track.
Well, I've lived here for more than ten years. I worked in the big purification and processing plants here after leaving my homeworld of Ando.
In all that time, I've learned very little about the Selkath and their way of life. They don't like off-worlders much, even if their politics are neutral.
I can't get used to the Sith presence here, but everyone is interested in Manaan to some degree. It's all because of the kolto.
No, but it's unnerving to have them here, especially after what happened on Taris. The swoop circuit was really hurt by that, I'm sure you know.
I know that you need it to make medpacs, and I know Mannan is the only place to get it. That's all anyone knows, I think.
I'm not sure why you would be interested in going over this again. I'm just a failing amateur swoop racer.
Me? No one is interested in me. I'm just Queedle Molto, one of many failing amateur swoop racers.
If you like. I probably won't be going back out on the track soon anyway.
All right, but don't take too long. I want to get my swoop upgrade done soon, so it'll be ready when you come back to East Ahto.
Anything you like. You helped me more than enough.
Hukta Jax and Casandra Mateil are the only two professionals here right now. They keep to themselves in the Racers' Lounge.
The only thing I can really say about them is that I'll never get close to beating them. I should probably just give up racing.
I can tell you I never thought I would beat them. I doubt that Casandra and Hukta like that I've won Round Three.
I hope that will just turn to friendly rivalry. I think I can make a go of professional swoop racing after all, thanks to you.
You understand everyone enough to beat their times. That's probably more than I could tell you. I'm learning though, and I'll get even better.
Thanks again for your help. I appreciate it.
Not long, but I don't know how much more time I'll be putting in. I think I've gone as far as I can go.
I'll see if putting the credits you gave me into swoop upgrades will help, but I don't know if it will. I may just not be good enough.
I guess I'll know when I get my bike upgraded. That will take a little while, so check with me when you come back to East Ahto.
Thanks for your help either way. I mean it.
I'm not getting any better out there. I race hard, and I think I have good skills, but I just can't afford to keep up with the professionals.
Their swoop bikes are modified with the best equipment. There is only so much you can do with a borrowed toolkit and standard parts.
I can't afford to make this my life. I want to keep going, but without money, you don't win, and if you don't win, you don't get money.
I am no beggar! You asked what was troubling me and I told you. The 500 credits I need is my problem, not yours.
I'm not asking for anything. You asked what was wrong and I'm telling you. The 500 credits I need is my problem, not yours.
It's not your problem to worry about. I shouldn't even be bothering you with this. The 500 credits I need is my problem, not yours.
That's the attitude of the professional racers too. Survival of the fittest, I guess. I'll probably quit when my Round One time gets beat.
I saved all my wages from the processing plant to buy my swoop in the first place. I just don't have anything to spare.
That's nice of you to say, but it doesn't change anything. I'll probably end up quitting as soon as someone beats my time.
You're just giving me 500 credits? Just like that? I don't know what to say. I'd have to save for months to get anywhere near that much.
Thank you. I mean it. I'll get them working on my swoop right away. Maybe I can improve on my Round One time after all.
Come back to East Ahto in a day or so, after the changes are made. I hope it helps. Maybe I'm just not good enough. I guess we'll see.
Not long at all, but I guess I'll be able to try and make it a career now. This was a big step for me. Thanks for your help.
I don't know. It's been hard to keep up with the professional racers. Maybe it's the course, or maybe it's me. I'm not doing very well.
I haven't raced anywhere else, but I'd probably do just as bad on another track.
I didn't think so before, but thanks to you, I made it to the top round of racing. I guess the course is all right after all.
I think you answered your own question by becoming Sector Champion. It's obviously a good place for you to race. Me too, I guess.
I was worried it was too hard to get ahead on this course, but your help made me realize I just needed a little boost. Thanks again.
What else can I tell you? You're Sector Champion now. You've shown you know more than I could tell you.
Just leave me alone. I'll get by without your help or abuse, thank you very much.
Hello there. I... wanted to thank you for showing me I should get out of the swoop circuit. I just don't have what it takes.
You beat my time easy, and you're not even a pro. I'm taking the hint and leaving before I lose all my credits in the sport.
I really wanted to make a go of it... but I guess you can't always do what you want. Well, you can. Nice racing. Good luck on your career.
I guess it doesn't. I just couldn't compete with the professionals, or even the serious amateurs. I was never even in the running.
That won't work now, I think. You and all the other racers have outclassed me in every round. I just don't have the resources to compete.
Maybe if I had been able to get my swoop upgraded... I don't know. It's too late now. It was fun while it lasted, but it's over. Goodbye.
I suppose, but I wanted to go past them. Do you know that no Aqualish has ever taken Sector Champion? I had hoped...
Ah, it's too late for that. Maybe if I'd got some swoop upgrades... I don't know. It was fun while it lasted, but it's over. Goodbye.
It's too late for that. Maybe if I could have had one last good run... maybe if I could have upgraded my swoop. Ah, it doesn't matter.
Thanks anyway, but I'll be leaving now. Back to the processing job, I guess. This was fun while it lasted. Goodbye.
I don't really understand why you gave me the money to upgrade my swoop and then didn't give me time to do it before beating my time.
I guess you had your reasons. Here, take your money back. I won't need it now.
You are very generous, but it's too late for that. I've got no reason to think I could win even with the time to upgrade.
I had fun for a while, but I just can't compete without upgrades. I'll leave it to you professionals. Goodbye.
You owe me more. It's called interest.
Do as I say! Pay me for my trouble!
Fine. Just answer my questions then.
Thank you. I knew you would do well.
You keep it. Use it for more upgrades.
You sound pathetic.
Sorry. I want to ask some questions.
Whose fault is it? Like I said: pathetic.
Very sad. Just answer my questions.
I just want to ask a few questions.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
Do you know much about Manaan?
Have the Sith been a problem?
What do you know about kolto?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
How long have you been at this?
Use the money I gave you to upgrade.
What do you mean by that?
I have no respect for beggars, fool.
You mentioned you needed 500 credits.
Ah, now I understand. You need a loan.
How much do you think you need?
I guess you'd better just give up.
There's no way you can earn the money?
If I had that much I'd give it to you.
Here, I can give it to you.
Is Manaan a good course for racing?
What is bothering you?
This sport doesn't need losers.
Quitter! Stand up for yourself!
It's good to know your limits.
Why don't you keep trying?
Keep the money. Try again.

I haven't the faintest clue as to what you're talking about.
Who knows? Some scheming plot, no doubt. Hopefully the Selkath uncover it and ban the Republic from the planet.
I know he'd already be tried, convicted and executed if the Selkath knew anything about justice! But the fish people are as weak as the Republic when it comes to such matters.
