I'll be going now.
I know the pass code.
Zeta 245698 Alpha.
I have this passcard.
I have business with the Sith.
I want to ask you some questions.
Why have the Sith taken such an interest in the Selkath youth?
Why is the Republic hiring so many mercenaries?
Do you know about the Sunry case?
I have no desire to speak to you. I know you have links to the Republic.
We might have a position within the Sith organization for one such as you.
Your offer is pretty good. But I've heard some nasty things about you Sith. Is it true you bombed Taris into dust?
This is war. In war certain distasteful acts cannot be avoided. But ask yourself this - when we win this war, would you rather be against the Sith, or with us?
You make a good point. And I've never turned down a job that pays up front.
Excellent. Report to the Sith Embassy tomorrow for your assignment.
What do you want now? You press your luck, pestering a Sith soldier. It doesn't seem wise on your part.
As I have said in the past, the swoop races attract the lowest of rabble. As you are one of them, I suggest you leave me alone.
Don't count on the small measure of celebrity you have attained at the swoop races. All are equally inferior before the Sith.
What do we have here? A lost off-worlder, perhaps? You're probably here for the swoop races. Track is through the west corridor. Get moving.
I hate the rabble the races attract. They're always trouble.
What did you say? You don't want trouble from me, friend. You might as well take a blaster to your own head.
I'm sure you didn't. Walk away. Now.
So, you have some courage. Dumb as a B'omarr castoff, but you've got courage. What do you hope to accomplish with this threat?
Even if you expected to live through my attack, the Selkath would lock you up for fighting in their streets.
I thought you might. Walk away. Now.
Ah, so you wish to goad *me* into action so the Selkath turn their unyielding laws my way? Amusing. Perhaps you aren't so foolish.
You've made your jest on the one world where you would not be immediately struck down. I suggest you walk away while your assumption holds true.
I'm no guide. The Sith don't suffer questions for long.
Of course you do. Good riddance.
Then seek out a helpful fish for answers. I have no interest in the affairs of the Selkath and you have no reason to inquire about mine.
What do I think? I think it's a shame when an unworthy newcomer unseats his betters. I am not easily won as a supporter.
Are you hoping that I will look more favorably on you because you have taken the Sector Champion title? You are mistaken.
I am fond of the sport, true, but it's more about hating racers I don't think should win than actually paying tribute to those I favor.
Hurry it up. This is a poor use of my time. You should know not to annoy one of my kind.
Hukta Jax shows the proper spirit of competition, and it has brought him to the top before.
The Gamorrean? You're joking.
Brute force to the finish, he's very efficient.
I believe Queedle Molta has taken top spot. I prefer the professional racers. His win was just a fluke. An aberration.
Wait, I recognize you. I watched you take top prize at the swoop tournament. Nice work, Sector Champion, but you haven't won me over.
Move along, off-worlder. I've had enough of you.
I don't think I asked your opinion, Sith.
I meant no harm. I apologize.
You don't look so tough to me.
Then I will beg your pardon and leave.
I made no threat. I merely voiced an opinion.
Could I ask you a few questions?
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I wanted to ask questions about Manaan.
What do you think of the swoop races?
Let's go back to my first questions.
Who do you like?
Why are you back again? I didn't show enough disinterest the first time around? You really shouldn't pester a soldier of the Sith.
I shouldn't expect you to listen. You're probably just another open-mouthed fool here for the swoop races.
Go look for fans over at the swoop races, Sector Champion. I'm sure they'll give you what your looking for.
What do you want, rail-rat? I don't have the time or desire to bother speaking with wandering idiots.
Go join the other transients in the swoop race area. At least you'll all be contained.
Hostile? I would consider this the height of calm for dealing with insects like yourself. If I were hostile, you'd be dead.
Wisely played. Go away.
Yes, Manaan is a very unsatisfying world for settling disagreements. The Selkath are very insistant that even words are not used as weapons.
Since we both refuse to initiate a violent event, you'll have to accept my contempt-filled dismissal, and hope we don't meet again.
I will get tired of your voice in short order, so make it quick.
Good. This visit was dragging on.
Grow some gills and swim the planet yourself. There's no substitute for personal experience. I have nothing else to say on the subject.
Our Taris campaign killed the giants of the sport. The current racers are hardly inspiring. An Aqualish champion? Hmph. Laughable.
You're the Sector Champion; you know the races inside and out. Why ask me? Are you trying to worm a compliment out of me?
Nothing about the current state of the races make me want to watch. Especially if it means associating with the cattle grouped in there now.
Hurry it up. This is a poor use of my time. You should know not to annoy one of my kind.
I admire the mercenary spirit of Casandra Mateil. Other than that, no one.
Her mercenary spirit isn't what's selling the autoprints.
She does have... other qualities as well.
You're probably another race fan in a fool's stupor after that big win by local whelp Queedle Molta.
Go talk with your adoring fans over at the swoop races. I'm sure they fawn all over their beloved Sector Champion.
Go away. You would regret the only other option.
I don't like how hostile you are.
I won't take that chance. Goodbye.
A pity we can't test the theory now.
Could I ask you a few questions?
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I have some questions about Manaan.
You mentioned the races.
Let's go back to my first questions.
There are no racers you like?
Move about your business, human.
Out of my way - unless you want to feel the wrath of the Sith!
The wrath of the Sith is a terrible thing! Remember Taris! You'll see - you'll all see!
You dare mock me? If it wasn't for the Selkath laws I'd teach you proper respect!
Hey, you working for the Republic? You look like a Republic agent - I can see the cowardice in your eyes.
Are you threatening me? It's illegal to try to start a fight in Ahto City! Constable - over here! This Republic scum is trying to break the peace!
Is this true human? Are you threatening this woman with violence?
Human, you are fined 100 credits for disturbing the Manaan peace. If you do not pay, you will be taken to the Manaan prisons.
Perhaps a 500 credit fine and a stint in the Ahto City jails will teach you to respect our laws.
Further disturbances will be dealt with in a similar manner.
Then you shall be imprisoned until you can pay the fine.
I am not deaf, human. I heard your words, and threatening physical violence is not permitted in Ahto City.
Insults are one thing, human. Threats of physical violence are quite another. They are expressly forbidden by the laws of Ahto City.
[Failure] A strange interpretation of these events, human. One I do not share. Clearly you are the one at fault here.
[Success] Yes - you are correct, human. The Sith is the one at fault.
Me? I didn't do anything! This is an outrage! A travesty of justice!
Come with me to the Ahto City prisons. We will alert your Embassy and you shall be released when they pay the fine.
Though I've known the Sith to let their people languish in the prison for many months before securing their release.
I'll get you for this, Jedi! The Sith won't stand for this!
[Failure] Apologies are not sufficient. The law must be upheld.
[Success] Very well, I shall overlook this infraction. But you would be wise to watch your words in the future, human.
The Selkath claim neutrality, but you're always giving preferential treatment to the Republic! I'm going to report this incident to the Sith Embassy!
You think you can impress me by spouting a bunch of Jedi garbage? If it wasn't for the Selkath neutrality laws, I'd add your name to the list of Jedi I've killed.
Hey - this street is for Sith only. You got to pay a 20 credit toll to walk down this street.
You talk big - but remember what we did to Taris. Maybe you're next on our list.
Hiding behind the Selkath laws - typical Republic cowardice!
Thanks for the credits, nerf-herder!
Maybe I should just split you open from head to toe! How's that for wrath?
I've seen the wrath of the Sith. I wasn't impressed.
Your words are all sound and fury, signifying nothing.
You better change your attitude, or the Selkath might find your body floating in the ocean!
... And? You want a piece of me, too?
Your laws are nothing to me!
Here are your credits.
I don't have that much.
The Sith and I are exchanging meaningless taunts.
She started it! She's insulting me.
[Force Persuade] This argument was the fault of the Sith. She should be arrested.
[Persuade] I'm sorry, constable. It won't happen again.
What are you going to do?
Your taunts are nothing to me. There is no emotion, there is peace.
You can have your credits when you take them from my cold, dead hand.
This is a public street!
Fine, here's your 20 credits.
Back off, Republic dog! You couldn't hope to compare to a real woman!
Back off, Republic scum! A man like you couldn't hope to satisfy a Sith woman!
You are amazing out on the course... and in person. Congratulations.
I haven't seen a race like that in years. Well, there was Gandroff on Coruscant, but he lacked your... charms.
You sure put Hukta in his place. I don't have to say that you are a much more appealing champion.
It's amazing what you've accomplished here, and you've done it with such style. I've never met a woman like you.
Could I get an autoprint? You've just had the quickest rise to Sector Champion that I've ever seen.
Wow, I bet you could have won on Taris with times like that. It's a shame we'll never know.
Good race, Sector Champion. I guess you'll be off to the big tracks, once the circuit is back up.
Whew, that was an exciting time you turned in. Noboby else had a chance.
I'm putting all my credits on you. You're a sure thing.
Are you sure you're up to challenging the third round time? I mean, you're good, but are you that good?
Some of the other fans didn't think you could reach the second round, but I knew you would all along.
Some of the racers are having a bad time here on Manaan. Seems like you have all the luck right now.
You're up against the second round times now. That's a hard round to beat.
The second round always has experienced riders. You'll be up against some tough times.
I guess you've got what it takes to advance. The odds against you winning are getting better.
You're pretty good. Maybe I should start putting some credits on your races.
Queedle is the local favorite. You should cheer along with us. He needs the encouragement.
We need more rules about overpowered bikes. Hukta just rides over everything. It's boring watching him.
Hukta Jax is insane. He just smashes through everything to the finish. I guess we should expect that from a Gamorrean?
You here to cheer Casandra? She's a fine racer. I hope she knocks Hukta out of the running.
I cheer for Queedle now that he's winning. It would take an amazing racer to win me away.
How about that? Queedle, a local racer, showing those pros how it's done!
A new Champion! And it's Queedle! I knew he could do it with a decent swoop under him.
I don't believe it! Who'd have thought Queedle had it in him?
You sure you're cut out for this league of racing? Maybe the stress of it is getting to you.
You didn't look too good out there on that last run. I guess everyone has their bad days.
No offence, but I could have done better than you on that last race. As a true fan, I know how to do these things right.
Well, I guess the course proved too much for you at this level. Better luck next time.
The crowd really started pulling for you in that last race. Everyone loves a winner, I guess.
Your win was a complete surprise to everyone. I'm sure the crowd thought you would burn out, but you showed them.
You're deadly serious out on the course. Like Hukta Jax, but with talent. You deserve to be champion.
Ha. I've never seen anyone who rides like you. This has been a great tournament.
Racers like you are why I watch the sport. You dominated the whole field. It was... exhilarating.
You handled that race like a pro. I like confident men.
I didn't think you had it in you, but I guess I was wrong. You've really won me over, champion.
Well, you've captured the sector championship. I have to say I've never seen such an... impressive racer.
Nice race. How do you go so fast? Are you sure your swoop is legal?
If you win again, I'll be absolutely amazed. You are moving up so fast.
You're surprising a lot of people. Me included. Nice job out there.
Some of the crowd may turn on you. You're not the underdog anymore.
Not bad at all, but I'll start cheering when you prove you're not just using beginner's luck.
You won't have such an easy run in the second round. We get some experienced riders through here.
You're not bad for a beginner. It's almost like you've competed at this level before.
I sure hope you're staying here. Beating the first round has made you look pretty good to the crowd.
Have you been to the swoop races before? Some of these riders are sure full of themselves.
Sure the swoop circuit is suffering a bit with Taris gone, but we still have some good racers to watch.
You'll have to get in line for the good seats when the races start. There's a lot of people that want to see them.
I was down here last week and I got Casandra Mateil's autoprint. She doesn't do that very often.
Everyone thought Queedle couldn't compete because he was just a local racer, but he's shown them all.
Queedle has really improved out there. He was always my favorite.
I always cheered Queedle before, and I guess it helped! He's beaten everyone!
It's amazing what's been happeing on the track! Queedle has taken the top spot!
You'll have to do better than that if you want to be sector champion.
Your last race was a disappointment. Lose many more and the crowd will turn on you.
I was cheering for you. I hope I didn't jinx your race.
You're only as good as your last race. Remember that.
Don't worry about hurrying through the ranks. With the circuit down, there's not many other places to race right now.
Racing here is pretty well regulated. I hear that other tracks are falling under Hutt control.
Good to see a new racer coming in. I want to see someone give the pros a run for their money.
You'll find that racing here is serious business. Maybe even dangerous sometimes.
I could have been champ. I can't afford the swoop upgrades though.
You'll be the talk of Manaan for a while. Nobody is going to get anywhere near your time.
Are you sure you're not a pro? You sure seem to know what you are doing out there.
Wow, you shot through the ranks here. I'm impressed. I couldn't do that.
This isn't the best track, but it's better than the dustbowl on Tatooine.
You're probably here to see the more established racers. That'll be me someday.
I'm just starting out. Hopefully when the circuit is back up fans like you will start to know my name when I race.
Hey! Come to cheer your favorite swoop-jock? Well, this is the place now that Taris is gone...
Greetings again. Will you be racing today? We're always looking for serious competition for the established riders.
Greetings to you, off-worlder. Are you here as a spectator, or will you be entering the swoop field as a contender?
As you will. Please return if you have business related to the races.
You must be very new to Manaan if you are unfamiliar with the swoop races. Our course is one of the most respected in the sector.
Of course, with the destruction in Taris, we're in a bit of a rebuilding phase. Our Sector Champion was one of the casualties there.
Perhaps you have, but that is not a recognized circuit track. Motta the Hutt is not a respected promotor, no matter what he says.
He has also altered the payment structures set up for the swoop circuit. Of course, most of the governing circuit organization was lost on Taris.
I hesitate to believe that. Sith interference disrupted any holo-feed that might have verified your story. We only know that all on Taris were lost.
You are welcome to prove your skill here, regardless of experience. The course is open to any that have the means to participate.
100 credits must be paid for each officially timed attempt that you make. This amount will be due before each race.
Very well. I will tell our organizers to have the course ready for your return.
Of course, Sector Champion.
The course is laid out in buoys across the ocean surface of Manaan. You race against times set by others, with no other swoops on the track.
Your bike likely has the standard five gears to shift through. As your speed increases, watch the indicators in the lower left to know when to shift.
Shift at the wrong time and your swoop will accelerate poorly or slow down. Shift correctly and you will optimize your perfomance.
You can also steer over "swoop boosters" placed along the route. These will increase your speed substantially for a short time.
There are obstacles that you must watch for. Steering over floating buoys won't damage your bike, but it will slow you down.
Races on the Manaan course are organized in the galactic standard three round system. Each round pays differently.
Certainly. I'm always accomodating to the racers.
Sparce. Taris took a great many good racers with it when it was destroyed. Including our Sector Champion, Sakul Ondondanax.
Currently our biggest attractions are Casandra Mateil and Hukta Dax. They are the only touring professionals present for this tournament.
But, even with such auspicious competition, Queedle is the racer getting the biggest responses. He's a local favorite, and very talented.
The biggest surprise of this tournament has been Queedle. He's gone from underdog to champion in short order. The crowd loves him for it.
The racer getting the biggest crowd response was a local underdog named Queedle, but he has decided to retire. A loss, to be sure.
Round One pays 500 credits. Round Two pays 2000 credits. Round Three is 5000 credits. These are relatively standard values for the sport.
Each round is paid out only once per tournament. The leader that shows dominance in all three is named Sector Champion.
Here on Manaan, Round One is the domain of hobbyists and amateurs. I mean no disrespect by that. They just can't afford the faster swoops yet.
Round Two is populated by the beginner touring racers. They have decided to invest in the sport, and are attempting to make it pay.
Round Three is usually only attainable by seasoned professionals. There have been exceptions, but only rarely.
Tatooine is not recognized, and won't be while Motta insists on refusing to accept galactic standards. When the circuit is reestablished, he will fall in line.
You have already achieved the pinnacle of the sport, and can't earn any more at this time. You'll be notified when more races are scheduled.
Winners of the first round are paid 500 credits. It's enough to cover your expenses, but you'll have to keep racing to really make it pay.
We'll record this for future reference, and wish you well on your attempt to reach Sector Champion.
A second round win is worth 2000 credits to you. Many racers bow out when they reach this level, but I have a feeling you won't.
The next round of races will determine Sector Champion. You'll have to be flawless to achieve that.
You have won a great deal of money. The payment for becoming Sector Champion is 5000 credits!
That will be the last amount offered for now. When we begin a new round of races we will make certain you are notified.
I'm afraid your recent performance hasn't been worthy of payment. Improvement will be needed on your part.
Very well, but before we place your swoop in the starting position, I must collect the 100 credit fee.
[Success] Perhaps you don't need to pay the fee for this race. Yes, I think that is an acception we can make this one time.
I'll warn you, though, I will not be able to offer this option again. My accounts are very closely monitored. Now, let's look at who you will be timed against.
[Failure] I'm sorry, but I can't make that exception in this case.
[Success] I would tend to agree. We already have a number of racers that are struggling. I will drop the fee to 50 credits.
I'm sorry, but that it the bets I can do at the moment. My accounts are closely monitored.
I am sorry, but we cannot make exceptions. We find that racers are more considerate of the course if they have to pay for upkeep.
Very good, off-worlder. Now we must determine what time you will be trying to beat. Let's have a look at the standings.
Queedle is a local favorite, but this won't be much of a race. His swoop simply isn't professional quality. Time to beat, <CUSTOM18>.
Manaan swoop racing fans, we have a race about to commence! Show your respect as the newcomer challenges Queedle for Round One placing!
Casandra Mateil is your opponant for this round. Her time of <CUSTOM19> remains the respectable mark to beat.
Racing fans, your attention! A new challenger will now attempt to unseat Casandra Mateil! Let them hear you!
Hukta Jax is your opponant now. His time of <CUSTOM20> is your mark. I trust you are ready?
Manaan race fans! A new contender now addresses the time of Hukta Jax! A race to end all races! Beginning now!
This will be an exciting race, I think. You are going against Queedle's new time of <CUSTOM21>. He's the solid crowd favorite now.
Attention fans! A new contender will now face the time set by your resident champion Queedle! Excitement is guaranteed!
I'm afraid there are no rounds currently in need of completion. As Sector Champion, you will be notified if further races are to take place.
You can feel free to speak with the track Maintenance Officer to book a practice run, but it won't be officially timed.
There is a small fee for practice runs, but it is significantly less than for official races.
Er... before you do... your next race would be against the leading time set by racer Hukta Jax. He was very insistent that you speak with him first.
Please, try not to anger the Gamorrean. He could prove troublesome, and we don't want the scandal of having to jail professional swoop racers.
He will be in the Racers' Lounge, the room just to the east.
I must first pay you for your win in the previous round of races. We must keep the accounts up to date.
Your persistence is admirable after your last race being such a disappointment. First I must ask that you pay the 100 credits racing fee.
I'm sorry, but I'm sure there are others that will have what you need. My duty is to organize the races, and I pay attention to little else.
Welcome back, Sector Champion. I'm sorry, but no new races have been scheduled yet. You will be notified when they are.
Greetings, Sector Champion. You have proven a spectacular racer, despite the near-lawless taunting of Hukta Jax.
There are no new races sheduled as of yet, but we will be sure to notify you as soon as there are.
We will, of course, pay you for your win. Your racing skills have earned it.
I don't need anything. Never mind.
Tell me about what goes on here.
I'm not interested in this. Goodbye.
I would like to sign on as a racer.
I have raced on Tatooine.
I won the season opener on Taris.
I'll be back later.
Give me the basics on how to race.
Are there any hazards on the course?
I'm owed money for my last race.
I want to talk about the rewards.
Let's go back to my other questions.
Describe the current crop of racers.
What does each round pay?
Tell me what the rounds are.
Tatooine uses tiers instead of rounds. Why the difference?
Go over the system anyway.
I'm ready to race.
[Force Persuade] I don't need to pay the fee.
[Persuade] Lowering the fee would encourage new racers.
I can't pay that amount either.
I'll pay the 50 credits.
I can't pay that much.
I'll pay the 100 credits.
Where is he?
Can you help me with information?
I don't know how much longer I can stay on this world... The Selkath don't make it easy for us off-worlders.
A friend of mine recently got into Pazaak - you know, the card game. Now he can't stop! It's so addictive!
Wow! Hey, you're the sector swoop champ, right? Too bad about the circuit being so small this year, but still!
The whole swoop racing circuit for this sector has been falling apart since the Sith bombed Taris.
Did I tell you I'm a fan? I saw recordings of some of your races and you're great! Maybe when they get the circuit back up we can really see what you can do!
I hear there's going to be a heavy meteor shower in the Coruscant system this year. Last time this sort of thing happened, they lost one of the orbital stations.
I hear the Czerka Corp. got kicked off Kashyyyk by the locals... Good for them! At least someone's getting something back from them.
There's a lot of credits to be made in the Republic in times like these. If we survive of course...
The fighting between the Republic and the Sith is spreading farther. I wonder how long before Manaan becomes a battleground...
I heard there's been some sort of revolt on one of the Sith worlds. Maybe the Republic would actually have a chance... if it weren't for Malak.
I heard the Sith are trying to work on a synthetic version of kolto. I wouldn't be surprised if the Republic was, too.
Manaan may not seem very hospitable, but a surprising amount of trade runs through it because of the kolto trade.
The Selkath have clamped down on kolto exports all of a sudden. No one knows why. If someone did something to offend them, there's going to be trouble I think.
Welcome to the used goods store of Yortal Ixlis. If there is anything I can help you with, all you need to do is ask.
As you wish, human. Should you ever find yourself in need of quality used merchandise I urge you to return to my establishment.
I fear I will be of little help in providing information, human. I spend most of my time here in my shop or out collecting inventory.
And at night, I am too exhausted to do anything but return home and sleep in preparation for the next day.
I will do my best to answer your questions, but I cannot promise to be of much help.
Ah. Yes. That. Well, I was not always in such dire straits. In fact, once I would have been quite well off, but the Sith had other plans.
Well, technically my debt is to the Czerka Corporation, but that amounts to the same thing in the end.
I need money to pay them off, but I cannot find work anywhere the Czerka Corporation has influence. So they put me here, fixing scraps and selling them for little profit.
In time, in years I may be able to repay my debt, but for now I must work. Is there anything else I may help you with?

I was quite a hand at electrical and mechanical devices of all sorts. I traveled the galaxy working for hire among all sorts of beings. But one day I failed in a task for a Czerka Corporation executive and was forced into debt.
Yes, my debt to them is quite large I fear, and it will be no easy task to repay it.

I know of no such thing in Ahto City. This is the only city on Manaan suited to non-Selkath. The oceans are the ancestral home of their people. If there are any ancient ruins of their culture, they would lie there.
I know nothing of this trial, though I find the facts hard to accept. Sunry was a famous hero of the Republic - hardly the type to commit murder.
I would not be surprised to learn the Sith have framed the poor man in an effort to embarrass the Republic. The Sith have no conscience in such matters.
I have no proof that they are, yet it would not surprise me. The Sith are evil to the core.
My own experiences with the Sith have been most unpleasant. They come and mock me, and damage my goods. But I cannot take action against them, or they would surely kill me.
I cannot say. Perhaps the Republic is preparing for a battle with the Sith. They are at war, after all.
And I wish the Republic a quick and total victory. My own life will be much easier once the Sith have been defeated and destroyed.
Of course, human. My stock is all second hand, and some of it has minor damage.
But with the repairs I have done to them, my items are as good as new - for a fraction of the price.
Come in human, please. I need all the customers I can get. Since kolto production dropped the Ahto City authorities have increased my business taxes tenfold to make up the shortfall!
I am loathe to leave this planet, but I fear I cannot long afford to continue business under these circumstances. What is it you need, human?
The Sith fight amongst themselves constantly, even their masters. I heard that happened on Korriban, but none of the Sith are talking about it.
The Sith and their Czerka Corp. dogs have been driven off Kashyyyk I was told. Good riddance I say! If only we could do that here...
Is there anything you need help with?
Welcome, come in. I have heard you are a swoop racer, and swoop racers always have money to spend. My favorite customers.
Whatever you desire, you will find it here at Yortal's secondhand shop. So what can I do for you, friend?
Welcome, human. Please come in. Today is a good day for me. I have heard the Sith will face severe penalties for their plot to corrupt the Selkath youth.
I doubt they will be banned from the planet, but any penalty they suffer brings me joy. So, what can I do for you on this joyous day, human?
Are you here to mock me as the Sith, or do you actually want to buy something?
I suppose I deserve that. But you'd be bitter too, if the Sith kept coming in and making fun of you and your inventory!
Let us forget this unpleasantness and start our meeting over, yes?
Please, forgive me. I had no cause to be so rude to you. The Sith make such trouble for me and business has been slow.
But that is no excuse for my tone. I apologize. Please, let us start off on the right foot.
I think I'll be going now.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
How did you come to run a junkpile... er... used goods shop?
What does that have to do with running a junk shop?
How did you get in debt?
You owe them money?
I'm looking for some ancient ruins, or possibly some type of Star Map.
I'm investigating the Sunry case.
Are the Sith involved in the recent disappearance of the Selkath youth?
Do you know why the Republic is hiring mercenaries?
I have some more questions for you.
I'd like to look at your inventory.
Watch your tone, or you'll be looking for some replacement limbs!
With an attitude like that, it's no wonder you have no customers!
Maybe I'll come back when you're in a better mood.
I'm interested in buying something.
I'm not here to make fun of you. I'm <FullName>.
Hello there. Are you looking to book the swoop course for a practice run? There will be a small positioning fee of 20 credits to have your swoop bike readied.
Very well. Goodbye.
We find that racers are more careful when they are funding the course with each race. Besides, we must defray maintenance costs somehow.

A what? No, never head of it. Now this area is closed on account of the murder, so you're gonna have to leave.
Me? Oh, right. I'm Ignus. This is my hotel.
But since the murder happened I haven't exactly been able to do a lot of business. That's the price of law and order here, I guess.
[Failure] Ha! They sent me a list of people to let in, and they're all Selkath. Somehow, you just don't look like one.
[Failure] I... I... Sorry mate, but it's Selkath authorities only since the murder. You're gonna have to go someplace else to stay.
This old Republic war-hero by the name of Sunry was seeing this Sith woman here - Elassa.
Well, they were seeing each other, but the other night a blaster went off in one of the rooms. Sunry got seen leaving the place and the Sith woman was dead on the floor.
But not everyone thinks this Sunry did it, so the Selkath are holding him in prison while the case gets sorted out. In the meantime they close down my hotel!
But enough about my problems... You can't stay here while the investigation is on. You'll have to find someplace else to stay. Sorry.
You're the one defending Sunry now, eh? Well, the hotel's open for you and I guess I got to answer any questions you want, too.
Well, OK. If you need anything else I'm going to be right here.
There were only two other people in the hotel when it happened. One was a Rodian named Gluupor. Seems like a really dirty, shifty type.
Normally I don't let his kind in here - I'm a reputable business man, you know! - but there weren't many people here, so I decided to take a chance.
The other is a regular named Firith Me. He's a Pazaak player. Probably an addict, but he claims he's big in some circles.
Don't know anything about him other than that.
Anything else you want to know?
Elassa used to rent rooms here every week or so. Then Sunry would come by a couple hours later and stay all night.
It doesn't take a genius to figure out what was going on.
The Sith woman Elassa rented a room in the hotel. An hour or two later Sunry comes in and goes to her room. A couple hours later I hear a blaster shot and see Sunry running.
He can't run good 'cause he's a cripple, but still he was going pretty fast. I would swear he started after the shot though.
What do you want to know?
No, I don't think so. I mean, it's possible, just barely, but I wouldn't say that to the court.

[Failure] No. No way I'm lying to the court just because you want to get your Republic buddy off, or whatever. I have no interest in going to prison!

*hushed* You, Jedi! I hear you are investigating the Sunry murder trial, are you not? Hmm. This case is not at all that it appears to be. Many currents, might I say, flow beneath the surface.
Oh, but I think that you do!
Let us just say that I am an interested party, and that I have, heh heh... concerns.
This murder is much more complicated than it may first appear. Sunry and Elassa are proxies for their governments and both sides want the other to fail.
You can see the journey, heh, by the footprints. You understand, yes?
Hmm, dear dear. I'm saying they both had something to do with it! They've both kept their hands in this from the start!
If you want to get to the bottom of this murder, you might seek information from both the Sith and the Republic, likely in their Embassies.
And I've been seen speaking to you for far too long.
Heed my advice, Jedi, and you may yet find the truths in this murder.
Because you have no one else to trust? Not Sunry, not the witnesses, and certainly not the judges!
And if you take my advice, what have you to lose?
No, of course not! You think state secrets are for sale on the common market?
You would have to be, heh, devious to get what you want.
I don't have time for this!
Why are you telling me this?
What do you mean?

Huh?
Um... I think so... kinda...
I've heard enough of you!
Why should I believe you?
They'd just give it to me?
Greetings, Master Jedi. I hope you have a pleasant stay here on Manaan. If you have any questions or needs, please direct them to our envoy Roland Wann at our Embassy.
I can't believe those Selkath found Sunry guilty. The Sith must have bribed them or something... So much for neutrality!
Good thing Sunry got free! The Sith who tried to pin the murder on him would probably have made him disappear in prison.
The Sith Embassy has gone silent... and they aren't explaining. I hope it was something bad!
Kolto production seems to have dropped off a LOT, recently. The Selkath have been eyeing us funny, too...
Have you managed to retrieve the data from our droid in the Sith base?
Time is a critical factor. We cannot allow the Sith to decode that data recording or our operations on Manaan would be compromised.
Excellent! It does not appear to have been tampered with, so the Sith did not manage to copy its contents yet.
And now for your information... We are not supposed to speak of this, but since you are a Jedi, and we have exhausted all the other options, I think I can entrust you with this.
As you know, the Republic is fighting for its very existence against the evil of the Sith Empire. As you also undoubtedly know, we are doing very poorly.
We need much in the way of supplies and material to stem the tide of battle and bring us victory.
Manaan is the sole source of kolto, the most powerful medical substance in the galaxy. Frankly, we need as much of it as we can get.
The Selkath conservatives with their neutrality treaties seek to treat the Sith and the Republic equally. This includes kolto exports.
But a few more far-sighted Selkath see that if the Sith are ever allowed to win, the galaxy will be plunged into darkness and there would be nothing to stop them from taking Manaan anyway.
So we made a deal...
I know... but to the senators, it seemed to outweigh the risks.
Shhh! Not so loud! Yes, it is a technical violation of the treaty, but it is sanctioned by elements of the Selkath government. We need only keep it hidden from the Sith.
We recently began construction of a secret underground facility to harvest kolto directly at its source. We also hope to one day be able to synthesize it effectively.
Current techniques are insufficient for the task, so we must mine it for now. The amount we take would hardly be noticed, since most is lost naturally before it reaches the surface anyway.
We were nearing completion of the base when the digging teams reported some sort of obstruction... an ancient building or artifact. Possibly your 'Star Map'.
Transmissions from the base were cut off abruptly after that, and we haven't heard from the station since.
Please, just let me explain.
*Sigh* We don't know. We just don't know.
As you may have noticed, we are hiring a lot of mercenaries around here. Ostensibly they're to be shipped off-world to aid in our fight against the Sith, but they are really for another purpose.
When we lost contact with the station in the Hrakert Rift, we sent our contingent of Republic soldiers down to investigate. None returned...
We have tried hiring mercenaries and sending them down as well, but none of those expeditions have returned either.
The reason we really sent that droid underwater - and the reason we needed its data back so badly - was to find out what had happened to the Hrakert Rift station.
But now that we have the data back, our operation is in no danger of exposure to the Sith. And now I must live up to my end of the bargain.
I took the liberty of having a submarine prepared for your departure. Merely use this card to get past the door behind our kolto packing room and enter the sub therein.
It has been programmed to take you down to the station, and also to take you back up should you need something.
I would send soldiers to assist you, but we have lost many of ours, and nearly exhausted the mercenary population of this planet. The soldiers we have are barely enough to keep this base secure!
The Sith have also noted our interest and begun to bribe mercenaries away from us...
Please, find out what happened to the facility. There may be some survivors left down there, perhaps even the head scientist - Kono Nolan.
Good luck in your efforts.
Ah, you're back. Have you decided to assist us and, at the same time, yourself?
There is no need to be so rude.
Very well.
Good. I'm glad that you have come to accept the inevitable. Now we can really get down to work.
There are several leads we have been working on to get into the Sith base. Any of them should work for you, although it might be wise to concentrate your efforts on just one.
The first method that's possible is to help us interrogate a Sith prisoner we managed to catch after he tried to infiltrate our base. He is being held just inside our enclave.
We think he may be able to give us the passcode that the Sith give their informers to enter the base.
He has proved most resilient so far...
We managed to pick up a crate of blank Sith data cards the type they use for passcards.
The encryption system to unlock them is very difficult however, but if you are more skilled than our technicians, you may be able to gain access that way.
The Sith have got the Selkath to give them exclusive use of one of the main hangar bays.
Visiting Sith masters use this bay to land, then take a speeder over the water to an external entrance to the Sith enclave.
The luckless spy we mentioned earlier had a passcard to that hangar on him. While it is surely well guarded, it may prove to be the most direct route. Here is the card.
The Sith base itself is very heavily guarded. If they became aware of your presence, I fear you would be quickly outnumbered and killed.
Here is a passcard to get you inside our facility. You should find all you need to get started in there.
You can choose whichever of the methods you want as long as you get in the base and get the data recording back. Which method do you think you would like to try first?
You'll need luck for that one - odds are they have some pretty strong guards in there. But it's also the way most likely to succeed.
Good choice. We've been working at that for a while, but it's been too difficult so far. Maybe you'll have better luck.
Good call, just make sure you don't push him too hard or we might lose him.
I wish you luck in your task. Should you retrieve the data recording from the droid, return it here to me and we can see about getting you that information.
Good. It is a very intelligent and skilled individual who can crack the matrices of a Sith encryption system.
But there is one last method you should know about in case all other options fail.
Good. It's a logical place to start. But you should also hear about the other options available to you.
When you are ready to explore the Hrakert Rift, enter the Republic base. In the kolto packing room there is a door leading to the Republic submarines.
The sub will have a course to the Hrakert Scientific Research facility charted in. It will take you to the Hrakert Rift.
I wish you luck on your quest. Hopefully a Jedi can succeed where so many others have failed.
Greetings once again. I trust you have been discrete concerning the events at the Hrakert Rift.
Should the Selkath obtain proof of what occured down there the consequences for the Republic would be severe. For both our sakes, I hope you are smart enough to keep silent on this matter.
Truth be told, I am uncomfortable even with us being seen together. The rumors are already plentiful enough among the Selkath about the Republic's role in this.

Don't be foolish! If the Republic's role in this is discovered, I will be sure the blame rests on your shoulders as well. We share a secret - and we will share the consequences if the secret is revealed.
For both our sakes you should move on. Our conversation attracts undue attention.
Welcome to Manaan. I am Roland Wann. As the official representative of the Republic Embassy on this planet, I am here to help all citizens of the Republic should they require aid.
Then I shall wish you good day. On behalf of the Republic, I hope you enjoy your time here on Manaan.
You mean you sliced into our... That is a very serious crime! We could have you executed for treason if that information caused any harm!
But... I may just be willing to overlook this transgression if you NEVER EVER TELL ANOTHER LIVING BEING ABOUT IT.
And that is all I will ever tell you on the matter.
I don't know much about the facts of the case, but I find it hard to believe. I never met Sunry, but he's a hero of the Republic - not a murderer.
The so called evidence against him is an obvious frame up - it has to be! The Sith must have plotted Sunry's downfall to embarass and discredit the Republic!
The Republic? That makes no sense. Sunry has no enemies in the Republic, and his conviction will make all of our jobs more difficult.
Who else? Sunry's conviction will be a blow to Republic-Selkath relations. Who would benefit from this other than the Sith?
If you want to solve this mess, I would focus on the Sith. That, or check out the murder scene at the hotel. Talk to the other guests - maybe they know something.
I regret I could not be of more assistance in your investigation. Is there anything else?
Uh... of course, of course. I will do whatever I can. But I am only a simple diplomatic representative of the Republic. I doubt I can be of any use to the Jedi Council.
An ancient and forgotten race... and you think it may be here on Manaan? Hm...
Well... perhaps. But if you want to get information about that, you'll have to do something for me first.
[Failure] Don't think you can manipulate me, Jedi! The Republic Diplomatic Corps has to deal with the Sith all the time, so we are very resistant to mental influence.
Your only real choice is to help me, so I can help you.
[Failure] No, no. You do what I want and maybe I can help you out. Until then: nothing.

We were using a submersible reconnaissance droid in the ocean surrounding Ahto City and it was... damaged. It took a data recording of the outside of the city before being driven off by the firaxan sharks.
But while it was returning to the surface it encountered difficulties and was disabled. Its automatic systems floated it to the surface, but we could not retrieve it in time.
The Sith were applying subtle pressure to the Selkath authorities for some reason we have not determined, and were able to delay us long enough that they could retrieve the droid before we did.
The droid's data centers are heavily encrypted, so it will take the Sith several days, we believe, to get to its data. It was captured 12 hours ago. It is imperative that we get it back!
It's intelligence information about Sith activities on Manaan, as well as some oceanographic reports on the local marine life.
But you need our information, and I guarantee you that you will never be able to get it unless we have our secrecy guaranteed against the Sith.

It is heavily guarded, we are sure, in the Sith Embassy here on Manaan. Since we have no remaining soldiers to spare, and certainly not our elite ones, we have no one capable of entering the Sith base and retrieving it.
That is what we would ask you to do.
If you want to find information about ancient ruins or your 'Star Map' or whatever it is, I think this is your best choice.
But you will have time to consider your options. And when you come to the only conclusion possible, I will be here to tell you how we can work together.
A beautiful place, Ahto city - a paradise on the water. But remember, within the city itself the Selkath have absolute authority. They are a tough race, but fair.
Obey the Selkath laws, keep the peace and you should encounter no problems. I assume you received a visitor guide to the city when you docked your ship.

Any confrontations between the Sith and Republic are dealt with swiftly and decisively. Is this understood?

But my feelings about the Sith are well known around Ahto City. I shall spare you further outbursts. What may I do for you?
As you wish, human. My inventory contains the finest Aratech equipment you can find on Manaan - all of it far superior to the Czerka Corp swill the Sith are so fond of.
Greetings, human. I welcome you to my store. But if you have come seeking med kits, I must apologize for the price in advance.
The Selkath say the kolto harvest is the lowest it has ever been, and healing salves have become extremely expensive.
I have heard from several customers that you are now the Arbiter during the murder trial of Sunry, the Republic war hero.
I admire you for accepting this position. I have no doubt Sunry has been framed by the Sith. If there is anything I can do to aid your investigation, I will be happy to help.
Welcome, welcome. This is a great time to be alive, as the Czerka Corp. has been driven from one of its outposts.
They lost their "trading" outpost on Kashyyyk - merely a slaver's den I've been told. News of this sort is welcome indeed to me. What can I do for you today?
Come in, come in! You honor my humble store with your presence. All of Manaan has heard tell of your glorious swoop riding exploits.
I carry many other choice items of the highest quality. Items a celebrity of your stature might be interested in.
Have you heard the news? They say the Sith slaughtered a secret Jedi oupost on Dantooine in a vile and cowardly sneak attack.
Yet despite this monstrous act, the Selkath authorities insist on maintaining their neutrality - and the Sith walk amongst us like vermin in the streets of Ahto City!
I think I'll be going now.
Do you know about the Sunry case?
Why do you dislike the Sith so much?
Let me see what you have in stock.
[This door has been permenantly sealed.]
[Republic security clearance is required to enter.]
[A note reads: This room is sealed by order of the Selkath High Court. Only court appointed arbiters may enter.]

Docking Bay
If you have any other questions you should probably see Roland Wann, he's the Republic diplomat here. He's by the Republic enclave near the visitor residences. Have a pleasant stay, Master Jedi.
Yeah, what do you...? Oh, I apologize Master Jedi, I should not have been rude.
Of course. If you have any other questions you should probably see Roland Wann, he's the Republic diplomat here. He's by the Republic enclave near the visitor residences.
If you don't know where that is, go north from here, then south past the port official and the first courtyard, east into the second courtyard, then north then east again. You got that?
Have a pleasant stay, Master Jedi.
Of course, I'm always willing to help a Jedi. What do you require?
A Star Map? Like an ancient artifact or something?
No, sorry, never heard of it.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
Um... It's big. Real big. Actually it's pretty much the only real city on the entire world. The only place for us air-breathers anyway.
Manaan is a water world - which you may have noticed on your way down to land here - inhabited natively by a species of fish-people called the Selkath.
They built this city to cater to us off-worlders and as a base of operations to export kolto, which is the only real thing they have to trade here.
The Selkath think that by staying neutral they can play both sides, selling kolto to everyone that needs it, and making themselves too valuable to be worth conquering.
Well, that, and they threatened to destroy the only natural source of kolto on the planet if anyone tries to attack them.
But I think they're underestimating the lengths the Sith will go to get what they want... They're probably planning something already.
Is there anything else you require?
You're joking... right?
Sorry, but everyone knows what kolto is. The most powerful healing agent in the galaxy. I would've died several times myself if we didn't have this stuff handy.
But the reason it's important here is that kolto is only found naturally on Manaan, and all of our attempts to synthesize it have failed miserably.
So we sit here on the surface, the Selkath harvesting what kolto bubbles up from the bottom of the ocean, and we buy it from them.
Us and the Sith of course. The Selkath don't want to play favorites.
Well, for the kolto, of course. Really that's the only reason anyone would want to be here. It's the only reason the Selkath built Ahto City in the first place: to export kolto.
These damn Sith are everywhere on Manaan, pushing us Republic citizens around, trying to goad us into breaking the law somewhere.
Peacefully? Not hardly. Just look in their eyes. You can see they'd like nothing more than to kill each and every one of us, personal-like.
If you say so, Master Jedi. It's very aggravating. Sometimes I just want to take one of them and... *grrr*
You're... you're joking, right? The smug Hutt-spawn push us every chance they can get and enjoy it.
There's nothing we can do, though. The Selkath want to maintain their neutrality and they enforce it VERY strictly.
So we have to sit here and let the Sith insult us and we can't raise a hand against them otherwise the Republic will face severe kolto export restrictions. That could lose us the war altogether.
The Selkath want to maintain their neutrality in this war we're fighting with the Sith and they enforce it VERY strictly.
No really, I should apologize. I should try to control myself... as you Jedi do.
Is there anything I can help you with?
Never mind, I must go.
I would like to ask a few questions.
Have you seen an ancient Star Map?
Who are the Selkath?
Tell me about Ahto City.
Why haven't they joined the Republic?
The Republic and Sith both stay here?
What is kolto?
Why are there Sith on Manaan?
Why do the Sith upset you so much?
The Sith and the Republic coexisting peacefully? Well... relatively...
It is the work of the dark side.
They mean well, but are misguided.
Yeah, I know the feeling...
Why don't you run them off Manaan?
Breaking the law?
It is alright.
People are saying the Republic did something to cripple the kolto production here on Manaan, but I don't believe it. Sounds more like something the Sith would do.
If you got a problem go talk to our diplomatic representative. Don't bother me with it.
I can't talk now. I have to get this kolto loaded up before my shift is over.
The Selkath have scaled back all kolto harvesting - but nobody is saying why. Good thing we've been stockpiling this stuff for the past year.
Hey - I'm working here! Go talk to the diplomatic rep if you got something to say.
I can't stop to talk to tourists - I'm on kolto packing duty.
You Republics make me sick. It's a good thing there are cameras all over the place on Manaan, or they'd have droids cleaning you up off the walls by now.
You Republic people are so pathetic, sitting around grovelling at the tablescraps the galactic senators deign to give you. It makes me sick.
The senators work for the good of the whole galaxy, not for individual gain!
Ha! Don't make me laugh, you gutless simp! It's the destiny of weak-minded fools like you to be ruled over by the strong, like we Sith!
I'm warning you! Don't push me, or you'll get just what you're asking for!
Try it. Just try it. I'd love to see you throw the first punch. And with all the cameras around the Selkath would be all over you inside of 30 seconds.
You break their laws, you pay the price, Republic scum. But I can see that you're not man enough to back up your words anyway.
If you ever feel like relieving yourself of your worthless existence, feel free to come by our enclave here. We have many, many ways to fulfill your wish.
*grrr*
Stay out of my way. I'm on legitimate Sith business.
Everybody knows the Republic crippled the kolto production. Why don't the Selkath ban them from the planet?
We've got all the proper kolto trading permits, so back off.
I don't have time to listen to your stories - I've got a full shipment of kolto to load before my shift is over.
Kolto's real scarce all of a sudden. From what I hear, the Republic is to blame.

TRANSPORT ONLINE
LOADING FLIGHT DATA...
DESTINATION: SITH BASE
COMMENCE LAUNCH?
RESUMING STANDBY...
COMMENCING LAUNCH...
[Leave.]
[Take the transport to Sith base.]
[Private Sith docking bay. Security clearance required.]
Hey, Stranger! Mysterious Stranger! Wow, look at you... a Jedi! Heh. No wonder I could never beat you. It's me - Duncan. Deadeye Duncan. From the dueling arena on Taris. Remember?
Well, there were a handful of us who made it out. The lucky ones. I survived by breaking into the military base, overpowering a dozen Sith soldiers and stealing one of their own ships.
Oh, right. Okay. Goodbye then. I was just heading off planet anyway. Good to see you again, Stranger.
Well... when the bombing started the Sith sent down a bunch of auto-piloted ships to evacuate soldiers from the planet. I saw one and I figured it was a rescue ship, so I ran up to it.
A Sith patrol was approaching from the other side, getting ready to board. When they saw me they all pulled their blasters. But it takes more than a dozen armed Sith soldiers to slow me down!
Well, to tell the truth I didn't actually take the Sith out. A building fell on them. A chunk of building, actually. From the bombing. Crushed the whole bunch of them. Heh. Very messy.
So there I was, all alone and standing by this empty evacuation ship. I climbed on board, overrode the auto-pilot controls and lifted off into orbit.
The ship had all the Sith launch codes programmed in, so I didn't have to worry about being blasted from the sky. I just played it cool and tried to fly casual.
In the confusion of the bombing, nobody paid any attention to my one little ship slipping away from the fleet. Once I was out of scanner range, I knew I was home free.
I've decided to become a mercenary. I came here looking for work; I heard the Republic was hiring. But they weren't interested in me. I guess I made a mistake by telling them who I was.

They'd heard of me. Seems like everybody's heard of me. The legend of Deadeye Duncan, the worst duelist of all time, has spread far and wide across the galaxy. Makes it hard to earn a living, you know.
I have no idea. All I know is that if I don't find some way to shake my reputation soon I'm going to have to find another line of work. It's too bad... hey, wait a minute!
You're a Jedi now, so you probably won't be doing much dueling anymore, right? So the name Mysterious Stranger probably won't be much use to you anymore, right? So, uh... could I have it?
I mean, if everyone's heard of Deadeye Duncan then they've probably heard of the Mysterious Stranger. But nobody knows anything about you except the name. You could be anybody: man, woman... me.
If I say I'm the Mysterious Stranger, who's going to know? There'll be celebrity tours, maybe some endorsements... I could milk this thing for months. Well, right up until people see me fight.
What do you say? Fame, celebrity: you don't need that. You're a Jedi! But I'm just a guy trying to earn a living. Come one, give me a break.
Okay, okay. Settle down. No need to get violent. We're not in the duel ring right now.
Eh, just forget I ever mentioned it. It was a dumb idea. I'll figure something out on my own.
I probably should be going now, anyway. I'm heading off planet. Maybe I can find work somewhere else. Somewhere they've never heard of Deadeye Duncan. Goodbye, Stranger.
Really? You mean it? Oh, this is great! Heh! No more jokes, no more snickering! When I tell people I'm the Mysterious Stranger they'll finally treat me with respect.
Thanks a lot, Stranger. Oops, heh. I guess I shouldn't call you that now. People will think I'm talking to myself. Ha-ha!
Anyway, I should be going. I'm heading off planet to look for work. Shouldn't be too hard, now that I'm the Taris duel champion! It was good seeing you again... and thanks.
I'm glad to see you made it off of Taris alive... things were pretty bad when the Sith started their bombardment. But I guess getting off the planet would be easy for a Jedi, huh?
How did you escape Taris?
Good, I'm happy for you. Goodbye.
Yeah, right. Why don't you tell me what really happened.
You overpowered a dozen Sith?
Do you expect me to believe this?
So what are you doing here?
Great story. Goodbye.
So what are you going to do now?
Why is the Republic hiring mercenaries?
You'll never pull this off.
You want to tell them you're the champion?
If I ever find out you're impersonating me, I'll slice you open!
No, you can't take my credit.
Okay, the name is yours.
You were pretty easy to slow down inside the dueling ring.
Deadeye Duncan. I remember.

Intruders have entered the complex! All units report to battle stations!
[This door has been permanently sealed.]
If what you say about the Sith is true, prove it! Until then we have no evidence of the crimes you accuse them of!
Greetings, fellow Sith. We may fight alongside one another one day.
The Sith have treated us with respect and honor. You must bring us proof before we will believe the accusations of cruelty you make against them.
There is much yet to learn of our new ways. But when we do... then the old shell-fish will tremble!
We shall give you a chance to prove your claims against the Sith, human.
The Master has promised to teach me great things. I am most eager to learn.
Your death will bring glory to our new Sith Master!
Have you brought us evidence to back up your accusations? Have you found proof the Sith are evil, as you claim?
It is good to see another follower of the teachings of the Sith. We will learn well, and benefit greatly from it.
Intruders! Should we sound the alarm, Shasa?
No - wait. We cannot always be running to the Masters for help. We should handle this on our own.
Perhaps this is a test the Sith have prepared for us?
What are you doing here? Only Masters and Apprentices are allowed in here.
You won't find us to be such easy vitcims! Our Sith Masters have taught us well!
I told you your father would get suspicious, Shasa! He always hated the Sith!
My father doesn't understand - he is blinded by his own prejudice!
The Sith are teaching us mastery of the Force. Our alliance with the Sith will bring strength to Manaan and the Selkath people!
Republic propaganda. The Sith are the victims of lies and half truths! They are not monsters - no more so than the Republic.

The Sith have promised to guide us in the use of the Force, as a sign of their good faith. And once the Republic is defeated, the Sith have promised to withdraw from Manaan and respect our independence.
Ah, I see you are not as foolish as the others I have met. It is good to see that the Jedi Order also realizes the strength of the Sith, and will do what is right when the time comes.
If you encounter my father, tell him I will not return to him. I have cast my lot with the Sith and that is all.
Spare us your lies! The Sith have treated us with nothing but respect and honor!
You speak as if we are prisoners here, but we can leave whenever we wish! Our friend Galas chose to leave, and he was returned safely to his home in Ahto City.
Shasa, what if they speak the truth? Remember what happened at Taris...
Taris is nothing but a Republic lie! If the Sith are such monsters, then prove it to us. Surely there must be some evidence of the horrors they commit!
Shasa - this is the Master's own datapad! Look - they are speaking the truth!
I... I cannot believe it. And yet, the evidence is right before me. The Sith wanted to use us to betray Manaan!
I must apologize for doubting you. The Sith are truly as evil as you have claimed.
We must report this to the Ahto City authorities!
Yes - we must report this at once. We thank you, human, for showing us the truth. You have saved us from a terrible mistake.
Quickly, my friends - we can stay here no longer. We must flee this foul embassy and warn our people against the plot to corrupt the Manaan youth.
Just be careful with those gifts you've already learned. Beware the dark side... or you may end up betraying your world regardless.
You have been saved from more than you know. Given time, the Sith would have turned you fully to the dark side... and you would have betrayed your world gladly.
Shasa - this is the pin I gave Galas when we were children. There is blood on it.
You could have found this anywhere! For all we know, you killed Galas!
[Failure] I don't know if we should believe them, Shasa.
The pin is not enough. I am still not convinced the Sith are the monsters you claim. You must find more definite evidence if we are to believe you.
Use the Force, then. Look into your heart and you will realize what is truth and what is lies.
[Success] Shasa - I believe them. How else would they have found this pin?
I... I didn't want to believe it, but I can no longer deny what I know to be true. Galas is dead, and the Sith are responsible.
So you say. But why should we believe you? We need physical proof, not the words of some Republic sympathizer.
[Failure] Do you think we are weak minded fools? Our Sith Masters have taught us how to resist such simple Jedi mind tricks!
You have no proof of your claims - that is why you must resort to such tactics to make us believe you. The Sith would not try deceive us like this!
[Success] Shasa, I think the Sith are evil. I want to go home.
Yes - the Sith are evil. We must leave and never come back.
I can understand why you're doing this, but surely it can't be that hard to *prove* the evil of the dark side, can it?
Oh-ho! Is this how you win an argument? I would have thought it easier to prove the evil of the dark side than that.
[Failure] I will not give you time to gather lies and false evidence! You are an enemy of the Sith - and now you are an enemy of the Selkath as well!
We shall make our Masters proud by slaying you!
[Persuade] Spoken like a true Sith. They wouldn't wait for proof either, I'm sure.
[Persuade] Wait! If you do not allow us time to prove our claims, you act just like you claim the Sith not to be!
[Success] Shasa, I think we should give them a chance to prove themselves.
We will not report your presence to our Sith Masters yet. If you bring us proof of Sith lies and torture we will return to our families and report this to the Ahto City authorities.
Until then we shall stay here and continue our training in the ways of the Force.
Well, great! It can't be that hard to find proof of the Sith's activities... can it?
Yes... certainly you must have heard of the destruction of Taris. It is your 'honorable' friends that committed that atrocity.
I haven't found the evidence yet.
Selkath, Sith - I'm just here to kill anyone in my way!
I am <FullName>. Shaelas has me investigating the disappearance of young Selkath.
I am <FullName>. What are you Selkath doing inside the Sith embassy?
If you ally with the Sith, then you'll suffer their fate - death!
The Sith are evil! What they told you was a lie.
Good, I knew the Sith would win.
The Sith just want to corrupt you!
If the Republic is defeated, the Sith will enslave your planet!
This datapad proves the Sith are lying to you!
I found a young Selkath dying from torture here. He gave me this...
[Persuade] The Sith tortured him to death, Shasa. You know it's true.
The Sith are evil, Shasa. They will use you to conquer Manaan for the kolto.
The Sith are evil, Shasa. They only want Manaan's kolto.
[Force Persuade] The Sith are evil. You want to leave this place and never return.
[Persuade] Give me some time, and I will find proof the Sith are evil.
You there! I don't recognize you! How did you get in here?
[Failure] You... I don't recognize you! I know the face of every Sith on the planet! We'll get to the bottom of this!
[Failure] Ha! I don't recognize you and I know every Sith on this planet! We'll get to the bottom of this!
Commander Grann, report to the security desk immediately!
Yes? What is it?
You authorized this person to enter?
Yes, they had the proper authorization to enter...
I don't know them... and their identification doesn't match up! They're spies!
What?! Sound the alarm! Droids, destroy them!
Your pass-code is out of date! And I don't recognize you at all! We'll get to the bottom of this soon enough!
Your pass-card is out of date! And I don't recognize you at all! We'll get to the bottom of this soon enough!
[Force Persuade] We are authorized to be here.
[Lie] I don't have to tell you! I have higher authority!
I know the pass code.
I have a passcard.
How did you get in here? Wait - I recognize you!
Lord Malak was most displeased when he learned you had escaped Taris alive! He has promised a great reward to whoever destroys you.
Master, give us the honor of aiding you in destroying this enemy of the Sith.
As you wish, my eager apprentices. We shall remove this thorn from Malak's side once and for all!
Let's bring this on!
See? What did I tell you?
Commentary: It is not possible to destroy the master. It is suggested you run while my blasters warm up, meatbags.
Well, let me guess! You intend to collect this reward, right?

If you're going to go in there, do it quickly! I'll shut the door behind you... but don't expect me to open it again!
Where did you go? How did you get back here without being eaten?
You just got lucky! Or... or it's waiting for me to go back before eating me!
No!!! Whatever's out there will eat me too! Eat all of us!
You can't make me! I won't go!
When the Republic sends a real team down, they'll save me! They'll kill the monster and then we'll all leave safely!
If you're going to go into the rest of the station, don't expect me to help you... the Selkath will rip you all apart!
I don't know... I don't know why! But I'm not going to take my chances out there... It's waiting for me, I know it!
Nonono! It will eat us all up if we go out there! At least I'm safe here behind this door. The Selkath can't get me in here.
How... how did you get in? Did they send another submersible? Quick, we have to get out of here, we have to get away!
No! No! We have no time, we have to leave now! I managed to close the door after they killed everyone else, but I don't know how long it will hold.
The Selkath, they went crazy! They started killing anything that moved. Someone must have triggered the defense systems too, 'cause all the droids activated as well.
I was one of the mercs the Republic sent down here to find out what happened. We came down and secured the first couple rooms... there were bodies everywhere...
And the Selkath came out... screaming and croaking their fishy little war-cries.
They're dead! All dead! They swarmed out and over us. There was no way we could stop them.
So we ran... But hardly any of us made it. I locked the door behind us, bu... but the others had already left in the submersible!
The sharks... the firaxa out there and... worse... I heard an explosion shortly after the submersible left. They didn't make it. Just food for the sharks and the Selkath... like us.
What!? No! You're one of them! You'll never get me!
That doesn't mean its not still out there! Watching.. waiting...
Back to the surface. Yes... NO!! There's something out there... it got the other submersible already.
We can't leave until you do something. Blow up the entire station maybe. That might distract whatever it is long enough for us to escape to the surface.
But all the machinery and stuff is in the southern half, and that's been flooded! There might still be environmental suits around but... but... the Selkath might have laid their eggs in them!
You got a better idea for us getting you out of here, huh?
Suggestion: Perhaps we could dismember the organic? It would make it easier for transport to the surface.
Hey! Y-you... you can't just rip me to pieces! I'll die!!
Beep! Beep! Boop!
Amendment: I did forget that. Stupid, frail, non-compartmentalized organic meatbags!
Then how are we supposed to get you out of here?
No! I locked the door so that the Selkath won't get in. If you open it, we're all done for!
If you go in there, you're dead! You're all dead!
If you want to die, then go! You won't hear me mourning for you! I'll stay here and be safe until some sort of REAL rescue comes!
Don't get your hopes up too high. I have no intention of dying.
They swarmed out and over us. There was no way we could stop them.
I don't know what you're talking about. I've never seen any map, just stinking, reeking death.
We have to! We have to leave! The Selkath, they went crazy! They started killing anything that moved. Someone must have triggered the defense systems too, 'cause all the droids activated as well.
Cause I'm better than you.
Come with us back to the surface.
Fine! Then you'll rot here!
We made it back up.
It will be fine.
We went back to the surface.
I'm <FullName>. Calm yourself down.
What happened here?
What happened to the scientists?
You snivelling worm! You're just food for the Selkath!
I didn't see anything...
Let's get you back to the surface.
Wait here while I go into the station.
I have to get into the station.
I have to get into the station.
You call yourself a mercenary?
Tough. I need it open.
I have no choice.
You fought them?
The Selkath?
I have to find the Star Map.
I am not going anywhere.
Who are you?
Why? What happened?
Is somebody out there? Fishy, fishy, fishy? Coming to eat me, too? You can't get me little fishy. Not in here. I'm safe behind my walls.

Ha-ha! That's what you think! Fishy think that too. These walls and door are six centimeters - no... twelve centimeters! - of durasteel! I'm invulnerable behind my walls! Nobody's getting in here! *crazy, manic laughter*
When the Selkath went insane and started killing everybody, I locked myself in here! I'm safe in here. Nothing can hurt me in here! No fishy food for me.
Bye-bye. Go look for fishy people. They'll chomp and bite and chomp and bite. Food for fishy - that's you.
Nooooooo! You can't harm me in here! I'm invincible!
Aieeeeee!
[Failure] No, no, no, no, no. That's what the others said. Mercenaries like you. But they're dead. The Selkath ate them! Lunchie-munchie!
Only the ones left in the south part of the base might still be alive, where the kolto is. Few fishies there! But many, many fishy in between in the water!
Don't know. Go ask them. Ha-ha-ha!
When the demon screamed it shook every mind in the station. We fell to the ground, but survived. Fishy, fishies, though, they just got hungry!
Oh, you'd like that - wouldn't you? I walk out and - BAM! Selkath swarm in from everywhere, ripping and rending! Fishy move fast and silent.
No, no, no friend. I don't play that game. I've got a winning hand right here in this room - my room! No fishy, fishy for me!
Investigate? You're just like the others - fodder for the Selkath. Walking fish snacks. Chomp, chomp, chomp - if you can run you might be fast food.
Come out from there right now, or we'll blast our way in!
If you don't come out, I'll just leave you in there.
I'll carve you into little fish-bits!
[Insert lightsaber into locker.]
[Force Persuade] You want to come out of that room. You feel safe with us.
[Persuade] Come out - we'll protect you from the Selkath.
What made the Selkath insane?
Why don't you come out here?
I'm <FullName> and I've been sent by the Republic to investigate what's happened here.

Come on - hurry up! ## Don't just stand there, we have to keep moving! The water is filled with... ## Ahhhhhhh....
Don't just stand there, we have to keep moving! The water is filled with...
Ahhhhhhh....
Come on - what's taking you so long? We have to cross the ocean floor to reach the buildings that lead to the kolto harvester.
Besides, it's a lot safer out here. No Selkath looking to make a meal out of us.
If you want to kill me, you'll have to catch me first!

What? No - I didn't survive this long just to get killed by you!
Isn't it obvious - the Selkath have gone insane! They're killing everything that moves!
Oh, I'm a merc the Republic hired a couple days ago to investigate - but all we found was a bunch of insane Selkath killing everything that moves!
All my companions are dead. The Selkath swarmed over us - there were dozens of them! And they...they looked wrong, somehow. Like something had changed inside them. Insane or something...
Oh, I'd have gone back to the surface long ago if this complex hadn't been overrun by all those crazy Selkath! There's no way for me to get to the submarine docking bay.
I discovered a way to get to the bay and seal off the rest of the base. I just have to find the kolto harvester they built on the edge of the Hrakert rift.
It's got an emergency override to open the doors to the submarine docking bay and I could get in from the outside.
I figured my only chance was to slap on an environment suit, head out onto the ocean floor and check that harvester out for myself.
Besides, it's got to be safer out on the ocean floor than back in there with all those crazed Selkath mutants running around looking for dinner.
I'm not spending another minute in this facility - not with those psychotic fish people all over the place!
I'm heading out to the ocean floor right now - it leads to another complex of buildings. Going through them is the only way to reach the kolto harvester.

We should probably stick together, but I won't wait around in here with the Selkath. You can catch up with me if you want - down the hall and through the doors on the right. I'll be waiting on the ocean floor where it's safe.
Psychotic fish just don't try to dodge as much.
They looked wrong? Hmmm... this whole place smells wrong. Like an Urellian urgoth egg gone bad in the hamper.
Doesn't smell so bad to me, old man.
Must be those reliable and finely tuned senses of yours, mercenary.
Changed inside them? Yes... this whole place feels wrong, somehow.
You're not a Selkath - but I think I'm going to kill you anyway!
Who are you?
What's going on down here?
I am <FullName>. The Republic sent us down to investigate.
What are you doing in the underwater section of the facility?
I still need to investigate...
You wait here - I'll go check it out.
Okay, I'll come with you.
