Get lost, tenderfoot. I hunt desert wraid, I don't babysit.
Easy now, I'm not looking for a fight. This is a friendly place to gather. You... you're kidding, right?
This really isn't worth the headache. How about I just leave. Here, take my seat.
Every ship that lands brings a new hotshot. I don't have the time.

I suppose I just need time and experience. I'll get better. That's my challenge.

Perhaps someone else is holding out, but there are simply fewer wraid out there.

Nobody, now that Tanis quit. You had something to do with that, didn't you? Good for you.

Careful if you're doing a bit of hunting now, friend. You get hurt, you'll lose your shirt paying for kolto. Don't know why it's so expensive.
Well, now, did I see you take the big prize in the last round of races on Manaan? What brings you here now?

This world may not have much, but it does have the meanest predators this side of the Galactic Rim. A hunter's paradise.

I suppose there's trouble here, like anywhere else, but you'll have to ask someone else about that. I keep to myself.

You've probably heard about the big prize, the krayt dragon. The most fearsome predator in the system, they are.
If you could find one, and I doubt you will, I'll buy the stones polished in their gizzard, the dragon pearls.
You'd think it'd be easier to find such a gigantic creature. Komad's father took one down, but that was years ago.
If he's not here he's probably out scouting the dunes. He's been to the Eastern Dune sea, but I don't know how you'd get there.
He'd been a hunter for years, using strict traditional methods. Komad is just like him. Maybe he'll show you a thing or two out on the dunes.
You've already taken the big prize. Imagine that, taking down a big bull dragon. It'll be a while before anyone tops that.
Well, that's not up to me, now is it? You'd have to talk with the people down at the Czerka office in the center of town.
You need a license because nobody gets out of the city without one. Czerka Corporation uses it to keep track of people.
They want people to know that if they step outside the gates, they are on their own. Only serious hunters pay the 200 credit fee.
Once you have a license, I'll pay for whatever spoils of the hunt you bring back. I have off-world buyers that take them.
I'll answer what I can, but you've already got yourself a license. You should be out on the dunes.

I've always been driven off, and if I examine the site later, there is nothing left.

Finding their encampment is easy enough. Walk south until you are attacked.
I am Komad Fortuna, a hunter and member of this lodge. It is not the life for everyone, but I am content.

Perhaps they will kill so many wraid that they also kill the hunt. After that, perhaps the solo hunter will still prosper.

Tanis did, but he appears to be no longer with us. Perhaps you already knew this, human? I can't say.
Our hunt proved it. We found a dragon where other hunters should have noticed. It will be the last one seen for a long time.
They are elusive. Perhaps they sensibly avoid the places where their kind have died. I don't know.
I'm just glad we found him him using the old ways. That was a victory.
Save your words, swoop rider. They do not suit you.
You have no place here with me, human. Leave me to my thoughts.
Greetings again, hunter. Your time out on the dunes has brought wear to your face. It is a trait that you and I share.
Probably from worry at getting your hands dirty. I really don't have much to talk to you about. You are not my kin.
It is the weight of decisions made for the good of all. I don't think the others would understand. All they know is that a dragon is dead. I am content to leave it at that.
Yes, what will you pay for me not to kill you?
Perhaps you are right. You are safe... for now.
Pay me or end up dead. It's that simple.
[Force Persuade] They wouldn't get here in time. Pay me.
Just a few questions, if that's all right?
Information, if I could trouble such a worthy hunter for a moment.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
What about the Jawas?
Have you ever seen the Sand People with anything odd?
What kinds of ruins were these? Where were they?
Who are you? What do you do?
I want to ask about you and hunting.
Let's go back to my first questions.
What can you tell me about the other hunters?
Wouldn't the guards have something to say about that?
What about the hunters besides the Gamorreans?
How long have you been at this?
You really don't know anymore?
Where is the best hunting?
So dragons are rare? Are they dangerous?
Who uses battle droids?
Why are such large beasts so hard to find?
Your traditional methods aren't popular?
Don't you interrupt my drinking. Gurke gots more patience. Go bother him.
Ha! Little baby come back to talk? Maybe Gurke can stand your whimpering, but not me. Get lost.
You... you go deal with Gurke, maybe. I don't want any more trouble. Not even a little.
Gurke said no more talking. You got sand in your ears? No more talking.
Hello again. Something else I can do for you? Slow night? Day? Whatever?
Hello again. Tired of the swoop track? What can I do for you?
Well, hello dragon killer! I should have you deal with the wife. You know, because she's scary? Like a dragon? Ah, forget it.
What can I do for you, hmm? Did my wife send you? This ain't about credits, is it?
Whoa, what did you say? You know, I come here because the guards stop your kind of trouble before it starts.
It's more annoying than anything. You shouldn't make threats you don't want returned. Bad move.
Well, actually, they probably are, but I'll save you the trouble of testing it. I'm leaving.
I'm not wasting ammunition on a fight with you. I've wraid to hunt. We meet on the dunes... you watch out.
[Failure] Uh, no I don't and no I don't. What do you think you are, a Jedi? Heh. That's a laugh.
[Success] You seem like a good sort. Here, how about I buy you a few rounds?
Wait... I never do that. Why... why does my head hurt? Something strange is going on here.
I'm leaving. I don't much like newcomers anyway.
Everyone is looking for something, I suppose one of us should get it. Ask away.
I'll answer, but since when do you swoop riders show much interest in anything besides speed?
Oh, of course. Who put you up to this? My wife? I meant what I said about having no credits.
Good hunting.
You hurry back any old time, darling. Anytime.
Who knows the planet? I don't know. I guess the Sand People. I'm usually running when I see them, though.
Smart traders. They've salvaged and sold me my own damaged droids once or twice.
They don't say much I can understand. I think they're a little slow, but who am I to judge, huh? Ha!
Uh, sure, my blood. They almost got me last year. Tore up two of my battle droids. The wife was mad about that. Heh. Took her weeks to fix.
Where they got weapons to cut battle armor, I don't know. They act like animals, but they can surprise you.
I don't know. Pick a dune and walk, they'll get you soon enough.
Well, darling, old Tanis might be just what you need. Unless you mean the dunes. I suppose only the Sand People really know them.
It's serious business. I'm sure I can help you through it.
Ah, the old girl doesn't understand me. Her loss. Now, you have questions about Sand People or something?
He seems pretty forward, period.
Ooh, you're a sour one. Loosen up, we're all friends here.
Perhaps you had best turn your thoughts back to your wife, sir.
I'm sure I can help you. Ask away.
Well, my name is Tanis and what I do is hunt. I'm sure you've heard of me... well, actually, I hope you haven't.
Again? Nothing has changed. It's all just as dirty and tedious as it was before.
Hunting is a dirty and tough business. What can old Tanis tell you about it?
Fine, fine, whatever you want.
Uptight and cold, like my wife. They don't like me streamlining the hunt with droids. I don't fit in, but I don't let it bug me.
The Gamorreans are different. Good rowdy drinking buddies. Gurke and his boys, they understand that hunting is a business.
Of course, they hunt... other things than wraid too. Just don't turn your back on them. Ever.
Nothing, nothing at all. Just keep your eyes on them. That's all.
Dorak is reasonable. Komad is a pain, but he keeps his distance. I can tell he doesn't like me much.
Ask around the lodge if you want information about the other guys. I don't really talk to them much.
But I suppose you would want me to do whatever they say. I heard how you rolled over for Gurke and his boys.
That's not the way to establish yourself, you know? It's hard to earn respect here.
You know how it is, you don't take any backtalk either. I heard about you and Gurke. I should have you deal with my wife.
Ah, she doesn't understand me. You know the drill. It's not my fault; she knew who I was when she married me.
Too long, but it beats smuggling. You ever run into a Sith dreadnaught in the desert? No, you haven't.
Hell, I married her. Ha ha ha! No, no, seriously now, I had this friend that crossed Sith-space and got stripped of everything.
It's not like I have much now, I guess, but I still prefer Sand People to getting ambushed on unproven trade routes.
Ah, she doesn't understand me. You know the drill. It's not my fault; she knew who I was when she married me.
There isn't any. Too many hunters, not enough prey. I can barely keep expenses covered. Maintenance on battle droids is expensive.
Of course, it's better than going alone. What if I stumbled on a bunch of Sand People? These solo hunters are crazy.
What do I care? I need to eat. I also need to pay for parts so the wife can keep the droids running. It's all about the credits.
Some guys will talk about honor and stuff, but they still sell their plates to Fazza. I guess honor needs creds too?
I suppose, but so what? When that resource goes belly-up, I'll just move on. I'm just a wandering spirit, I guess.
I'm not real popular with the others, but they just fool themselves. They're in it for the credits too.
Hmph. Hunting a species to extinction. Now there's a logical way to make a living.
I'm more the practical type, beautiful. I keep myself fed and make sure everything I have is taken care of.
You're the one that took down a dragon! What could I possibly tell you? My battle droids can't even fight that good.
Sure you do. Tanis can tell you all about the thrill of the hunt, man versus beast. It's all very exciting.
What, specifically, would you like me to cover?
Well, the wife doesn't really take much of an interest in my work. Not like you. Now, you have questions?
I'll do my best to make you happy. Ask away.
I don't hunt anymore. I made a deal with you, and I'll stick to it. The others will have to help you.
Besides... without the wife I can't keep my droids going. But I don't need her. You can tell her that. Yeah.
Ooh, candy words from a swoop racer. Well, I just feel all warm inside. Save it for the ladies, what do you want?
Well of course, darling, whatever Tanis Venn can do. You know, very few human females come to Tatooine...
Ask your questions. Please.
Grrrr!

[Force Persuade] Just answer the lady's questions.

I thought it obvious. Should he act like that after mentioning his wife? Greasy little wrench-rat. He asked for it.
I have to thank you again. You really didn't have to save my sorry carcass out there. I appreciate it.
Not that it puts me in debt to you. Because I believe I mentioned how little this job pays.
You know, darling... if there was anything I could do to make it up to you... anything? No, huh?
You can give me credits before I decide to kill you.
Give me credits before I kill you.

Not fast enough to stop me killing you.
[Force Persuade] You like me. You want to give me credits.

I'm looking for experts. You seem knowledgeable.
I have to leave. Goodbye.

Keep your cool, loverboy. Just answer my questions.

Jolee! Leave him alone! I'll talk to him myself!

Jolee! Why did you do that?

Tatooine - Swoop Registration
That was a hard fought run, but still a little slow.
A great effort, but just not enough.
Early mistakes cost some time on that run. That's gotta hurt, folks.
Just squeaked in under the last time. A very good run.
Those mods are paying off. A much better run!
A top-tier run! Excellent time!
This run won't be officially timed, but let's give'em a hand anyway.
A lot of work has been put into this bike, but can the driver make it perform? Timers, get ready!
This driver's had a string of losses. Let's see if they can't get back on track today.
Another driver coming up whose been practicing out in the canyons like most locals.
Another swoop on the line. Get your timers ready.
Looks like we've got another racer up on the line. Let's see how they go.
Ah, it's you again. So, is this about racing or business? One or the other, I've got no time for anything else.
Yes, you'll be wanting to race. I'm sure you'll give the swoop fans a good show.
Looking to make up for your previous disgrace? If you keep losing, I'll have to reconsider letting you on my track.
Very well, but you've already proven your skill on my track. What else do you want?
Oh, no, I'm not talking to you about that anymore. I agree to strange things when you are around, that's for sure.
Nico's got the best deal I've ever given, no lie. Now leave so I can figure out how to still make money off this.

Hehe, nothing to talk about, friend. You made sure that Nico signed the best contract I've ever come up with.

Yeah, you do that. I've got business to work on. Big business!

The track crosses the dunes of Tatooine. You will race against times set by other racers. There will be no other swoops on the track.
Your bike likely has the standard five gears to shift through. As your speed increases, watch the indicators in the lower left to know when to shift.
Shift at the wrong time and your swoop will accelerate poorly or slow down. Shift correctly and you will optimize your perfomance.
You can also steer over "swoop boosters" placed along the route. These will increase your speed substantially for a short time.
There are obstacles that you must watch for. Steering over rocks won't damage your bike, but it will slow you down.
Ah, I set up a quick three-tier system so people know where they stand. I pay for the first time to reach each tier.
Hurry it up, I don't have all day.
There aren't a lot of pro racers *anywhere* with Taris gone. I'm going to try and build up one or two of my own.

Zoriis Bafka is the best of the lot, outside my local champ Nico. Most racers in her league never stop here.
Tier one is 10 racing bonds. Tier two I pay 30 racing bonds. Tier three I give 80 racing bonds. You'll agree the amount is fair.
I pay each level only once. I'm not here to support you. I only pay to encourage constant improvement.
Racing bonds are monetary notes I issue so vendors know who my friends are. Any merchant will buy them.
Each bond is worth 60 credits, give or take. It depends on the merchant.
Tier one here is strictly amateurs. Might get a good race out of them now and then, but they aren't going anywhere.
Reach Tier two and you show promise. You're still fodder for the pros, but you're pretty good.
Tier three... only one of my local guys in that range. Nico. Good chance to go pro... if he knows what's good for him.
Here on Tatooine we do things Motta's way. With Taris gone, there's no circuit governing organization to say I am wrong.

Attention! A second tier race is about to begin! Show your support for this up and comer!

I don't want my racers getting discouraged... and I don't have much interest in signing you. I think you'd be... difficult.

Patience. I still owe you for your last race. Let's settle that debt before we go any further.
I admire that you are so eager to get back out there after your loss. Let's hope you do better. I'll have your bike placed in position.
I make my money off of signing good racers. Good ones, not great ones. I want them young and stupid.

I have some experience.
I raced on Manaan.
I raced on Taris. I won the season opener there.
I'm looking for information. Can you help?
What do you want? Nothing from me, that's for sure. Take a walk.
Hi again. Something I can do for you? I'm just waiting for a crack at the track.
You are crazy-fast, you know that? I saw your races and... well, I'm just amazed. What do you need?
I hear you are moving up. I'll be that good, someday.
Wow, you're pretty good. I mean, I'm just a swoop-kid starting out, but you blew past my time easy.
Hi there. You waiting for a slot on the track? Me too. There's lots of racers coming through here now.
New swoop jocks like me don't get much respect. Just takes practice, I guess.
Uh, I didn't mean anything. I don't want any trouble.
Right... trying to prove that you can push around some kid swoop jock? I don't need this.
I'm not waiting around for you to snap. I'm no fighter. I just race.
Hey! I'm not looking to fight. You want to race when my turn comes around, you pay the fee and go ahead.
Hey, come on. I don't want any trouble. Here, take what little I have. Just don't hurt me.
No need to get like that. I don't have any track time coming up anyway.
Sure, but you signed up, didn't you? If you've got any experience you probably know everything I'd tell you anyway.
Well sure, but I don't know much besides the track. You even interested in the swoop track?
Race hard, watch for rocks.
Anyone but us swoop racers. Really, we can show you the track, but anything else, we've got no clue.
You could check with the Czerka office. They like to think they know everything.
What's so interesting about me that you keep asking? I'm just a kid racer.
Heck, nobody is ever interested in me. I'm the new guy, Garm Totryl. Pleased to meet you.
Sure. I don't think I'll be getting much track time anyway.
You should ask them yourself. I don't feel right speaking for the pros. I'm the new guy to them.
I doubt they'll have much to say to you, either. After that stuff with Nico, seems you're more a promotor than a racer.
You could talk to anyone now, after helping Nico like you did. You've made some friends, for sure.
It's not my place to talk. I'd be nervous even talking about Nico. He's young like me, but he's practically a prodigy.
Everyone thinks he's the next star of the pro circuit... if he signs with a promoter. Motta is really pushing him.
I hear that the deal is pretty bad, but I'd take it in a second. I don't have Nico's skill, though.
Not that long. Just this season. I'm getting better... still too cautious. Good thing I've some pros to learn from.
How they keep their nerves steady, bike maintenance. You know, all of it. I'm not as good as some, but I try.
Ha! You're kidding, right? Every racer here would rather be someplace else, but this is it for most of us.
Taris blowing up has messed up the swoop circuit. People are just looking for somewhere to keep their skills sharp.
It sounds weird, doesn't it? Worrying about racing when all those people died? Nothing we can do.
Motta pays for timekeeping and official records. You can race anywhere, but here, if you do good, it actually matters.
That's why I stick around. No work, no future, but Tatooine at least has this. It's my shot... maybe.
You're running some great races out there. You beat mine, anyway. I'll be that good someday.
You're the best I've seen in a while, though. Maybe even better than Nico. That's pretty impressive.
What makes you think you know anything about me, worm?
Sure, just kidding you. But you be careful...
Maybe I'm tired of your face. Maybe I'll remove it!
How about you pay me to leave you alone.
Yeah, yeah, follow your dreams. Just answer my questions, kid.
I've a few things I wanted to ask. Spare a moment?
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
What makes you say that?
What do you think about that?
How long have you been at this?
What do you want to learn?
Is this the best place for racing?
Why have racers come here?
Go on, leave me alone. I've got stuff to worry about.
You don't know. Don't go thinking you know, because you don't know. I've got problems.
I don't feel like answering. I wouldn't be much help to you anyway. I just race. Don't know about anything else.
You race, right? Know anything about contracts? Ah, I shouldn't get into it. It's my problem.
Deal with that Hutt Motta and you'll understand. Until then, I just don't want to talk about it.
Racer stuff. Nothing you'd understand. Don't mean to be rude, but it's kind of secret.
Ha! Sure! Race your bike out of that explosion? Everyone knows that the whole planet is gone. Nobody got out.
I'm not in the mood for jokes, thanks. I've got things to think about. You wouldn't know anything about it.
Oh, hi. You another racer then? I heard someone new was talking to Motta. Always room for more, I guess.
Nice job beating my times, too. I guess my heart isn't in the racing. Contracts are distracting stuff.
Don't know how much longer I'll be around here, but maybe we'll have time for a few races.
All right. See you around the track.
Sorry. I've been here a few years, but only for the racing. Maybe ask over at Fazza's club. The hunters get around.
Not sure there's much I could tell you. I mean, you have the track record.
Hurry it up, all right? I have things on my mind.
Motta has some basic incentives for good times, which you probably know, but this is just an amateur track.
The pro circuit is where the real credits are, but even that is hurting. I guess a lot of riders were on Taris.
If there's anything around, it'll be at the Czerka store in their office in the center of town. Stock is scarce on this rock.
Just a few years. I used to run down in the canyons, but nobody sees you down there. I wanted crowds.
I've been told I am. I might go pro. I'm looking at some contracts but... that's between me and Motta.
You have to step up and do it to know anything about it. You'll understand once you post some fast times.
Did you? I'm not sure that it's any of your business. Top racers keep to their own. I don't know you.
Maybe if you were better on the track I might feel like talking about it. Someone who can turn out the fast times might understand.
I suppose you've got a right to know track business, what with the times you've been posting.
It's not that I'm not grateful. I mean, it would get me into the pros. I don't have the credits to get in on my own.
Not that I care about credits. I just want to race... but the deal with Motta is pretty bad. He'll get most of what I win.
You've posted some good times... he might listen to you. I would. I respect you as a racer.
But... I kind of doubt he'd give me a better deal. He doesn't have to. He is putting up most of the money.
I doubt there's much you could say. It's not your business anyway. Top racers take care of their own.
Thanks anyway, but I'll think it through myself.
It doesn't matter what you think. You don't really know anything about it. Only a top racer would.
No offense, but you aren't on the boards compared to me. Post some stunners, then we'll talk.
Don't threaten me. Every racer here will step up to stop you. You aren't one of us. We take care of our own.
Heh, maybe Motta isn't so sure of himself if he has threaten me. Are we done now? I've thinking to do.
[Failure] Uh, no. Not until I've given it some thought. What, did you think I would just cave in?
Now, if you don't mind, I think we're done for now.
[Success] I... I'll sign the contract. Yeah, I guess that's best. I mean, the deal can't be all bad, right?
I mean, you'd know, right? And all I want is to race. Who cares about the credits... who cares.
Thanks for... making things clear. If you don't mind, I think we're done. Goodbye.
That promoter's going to bleed that poor kid dry... but I guess he's got to learn the only way to get by in this life is to look out for yourself!
Do you now? You might know a good deal, I guess. You sure know your way around the track.
What? You're threatening me? I suppose I do need a kick in the tail to make up my mind. Maybe... it's for the best...
You should not force someone to do what they don't want.
How is this different than slavery? You push the boy against his will.
Tsk tsk. Not even willing to expend a bit of effort in actual persuasion, hey? Well, you do what you like.
Forcing the boy to sign his life away? Is that really necessary?
[Failure] I'm still not liking the sound of it. I just don't know.
[Success] I suppose I do. Not much chance I'll get off this rock on my own, now is there?
You did? I don't believe it. I mean, I do, but I sure wasn't expecting it. I appreciate it. I really do.
Now I can take my bike to the big races. There's not much of a circuit right now, but I'll be ready when it recovers.
Thanks again. I meant it.
Hard to tell. I'll get some more runs here first. I need the practice. I have to top *your* time.
I'm impressed, helping a kid like Nico off to a decent start. Good job.
You again? I don't really feel like talking right now.
I have to thank you, you know? I don't know how you did it. I really don't.
Leave me alone, will you. I've got things on my mind.
Poor baby. Make me care.
I just have some questions.
Anything I could help you with? What's bugging you?
I raced on Taris.
Goodbye.
Do you know much about Tatooine?
I wanted to ask some questions about racing.
Back to my other questions now.
What does racing pay?
Where is the best place to get bike upgrades around here?
How long have you been racing?
Are you any good?
I talked to Motta about you.
Why don't you want the deal with Motta?
Maybe I can talk to him about it.
I think you should sign the contract he offered.
I'll get back to you. Goodbye.
You'll sign or get hurt! Understand?
[Force Persuade] You will sign the contract with Motta.
It's simple: sign, or you'll die on this rock. Maybe soon. Understand?
[Force Persuade] You will sign the contract with Motta.
[Persuade] It's the best deal you'll get. You know it.
Trust me, a fellow racer. Consider it.
I convinced Motta to give you a better contract.
Goodbye then. Good luck.
When do you think you'll be leaving?
Sorry, the track is only for racers that Motta has accepted and signed up. He pays for track upkeep, so it's his choice.
Go talk to him and we'll see about setting you up.
Well, another swoop-jock come to give the track a try? It's just a 20 credit timing fee for recreational runs.
All right. Anyone else want to step up?
Well, Motta pays for timing on official runs, but rec-runs are staffed by volunteers. They deserve a little something.
Besides, paying for runs keeps usage down. That way we don't crowd the pros off the track.
Very good. We'll have your bike put in position for the next time trial. Get ready, it won't take long.
You'll have to go through Motta for that. He keeps track of all official standings at this track.
There's money in it too. He pays riders for good times to encourage competition.
Want to take an unofficial run around the track? You've beat everyone, I know, but it's good to keep your skills sharp. 20 credits.
No thanks. Goodbye.
Why is there a fee?
I'll pay for a recreational run.
I'd like to try an officially timed race.
I'm surprised to see a new racer. How do you keep your bike running? Parts are scarce around here.
It's sad... one of our racers was on Taris. Ever race there? Probably not, I'd have heard of you.
Did I see your bike getting prepped? Not many new ones like that come through here.
I saw some footage of Taris before the Sith destroyed it... I swear I saw you... couldn't be.
You are too good for Tatooine, you know that? The best I've ever seen.
What are you doing here when you can race like that? If the circuit were up, you'd be a star!
That was some good racing. Best time of the season, I think.
That was some impressive racing. Good to see you and Zoriis put the boys to shame
You sure do look good out there on the track, champion. You look pretty good here too.
I like a man that can move fast when he needs to. Maybe I could trouble you for an autoprint... or something.
I like having a champion around, but you're probably destined for the circuit, once it's back up and running.
I have to say, you are looking very impressive to me right now. I hope you stick around.
You've beaten all the local talents. Only Zoriis is left, and she's a pro. Well, Nico too.
Yuka Rill won't recover from the loss you handed him anytime soon. That Ithorian's a sore loser.
It's amazing the way you are shooting up the ranks. I haven't seen racing like that since Nico started getting good.
I bet Motta's going to start looking at you as a potential champ. Your times just keep getting better.
So, was your win beginners luck? Most of the amateurs get stuck at about this level.
Yuka Rill isn't going to like you. He doesn't do well against new competition, and you're up against his time next.
Too bad about Garm's time being beat, but he's just starting out. You're looking like you've been at this a while.
You are quite the racer. Too bad there isn't much of a circuit anymore.
I guess you're not quite up to taking the big prize. It's a shame.
Your loss wasn't the worst I've seen. I saw Yuka's big crash on Taris two years ago.
I guess the pressure got to you out there. It's not the first time a racer lost their edge.
That's really too bad about your last race. You should have won it for sure.
I Don't know how the riders do it. I get sick at speeds like that.
Not a lot of women on the swoop circuit. Not that there's much of a circuit left.
Nico is the big favorite around here.
I love watching the races. Nothing much else to do.
You a racer? Don't sign with Motta. That's all I'm saying.
It's crass to say, but the destruction of Taris means more racers coming here. Like you, I bet.
Once you've raced a bit you'll learn that this track isn't the greatest, but it gets the job done.
We get some decent speed on the desert. No need for expensive mods. It's good for new racers like you.
I've never seen a woman come into town and take charge like you did out there. You are scary. Wonderfully scary.
Lady, you are the best. I just had to say that.
You're beautiful out there, absolutely beautiful. And a pro racer as well!
That last race was incredible. You just keep looking better and better out there... and here as well.
I'm going to watch for you in the future. Your races are... just amazing.
That last race of yours was the most exciting thing to blow through Tatooine... ever.
If the circuit were up you'd be famous one three... no! Four worlds by now. You're just that good!
You are an absolute terror on the track! Are you sure you're not a pro already?
You're almost good enough to go pro, you know? I'll be cheering for you in the next race.
I'm looking forward to seeing you go against Zoriis Bafka's time. She's been a pro for years.
Yuka Rill will be crying for days... or whatever it is Ithorians do. You beat his time into the ground!
Motta wants Tatooine to be the new Taris for races. A few more newcomers with your skills and he might do it.
If you're such a good racer, why are you here? Maybe you've done as good as you're going to.
That was a pretty good showing out there. Maybe you're not just another sand-skimming nerf herder.
Taris was a good track, but their racers were uptight. You win, and you look like you enjoy yourself.
Watch your bike around here. You're doing all right, and the last thing you want is it to get stripped for parts.
You didn't look so good out there on that last race. Desert sun getting to you?
Not the worst I've seen, but you'll have to do better if you want to make the circuit.
You're losing fans every race you lose. You'd better tighten up out there.
I suppose I've seen racers do worse than you did, but you'd better show your skills on the next run.
It's too bad about Taris. The destruction there has really hurt the swoop circuit.
Got a favorite racer? Nico's good, but Garm's a real pro.
Every now and then we push a new obstacle on the course to keep it fresh. Good luck out there.
Gotta like the races. There's nothing else, so you'd better.
We don't see a lot of new racers. Maybe you'll give Nico a run for his money.
Motta thinks pros will start coming here now that Taris is gone. I think the Hutt is dreaming.
Odd to see new racers like you here. This track was never too popular with the pros. Too far out of the way.
Oh, you're gonna like it here. Crowd is friendly, even if it doesn't really compare to racing for the big circuit.
I, wrecked my bike in a race a few days ago. Not that I could beat your times anyway.
Now that you've proven how good you are, stay away from Motta. Just ask around, you'll see why.
You're a pro, right? You ever race on Taris? Wish I had the chance before it blew.
You didn't have much competition here. The circuit is hurting after the loss of Taris.
I was due to race on Taris, but I blew a qualifying race. Guess I'm lucky, huh?
I'm not good enough to be ranked yet. More trial runs, I guess.
I'm not racing until my parts come in. Who knows when that will be?
The track here isn't the greatest, but we have to practice somewhere.
You again? Why don't you go bother someone else. It's not like I owe you money or something.
You again? Come to rub my face in your times? You are practically stealing my paycheck every race you run.
Oh, it's you. You buried my best time on the track. What, are you *trying* to take money out of my pocket?
You new racers only want two things from old pros: money and advice. My advice? Leave me alone.
What do you want? You here for money? I'll pay the Hutt what I owe as soon as the circuit is back on its feet.
No, wait, you don't look like a collector. You're just some kid. Go on, I don't have time for you.
You don't look like anyone I owe. Stop fooling with me.
Go on, I've seen your type before. Go push the kids around. They don't put up much of a fight.
I'm not waiting for you to lose your temper around me. It's not worth it.
Wait, I don't want a fight. All right, if you want some money, I'll give it to you. I don't need you in my face like this.
[Success] I know I need to pay you. It's obvious my old loans have caught up to me. I knew it would happen.
[Failure] What do you take me for, an idiot? I'm not handing money to just anyone.
[Success] I should have known those loans would catch up to me. Never get your bike fixed in Hutt Space.
Here, this is everything I have. Now just leave me to figure out how I'm going to pay for track time.
I can hope, anyway. Just get it over with.
Why can't you new racers just go learn the track for yourselves? Why would I want to help you beat my times?
If I say no you'll probably hound me to death. Fine, what do you want?
Yeah, good riddance.
I don't know. Go ask some locals. I want to know as little about this dustbowl as possible.
You've heard all I have. If I had more, I'd use it to win, not tell you.
There's not much useful you'll get out of me. Yuka Rill is on the way down. I can't match the young riders.
I suppose. Make it quick.
Bunch of babies, all of them. Well, except for Zoriis. She's got the goods like I never had. Good for her, I guess.
But what do you care about this? I heard how you roped Nico into his new deal. He'll be just like me real soon.
And that Nico is going places, thanks to you. Wish I had someone like you at my back years ago.
If I have to say something good about the new racers, it would be about that Nico kid. He's got a future.
He doesn't fear the track. You get old, you start to worry about failing. He just lets it all come to him.
Some promoter will use him up, and he'll end up in debt like me. It's already happening, I bet.
Too many years. I've raced on almost every track and all I've got to show for it is an aging bike.
I've got a few trophies stashed, but they don't pay the bills. Yep, I should have quit after the Coruscant Classic.
I'd better hope so. It's the last stop for me. If I can't get some decent times going, I may as well not leave.
I wish I could use the destruction of Taris as an excuse, but I doubt I would have ever made it back there.
Old guys like me can't make it on the good tracks, and the new racers come here to try and knock us down even further.
I'm still trying to have one last good run... but it just isn't happening.
I've got nothing but time now that you've pushed me back to the slow times. Make it quick.
Wait, no, I recognize you. You're some new racer. Get lost. I don't need more of you on my tail.
Wait, I know you. You slaughtered my second tier time out on the track. It's like you're trying to steal from me.
I've got enough trouble without dealing with you. Leave me alone.
Maybe you were right. Maybe I want money.
Never mind. I didn't mean anything by it.
Show some respect! I could kill you where you stand!
[Force Persuade] You know you need to pay me.
[Persuade/Lie] There's a bounty on you, and I mean to collect it.
Just answer my questions and I'll leave you alone.
I've a few things I wanted to ask. Spare a moment?
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
What makes you say that?
What do you think about that?
How long have you been at this?
No good memories? That seems a waste.
Is this the best place for racing?
Why have racers come here?
I have nothing more to say to you. There is no point in continuing this.
Hello again. Have you had a chance to look more closely at our sport?
The track is yours today, I see. Well done beating my time. The sport needs people that give the crowd a spectacle.
You have certainly shown your skill on the track. I imagine you'll be taking aim at my times next.
Well, I am impressed with your efforts on the track. You show the promise of a gifted beginner.
Yes? Is there something you wish? I have a moment or two while others post their times.
Is this a racing matter? Perhaps you are interested in taking up the sport?
All right. Merely making conversation. I'm not looking for a fight.
The humor of this is lost on me. The mood on this planet is harsh enough without your games.
Now, if we are through, I must get back to my race preparations. I prefer to leave your unpleasantness behind.
Wait! Look, if I've offended some local custom or something, I apologize. I don't want a fight. Here, take this.
Is that all? Then take what I have. Yes, I'm just giving it to you. I can afford to turn this mugging into simple beggary.
All right, I will be as brief as possible. Ask away.
I always have time for a fellow swoop racer. Go ahead.
I'm not so preoccupied with the track that I can't spare a few minutes. Go ahead.
Racer's luck be with you.
I must confess that I haven't had much time to learn about this planet. Talk of Taris has seemed more important.
Some of the hunters in Fazza's lodge seem like they would know more than I would, but that wouldn't take much.
I am not used to such attention. What do you want me to repeat?
My name is Zoriis Bafka. I suppose I am one of the more experienced racers here. What do you want me to answer?
If you wish. I don't mind answering.
There are some promising newcomers here. Garm tries hard and I wish him well, but Nico is the one to watch.
But you know about him. He will be a champion, but with his deal he won't see many of the benefits of it.
Are you denying your role in his choice? I think it was fairly explicit that you pushed him into the deal.
But, I suppose it was his choice, even with your... vigorous encouragement.
But you already know about him. The favor you have done for him will help him greatly in years to come.
It's invigorating to watch him discover his skills. I hope he manages to remember why he took up the sport.
The race is not just about speed. It is a business, and we are the product. He must market himself carefully.
It is a necessary side to the sport. We must make someone money, or there would be no circuit.
A few years, but I raced under a different name when I was young. My early career was not very spectacular.
It wasn't that big of a deal. I made the jump from one league to another and wanted to shed some baggage.
Don't waste much thought on it. It was purely a personal matter that has no bearing today.
Perhaps not, but it will do for now. Professional racers like myself travel wherever the purses are highest.
It's no secret that one of the most popular tracks was lost with Taris. Other promoters will need time to organize.
In the meantime, we will race at the smaller venues. This is almost a recreational stop for me.
You lose the skills if you don't use them. I could race on any open road, but competition gives the push to get better.
Besides, if my presence lends a little prestige to the track, maybe we'll get some new racers out of it.
I'm sure you will be racing again soon yourself. You have shown that you have the necessary skills.
Your petty hobbies are of no interest to me.
Of course not. I meant no harm.
I think you've found one anyway!
I don't want a fight either. I just want money.
I just have some questions. Don't bother getting friendly.
I wanted to ask a few questions, if you have the time.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
What can you tell me about the other racers?
He should have been smarter.
What makes you say that?
What do you think about that?
How long have you been at this?
Why did you change your racing name?
Is this the best place for racing?
If this track is so small, why bother?

Tatooine - Cantina
Yes, I'm sorry, do I know you?
I am here, Mother. Or don't you recognize me?
What do you expect, when I haven't so much as had a picture of you since you left? Do you know how long I've been trying to find you?
You knew as well as I communication would be impossible once I joined the order. Now what is this about? Where is Father?
Then you haven't heard. I should have known.
Has something happened to him? Are you going to tell me or not?
Your Father is dead, Bastila. That is part of the reason why I was looking for you.
Dead? What happened? What did you do to him?!
Isn't this a lovely reunion? Already she is flinging insults at me. Tell me... you're one of her friends. Do you treat your mother this way?
I see Bastila seeks out friends that are as selfish as she is. This is how you treat a dying woman?
I'm sure Bastila feels the same way you do. She would prefer to be left out of it, at least until I'm as dead as her father is.
Is that so? Well, I'll be joining her soon enough, I suppose.
I was told you were sick. Are you actually dying, or is this merely melodrama for my benefit?
Such sweet things you say. *sigh* Perhaps I should tell you everything, first, before we start arguing again.
You could start by telling me what you got Father into that killed him.
I hadn't realized Jedi were so spiteful. You want me to tell you I brought your father here for an expedition, do you? You want to blame me for his death?
You never accepted that your father loved going on his treasure hunts, leaving you alone with me. I was always to blame for everything, what else is new?
So yes, fine. I brought your father here to look for krayt dragon pearls. He took an expedition into the Tatooine desert and he died.
How can you be sure of that? Father is an experienced --
Do you think I would look for you if I wasn't sure? They were attacked by a krayt dragon and one of the guides fled the battle. He saw your father killed.
I... see. So what do you want from me? Credits?
Don't be insulting. I want you to use those senses of yours. I want you to find him. I want you to bring back his holocron.
Why? So you can sell it?
Is it too much to ask that I have something to remember your father by? Of course it is, isn't it? You couldn't be bothered.
We're very busy on a mission from the Jedi Council. I doubt I'll have the time. Ask my companions if you doubt me.
It doesn't seem to have anything to do with what she's asking. Are you actually sick, Mother?
What difference does it make to you? None, I'm sure. Just find your father's holocron and you won't have to worry about me again either way.
That's the kind of response I would expect. Very well. We'll look for the holocron if we have time. I can't promise any more than that.
I believe your father was headed north towards the Sand People enclave. I would check along that route, dear. Do please hurry.
What remains would there be? Krayt dragons are huge predators, easily able to devour a human, and the desert is a harsh environment.
Finding my father's remains would be an even more impossible task than finding his holocron. An ignoble end to a fine man.
As my daughter is quick to point out, I haven't the coin to hire another expedition. Nor am I the adventurer my husband was.
Yes? I'm sorry, do I know you?
Good. I thought you were perhaps one of those collectors from the Exchange. Since you're not, I doubt we have any business. Good day.
I'm sure there are plenty of other strangers about for you to harass with questions. Why don't you select one of them?
Thank you. I would rather be alone.
You know my daughter? Where is she?
Is that so? Has she said this, herself? Tell her it is quite urgent that I speak with her at once. She has been most difficult to find.
See that you do. If Bastila is here, I can't see why she didn't come herself.
I don't see why Bastila should be telling anything to a stranger about family business. Simply tell her to come and that should be enough.
I most certainly will not. What I have to say is for Bastila alone. It is... family business. That should be enough for her to come.
Back already? Have you even looked for the holocron, yet?
I don't have the holocron, if that's what you're asking.
Then what are you waiting for? Go, find it!
I have the holocron, Mother. I'm just not sure I want to give it to you.
And why not? Would you deny me even that?
I've never denied you anything, Mother. You may think I don't remember what it was like before I left for the order, but I do.
You were the one who pushed Father to go on one treasure hunt after the other. You loved living in wealth. You think I don't remember the fights?
You were eager to send me to the Jedi, even though I didn't want to go. You took Father away from me, and now this holocron is all I have of him.
Fool girl! You have a strange way of remembering things. That wasn't --
No. I don't wish to argue with you any more, Mother. It's time we parted ways, now, for both our benefit.
So that's the way it is, is it? All that Jedi training and you haven't learned a thing.
On the contrary, I've learned much. I've learned, for instance, when it is best to walk away from a situation that can lead only to conflict.
How can you learn anything when you hear only what you want to hear? Well, go on, then. Keep the holocron. It was for you, anyhow.
I'll just go off and die peacefully and you needn't bother with me anymore. That's obviously what's best.
Farewell, Mother. May the Force be with you.
Hmph. It may as well be with one of us.
I... perhaps not. I can remember my father well enough. But I ask you: why should she have it?
You don't know her. My mother is notoriously deceptive when she wants something. Why should she have the holocron?
Is it too difficult to believe that I am a dying woman who simply wishes to see her husband one last time?
I find it difficult to believe anything you say, Mother.
*Sigh* You're right. It shames me, but I just... I find it difficult to... let go of the past. I'm... sorry, Mother.
I was hard on you, dear. I wasn't a very good mother to you, I know that.
Your father loved you so. He wanted you to be just like him... he wanted to take you on his hunts, but I said they were too dangerous.
I always tried to keep him from the dangerous ones, but he would have none of it. It was a reckless life we led, always moving... I didn't want that for you.
So that's why you gave me to the Order?
What do your father and I have to show for all those years of hunting? Nothing. That was no life for anyone, especially not someone as gifted as you.
Your father... he spent all his last years trying to pay for my treatments. That's why he went for the pearls. I begged him not to, but...
Your treatments.
I'm dying, Bastila. I did not lie about that. It's been a long time in the coming, and there's really nothing that can be done anymore.
I told your father to let me go, but you know how he was. Stubborn. Like you.
I'm so sorry, Mother. I don't know what to say...
Keep the holocron, Bastila. It would do me good to know you have it. This... talking to you... this is what I really needed before I...
I know, Mother. Thank you. I'm glad we talked, too.
Well, now. You said you had important business, and you were never one to mince words. You there... you take care of my daughter, you hear me?
So you're not. I'd feel better knowing that someone was there to watch over her, however. I wasn't.
You make her let you. She's too much like her father in that respect.
So could her father. That doesn't mean she doesn't need help now and again.
That's good. I'll feel a lot better knowing there's someone to watch her.
Where are you going to go?
*sigh* Alright, I will. Now you do what you have to, Bastila. You go make your father and I proud.
I'll try. Farewell, Mother.
You're back, I see. And Bastila isn't even with you.
I suppose she's too busy to even help her own mother, correct? Nothing more than I would expect from her after all this time.
Go on, leave me be. I will find the holocron myself, if I have to.
Only if she deserved it.
Hey, leave me out of this.
My mother is long dead, if you must know.
What about your mother's sickness?
Don't you want to find your father's remains, Bastila?
Why don't you get the holocron yourself, Miss... er... Helena?
No, I don't think so.
Could I ask you some questions?
I have to go.
Are you Bastila's mother?
Nearby. I'm not sure she wants to meet with you.
I'll tell her when I see her.
She said that you two don't get along.
Tell me what you want and I'll relay it to her.
You're right. Let's go.
Do you really need the holocron, Bastila?
Maybe you should listen to what she has to say.
I agree. We should go before this gets ugly.
Maybe one of you should be the first to give the other a break?
It sounds like you've already made up your mind.
Hmph. I'm not her keeper.
As if she'd let me!
Bastila can take care of herself.
I'll do my best.
Hello again. Could I tempt you into a game? There's very little else to do that won't potentially leave you dead.
Hello again. Would you like to have another round of Pazaak? I'd like to try and win back my money.
I mean, I don't want to say that it was beginner's luck, but you should play again to truly get a feel for the game.
It's only fair, after all. You have won against me twice, but I still think I can teach you a thing or two.
Ah, it's you again. Truly, you are a fine opponent. I'd be honored to play you again.
However, you'll understand if we don't have any wagers. I... respect your ability too much to insult you by betting on you losing.
Stop by anytime. I'd like to visit my money.
Something else? I don't think I know about much else. Pazaak is all that I do, right now. I'm sorry.
Ask around, I'm sure there are many better sources of information than me.
Very good. Just for the sport of it. That's all I can afford.
Ahh, you are back. I hope I didn't scare you off with that loss. Hard blow, but that's the nature of the cards.
I don't want to sour you on the game. Perhaps another small wager game?
I don't want to say that your single win was a fluke. Perhaps you would like to play again?
Ah, you did have two promising wins. Would you care to try and take your money back?
Well, a fresh face for the game. I wonder, would you care to play? My name is Furko Nellis. My vice is Pazaak.
All right, but remember that there isn't much fun on Tatooine that isn't life threatening. Come back if you'd like a game.
Ah, I'm sure you do, but I won't have answers. I leave other people to their business, and they leave me to mine.
Really, you'll have to seek information elsewhere, but if you want some recreation, I've cards ready to play.
Must I? An opinion would draw attention to myself. The Sith have shown what happens to things that draw their attention.
Ha ha! Very good! Would you... care to wager on a game?
Of course, it is always good to keep them fresh in your mind. I'd be glad to go over the delicacies of the game with you.
But, I think you would benefit more from having a copy of your own to study when you wish. Here is a handy page you can slot right into your personal journal. There you go.
No? That's unfortunate. I happen to have one that I could sell you, but it's a little basic. Certainly not tournament worthy.
Here, how about you give me... 100 credits. A fine deal. Not many stores sell... equipment of this nature.
[Success] You know what... I don't want to charge you for it. I want new players to take up the game.
[Failure] I'm afraid I really can't do that. The cards have their value. I can't change it.
[Success] Hmm... perhaps you are right. I want new people to get a good start on the game. I need opponents.
Besides, it is a very basic deck. All right, it's yours. Now, care to have a game or two?
Very good, I'll just take that, and here you are. Now you should practice. Care to play?
Well, since you have never beaten me, we'll make this for a paltry 50 credits. No bargaining now. This is serious.
To be fair, I'll use my practice deck as well. I don't want to scare you off, you understand.
That is unfortunate. Please, feel free to return when you can. I'm sorry, but I prefer the thrill of the payoff.
Ha ha! Very good. Now, don't worry if I beat you too harshly. It is a learning experience.
Hmm... you have some rudimentary skills. I think I'll use my second best deck this time and up the stakes.
200 credits will be the wager. I trust you will have the money on hand?
You won't be so eager in a moment. I promise you.
Well... you have proven quite the opponent, but I think the time has come to end this. You will not win again.
I usually only use this deck at tournaments, but I think you're worthy of it. Shall we say... 500 credits on the outcome?
Yes... well then, 500 credits on the line. Heh... here we go.
Right. Goodbye.
I want to ask you about something else.
All right, let's have a game.
I'll be going now.
I want to ask you some questions.
You must have an opinion about what happened on Taris.
Okay, let's talk Pazaak.
Brief me on the rules.
I don't have a Pazaak deck.
I can't pay that right now. Maybe later.
[Force Persuade] You don't want to charge me for it.
[Persuade] Come now, you'll make your credits back by playing me.
100 credits will be fine.
I'll play. What is the wager?
I've changed my mind.
I can't pay that.
Let's go.

Well, imagine you coming back. Heh heh. Something you want?
I heard about you setting a track record. Wish I'd seen it. Ah, it would've just made me want to be out there myself.
Hello again. I hear you're pretty fast out on the track. Remember these days. Yes sir. Once they're gone, whoo, they're gone.
I hear you're pretty good on the track. Yeah. I remember my first paycheck for racing. Heh heh. So small you couldn't see it, but I remember.
Well now, what can Gandroff do for you? It's been a while since I've had anyone bother talking to me.
Usually it's some kid wondering what my old racing days were like... but that was back on Taris. Seems like a long time ago.
No need to get all confrontational. What are... what are we, Sand People? You wouldn't find much fight left in me, anyway.
Doesn't seem like it. I've seen your kind before. Does it make you feel big, pushing old men around? You're all the same. Heh.
Now, leave me to my drinking. I don't think we'd have much to talk about. Not if I can help it.
Why bother? I mean, will this pay for ship maintenance or whatever? You're just looking for coward credits.
Bah, if it will get you to leave, just take what credits I have. Take em. Take em. Now leave me. I don't want anything to do with you.
Then race for it! By the Force, what do you think an old man like me would have? Bah, take it all.
Uh, well, I wouldn't worry about that, not with your attitude. Go on then, ask away. I'm ready.
Sure, not a problem. Might as well try to pass along some of what I know. Heh heh. My racing days are pretty much done.
I'm not sure what I have that you would be interested in. I... I'm... I'm just an old swoop-jock that doesn't have the head for it anymore. Heh.
Uh, keep safe. Yup. Yup. Seems like tough times are coming.
Ask me again in a few years and it will be me. Heh heh. I'm probably not going back out on the circuit... if there is one.
But, for now, I don't know any more than the next guy. You should try the locals. Jawas maybe. Funny little guys. Li'l jawa, li'l jawa.
Ahh, something I know. Well... well, something I used to know. Um, my racing days are behind me. Gandroff is the name.
All right then.
I don't really talk to any of them. I know Zoriis from the circuit and you couldn't ask for a tougher lady. Smart too.
I don't know the younger guys, but after you pushed that deal on Nico, I doubt they'd trust me or anyone.
I don't know the younger guys, but I suppose they're in good hands. What you did for Nico was good to see.
I don't know the younger guys, but... but I've been watching Nico. Uh, good to see someone doing it for the love of the race.
I don't know, but some people just have something that lets the bike take them. It's like the air stops pushing back.
That's an old track tale, you know; when the wind decides to stop fighting? I used to have that. Heh... not any more.
I think you know what I mean; when the wind decides to stop fighting? Hmm. You've felt it. I can tell by your times.
Oh, well past my prime, by any measure. I started late, too. Not like the kids out there now. Some of them are too young. Hm.
It's a cutthroat business. I... I've seen some of them burn out after a year. They get dangerous, and don't live long.
That's not everyone, of course, but... but it happens. I'm a has-been, I'll admit, but... but dying while you're on top is still dying. I'll pass.
Best place to race is wherever the track treats you sweet and your times are golden. It's that simple.
You get hung up on any one track and... and you'll end up like me. Heh heh. My favorite stop was Taris... Taris, yes... always looked forward to going back.
Now I don't want to touch my bike at all. Maybe I wasn't in the winner's circle lately, but I still raced for sport, you know? Vroom vroom.
A woman. I never won on Taris, but it was always my first stop on the circuit, and the last if I could help it. Heh.
That doesn't matter now. You can't ask for more certain closure than the whole planet being gone. Poof. Boom. Heh. Gone.
Oh, I... I don't want to get into that, miss. Let's just say that there was always someone trackside rooting for me. Heh heh.
I... I am not used to such attention. Uh, what do you want me to repeat?
I saw you down by the track, didn't I? Or was that someone else? I've been distracted by what happened on Taris.
Go on, take a walk. My mood is sour enough without you here.
I don't care about your faded glory. I'm not here for storytime.
I meant no harm. I apologize.
Then just die, old man. I'm not backing down.
I don't want a fight. I just want money.
I just have some questions. Don't bother getting friendly.
I wanted to ask a few questions, if you have the time.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
I want to ask about you and racing.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Your answers are tiresome. Have you anything of use to say?
What can you tell me about the other racers?
What makes him any different than the others?
How long did you race?
Why do you think that?
Is this the best place for racing?
What made Taris any different than here?
Leave me, human. If you're here to stir things up, I want no part of it.
Don't care if we've got Sith rule or Republic rule. Either way I work the mines.
Sith... Jedi... do either of them really care when normal people get caught in their fighting?
Good thing there's nothing on Tatooine to get the attention of the Sith. Right?
Jawas... can't stand them. They never bathe, you know.
Trapped out here... can't do anything. I wonder which planet is next?
Scurry away. I had family on Taris and I'm not in a mood to talk.
Don't go bothering people while they are drinking. It's rude.
Back, but nothing changes, and ours are still lost. Iziz starts to know you will not help, and fades his hopes.
Why would you bother we of Jawa under Iziz? Yours do not care for ours. Do you miss we that are taken? No.
Your kind are like that, and Iziz is foolish to think that you are not. We know this. Leave us to the trouble.
Iziz stands at the walls that hold out the sand. They listen poorly there too. Your kind hide behind bad ears.
Is this interest? Not from your kind, though Iziz thinks otherwise. Speak to him if you are acting and pretending.
Jawas are tired of giant-speak. Might as well slave to the gaffi. So you trade, but what is that if no help is given?
Query: Is the miniature organic implying falsehood? Shall I blast it, master?
Hmm. These Jawas sure aren't the trusting type, are they?
No doubt with good reason.
Well, for once, I'll agree with you.
The voices of Jawa under Iziz are not flawed. The ears of your kin are poor while we speak plain of our missing.
Seems fairly clear to me, though he doesn't seem used to people actually stopping to listen.
He sounds... not right. Unnatural.
It's not that hard to understand if you listen. It's just... odd.
Hence the 'unclear' part. Or did you miss that?
Your sarcasm is not appreciated, Carth.
Translation: Doubtful. The Jawa language is structured in an odd manner. You are lucky to understand what you do.
Strange. You are of your kind, but are unlike them too. You helped where others did not. Iziz was right in this.
You have the thanks of the Jawa under Iziz. We will remember when you are the ones that have gone.
But taking of more was there as well. You have made the unfair trade. We will remember, both good and not.
Jawa babble. I don't have time for this.
Iziz... is that your leader? Where is he?
"We that are taken?" Are some of your people missing?
You two agreed? Somebody mark this day down.
Please, could you try to speak more clearly?
"Of your missing?" Have some of your people gone missing?
You again? What is it now?
Did I see you down by the swoop track? I'll remind you that I don't give loans and I expect prompt payment on bar bills.
Drink up, friend. I hear the Sith are restless on Korriban, and they never keep their problems to themselves.
Looks like people will have to drink to forget their pain, now that kolto is so expensive. Of course, no one from Manaan is saying a word about it.
I had a few Czerka employees confide that the company is pulling out of Kashyyyk. Leaving as soon as things get difficult... just like they'll do here.
Hmm, what's the winner of the Manaan Sector Champion title doing here, I wonder? Must have blown all your winnings.
Eh? Who are you, then? The only new people that come to Junix Nard's cantina are longtime losers and bounty hunters.
I don't have to tell you why the two don't mix well. Please keep any blaster fire to a minimum.
Yeah, yeah.
I suppose you are fishing for a reaction to the destruction of Taris? That's all anyone from off-world is talking about.
Well, I'll tell you, it's about time someone kicked the Republic in the tail and got things moving. I guess the Sith are the ones to do it.
Don't get me wrong, all those deaths were horrible, but war gets the money moving. Maybe they'll decide to fortify us out here.
No.
Just "no". I don't look for trouble. You'll have to talk to people yourself if you want more than that. Now, if you don't mind.
What, did some Czerka promoter tell you to come to this planet? I pity you if you were expecting a prosperous mining outpost.
Nothing here but sand and more sand. There's a little hunting and racing, but nothing that will make a small man rich.
It would cut into my business if people thought I'd turn them in. I don't know anything about anyone, thank you very much.
Now, if this is about Sand People, that's a different matter. I have no problem talking about them.
I know they don't negotiate. Attacks are worst in the far south of the Dune Sea, right where the sandcrawlers have to pass.
You wipe them out, you'll make a lot of friends.
You made short work of the Sand People, and I thank you for that, but don't make trouble for me here.
I don't deal with any of that. Motta the Hutt has a lock on everrything race related on Tatooine. You deal with him or you don't race.
What, you couldn't take some notes when you signed up with Motta? I heard you were down at the track; there's nothing new I can tell you.
Well, there's two kinds of hunting on Tatooine: hunting wraid, and hunting people. Both are dangerous and both have certain restrictions.
You'll need a Czerka hunting license, even though most hunters deal with Fazza at the lodge once they have their paperwork squared away.
All right then. Just keep it brief, will you? I've got customers.
They maintain an office west of here in central Anchorhead. That's about all they maintain these days.
Fazza's is northwest of here, north of the Czerka office. He'll steer you towards the Czerka for a license before dealing with you.
After that, he'll buy the trophies you collect. I don't know what he does with it all, but I guess he makes a living somehow.
You've got a license there, don't you? Fazza's lodge will be open to you now. Nothing more I can tell you about hunting that his lot won't.
And since you got that license from Czerka, you know they look for bounties of their own. They are the ones with credits to pay and interests to protect.
I've already gone over this stuff with you. Couldn't you go ask someone else? I'm not one of those "listening" bartenders.
Czerka Corporation only worries about keeping their own stores full. I don't have much on hand.
I have to go. Goodbye.
Anything out of the ordinary happening?
Know about anything more local?
"No" you don't know, or "no" you won't tell me?
I want to ask about things here on Tatooine.
I want to ask if you know about a bounty I am currently hunting.
What do you know about the Sand People?
Tell me about racing.
I've got some questions about hunting.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Where does Czerka Corporation give out the licenses?
Where is Fazza's lodge?
Do you have anything for sale?
Well, imagine you coming back. Something you want?
Something you want, spacer? Go talk to the office if you want to complain about conditions here. I don't want to hear it.
Seems like every other person I meet is complaining about something. Well, it's not going to get better, so leave me alone.
Oh well, I wouldn't want that, now would I? Just leave me alone.
Just hot air blowing, eh? Well take it somewhere else. I don't have the patience right now. Not with my workload.
Go on, leave me alone. I don't want to have anything more to do with you.
What are you doing, coming in here like you're Sand People or something? That's no way to do business. I don't need this.
Here, take some cred's, if that's what you want. Go drown in a drink, like every other failure in here.
What, are you a beggar? Fine, if it will get you to leave, take a few cred's, but don't expect another handout.
Trouble? Why would I want to make trouble with you? This planet has more than enough as it is.
I don't really have any interest in helping you. Will this be quick?
Good. I've a lack of business to attend to.
Nobody we've brought, that's for sure. Our experts said this rock was supposed to have mining potential to last for years.
Nothing but garbage ore, good for nothing. You ever try to sell someone garbage? My name is mud in three systems now.
Well, you don't look like much of a customer, and neither does anyone else here. I sell to companies, not people loitering in bars.
Bah, you wouldn't understand. You're like everyone else, complaining about how Czerka isn't feeding and clothing you like it should.
Well, I'm mad too. There's not much of a retirement plan I can count on if the whole outpost goes belly up. I'll be just like you.
All right then. Make it quick.
He has no pride at all. Might as well be dead.
You're pet is growling. Maybe he needs to be brushed. Look, you're just like everyone else, angry about not getting enough work.
Like I said before, I don't much care what you think. I'll be on the street if business keeps dropping, and it will.
You swoop racers, do you even know what it takes to run an outpost like this? As long as there's flat ground, what do you care?
Get lost, spacer. I've had enough of you.
I'm getting sick of your attitude.
I meant no harm. I apologize.
Why should I? You going to do something? I could kill you.
I will, for a price.
I just have some questions. Don't give me any trouble.
I wanted to ask a few questions, if you have the time.
I have to leave. Goodbye.
I'm looking for something. Who knows this planet best?
You're not much of a spokesman for Czerka Corporation.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Have you anything useful to say? I'm getting tired of you.
I've enough to worry about with my mining quotas, I don't have time for you.
Czerka Corporation should just close this whole place down. Heh. Who would miss it?
The sooner I get out of this dustbowl, the better.
Maybe the Sith will give us more support here on Tatooine. Couldn't get worse.
How are the Sand People doing so much damage? Blasters beat gaffi sticks, don't they?
Should have been a wraid hunter. I hate this uniform.
Go to the Czerka offices if you want a job. I'm off duty.
Our business has nothing to do with you, spacer.

Move to the sides, out of serving way.
Jawas will dig the sand for you one day.
Better here than with People of Sand.
You were not here first, yet Jawas serve.
This job is not fair trade.
