Greetings again from the offices of Czerka Corporation. Is this about bounties or something else?
Hello again. I hear you've made an impression down at the swoop track. Czerka Corporation wholly supports local events.
Er... not financially, you understand. Now, was this about bounties or something else?
Can I help you? These are the offices of Czerka Corporation. I trust you have business with the company?
If this is about employment, I'm afraid all regular mining positions are full. And before you ask, we are also no longer selling hunting licenses.
Farewell. Czerka Corporation welcomes your future inquiries.
I assume that by "out of the ordinary" you are referring to the destruction of Taris? That is all anyone is talking about.
I'm afraid Czerka Corporation is not offering any comment on those events. We wouldn't wish to anger the participants.
Czerka Corporation policy is not subject to your approval. It is a sound business model. Save us your commentary.
If you are looking for local events, I suggest you go to the swoop track. One of the few leisure industries on Tatooine.
Hmm... there was also a Jawa here earlier, saying something about needing help. I think he's out by the city gates.
I can't be more specific about what he wanted. Our droid translators had difficulty with the message.
Of course. Czerka Corporation records are available at our Representative Kiosk on Coruscant. Business hours please.
For your needs here, we maintain a fully stocked storehouse. Speak with Greeta Holda about any purchases.
Certainly. Please pose your questions to the Representative Kiosk on Coruscant. Business hours please.
[Success] Of course, I could just tell you now. No sense in being so secretive. It's all fairly obvious.
[Failure] I'm sorry, but I can't help you. I'll have to refer you to the Representative Kiosk.
[Success] I suppose you're right. It's not like you can't tell the state of things just by looking around.
Mining operations here have not been a success. The ore is substandard, and there's less of it than surveys indicated.
With the Sand People raids on top of it all, it's no wonder this planet has been abandoned before.
We can't ignore evidence that Anchorhead was settled more than once before, and abandoned each time.
There's probably about a century between each attempt. Just long enough for records about why it failed to disappear.
The Jawas scavenge ancient tech all the time. It's a remote world. Who knows what's here?
The company would have to be foolish to stay. It will be costly, but in the end, leaving will be cheaper than staying.
I imagine all the heavy equipment will be abandoned. It's not worth shipping out things like sandcrawlers.
Maybe the Jawas will find a use for them when we're gone. Ha! That's a laugh!
No one knows. There are odd energy fluctuations on this planet, but they defy analysis or explanation.
But the effect is obvious. Ore taken from Tatooine is useless for construction. It degrades incredibly fast.
Word is getting out about it too. We're running out of buyers. Czerka Corporation is not doing well here.
I'm sorry, but day-to-day operations of Czerka Corporation outposts are fully regionalized. I have no information on Kashyyyk.
I'm sorry, I'll have to direct you to our Representative Kiosk on Coruscant. Business hours only, please.
Yes, we are still waiting for you to return with the Sand People Chieftain's gaffi stick. I will reward you well when you do.
We don't have any new information on the subject. It is still possible that they have an enclave in the far south of the Dune Sea.
And I would remind you that you did agree to do this task for Czerka Corporation. We expect completion in a timely manner.
I should remind you that you were not retained as a diplomatic representative. You are a hunter, and should go after your prey as we agreed.
You are not authorized to do anything other than deliver what was promised. Do so, and don't talk of this foolishness again.
You have fulfilled your end of the bargain and Czerka Corporation is grateful. The Sand People will be less of a threat without their chieftain.
I will of course continue to give you bounties on regular gaffi sticks. Every one helps.
As I said, we are no longer selling them. There are too many people cavorting about outside the walls as it is.
Very well, though I do have work to get back to.
With the downturn in mining, people want any chance at credits they can get. Most wouldn't survive a day, let alone qualify as hunters.
The last license issued before the ban was given to a woman named Marlena Venn. She'll do fine; she had a mean streak a parsec wide.
She also paid double. Exceptions like this are rare, unless it suits the company to offer them.
Well, normally we charge 200 credits, but I could make an exception if you agreed to perform a task for us. It's similar to hunting.
The Sand People are becoming a problem. They destroy our sandcrawlers and kill our miners. One particular tribe is the worst.
It's as if their chieftain has decided to wage a war against us. I would like their attacks... terminated. Bring me their gaffi sticks as proof.
If you agree to do this, I'll give you a hunting license now and pay a bounty for each stick later. I'll give a bonus for the chieftain's.
Excellent. Now, just so we understand each other, this is an enforceable contract. Czerka Corporation takes this very seriously.
Here is your license, and a few directions. We believe one of their enclaves is in the far south of the Dune Sea.
You might try following one of our sandcawlers. They are regularly attacked. I wouldn't mind you escorting them.
Very good. Czerka Corporation looks forward to your future business.
Then you are free to not leave the city, just like everyone else. Czerka Corporation will welcome your eventual change of mind.
Please, feel free to enjoy the door behind you.
Which would you rather have dumped on your office floor? Besides, they are ceremonial weapons unique to each warrior. It's just as good.
We use them to insure that only people judged fit by Czerka Corporation are allowed outside the city.
We don't allow casual exploration because of legal concerns. Czerka Corporation takes no responsibility for loss of life on the dunes.
It's just so we can keep track of people. No one leaves the city without a Czerka hunting license.
I see that, but do you have the all important Chieftain's Gaffi? That was what you agreed to get for us.
Very well, but we need this matter taken care of.
Well, that is a very big headache that you have removed. I'm sure there are still Sand People out there, but they will be quieter now.
I think I'll give you a bonus for this. You've more than lived up to your side of the bargain. Czerka Corporation thanks you.
*ahem* While I respect your... forcefulness, I must remind you that ours are the finest, and only, guards in Anchorhead.
It would simply be inadvisable to attempt such an action in here. There would be no place for you to run. I don't fear you here.
[Success] And I wouldn't want you to leave without this additional reward. Yes, of course I wouldn't.
Once again, Czerka Corporation thanks you.
[Failure] I think you'll find that the reward I have given is more than adequate for the task. No more is deserved.
[Success] It would be valuable to have someone on call if the Sand People made another incursion. I think you're right.
Yes, here is an additional reward. Once again, Czerka Corporation thanks you.
I'm sure. Czerka Corporation thanks you again.
Then I'll take those off your hands, but the real prize is still out there.
Of course. You have done a good job for us and I'm happy to pay you.
Griff? Uh... there's no Griff here. Never heard of him. No, I... I don't remember a single Griff on the Czerka Corporation payroll.
That... may help in this instance. Let me think... perhaps I remember this Griff character.
[Success] Can you spare me a few moments? I have something I want to get off my chest. I want to tell you about one of our workers. His name was Griff.
[Failure] I'm sorry, but Czerka Corporation officials do not accept bribes. Now, unless you're interested in our bounties or some other business I'm going to have to ask you to leave!
[Success] Oh, you mean that Twi'lek! Must have slipped my mind for a second. Yes, of course I remember Griff.
We hired that Twi'lek some time ago. Not a good worker according to his crew chief: always complaining and faking injuries to get out of work.
He entered false time sheets and slept through his shifts. We even suspected him of stealing Czerka Corporation supplies, although we could never prove it.
We would've fired him but we needed workers. It would have been better for him if he had been fired. Then the Sand People wouldn't have gotten him.
He was lost in a Sand People raid we suffered not too long ago. There were prisoners taken, but our rescue parties never found anyone alive.
In the end it just wasn't cost effective to keep searching. All miners sign a waiver absolving Czerka Corporation of liability in these circumstances.
We didn't find his body so we have to assume he was taken prisoner. Whether he's still alive, I couldn't say.
That's all I can tell you. I shouldn't even have said this much; this is all privileged corporate information. I could lose my job!
As I said, all employees have signed waivers absolving Czerka Corporation of any financial liability if this occurs. It is the industry standard.
I suppose you could apply for special dispensation from the Czerka Corporation Representative Kiosk on Coruscant. Business hours only, please.
Czerka Corporation cares deeply for all of its employees. That's why we've started a bounty program to thin the Sand People numbers.
I have to go. Goodbye.
Anything out of the ordinary happening?
No desire to mistakenly associate with the losing side, hmm?
Know about anything more local?
I want to ask about Czerka Corporation.
May I ask how your operations here on Tatooine are doing?
[Force Persuade] It would be better if you told me now.
[Persuade] Why the secrets? The company stuck you here. Tell me.
What do you mean the planet was abandoned before?
Does this mean you have plans to pull out?
What makes the ore substandard?
I wanted to ask about your activities on Kashyyyk.
Which is very convenient if one branch is charged with misconduct.
I want to ask about our agreement.
There may be a nonviolent solution to this.
I want to ask about hunting licenses.
Let's go back to my first questions.
Have there been a lot of people leaving the city?
What was it you wanted me to do for a license?
There is no way to get a license?
I will agree to do this for you.
I'll go get to it then.
I don't want to do this.
Why pay for the gaffi sticks? Why not their heads?
Why would I need a license anyway?
I have gaffi sticks to redeem for bounties.
I was mistaken. I'll be back later.
Yes, here it is.
Hand over more or I bury you the same as the Sand People.
[Force Persuade] You want to give me an additional reward.
[Persuade] For a bit more I could maintain my vigilence in the future.
That amount will suffice.
Just the regular ones for now.
I'm looking for a miner named Griff.
Never mind. I want to ask you about something else.
Maybe 20 credits will refresh your memory?
[Force Persuasion] You want to tell me about Griff.
[Persuade] Are you certain of that? I would leave sooner if I knew.
So you fired him?
Yes, that sounds like him.
You mean he's dead?
The Sand People?
Did the Sand People kill Griff or not!
Is there some type of reward for saving him?
So your workers are all expendable?
You again? You want to buy something? If not, go bother the officers.
Oh, a swoop-jock, hmm? I know I don't have the crazy suicide parts you're looking for.
Yes? What is it? If this is about mining or Sand People, you go to the Czerka officers. I just manage the storehouse.
Bye then. Come back if you need any supplies.
Is that a coy way of referring to Taris going down? You don't want my views on that.
You know what? At least the Sith seem to make things happen. How old is the Republic? 15,000 years? It's stagnant.
Every year ships get a little faster, droids get a little smarter, and people get a little fatter. That's about it for progress.
I suspect I'd do just as much grunt-labor under them as I do now. They'll at least shake things up.
You say that like you know something. Well, keep it to yourself. I like to watch this change from a distance, thanks.
Nobody's innocent once their mother has left the room. That's just my view.
Don't care about them. I stay in the Czerka compound. We could be on a pleasure world, for all I care or know.
Well, the cost increase of kolto is downright weird. Maybe the Selkath think the destruction of Taris scared people enough they will pay inflated prices for medical supplies.
Well, it's odd that I'm talking to the Manaan Sector Champion, but with Taris gone you likely don't have much choice about where to race.
I hear the Sith are wasting their efforts fighting among themselves when they should be getting things done. Like they did on Taris.
Then go ask a Czerka officer. I just collect my credits at the end of the day, just like the miners or guards.
It doesn't matter what I think. Maybe they'll pull out, maybe they won't. I'll man the store on the next rock.
Look, it's not my business what Czerka Corporation does somewhere else. I don't even care what they do *here*.
Now, what would the officers say? Oh yes. Go talk to the Kiosk on Coruscant. You want to buy something or not?
Very well, though I do have work to get back to.
Their operations on Kashyyyk are in more trouble than you or I could ever give them. Of course, they would never admit that.
I don't much care about how Czerka operates, but I get a chuckle out of anything that gives them grief.
Not my affair. You want to hunt for Czerka Corporation you talk to the Protocol Officer.
Mostly just standard Czerka provisions and supplies. Not enough to keep the locals happy. Have a look.
Was there something specific you were looking for? You seem like you are looking for unique things.
Take a look. The best stocked storehouse on Tatooine. Not that that's saying much.
I may, but that is not something I usually sell to spacers. You don't look like a moisture farmer. What do you want them for?
Of course, of course, I'll show you what I have, but don't push your luck with those threats. It's not polite.
No, I suppose not. It wouldn't have mattered. Well, let me tell you what I have, then.
Ah, exactly the kind of appeasement that Czerka Corporation doesn't like to support in their policies. I like it.
Well, I have two of the finest vaporators that Czerka Corporation produces. Of course, they only produce one model right now.
The price is 400 credits for the pair. I won't break them up. They function best when linked together.
I'm sorry, but that is as low as I can go. There's nothing I can do about it. Czerka regulations, you know.
Well, I don't think that's very likely. I have to cover my costs, you know.
You're a big something, but not so much a threat. That won't work on me, not in the heart of Anchorhead.
If you did anything in here you wouldn't be safe anywhere. There are guards everywhere. Look, let's just do some honest business.
[Success] Of course I want to lower the price, but Czerka regulations... ah, who cares about those, right?
[Failure] I can't do it. I just can't. You'll have to come up with the money.
[Success] Well, I don't have much love for the company, not like little miss Protocol Officer over there.
I'll lower the price to 200 credits, but that is it. Don't even ask again.
I really don't think so. I don't know how, but you've already convinced me to lower it as much as I can. It's a good deal.
Fine, fine, I assume you'll be able to handle the deployment of them? They are surprisingly light.
It's a pleasure doing business with you. Do come again.
The price is 200 for the pair. I'm not sure how you talked me into that ridiculously low bargain, but there it is.
You're that friend of Griff, right? He gave me a message for you.
He told me to tell you that he made a mistake brewing the Tarisian ale. It didn't work out right for some reason.
He told me the tach gland was ruined. And he said he wasn't going to stick around and have to face his Exchange contact.
He hopped on board the last shuttle. I don't know where he was heading, but I can't say I'm sorry he's gone.
He was one of the worst employees I ever had. He was always on a break, he mixed up orders and I think he might have been stealing from me.
You and a dozen others. I was smart enough not to give him an advance on his wage, but you can kiss your credits goodbye.
People like Griff, they know how to disappear when they get in too deep. You won't hear from him again any time soon. Waste of time to even bother looking for him.
There was one last thing. He said to tell his sister goodbye. And to tell her he's sorry.
Damn it, Griff - won't you ever learn? How can my own flesh and blood be so stupid!
I don't like the sound of this.
I have to go. Goodbye.
Anything out of the ordinary happening?
What about your opinions on Taris?
You like change; that's good.
Even if it means the deaths of innocents?
Okay, what about local events?
I want to ask about Czerka Corporation.
How do you think they are doing here on Tatooine?
Do you know about their operations on Kashyyyk?
And that absolves you of all responsibility?
Let's go back to my first questions.
I want to ask about bounties.
What do you have available for purchase?
No, just your normal fare.
Do you have any moisture vaporators?
You just show me what you have. Don't risk angering me!
That's not really your concern, is it?
To exchange with Sand People to stop their attacks.
I can't pay you right now.
Could you be persuaded to lower the price?
You'll do as I say. I'm the biggest threat in the room.
[Force Persuade] You want to lower the price.
[Persuade] Czerka's costs, not yours. Who cares about their money?
Perhaps I could try to persuade you once more?
I'll take the moisture vaporators for 400.
200 for the moisture vaporators sounds fine to me.
I'm not surprised. Anything else?
What kind of mistake?
Did he say where he was going?
You just let him go?
You mean he's gone?
Good riddance!
That cheapskate owes me credits!
I have to go after him!
You're back! I knew you'd come through for me. I knew I could count on you! Uh... you do have a tach gland for me, right?
Changed your mind? No... you can't! Eh... do you know what this guy from the Exchange will do to me if I don't come through? Come on, you have to help me here!
Sorry, like I said before I don't have any credits on me. And Greeta won't lend me any. It's like he doesn't trust me to pay him back or something.
But you come through on this and I promise you'll get a huge payday down the road. Two... no! Three thousand credits! How's that sound?
Come to papa you sweet simian organ! It may not look like much, but once I turn this into a bottle of Tarisian ale it'll end up being worth a fortune!
You know, once we synthesize this and start brewing Tarisian ale in mass quantities we're going to be looking for some investors.
You give me a couple hundred credits and I can get you in on the ground floor. You'll get a return of... oh, at least twenty times your investment!
You don't know much about business, do you? When an opportunity like this comes along you have to jump at it! Come on, what do you say?
Whoa - no need to get violent. I can take the hint. I was just trying to do you a favor, but I see you're not interested.
It's your loss. I better get started brewing that ale. Meet me back here later and I'll give you a downpayment on what I owe you.
Wise move. I can see you really understand how business works: now, when you see your chance, you jump at it! Heh, that's my motto.
I better get started on brewing that ale. Meet me back here later and I'll have a downpayment on what I owe you.
Hey, don't worry, you'll get your credits as soon as we start mass producing that Tarisian ale. I just wanted to know if you were interested in an even bigger payoff.
Thanks, Mission. You won't regret helping me out with this!
Please, Griff. Let this be the last time. No more cons. No more scams. No more schemes. That's all I ask.
Hey, sis, no need to worry about that. I've turned over a new leaf. From now on I'm going to stay out of trouble and do things right.
And once we've cornered the market on Tarisian ale good things will be heading my way. Then I'll make it up to you, Mission. Just wait - you'll see!
This wasn't my idea, Griff. If it was up to me I'd let the Exchange deal with you!
Geez, sis - that's pretty harsh. Come on, I know things haven't been great between us but when I corner the market on Tarisian ale I'll make things up to you!
Forget it, Griff. Don't you understand? It's too late - you're dead to me now. I don't want anything more to do with you. Ever.
Okay, that's the way you want it. But when I'm rich you're going to regret saying that!
Ah, just the person I was hoping to see!
Mission didn't come with you, I see. Uh... guess she's still mad at me. Oh well... it's probably for the best. This job is more up your alley anyway.
Hmph! Save it Griff - I'm still not talking to you! I want no part of whatever you're involved in!
Okay, sis - I see you're still mad. Fair enough. I don't think you could help me with this anyway. It's uh... more of a job for your friend here.
As you may know, tach glands can be refined into a very potent powder. It's the primary ingredient in Tarisian ale - that's what makes it so strong.
Of course, now that Taris is pretty much wiped from the face of the map Tarisian ale has become somewhat scarce - and uh... very, very valuable. Luckily, I know the secret recipe!
I know this guy... he's with the Exchange. Now, if I give him a small sample of Tarisian ale he says he can synthesize it and reproduce it in mass quantities.
Problem is, I need one of those tach glands to make the first batch. And now that Taris is a smoking ruin, the only place to find tach is on Kashyyyk.
If you can get your hands on one of those tach glands I'll make it worth your while.
Sorry, like I said before I don't have any credits on me. And Greeta won't lend me any credits. I mean, it's like he doesn't trust me to pay him back or something.
But you come through on this and I promise you'll get a huge payday down the road. Two... no! Three thousand credits! How's that sound?
Griff, are you blind? Can't you see you're talking to a Jedi? We're out here trying to save the galaxy! We can't waste time on this!
Please, you have to help me! I... I promised this guy from the Exchange a sample of Tarisian ale! If I don't come through for him he's going to break my legs... or worse!
Come on, I'm Mission's brother! I'm her family! I mean, think what she'll do if you just let the Exchange kill me! Besides, this is a sweet deal!
Come on, Mission - I'm your brother! I'm family! You can't turn your back on me!
Forget it, Griff, I'm not falling for that line again. You'll have to find your own way out of this mess!
You bring me a single tach gland and you not only save my life but you get a piece of this great business opportunity! I mean, you can't pass this up! Think about it and you'll see I'm right.
Yeah, I knew you'd come through for me! You won't regret this... you'll see! Uh... just... just don't take too long, okay? This guy from the Exchange could stop by any day.
I kind of told him I already had the stuff, so if he shows up and I'm empty handed... well, let's just say I really, really hope it doesn't come to that.
I'll be back when I have that tach gland.
I've changed my mind, I'm not doing this.
I'm not giving you the gland until I see some credits!
Here's the tach gland. Take it.
I've done more than enough for you already!
Ask me again and that tach gland won't be the only freshly harvested organ around here!
I don't need business advice from you, Griff.
Okay, here's 200 credits.
You already promised me a few thousand credits.
Come on, Griff, get to the point.
What's the job?
What does this have to do with me?
So you want to open a bar?
I don't have time for this, I'm trying to save the galaxy!
What's in this for me?
Sorry, Griff - I don't trust you.
That's what you get for dealing with the Exchange.
Don't worry, Griff, we'll get those tach glands for you.

Playback: A special message from Marlena.
Replay: A special message from Marlena.
Careful! If that happens again they could all explode! No way I would survive that!
Hey, you did it! You got them going! All right boys, give me some space.
What the...! What did you do? Oh no...
Well, nice to see you again. Ah, not to pressue you - certainly, no pressure - but you did say you'd rescue me.
You asked for nothing in return... but really, soon would be nice.
Well, normally I'd be patient, but the constant threat of death is just so stressful. You know?
We've been over this, haven't we? My wife has put some kind of kink in my battle droids. If I move, they're threatening to explode.
I haven't got a clue where to start. She knew I wouldn't. Please, repair them for me if you can.
If you expect me to give up hunting, speedy service would be nice.
You asked for credits, after all. Speedy service would be nice.
It's just that I had hoped you could do this with a little more... I don't know... success? I won't survive another blast.
I mean, I can certainly see how you'd want to keep me in one place. You ladies can be so coy...
So, uh... what's new? Uh, rescued anyone recently? You know, maybe someone trapped in the desert!
That was... unpleasant. Thanks for your help. I would have been a goner. Heh, and the old bat thought I was dead. HA!
You never asked me for anything, but I consider my life worth something. Please, take this. I insist.
What else could I give you? I need what I have to repair my droids and get back up and running.
You shouldn't have fixed the droids first, then. Rally on my target, boys!
[Success] I'd... really like to pay you more. Here... take whatever I have. It's all yours.
How did... how did you get me to do that? Damn, that's what got me married and into this mess! That's it, I'm leaving!
[Failure] Look, I really can't. I'm sorry.
[Success] I suppose I do. That's pretty smart to appeal to what I think my safety is worth. Here.
Now, if you don't mind, I have to limp these boys back to my shop. Hopefully Marlena didn't take the manuals with her.
I love it when the ladies play hard-to-please, but there isn't much more I can do. This is an expensive setback.
Thanks again. I doubt any of those uptight hunters would have helped, and I doubt the wife is coming back.
I'm heading back to the shop... I hope she left the manuals for these things behind. Ungrateful little...
You wanted me to give up my trade. Well, consider it done. Maybe I can rent my droids for security or something.
You wanted credits for your trouble, and I never break a deal. Here's uh, all I have on me.
Now, my dear lady, I must see to your reward. Will, uh, earthly delights suffice? Er... I suppose not.
Hey there, thanks for stopping. I appreciate it. I've been stuck without water for hours. Wasn't looking good.
Oh, hey, it's you. I remember you at Fazza's place. Could I get you to help out a fellow hunter? Please?
Could you... hey, I remember you. You're the young lady from Fazza's club. Talk about answered prayers.
Now if you could... oh no... not you. Just my luck. Look, I don't want any trouble, just need a little help.
I don't remember you from Fazza's club. You new to Anchorhead? Could you maybe help me get out of here?
What? Oh, right, thanks. I guess I'll just DIE! Come on, help a guy out!
I'll bet she does. She's decided I've finally worn out my welcome, and she's "fixed" my droids to do her dirty work.
Well, ah, it would appear that I worn out my welcome with my wife Marlena. She fixes my droids... heh, fixed them good this time.
I triggered some sort of trap she programmed. She probably figured I wouldn't be smart enough to get out. Uh, she was right.
Something about me not following her archaic rules for proper conduct in a marriage. I swear, I never saw this coming.
Hey, I'm the victim here. I'm not sure how divorce works where you're from, but this is a little extreme, don't you think?
You know, now really isn't the time for a lecture. Of course, I might be more receptive after I'm rescued.
Look friend, some may talk about honor in the hunt, but they still sell their trophies.
You're beautiful, but not too bright. I hunt to make a living. Other hunters talk about honor, but they still sell their trophies.
The wife put a kink in my battle droids. They're in some sort of discharge loop, and if I move from this spot, they're threatening to blow up.
She knew I wouldn't know how to fix them. Could you try to do some repairs? They don't care if you move. It's just me who's stuck.
I'd, ahh, really appreciate a bit of help. Please?
What? Why? What did I do to you?
Well, I suppose I couldn't ask for a more valid reason than that. That's all?! That's it?! What are you, my wife?
So you just want me to die? That is just... so... typical of the people I meet... and marry. Thanks a lot!
So my life is worth less than a few wraid? How many? One? Ten? Twenty?
Oh, so this will be some sort of lesson for me, just because I don't "thank the bones" or some garbage?
Well fine, I'll... stay pretty much right here I guess. You can just get lost. I'll... I'll...
Heh heh. You're kidding, right. Right? Come on!
Phew! Don't scare me like that. All right, lesson learned, or whatever. Can you please try to get them going?
Nobody looks out for their neighbor anymore. Well, if this is it, I'd rather get it over with and maybe take you out with me.
So, let's see how these rigged-out droids like me jumping around. Hopefully the explosion kills you too!
Uh, what did you have in mind?
Well of course, darling. Anything at all.
Uh, sure, I apologize. Uh, now, about what you wanted?
Hey, wait for a moment. I need these rigs. I'm no marksman. No way I can agree to that. No way.
[Success] I won't use droids. You have to make sure the hunt goes on, right? Eh, now, could you help?
[Failure] I can't do it. That's my living. I'd have to leave this rock altogether. I can't do it.
[Success] Well, when you put it like that. *ahem* Very well then, if it will get you to help me.
Hey, no problem, but it won't be a fortune or anything. I'd bet the wife has drained our shared accounts. Now uh, about that help?
Just access each droid's repair interface. You'll have to do some tinkering, but be careful. One explosion I can survive. Any more than one and I'm dead.
Oh, and ignore the message Marlena left in there. No way do I deserve this, I swear.
Beep! Beeple beep!
Hey yeah! You've got yourself a 'mech droid, there! Tell it to do it! Please!
*mechanical splurch... unflattering sound*
Hey, now... did your droid just spit at me? I just need a little help here.
Commentary: I say we blast the meatbag and save you the trouble, master.
What's with all the droids, lately? My wife get to you, too?
Negative. I just don't like organic meatbags. Except for the master, of course. Ha ha.
Maybe we could program them to tap-dance? I love a good tap-dance.
This isn't funny! Come on!
I say leave him.
You're pretty heartless for such a pretty lady, you know?
I take it back. Let's congratulate his wife.
*sigh* I guess we should help him out.
Yes! Yes, I knew I liked this fella the minute I saw him.
Well... wait a minute... it looks like you've already taken care of things. Well that's great! Take that, Marlena, I'm going to live!
This should be interesting...
Commentary: One would hope the female is better at repairs than Yuka Laka. I still would like to crush his neck, master.
Philandering ways coming back to haunt him, I'll wager.
Oh great! You just get away from me! The last thing I need is Sand People trying to cut me up! Go on! I've got blasters!
What the... uh, yeah! You just get out of here! Hey I... I guess I'm pretty scary... trapped, but scary.
Oh... yeah I, uh, I knew that.
Anyone out there...? Could you help? I seem to be... ah... doomed.
Hold on there! How about talking to me before you go messing with those things? I need your help.
I'll get to it soon enough.
I've changed my mind. I'm not helping you.
I've decided that I want something in exchange.
What was it I needed to do?
You'll give me more or you will regret it.
I think I should ask for more.
Then I'll have to take it out of your hide!
[Force Persuade] You will pay me more and like it.
[Persuade] You know the rescue was worth more.
All right. Just get out of here, then.
That will be fine. Good luck.
I don't have time for this right now. Goodbye.
You're Tanis, right? Your wife says hello.
What happened here?
Why would she do this?
You don't seem too concerned about what triggered this.
You sit back and let your droids do the hunting?
It just doesn't seem very sporting.
What do you want me to do?
I'm not doing anything for you. You can rot here.
I just don't like you. Goodbye.
It's the cruelest death. Maybe I'll watch while sipping ice water.
It's better for the environment if I don't let you hunt.
You don't respect the hunt. You are a disgrace.
All right, I'll see what I can do.
I'm not kidding. You'll die here.
I'll help, but I want something in return.
One more "darling" and you'll be sorry, understand?
You'll have to give up hunting with droids.
[Force Persuade] You will no longer use droids to hunt. Ever.
[Persuade] Look around. You don't have much choice.
I'll help if you give me credits. All you've got.
All right, I'll try and help out. Hold on.
[Leave]
Easy, I'm no threat. It's just a disguise.

Having fun on the dunes, Tanis? I made sure you
would. Here's the deal: Your precious droids have
trapped you. They'll hold you until you die of thirst.
Make a mistake while repairing them, they explode.
Have a good death. My mother was right about you.
Hello there. You're heading out to the desert? You're a hunter right? You must be if you've been allowed to leave Anchorhead.
When you see Tanis, and I know you old boys always stick together, tell him his wife hopes he enjoys the anniversary gift.
You're just another of his buddies from that "hunting" club. I know your kind. You all cover for each other, I bet.
When you see Tanis, and I know you know him, tell him his wife hopes he enjoys the anniversary gift.
Oh, I'll be long gone soon enough. The next shuttle to... anywhere, really. I've had it with cleaning up his messes, repairing his droids.
If he lives, he can try and get by on his own. I doubt he'll last long with no one to listen to his lies.
Just a little something to remember me by. Something that symbolizes our years together. Something that will blow up in his face.
Of course, he'll never understand how appropriate it is. He can't talk his way out of this one. He's not smart enough.
Don't play dumb. You're just another of his playthings down at that "hunting" club. I know your type through and through.
Well, he can do what he wants. He'll get what he deserves. I bought my own license just so I could see that he did.
Oh, I'm through planning. I just left him a little mess that he has to take care of. If he's smart, he'll be just fine.
But he's not smart.
I'm sure you do. Like I said, when you see him, tell him his wife Marlena says hello.
What do you mean by "you old boys"?
Um, all right? What if he has a message for you?
Anniversary gift? What are you talking about?
Why do you think I would know him?
You sound like you're planning to kill him.
I have to go.
Don't let me die under here! Please!
Anyone! I'm trapped under here! Please help me!
Help! Please! Over here! Under the wreckage!
Haw haw! *snort* We gots you good now!
*squeee!*
We did a good ambush and you and you better pay... uh... maybe 500 credits now! You die otherwise!
Uh... what? Gurke said they be easy picking!
Shut up, stupid! *snort* They are just bluffing you! They got no hope at all!
What? Attack them! They trying to fight!
[Success] Wuh! Ah, we are sorry about everything! Yeah, everything! We'll leave now!
They don't seem that scary to me, Gurke. You sure?
Shut up and run, stupid! You want to die? Yeesh!
[Failure] Bah! you are nothing! You talk and talk but got nothing to show! I think we shut you up now!
[Success] Ah... maybe... maybe this time we play on the safe side. Yeah, maybe this time.
Gurke, are we leaving? Who's gonna pay for the ambush stuff?
Shut up, stupid! Just go. *snort*
Uh... you will? Of course you will! You roll over good!
But... Gurke said you types have lots of money!
Shut up! You got nothing? Bah! Then we kill you for your gear stuff!
What? Then you pay whatever you got! Yeah!
Hmm... not much... but maybe that's good enough. You roll over good.
Yeah, maybe we play with you again some time.
Haw! Maybe! You go where you want, now. We won't hurt you. Haw! *snort*
What? Why would we stop? You look pretty weak right now. We got you good!
[Success] We let you go now. We got what we wanted. Yeah, we sure did.
Uh, Gurke? They didn't give us nothing.
Shut up! We got what we wanted! Now we go! That's how this works! Yeesh. *snort*
[Failure] Bah! No way are we going to let you go. In fact, I think you should get shut up now!
Yeah, we are sick of the talking!
Shut up and get ready to fight. Stupid.
[Success] Hey, we get pretty good reputation if you run around all scaredy. Haw! I like it!
Okay, we will leave you alone here. You count yourself lucky! Yeah, you real lucky. *snort*
This isn't tough to figure out, you know. You don't pay, we bury you here!
Yeah, out here in the sand!
Please help! I can't get out! (click) 3... 2... 1.
Who are you to threaten me? I could be dangerous.
That's it! You're all going to die!
[Force Persuade] You fear me! Cower, little piggy!
[Persuade] I could be a powerful Jedi. Will you risk it?
Fine, I'll pay. Just leave me alone.
I don't have any credits. None at all.
I don't have 500 credits.
Fine, here is every credit I have. Take it all.
Perhaps I could persuade you not to do this?
[Force Persuade] You want to let me go. You got what you came for.
[Persuade] If you let me go, I'll tell others how smart you are.
And if I refuse to pay you anything?
What choice do we have? They have to be killed. All of them.
How am I supposed to make a living with this going on?
They should all be wiped out. Every last one of them.
Is it safe? Heh. Is anywhere safe? I don't think so.
I guess I'm lucky to be alive. No more of this for me, that's for sure.
Thanks for your help. I hope there's no more of those animals out there.
These Sand People are vicious. They attacked without any reason.
They were like animals. It was horrible.
Dozens of them attacked. I think the Captain's afraid there are more out there.
Barely got a shot off. That Captain will tell you all about it.
Out of nowhere, they came! I don't think the Captain even saw them coming.
Well, you should speak with the Captain. He's the only officer we've got left.
Don't hurt me! Please!
Thanks for your help. I don't think we'll try holding this position for much longer. We're not soldiers.
Did the company send you? It's about time they drove these animals out!
I don't have time for this sort of thing. I'm through with the desert. You can take your Sand People, krayt dragons, and crazy hunters.
Well you've got a lot of work ahead of you. Do you know about their enclave in the south? Don't even try to go near it.
They've taken all the Czerka weapons that were supposed to protect our sandcrawlers. That place is a fortress. A death trap.
You'll have to find some way to sneak into the place. Glad it's not my job.
Yeah, so do we. There's no way we're repairing this thing while getting attacked over and over. The desert can have it.
Ah, the Jawas will salvage it eventually anyway. Then we can buy it back and start over. Heh. Makes sense to me.
Just that they attack everything on sight. Well, I suppose they don't attack each other, but any outsider is as good as dead.
The company tried to arm us, and even set up remote self-powered turrets on the mining route, but...but that just made things worse.
It's like a fortress now. I don't know how you're going to break through all of that. Me, I'd sneak in. Well, actually, I would just get back to Anchorhead.
Who are you? Ah. It doesn't matter. Can you handle a blaster? They may attack again at any second.
I doubt we could hold out on our own against another wave of them.
Nothing in the job description covers this. Wait... well I guess we'll see how you fare. Here they come again!
You would be right. Came out of nowhere. Wait... Damn it! Here they come again! How do they do that!
N-now hold on, we don't want any trouble... please?
They... left? Well if that don't beat all.
Scared the living Force right out of me with that trick. You do that way too well. I thought our number was up for sure.
I have other questions about the desert.
I've agreed to try and stop the Sand People attacks.
I have to go.
Do you know anything about the Sand People?
You miners are cowards. A single attack wiped you out?
I would assume this was done by the Sand People?
[Leave]
I'm no threat. I'm just wearing their robes.
So we have found it. Father's holocron. I suppose I should be thankful the desert sands had not swallowed it up.
I don't know. I'll...I'll have to think about that. I'll keep it on me while I decide.
Are you going to give it to your mother?
[Your disguise fails at short range. The warrior attacks!]

[Without HK-47 present there is no way to communicate with him without risking violence.]
[He looks past you, like you were never there.]
[He screams and answers your threat in kind. He was likely waiting for an excuse to attack.]
Extrapolation: This guard doesn't appear honored to have the job of greeting us.
Translation: [Unitelligible]
Translation: It has had the expected effect. I hope you are ready for battle.
Translation: [Unitelligible]
Translation: He says we may only enter if we have the items the Chieftain asked for. He doesn't appear open to bargaining.
Translation: [Unitelligible]
Translation: He will take us before the Chieftain, as he was instructed to do.

Let me pass! I demand it!
Tell him to move aside or we'll make him!
Ask him if we can enter.

Krayt Dragon Area
Shh! Footfalls quiet, there is a great predator just within the cave. Care must be taken.
Time wears on. Have you found the bantha fodder integral to our plan? This dragon will not reveal himself for our paltry scent.
Bantha must be led to the cave to spur the beast out in the open. He will have a quick death after that.
Allow them to get closer to the cave. They will trigger the dragon's hunger, but as pungent as they are, they must be closer.
Good. Now, there is a herd that moves out in the desert. Lead them here. Approach them with the fodder and lead them here.
You are back? There is still time to pursue the hunt, human. Will you aid me?
Quickly, be ready. The banthas are in position and will soon stir our restless prey. I hope the mines do their job quickly.
Wait... what is that rumbling sound? Oh boy, he's a big one.
It is done, and the great beast is dead. To my shame, I denied him a final fight, but I will honor his memory to make amends.
You, however, will not. You did nothing against the beast. You will have no share of the kill.
But you didn't so much as damage it! It is atounding I was able to bring it down without your help! You endangered me and yourself with your inaction.
I thank you for your aid, human. You have earned a share of the victory, such as it is.
Will I? I don't think so. You have been given what you are worth. Respect the hunt and leave it at that.
And I will warn you, no words will change my mind. Regardless of the circumstances, respect for the hunt governs me. I will die defending it.
You flatter more than I am worth, given the circumstances. Any technician can place explosives. The only difference is that I feel shame about it.
I thank you for your help here today, human. I shall see you again, I am sure.
Regrettably so. I just hope you remember there were higher reasons for this. Don't let the spoils be your only reason to hunt. Wealth fades. The sands remain.
I thought I would see you out here, human. We are hunters, you and I. Perhaps... we should pool our skills...
I have tracked a very special beast to its lair. A krayt dragon rests within, and tonight he is the hunted, although by unorthodox means.
I have no knowledge of that, but there may be something in there. There are signs that this lair was purposefully dug out.
Krayt are opportunistic, and may have lazily moved into someone else's excavation. Of course, we must remove him to see.
I might very well ask you why you shouldn't? I haven't threatened you, human. I have merely asked you to help me.
Perhaps I should question you. I have said my reason for being out here. I can't be certain you are trustworthy.
You are here, they are not. I also didn't know the size of my quarry until I was tracking him. And perhaps there are... other reasons.
I tried to get the help of one other, but you saw him die in the lair. He lacked experience and, more importantly, patience.
I usually hunt for the skill of it, but must make an exception today. I want newcomers to understand the proper intent behind the hunt, no matter the methods we use.
We each have our reasons. You might select "challenge" or "glory" as your own. "Profit" is also valid.
When bull dragons reach this size it is rumored that they have a number of pearls within them. You would receive a generous share.
Nobody from our lodge has successfully hunted a bull dragon in perhaps a decade. My father may have been the last. His words are what I go by.
That is true, but this is a very critical fight. Bull dragons are rare to see. Rarer still is the apparent size of this one.
It is larger than the one my father felled a decade ago, and he is too far out of his territory and must be dealt with. I might not prevail alone, human, but I must try.
That is too bad. The hunt will have to wait for you. I can't do this alone.
You don't have much choice now. You've already led the banthas into position. The beast will be stirring soon enough.
We must bait the great beast out of hiding and ambush him swiftly. There is no room to engage him in the lair, and his hide will repel blaster fire.
I have placed mines around the mouth of the cave. We must coax him out, but this is the end of his season of hibernation. It will take much to rouse him.
The food of a beast this size is almost exclusively banthas... and foolish hunters, if we are not careful. To lure him out we must lure his food to tempt him.
They too have their food of choice. We must find some bantha fodder to lead the banthas here. I have a few ideas about where this may be found.
Sand People keep bantha herds, so some of them must have fodder on hand or in their settlement. A vendor in Anchorhead also had some. He had a kiosk in the spaceport.
If you find fodder and bait the banthas here, the mines will deal with the dragon as it emerges to feed. Not exactly a glorious hunt, but it will ensure the safety of the region.
What do you mean, human? This task is better attempted together. You won't leave now, will you?
I have spent many years following in the memory of my father. I can't step away from a battle like this.
No words can express my distaste for you. If you intend to take what I worked for, you will have to fight for it.
No, I won't allow you to simply walk away. You could return when I am weak or unsuspecting. I won't allow it.
No we won't. You would simply turn on me at earliest convenience. I won't have that. It's too late for that.
Defend yourself, human! You will die here!
We shall see, human!
I wish you luck against the Sand People. When you return, the dragon will fall. I wish it could be under more sporting circumstances, but we must do what the circumstances call for.
I had hoped for a mirror of my father's expedition, but that will have to wait.
I have spent a long time tracking this creature. Many hunters do not return from such searches. I have earned my place here.
And, if I didn't mention it, I am interested in having new hunters like you understand that even though I must use untraditional methods, the hunted still deserves respect.
I can't attempt this alone. If you won't help, I will have to wait for another hunter to come. The offer stands, if you change your mind.
You have already done what you must. You have intuitively led the banthas to this place. Your skills as a hunter may surpass mine in time.
The natural cycle on Tatooine spans hundreds of years, but there are complications that must be addressed. Complications from our presence.
Krayt dragons feed on banthas. If the numbers of either species fall, the other grows too numerous, and unbalances the cycle.
Now settlers use banthas, so there are less for dragons to eat. This one is moving closer to Anchorhead. Perhaps there will be more, but he is the threat tonight.
Greetings to you, human. I believe I saw you in Anchorhead. I thought I would see you on the dunes. You look like a hunter.
Perhaps you are interested in the ways of the hunt? Will you help me? I have tracked a very special beast to its lair.
A krayt dragon, the largest of the Tatooine desert predators. It is an honored creature to hunt, although we must use unorthodox methods today.
A valid question. This is a very critical fight. Bull dragons are rare to see. Rarer still is the apparent size of this one.
Good job! Come talk to me!
No time to talk with that dragon running around! We can't let it escape now that it's enraged.
I have led the bantha back to this location.
Look, I have your fodder.
I'm tired of running around like this.
I'll see what I can do.
Just do your part.
Don't worry, I'm ready.
I led the thing here! I found the fodder!
I want more. You will give me all of it.
I don't want it. Your skill made it possible.
Thanks. We did what had to be done.
I'm looking for a Star Map. It may be in this dragon's lair.
Why should I trust you?
Why do you want me and not another hunter?
Why would I want to do this?
Rumored? You don't know?
I thought you preferred the solo hunt.
I don't have time for this right now.
I'll help. Give me more information about how.
How will we lead the banthas here?
Thanks for the information. I don't need you anymore.
Leave? No, I'm going to take the kill for myself.
Bah! Then you are no use to me. I'm leaving.
Then we will continue with the hunt.
Then I will cut you down!
I will go find bantha fodder.
Why am I doing most of the legwork?
I'm not interested in this any more.
Why should we kill this great beast?
If it's such an honor, why do you want help?
This bantha is completely disinterested in you.
[This bantha perks up as you approach, obviously attracted to the smell of the fodder you are carrying. The whole herd falls in step.]
I'm tired of waiting, Komad. How big can this dragon of yours be? I'm going in!
What the...! Look at the size of it... Yeaaaarrrgh!!
AAAAHHHHHHH!!!
