Darth Revan has returned to crush Malak the Usurper! All hail Lord Revan, true master of the Sith!
I bow before you, Darth Revan, for you are the true Lord of the Sith.
Hail, Lord Revan! The One has prophesized that you will lead the Rakata back to the ancient glory of our ancestors.
All hail Darth Revan, the Sith Lord reborn! Death to Malak the Usurper!
My scouts have reported a great battle in the compound of the Elders. Tell me, Revan - in your slaughter did you find the book recording the great secrets of the past?
Well done, Revan. But before I will consider your oath fulfilled, I must study this tome. I must see if it truly contains the ancient knowledge I seek.
I will have the guards escort you back here once we have studied the contents of the manuscript you have brought us.
I have studied this tome, Revan. Much of it is beyond me, it speaks often of 'technology' - a form of magic I do not comprehend. But one thing has become clear to me:
All is not lost, Revan. After studying this book I have come to understand that even the Elders themselves did not actually possess the ancient secrets. They were only the guardians.
I now have the rituals to lower the shields, but the Temple is guarded by yet another barrier. Only those with powerful magic - what you call the Force - can pass through the entrance.
Why should we help you to enter where we ourselves can never go? No, you should return to your vessel and leave this planet now.
[Success] You did fulfill your vow and destroy the Red Rakata. And there are none among our tribe who can enter the Temple - you are the only one who can bring the secrets out to us.
If you fail to return, I will have lost nothing: I still have the knowledge gained from the Red Rakata computer. But if you return, I have much to gain.
Yes. You brought this tome to me as you promised. Now I must trust you again. We will help you enter the Temple, and in exchange you will bring forth the great secrets within.
The Temple is a sacred place to the Rakata, its power is bound in ritual and tradition. I have studied the ritual closely.
It is forbidden for more than one to enter the Temple at a time. This is one of the sacred traditions of our ancestors; I will not permit you to defile it.
You have the power to enter the Temple itself, but you cannot lower the energy shields the Elders built around it. Only a Rakata can invoke the ritual chant with the proper intonation.
If you are ready to enter the Temple, we can begin the ritual immediately.
Yes, there is that. Your presence on this world could cause complications. You command the power of the Ancients, there are those among the Rakata who might follow you.
Now that I have the technological knowledge of the Red Rakata you are one of the few who might stand against my tribe. Perhaps it would be best if I were to help you leave this world.
The datapad does make mention of the disruptor field, but it can only be disabled from within the Temple of the Ancients.
You have returned. Do you wish to enter the temple now?
As you wish. Come speak to me and when you are ready to enter the Temple and I will have my priests perform the ritual.
But remember: when the time comes you must enter the Temple alone, in accordance with the traditions of the ancient Rakata.
Remember: in accordance with ancient Rakata tradition you must enter the Temple alone. My priests will meet you at the shield's edge to perform the ritual.
Revan. Somehow I knew we would meet again. Even when you vanished, I knew you would not forget the vow you swore to me.
And when my scouts told me of a great warrior from the sky slaughtering our raiding parties with mysterious powers and magics, I knew you had at last returned!
The power of the Ancients cannot twist my mind, Revan! I am Rakata, not one of the weak-willed slave species! Tell me why our enemy still lives or our rancor war beasts will destroy you!
[Failure] No, Revan! We trusted you last time and you betrayed us! Why, Revan? Explain yourself: why does our enemy still live?
Your words are confusing. I recognize you: you are the one called Revan. You are the one who came here before; you and Malak, the one who served you.
You promised to slay our enemy. In exchange for our aid you swore to destroy the Elders and bring us their secrets. Are you saying this means nothing to you now?
I believe you, Revan. I sense there is something different about you. Something that has changed. You are not the same as you were before.
Yet the power of magic - what you call the Force - is within you still. You can still destroy the Elders and fulfill your vow!
But in exchange for your life you must fulfill the oath you swore to us before. You must slay the Red Rakatan tribe.
Force you? No, Revan - we were allies working to a common goal! It was you who suggested we forge our alliance.
I suppose that if what you say is true - that you cannot remember when you were last here - then you must have many questions. Very well, Revan.
I will help you to understand. And then you will destroy the Elders tribe and fulfill the oath you swore to us long ago.
Yes, I suppose that is true. I will start at the beginning, with our first meeting.
You arrived with Malak - your servant - three of your galactic standard years ago. My scouts saw your sky ship plummet to the earth and they went to loot the crash site.
They tried to take you prisoner, but you unleashed your magic - what you called the Force - upon them. Seeing your power they bowed before you and brought you here to me.
You used your power to rip the Rakata language from my mind, even as you drove Basic into our skulls so we could help you in your quest to find something called the 'Star Forge'.
But the answers you sought lay within the Temple of the Ancients, and we could not help you enter the Temple. The Elders alone hold its secrets, guarding them with their very lives.
[Success] I see you that you have changed much since our last meeting. I am confident you will not betray us this time.
The compound of the Elders is to the south, beyond the Temple of the Ancients. From torturing the few Elders we have captured, we know something of what lies beyond the gates.
The Elders are few in number. If you can get past the exterior defenses, you could surely slaughter them all. Then you can bring us back the knowledge they guard.
There was one prisoner, an Elder who's mind broke beneath our tortures. He raved of ancient rituals, of lost power and forgotten secrets! Unfortunately, most of his dying screams made no sense.
Yet in his last hours he spoke of a book; an ancient tome that recorded the most powerful knowledge of the Elders, and detailed the rituals that could unleash the secrets.
That I cannot help you with. Although we have recovered many strange devices from the sky ships that crash to the earth, their use is a mystery to us.
The Elders guard the ancient secrets. Within their compound is the knowledge of power and magic; including the knowledge of how to enter the Temple itself.
I have lost many warriors storming the gates of their compound, but they use weapons of light and fire against us, and not even our war beasts are strong enough to breach their defenses.
Sometimes we can capture an Elder when they venture forth from their compound, and we have learned something about them. That is how we know they guard the ancient secrets.
But no matter what tortures we inflict upon them, they will not reveal their secrets to us. They fear the knowledge they themselves guard, and they will never willingly surrender it to us.
I know nothing of this disruptor field, but throughout the history of our tribe ships have fallen from the sky. It has always been this way; though in recent generations it has become more frequent.
We have little understanding of such magic to make metal fly, but my scouts rush to take whatever we can carry from the crash sites in the hopes we may one day unlock these secrets.
This was how we acquired our rancor war beasts. Several very young specimens were recovered from a crashed vessel. We raised them to adulthood, training and breeding them to be loyal beasts of war.
We thought the war beasts would allow us to destroy the Red Rakata tribe, but our enemy has a weapon to use against the rancor. That was why we needed you to destroy the Red Rakata for us.
They use grenades filled with gas that kills our beasts but does no harm to the handlers. The Red Rakata have many powerful weapons, though they are inferior warriors.
It is this technology - the weapons of our ancestors - that you must bring me from the Red Rakata tribe. With it we will finally be able to wipe them from the face of our planet.
There is little I can tell you about the Temple. I know the secrets of our ancestors are contained within, but the Temple itself is barred to us.
But only the Elders know how to bypass the barrier that surrounds it. Destroy them and bring back their secrets to us, and we will help you enter the Temple. That was our agreement.
Whether you found some other way into the Temple I cannot say. All that matters to me is that you did not fulfill your vow. The Red Rakata still live.
That was the only tome I found in the Elder's compound.
So you will help me enter the Temple?
Looks like we still need each other.
[Persuade/Lie] I will bring you back knowledge from the Temple.
I'm not going into the Temple without help!
Forget it! I'll find my own way into the Temple.
I see I have no choice. Okay, I'll go into the Temple alone.
I will go into the Temple alone.
Why do I have to go in alone?
I can't leave until I shut off the disruptor field inside the Temple.
I still need to shut off the disruptor field around this planet.
No, I'm not ready yet.
I'm ready to enter the Temple now.
[Force Persuade] You want to help me. I am your friend.
[Persuade/Lie] I'll destroy your enemy soon. But first I need to ask you some questions.
I'm not Revan anymore. That part of me is gone. I'm <FullName> now.
I have no clue what you are talking about.
I'm sorry, but I don't remember any of this.
My mind was destroyed. My memories were lost.
You can't force me to kill your enemies!
I will help you, but first you must answer my questions.
Temple of the Ancients? I still don't remember anything.
I'm going to need some information if you want me to succeed.
You should probably start with the last time I was here.
[Persuade/Lie] I will kill the Elders and bring you their secrets!
I'll be back after I kill the Elders.
I don't see any other choice, so I'll help you.
I need parts to repair my ship.
Tell me more about the Elders.
You say my ship crashed. Was it because of the disruptor field?
What kind of weapon can stop a rancor?
Tell me about the Temple of the Ancients.

Who dares intrude on our meditations? You know the penalty for... Revan - you are back!
We have sworn allegiance to Malak. He has led the Sith to conquest and victory. Your time is over, Revan!
Malak told us what happened to you. The Jedi Council has stripped you of your power. You are a shell of what you once were!
You are not fit to rule the Sith anymore, Revan. Darth Malak will reward us greatly for destroying you!
Yes, the true Sith Lord has returned! Now bow before me!
I am Revan no longer. I serve the light and the Jedi Council now!
Zzzz...
Back again? I know my Master sent you, but I'm supposed to be resting and recovering. It will take time for the Kolto to repair the damage. *sigh* What do you want?
How may I serve you, Lord Revan?
Please, don't hurt me! I'm injured and unarmed! I can't even get out of this bed!
NO! Please, somebody help me!
I'm just one of the Sith apprentices - nobody important. I was injured when my Master sent me and two other apprentices out to investigate a ship that crashed here recently.
We didn't find the ship, but we stumbled across one of those rancors. It wasn't even full grown, but it took all three of us to bring it down.
None of us escaped unscathed, but I got the worst of it. The beast snapped my spine in the battle - I can't even walk anymore!
I have a broken back, remember? I can't walk. But if you want you could up my kolto dosage. That'll knock me cold for at least six hours. You don't have to hurt me or anything.
Since my Master sent you I guess I can answer your questions. What do you want to know?
Remember - tell my Master that I answered all your questions. I want to stay on his good side.
Good. The pain in my back is getting pretty bad, anyway. You'll actually be doing me a favor.
Lord Revan, I only followed Malak because I thought you were dead. But you are the Master I swore allegiance to. I will not betray you!
I will not betray you, Lord Revan. It is physically impossible for me, in any case. My injuries are so severe it will be weeks before I can leave this bed.
You think I'm gonna tell you all the Sith secrets just because I'm crippled? You won't get anything out of me!
[Success] My Master sent you? I guess it would be okay to answer your questions, then. What do you want to know?
I don't know much about the Star Forge, but I hear it has something to do with this temple. Maybe there might be information on it in the library down on the lower level.
I... I don't know. I swear. I'm just an apprentice. Why would they tell me anything like that?

I'll tell you whatever you want to know! Just don't hurt me, please. Haven't I suffered enough as it is?

[Success] I'll tell you whatever you want to know! Just don't hurt me, please. Haven't I suffered enough as it is?

I'll be going now.

I need some information.

Where can I get information on the Star Forge?

Revan! Lord Malak told us you still lived. At last - a challenge worthy of my skills. I grow so bored with slaughtering these mindless training droids.
I intensified my training ten fold in the hopes I would get the chance to face you in mortal combat! I am glad to see my training has not been in vain.

I'm surprised the Jedi Council let you live after all you did. But I won't make that same mistake; my pets will make short work of you!
I am the Dark Lord - not Malak! Bow down before me!

You are stronger than I would have thought possible, after what the Jedi Council did to you. Seems that Malak was wrong - the power of the dark side is not lost to you after all, Revan.
Yes, Revan! I was there when you almost died in the trap set by the Jedi Council; I used the Force to preserve your life. We are forever linked by my actions on that bridge.
The Council tried to exploit our bond. They hoped your memories would lead me to the Star Forge. But in our shared visions of the Star Maps I also tasted the power of the taint within you!
You can deny what you are, Revan, but you are only fooling yourself. I know the truth. I have seen the shadows inside your mind.
Remember: I was there when you nearly died in the trap set by the Jedi Council. I used the Force to preserve your life, Revan. We are forever linked by my actions on that bridge!
Do not mistake the power of the Force for love, Revan. It does not exist. Power is what forged our bond, and power is what made us both tools of the Jedi Council!
Our bond is not easily broken, Revan. Even when your mind was destroyed and reprogrammed with a new identity the bond between us endured.
These are not your true feelings, Revan. You are speaking as a tool of the Jedi Council - as I once did. But now I see how the Jedi used us both!
The Council tried to exploit the bond between us. They hoped I would draw out your memories to lead them to the Star Forge. We were slaves to their will - like all who follow the Jedi Code!
But in our shared visions of the Star Maps I also felt the so called taint within you. I resisted it at first, but now I embrace the power of the dark side - your dark side!
Of course not! I have been reborn in the wake of destiny... *your* destiny! The power of the dark side is yours by right!
Mistakes? No, Revan - the only mistake you are making is the one you are making now! You deny yourself the power that is yours by right! Only now do I realize how strong you are.
You deserve to be the true Master of the Sith, not Malak. I see this now. Together we can destroy your old apprentice. Join with me and reclaim your lost identity!
Your mind was too badly damaged to ever fully restore your memories, Revan. But your power, your strength of will, the essence of who and what you are: these things still remain!
Once long ago you defied the Jedi Council, freeing yourself from their control. You claimed your rightful title of Dark Lord of the Sith. Together we can defeat Malak and take back what is yours!
It is your power that will keep me as your loyal apprentice, Revan. I swore allegiance to Malak only because I thought you had lost the power you once wielded.
But you have proven yourself in our battle; I see you possess the strength to destroy Malak and reclaim the mantle of Dark Lord. Now I see you will make a worthy Sith Master.
No! This is the way of the dark side! Do not give in to the anger and hatred!
No! Don't give into your anger. Remain calm, remain focused. Don't let her twist your mind like this!
You are a pathetic fool, Revan! Together we could have defeated Malak and ruled over an Empire, but now I will be at Lord Malak's side instead!
You will be crushed with the Republic and all the fools who bow down to the Jedi Council! No one can stand against the power of the Star Forge and the Sith fleet!
I need deny my passions no longer, Revan. I would stand by your side gladly, as your lover and apprentice!
I swore allegiance to Malak only because I thought you had lost the power you had once wielded. But this... this would be much better.
I would be utterly yours, master! Together we would destroy Malak and you would reclaim the mantle of Dark Lord!
No! Do not walk down this path... it can only lead to destruction! I know of what I speak!
Shut up, Juhani! You know nothing of the dark side's true potential! When you felt its touch you fled to a cave and cowered in terror!
I have no wish to fight you and Bastila, but if you choose to walk down this path you know I must stand against you... even at the cost of my life.
Listen to me... the dark side leads to death and destruction. I've seen the horrors the Sith have unleashed on the galaxy. Turn away from this path.
Shut up, old man. Your time is over! The age of the Jedi and the Republic is no more! This is the age of Darth Revan and the Sith!
Don't do this, kid. I don't want to, but I'll fight you if I have to. Even if it costs me my life.
Yes! The sacrificial blood will consecrate this ancient temple in the name of the Sith! With the death of the Jedi the rebirth of Darth Revan will be complete!
I'm a Jedi... I'll never bow down to the Sith. If you go through with this I have no choice but to do battle against you.
Kill him! Grind his old bones to dust! Show him the fate of all who dare stand against us! Embrace the dark side!
A true Jedi will never bow down to the Sith. If this is your decision I have no choice but to do battle against you.
Kill her! Rend her flesh! Show her the fate of all who dare stand against us! Embrace the power of the dark side!
It's not to late for you, Bastila. The dark side is evil but it isn't all powerful. You can still fight against it. Don't let it consume you.
You are beneath my contempt, old man! You hid like a coward for decades on Kashyyyk! You know nothing about the true potential of the Force!
Bastila, it is not too late for you to be saved. The teachings of the Jedi can lead you from the dark side back into the light and a true understanding of the Force.
You are beneath my contempt, Juhani. When you felt the power of the dark side you fled to a cave like some cowering animal! You know nothing of the Force or its true potential!
But you, Revan - the power of the dark side is yours to command! You can use it to destroy Malak! With my help you could rule over the entire galaxy!
I... I don't. The only Revan I could respect is one who would break free of the Council's slavery. One who would grasp the power that lies before him... not the weak fool I see.
Revan - I knew you'd come for me. Malak thought you might be afraid to enter the Temple again, but he doesn't know you like I do. Not anymore. Not since you've changed.
Come on, Bastila. We have to escape before Malak shows up!
Quickly, Bastila - come with us! We have to escape before Malak arrives!
Escape? You don't understand. I have sworn allegiance to Lord Malak and the Sith; I am no longer a pawn of the Jedi Council.
Surely you know what I mean, Revan. Look at what the Council did to you; they turned you into their puppet. The same thing they do to all who are truly strong in the Force.
You say that as if the dark side is some terrible entity. The Jedi Council has brainwashed you like all the others. Like they once did with me.

They speak of the dark side as if it something to be feared. But in reality their only goal is to manipulate those who are strong in the Force. The fear of the dark side is a tool to maintain control.
Why do you think the Jedi forbid you and Malak from joining the Mandalorian Wars? They knew you would realize your true potential and break free of their domination.
Malak has shown me how the Jedi Council have been using me the same way they once tried to use you. They've been holding me back because they knew one day I would surpass them all.
I resisted at first. I endured the Sith torments with the passionless serenity of a true Jedi, emptying my mind. But after a week of endless tortures I finally saw the truth.
Malak forced me to acknowledge my anger and pain. He showed me the liberating power of these emotions. Then he made me see how the Jedi Council has denied me what is mine by right!
The Jedi Council gladly used my Battle Meditation in their wars, but they still treated me like a child - like an inferior. They were jealous of my power... of what I could become!
They wanted me to bow and call them Master and follow their Code and obey their every order. But all the while they were exploiting my Battle Meditation for their own use!
A pity the power you once had is so diluted in you. You could have been strong as I am now... stronger, even. But that will never happen, now.
With the power of the Star Forge Malak will destroy the Republic and conquer the galaxy. And I will be the apprentice at his side - after I prove my worth by killing you!
You used to be Revan, Master of the Sith, but no longer. You are simply a pawn of the Jedi Council and the Republic they serve... like I was until Malak freed me from their shackles!
Lies? You are the one living a lie, Revan. The Jedi Council made you into something you are not; they programmed you to be their slave.
You think so, do you? You style yourself the Master of the Sith that you once were? To think I once envied you your passion, your power.
You are a sad little fool. You speak as if I were the same Bastila that you've known all along. But freed from the control of the Jedi Council I've become much, much more.
I almost wish you could see things as I do now. I wish you could join me and taste true power once again. Sadly, I doubt you are even capable any longer.
Now you see the power of the true Dark Lord!
Don't call me that. I'm not Revan anymore. I'm <FullName> now.
I draw my power from the light now, Bastila.
We are linked by more than just a bond, Bastila.
There is no link between us, Bastila! Not anymore!
That is how I know you will come back to the light.
Then why don't we join our power together, as it was meant to be?
If I am so powerful, then why do you serve another master?
What are you saying, Bastila?
No! This isn't the Bastila I knew!
Learn from my mistakes. It is not too late to come back to the light!
How can I reclaim my identity if I can't even remember it?
I'm not Revan anymore. I don't even remember those days.
How do I know you won't betray me?
I don't trust you. I think I'll just kill you instead!
No, I... don't want you like this. I want the woman I knew.
Yes! Together we can rule the galaxy!
You... you're right. I cannot do this. I reject the dark side!
Then you must die!
I am the Lord of the Sith! Bow down before me!
Death to the Jedi!
No, I will not kill my friend. I reject the power of the dark side.
Turn away from this path, Bastila. The dark side leads only to destruction.
The Dark Lord Revan is dead. I am a servant of the light now.
I don't want to rule the galaxy. I want you to return to the light.
Please, Bastila... if you feel anything for me, you won't do this!
A pawn of the Jedi Council? What are you talking about?
No, Bastila! Don't go over to the dark side!
It didn't take long to convert you, did it? I always knew you were weak!
If you've fallen under Malak's control you must die!
I am Revan, the Dark Lord! Bow down to me, Bastila!
Don't be lured in by these Sith lies, Bastila!
I like this side of you, Bastila. Now we can truly be together.
Don't do this, Bastila! Fight it! I'll help you!
It's not too late, Bastila! You can still turn away from the dark side!
No - I don't believe it! How could you betray us like this, Bastila?
Hold on - you have to disable the energy shield around this Temple before we can leave. I saw a computer up here. It might be connected to the power generators of this place.
And if you don't disable the disruptor field protecting the Star Forge, the Ebon Hawk won't be able to leave the planet without crashing.
You will have to disable the energy shield around this temple before we can leave. There is a computer here on the Temple summit that has access to the power generators.
You can also use it to disable the disruptor field that protects the Star Forge. Otherwise, the Ebon Hawk will not be able to leave the planet without crashing.

We... we shouldn't have done that. It was wrong. The Jedi aren't allowed to fall in love.
It was... it was a moment of weakness. When I kissed you... we shouldn't have... no, I'm sorry.
I know we both wanted it, but we shouldn't have given in to our desire. We're Jedi! We can't act like this. Not now, not while we still have to deal with Malak!
I'm... I'm sorry. I don't blame you, but... it was a mistake. I have to get out of here before somebody sees us together!
Oh, my!
Why do you think I came to this decision? I know how hard this is for both of us! You just kept pressing forward, so I had to be the one to step up and do the right thing!
But Malak must be stopped, my own feelings are nothing when compared to that. Yet I know this could affect the sake of our mission if it is not resolved - I can't let that happen!
What I have been trying to tell you is that I've reached a decision. But this is not the proper place for this discussion. I think... I think we should have some privacy for this.
We can talk about this the next time we return to the Ebon Hawk.
I think... I think we should have some privacy for this. Come with me.
Part of my purpose on this mission was to guide you in the way of the light; to help you avoid the temptations of the dark side. But I fear I've failed in that task.
No, I suppose you don't. At this point I imagine I'm doing you more harm than good.
You're like no man I've known before. And you're nothing like what I expected you to be after... after the Council sent us on this mission together.
I... I need time to think about all this. Things are... they are not going as I thought they would.
We should... we should continue on with our mission, for now.
Yes, of course. You're right. I... I have to remember my training. The Masters know well the corrupting influence of the dark side, although it is hard for me to imagine.
But enough soul searching for now. We should probably continue on with our mission.
But maybe it's time to change that. You deserve to know how much I respect and admire you. I had to tell you how much I care for you. As a friend, of course.
Please, it's... it's not allowed. I have to remain true to the Jedi ideal. If this is going to cause a problem maybe... maybe I shouldn't have said anything.
Besides, the events on Taris proved that the Force wanted to bring us together for this mission, and there is little left to chance when the Force is involved. Is that not enough for you?
I wondered if the Council wanted to see how I would help and guide you on our quest. I wondered if they were testing me to see if I was ready to become a Jedi Master myself.
And then I realized how foolish such thoughts were. As the Council explained, sending a Master in our group would only have drawn unwanted attention from the Sith.
The fate of the galaxy is at stake, the Council would not risk it merely to test me. They calculated the risks and in the end chose the only option available.
I said we were brought together for our mission: to stop Malak. I hardly think the Force would be pushing us towards a romantic involvement when the fate of the galaxy is at stake!
Please try to stay focused. I doubt the Council would approve if they knew we were busy discussing our mutual attraction when we should be saving the galaxy from Malak.
Finding the missing pieces of the Star Maps is our only hope of locating the Star Forge and defeating Malak. The Council explained all this quite clearly.
Mutual attraction? I never said... it's just an expression! Whatever our feelings... uh, I mean... whatever *your* feelings, you have to try to ignore them. Don't let this complicate things.
You never give up, do you? I admit I'm interested in you. I find you intriguing. Compelling, even. But it's not what you think.
You have a great gift. You have an awesome command of the Force, and I tremble when I think of how you might misuse it.
What? I... no! No, of course not! Not like that, anyway. In many ways you are... you are dangerous. You could be the savior of the galaxy; or you could bring untold destruction upon us all.
A lecture won't be much use if you aren't prepared to listen. I suppose it would be best if we didn't speak about this for a while. Let's just return to our mission for now.
You are easily the vainest, most arrogant man I have ever met! Besides, I know you can't be serious, since I was purposefully *not* staring in your direction.
An amusing description, but hardly the truth. We both know the real reason you have some idea of what I am thinking: the bond we share.
I only hope I will have the wisdom to help you through the dark times. But for now, we should return to our mission.
My thoughts remain hidden, including whatever my feelings are for you. Uh... I mean whatever I feel *about* you... uh... I mean whatever I *think* about you.
I... that is, you... Why must you be so impossibly infuriating?! You know very well what I'm really talking about. I'm referring to the bond between us; the one the Jedi Council spoke of.
I suppose I'll just have to speak to you again later. Hopefully you'll be a little more... mature.
I suppose I'll just have to speak to you again later. Hopefully you'll behave a little less like a little boy and a little more like a... like a man!
But I imagine you've had enough questions for a while. So many things have happened to you since Taris. It's probably a lot for you to absorb.
We can speak again later, after you've had time to think about all this.
Don't worry, these are simple questions. Nothing too intrusive. First, what kind of background do you have?
Touched a nerve, no. Getting on my nerves, most definitely. I suppose this is what you men consider being witty. *sigh*
Now, are you going to answer my questions? Or would you rather just keep annoying me?
Please! I'm a Jedi. Such feelings, such attractions, are... well, they're beneath me, quite frankly.
I admit, I find you intriguing. Uh... I mean, I find your command of the Force intriguing. But my interest in you is purely academic. Surely you can understand why.
You also avoided detection by the Sith, discovered I was a Vulkar prisoner, gained sponsorship for the race and became the Taris swoop champion. That's quite a resume.
Your modesty is admirable. But though others helped, you were the catalyst for these events.
Yes, I can see you do not lack in ability; although modesty is another matter.
Perhaps. But the Force works through all of us to some degree or another. There are some individuals outside the Jedi Order that we considered 'Force Sensitive'.
The Force is in all of us, though for most people it is a barely measurable whisper. But there are some individuals outside the Jedi Order that we considered 'Force Sensitive'.
It is obvious to me that the Force has been working through you. There is no other explanation for your great success, though I am not certain what to make of this discovery.
Perhaps if you weren't - well, if you were younger the Jedi might take you for training. But as it is...
Ah, yes, the rescue again. Very well. For what it's worth, I conceed the point to you: you rescued me from Brejik. And yet we're still stuck on here on Taris.
I'm sorry; I've overstepped my authority. I'm speaking of things that are best left to the Jedi Council. For now let's just accept the fact that you are... gifted.
Hopefully between your abilities, my Jedi training and the skills of our companions we can find a way off this planet.
Actually, your presence at the swoop track is what I'm curious about. It couldn't have been an easy task to find me there. Yet somehow you managed.
I want to talk to you about what happened between us.
So that's it? It's all over?
That's okay - I never felt anything for you anyway.
Great - you learn a lesson and I get dumped!
I... I understand, Bastila.
You're rationalizing, Bastila. You're just scared to face the truth!
I'm going to stop Malak, Bastila. But I want to do it with you at my side.
You don't always have to be strong, Bastila. Give in just this once.
You know I'm right, Bastila.
I love you Bastila. And I know you love me.
We're not going back to this again, are we?
It didn't feel wrong to me.
Shut up and kiss me, you babbling fool.
So I was just a stepping stone to you becoming a Master?
This is nothing but an excuse! You're afraid to face your feelings!
Difficult for you? What about me?
If you have something to say, just say it!
Just give in to your feelings, Bastila. I know you want to.
So no you'll finally leave me alone for good?
You aren't my teacher, Bastila. We're supposed to help each other.
We're made for each other, Bastila. You have to see that.
You have to trust in the wisdom of the Jedi Code.
We could be more than friends, Bastila.
No, I'm glad you did. I care for you too, Bastila. As a friend.
I'm still not convinced.
I guess that makes sense.
You're right. I suppose we should get back to the mission now.
If the Force wants us to be together, why do you keep resisting my undeniable charms?
I'm sorry, Bastila. I know our mission is important.
Mutual attraction? I knew you were interested in me!
I think we both know the real reason you've been watching me.
I won't misuse my power, Bastila.
I make you tremble? Do you get all tingly inside, too?
You never tried to get in touch with your father again?
Spare me the lecture. I'm not in the mood.
I don't see how falling in love could lead to the dark side, though.
Well, you keep staring at me. See anything you like?
You have feelings for me?
You're so cute when you're embarrassed.
I don't like being manipulated!
Okay, I'll answer a few questions.
Whoa, guess I touched a nerve there, huh?
Uh... the second one.
I think you're interested in more than just the 'bond' between us.
I had a lot of help: Carth, Mission, Zaalbar.
What can I say? I'm a talented individual.
I think you're underestimating us non-Jedi.
Are you trying to say I can control the Force?
I don't want to talk about this anymore.
Be glad I'm Force sensitive, or I couldn't have rescued you.
What are you trying to say?
Oh, you can tell, can you?
Oh, yeah? Well listen, beautiful, I don't need to take this abuse. I get enough female Jedi bashing from Bastila, thank you very much.
What?! No! I mean... no! Don't be crazy!
Was there ever any doubt?
What? You must be joking. I'd be lucky not to get my eyeballs seared out of their sockets.
Oh no you don't! I'd have to shoot you down first, and I'm not kidding.
You think so? I could probably get the same kind of attention from a blaster rifle.
Ha! No, wait, wait, don't go. Not just yet.
Now *that* I'd like to see. Or would I? You've got my damn head on backwards, you know that?
Wouldn't you like to know. Just you wait, sister.
Uh. *That* is one bet I'm not about to take. Not a chance.
Anyway... as fun, uh, as this is, I do have to talk to you about something serious. Really serious. Uh, is this a good time?
And just what would you do if I wasn't? No, no, wait, don't answer that. I don't want to know.
Err... I'm not that bad, am I?
Damn it, woman, if you keep hounding me I'm going to put you over my knee and teach you a lesson!
You just wait, you'll get yours.
At any rate, I wasn't ogling you. I've just been admiring you.
Oh, no, I'm not even going there, sister.
No, no, I didn't mean it that way.
I had... had nothing left after that, really. I devoted myself to the fleet. Hunting Saul was my only purpose.
She had courage... and she was stubborn. Heh... a little bit like you in that respect. I could never talk her out of anything once she put her mind to it.
Oh? I don't know if I like the sound of that...
So... you do accept my apology. Huh. Good. Good. I'm glad.
You know you, uh... you aren't so bad to have around, you know that?
Right. Off we go.
More than that. But... anyway... we should be off...
I don't know. What am I going to have to do for it?
I...heh, I really think that we should, ah... get going.
I'm sorry. I'm glad things are better between us, now. We should... we should go.
Oh, the usual. Well that's not so hard. Let's get to it, then, shall we?
Well, damn it, I want to know why that is! I want some questions answered!
Well... yeah, true enough, I guess. But, damn it, I'm tired of nobody telling me anything!
I'm not trying to provoke you or imply that you're somehow responsible for the Jedi Council... but give me a hand, here! There has to be a reason!
No, I don't... I didn't mean that you weren't wanted, or that I want to go! It's just... damn it!
Look, I didn't mean it that way. I want to get to Saul, not... no... no, forget it. It seems all I can do is insult you, isn't it?
Just forget I said anything. Let's... let's... just get on with what we were doing.
I would be more than happy to, but she's as close-mouthed as the rest of the Council. I'm hoping you'll be the one to enlighten me.
Very cute. If you got any cuter, you'd pass for a Gamorrean's sister.
Look, I'm serious. No one seems to want to tell me anything, and it's starting to irritate me.
With good reason. Admiral Saul Karath is the commander of the entire Sith fleet. He's half the reason Malak has done so well in the war.
I didn't want to, maybe. Are you so sure you would have?
Well... there's more to the story, I guess.
Listen, sister... just because we're working together does not mean you get to badger me with constant questions!
Blast it if you aren't the most frustrating woman to talk to! Isn't there someone else you can harass for a little while?
Wait... *sigh* I didn't mean it that way. Don't go, damn it.
Look, I suppose I... could use someone to talk to. I'm just not used to it. And I don't know why you're so interested. But here goes.
Oh no, I'm not falling for that one. I wasn't born yesterday, you know.
I... *sigh* Okay, I give up. You win.
What? Me? What did I do?
Heh heh. Well I might be willing to take you up on that challenge. But uh, you're just not going to let up, are you? Fine... you want to know why I don't trust anyone? Here goes.
You do? Fair enough. What do you want to discuss?
Well, that's too bad, then, because it's not going to change.
Not all of us have the luxury of a choice. I'm conditioned this way, sorry.
I don't need to be analyzed, thanks. Can we just get back to business?
No, I don't want to talk about it. What I want is to save the galaxy... if that's even possible.
It's not what I want. I have a duty and I intend to see it through. The galaxy's in danger and I want to save it... that's what I want!
And I don't need all these questions. What I do need is to try and save the galaxy, if that's even possible.
Why is whether or not I trust you or anyone so damned important to you? Why... why do you even care?
We don't have time for this, so can we please just... drop it. For now? Can we pick it up later if you really must, I... want to get underway.
Is that your idea of an insult? Come on, sister, take your best shot.
Oh, ouch. I think you hurt my man-feelings with that one.
Wouldn't think of it. Feel better now?
I guess I did. Feel better now?
*Sigh* Look... all I mean is that if you're smart, you won't trust anyone... not me, not Bastila and especially not yourself.
Good. Then maybe we can talk reasonably about this.
All I've been trying to say is that this isn't personal. If you were smart, you wouldn't trust anyone, either... not me, not Bastila and especially not yourself.
You're probably one of the most skilled women I've ever met. You've saved my butt more than once and I'm lucky you're here to help me, no question.
I guess I did say you could ask me questions later, didn't I? Is this really necessary?
Pretty snappy with the orders, are we? Okay, you got it... sir.
Oh no, how can I resist a challenge to my manly pride, huh? Ha ha! Fine, you've made your point. Interrogate at will.
All my secrets are purely of the mundane variety, unfortunately. Nothing worth extracting, though you're welcome to try.
Let me ask you something first, though. I've been going through the battle aboard the Endar Spire over and over in my head since we crashed.
Some things just don't add up for me. Maybe you could tell me what happened... from your perspective.
Look... it has nothing to do with you, personally. I don't trust anyone, and I have my reasons.
And, no, I'm not going to discuss them. So can we just keep our mind on more important things?
Good. Like I said before, I prefer action to talk, anyway.
Alright, Alright. You're pretty damned tenacious, you know that?
We'll talk about it... but later. Right now I just want to get going.
Alright, alright. You must be the most damned persistent woman I've ever met.
If I was, you wouldn't have to ask. So don't worry about it.
I don't get testy. I get angry. And if I was angry, you wouldn't have to ask me if I was, let me assure you.
No, I was just joking, though you do seem to be full of questions. It's rather refreshing, to be honest.
Oh. Well, if it's an interrogation you wanted, why didn't you say so?
No. No, I don't have a problem with it, really. Go ahead and interrogate me.
I'm all ears, beautiful.
Maybe I'm just avoiding your questions. Is this really necessary?
Which? The fact that I'm all ears or the beautiful part?
Not really. Just a habit. You have something you'd rather I call you by?
Heh heh. A little bit touchy, are we? Is there something else you'd prefer I called you?
I might consider it. What are you going to call me, in exchange?
I like the first part of that. I'm a bit more partial to "the most handsome pilot in the galaxy". What do you think?
Well, then, I guess "gorgeous" will have to do until then, won't it?
Kidding aside, I bet you're not about to give up on those questions of yours. Are they really necessary?
Don't get yourself in a twist over it, gorgeous. I didn't mean anything by it.
All business today, eh? Are these questions really necessary?
Oh, for crying out -- fine. If it'll make you feel better, you call me something. Go ahead, come on, I can take it.
Is that it? You can do better than that!
Ouch. Heh heh heh. That *is* better. Well, I bet "beautiful" doesn't sound so bad in comparison now, does it?
Guilty as charged. I'll bet you still have those questions in mind, though. Are they really necessary?
Stubborn as ever. Okay, you got me. I bet you have your heart set on those questions. Are they really necessary?
What? Are you afraid you'll hurt my feelings? Come on, spit it out. You can do it.
Is there something else you'd prefer I called you?
You're the one who wanted to know more about me. Well this is it, this is what I am.
I know that. I'm not angry at you... don't think that. I must not be making much sense.
You probably mean well with your questions. I'm just not accustomed to talking about my past very much. At all, actually.
I know. Don't worry about it. I just... must not be making much sense.
I just can't believe he's dead. I... you should have stopped him! You should have done something to prevent this!
Oh, don't give me that innocent look! You can talk a Hutt out of his credits, you could have found a way... you could have saved him!
He was my son!!
I... I wish we hadn't come. I wish I'd never found him.
No. If it did, I would never have met you.
No, I did fail him. And so did you. I wish I'd never met you.
I'm sorry, too. And I'm sorry I ever met you.
I... no, I didn't mean that. Please... maybe it would be better if we continued with the mission. I want to... take my mind off this.
Saving the galaxy is what's important now. My son... I can mourn my son later. When we're done. So... let's just go.
Is it? You seem just fine at pulling off the near-impossible... when you want to.
Why didn't you want to? You knew how important finding Dustil was to me! You... you've helped others, why not him? Why not me?
All the blame? No. Part of the blame, though... part of the blame is yours. The rest is mine.
You could have. But... you're only partly to blame. I'm to blame for all the rest.
I can't help but wonder if part of you didn't enjoy this. I thought we might be friends, but with you... heh, who can tell?
No, I see that. I don't know what I was expecting, telling you all I did. The blame is mostly mine for this, anyway.
Is it? I find it hard to tell which side you're on, sometimes. Still... not all the blame is yours. Most of it is mine.
I don't understand.
It doesn't take Jedi powers to read a man, believe me.
Well, your mouth keeps opening. That's a sign, I think.
Oh. So there's something between you and Bastila.
So I'm crazy now, am I?
I've seen the way you look at her.
So someone would be crazy to like Bastila? I'll have to tell her that.
You love the attention. Admit it.
Good idea. I'll go get one.
Oh, I think there's things I can do that a blaster can't.
I could leave you alone with one, if you prefer.
Don't like it, huh? What are you going to do about it?
Bring it on, flyboy. I bet I take you down.
Sure, sure. You're all talk, Carth.
I can. Do you need to talk?
You've been keeping something to yourself?
It means a lot to me, Carth. Thank you.
If you were any more obvious, your eyes would fall out of your head.
Relax, Carth, I'm teasing you.
I'd still like to know what you see that interests you.
Hah! I'd like to see you try!
Is that a promise?
Not for a monkey-lizard, no. Not bad at all.
I'm blind, now, am I?
Oh, I get it. You think I'm stupid, right?
I mean that's a damn poor excuse for an apology.
I do, if that's alright with you.
What happened after that?
I don't know. Maybe you should work for it, a bit.
No need to start sweating, Carth. I was only teasing.
I have my uses. Let's go.
I knew there was a reason we kept you.
I know. I'm very charming, I'm told.
Don't you want me to accept your apology?
Just a little kiss. How about it?
I was only joking, Carth, relax.
No kiss, then?
Just make sure you don't need to make any more apologies. Deal?
Blow away the bad guy. Save the damsel in distress. The usual.
Yes, here I am. And I'm not going anywhere.
I have more of a purpose here than you do, flyboy.
Same could be said for you.
Why don't you ask Bastila?
You were born out of the loop.
Better than a Gamorrean's mother.
The things you say!
That name sounds familiar.
How could you have not seen through that?
I'd do the same thing in your shoes.
That's terrible. I feel awful for you.
I'm not going to repeat myself, Carth, You owe me.
You're damn right it does.
Do we have another problem, now?
Well, I wouldn't want you to feel harassed. Have it your way.
What exactly is it about me that frustrates you?
Alright, then, I'll leave you alone if that's what you want.
And you say I'm frustrating to deal with.
Really? It's hard to tell.
*I'm* frustrating? Look who's talking!
Never mind. I'll leave you alone, since I'm so frustrating.
You don't know? Typical male.
Oh, that's rich. Where have you been?
I can make you talk, Carth. Trust me.
I'd like to know now if we have a problem.
We didn't finish our conversation last time.
I want to talk about these issues you seem to have with me.
No, I do take it personally!
I wouldn't want to live like that.
Pretty pithy advice, I see.
Ahhh... so you don't trust yourself, is that it?
You sure you don't want to talk about it?
So leave. Be on your own, it's obviously what you want.
I don't need someone around who doesn't trust me.
Don't tell me to calm down, you ignorant bantha!
We'll just see whose head explodes, you ungrateful monkey-lizard!
Drooling Bomarr cast-off!
Gamorrean pig-man!
Don't patronize me.
Well, you had it coming.
Not really. This is still serious.
Maybe a little.
Answer the damn questions, already.
Don't be such a child. It's just a few questions.
Excellent. Soon all your secrets will be mine!
You do know we're on the same side, right?
Are you always this suspicious?
Yes, let's do that.
You haven't heard the last from me on this.
I consider this important.
Are you getting angry again?
Are you getting testy again?
This isn't an interrogation. I never said that.
I just would like to know you better.
Not if you have a problem with it.
Why do I get the impression that you're not serious?
I like the sound of that.
The beautiful part. Keep calling me that.
Carth, are you flirting with me?
Keep addressing me like that and you might lose an ear or two.
How about 'gorgeous'? I like that better.
How about "handsome thug"?
I'll think about it.
I think I'm going to be ill.
Don't hold your breath.
I'd prefer you didn't call me anything. It's demeaning.
How about my name?
Forget it. Let's get back to my questions.
Now that one I like. Call me that from now on.
That's no good, either.
There you go again!
How about "pushy thug"?
How about "sexist worm"?
Sexless marsh-toad!
Brainless, lice-ridden bantha!
Lobotomized Gamorrean!
Ha ha! You are such a pain, you know that?
Maybe not, but I still don't want you calling me that.
What? Don't be ridiculous.
'Beautiful'? Isn't that a little inappropriate?
You're right. I should have tried.
Don't try blaming me for your problems, Carth.
Me? Why am I suddenly at fault?
He was a Sith, Carth, remember?
Wishing won't help matters, will it?
You didn't fail him, Carth. You did your best.
I'm sorry for your loss, Carth.
That seems a lot to expect from me.
Stop trying to put all the blame on me.
I'm sorry, Carth. I wish I could have stopped this.
We're not friends, Carth.
You think I enjoyed it? That's pretty low.
I was an experienced Padawan, surely... but not yet ready to be a full Jedi and certainly not ready to train another. Especially not one so old as my wife.
Not to mention that I had remained a Padawan throughout the war. A formality, perhaps, but with the trial it had to be decided if I was worthy to become a Jedi at all.
They said I had learned wisdom the hard way. For all I had done during the war, they wished to raise me to full Jedi status at long last.
Nope. Never was. Technically I never rose above the rank of Padawan, for various reasons. Does that surprise you?
No I didn't. I may never have become a Jedi technically, but I'm an old Padawan with a lifetime of experience. That applies both to the Force as well as topics like love.
In my case, becoming a Jedi would have been a formality. I doubt the order and I would have gotten along well, considering my opinions on things such as love.
Heh. I suppose I'm not prone to live my life like most of the Jedi Masters do, that's true. My opinions on love are no different.
Not even a Jedi? You mean not any more, right?
Yes. You lied to me.
You seem to have all the abilities of a Jedi...
Not the way you describe your past, no.
Yes, of course. I would never jeopardize our mission. However, if we get the opportunity I would like to visit Tatooine.
Bastila's right. We don't have time for this.
We're on an important mission here, Bastila.
Don't be rude, Bastila.
Never mind.

This kit contains all the necessary parts for a droid to repair itself after being damaged in combat, including electrical regulators designed to isolate malfunctions. This kit can't be used by living beings. Construction kits repair 35 vitality points + INT modifier + (3 x user's skill in Repair).
This unit misdirects opponents by creating 5 holo-projections of the user. A successful attack on one of the projections disrupts energy flow and causes that image to fail.

These gauntlets are quite stiff, minimizing actions that might interfere with the manipulation of volatile materials. The user must have basic knowledge of Demolitions (paid points into the skill) to benefit from this item.

Tensor-mesh stiffens the forearm for steady handling of volatile materials. The insect-like Verpine don't personally use these items, claiming they merely mimic their own exoskeletons. The user must have basic knowledge of Demolitions (paid points into the skill) to benefit from this item.
This implant micromanages the cardiovascular system, effectively increasing the user's constitution faster and further than hard work and exercise might.
This implant boosts the regular energy impulses of the nervous system, sharpening the performance of dexterous action. Inactive users may suffer the odd lingering twitch.
This implant stimulates the brain, effectively increasing the user's capacity for intelligent thought, all at a price cheaper than a trip to the libraries of Coruscant.
This implant releases synthetic versions of the natural stimulants produced by the body, temporarily boosting the user's stamina.
This implant does use relatively experimental nano-technology to speed healing, but relies more on coagulants and solid doses of pain relievers. If you feel better, you are better.
This ocular implant greatly increases visual acuity, allowing the user to better track enemy movement in combat. General awareness will improve as well.
This implant regulates the nervous system, preventing loss of consciousness due to sudden impact or sensory overload.
This implant bolsters the immune system, prompting it to react immediately aggressively toward any virus or bacterium that might have otherwise resulted in a debilitating sickness.
This implant stimulates cardiovascular performance well beyond the user's norm. The Bavakar Medical Research Labs are at the forefront of developmental cybernetics.
Stimulants and energy bursts allow this implant to boost a user's reflexes well beyond normal. The Bavakar Medical Research Labs are at the forefront of developmental cybernetics.
This implant controls a cocktail of synthetic nutrients, encouraging quick thought in the user. The Bavakar Medical Research Labs are at the forefront of developmental cybernetics.
This implant maintains an ever-circulating stream of antitoxins in the user, increasing relevant antidotes for specific poisons introduced. Side effects include dry mouth.

These rods are used to record audio logs. They are popular among researchers and politicians.

These grenades cover the target area in a gooey bio-adhesive that traps anyone caught within the effect. It quickly degrades, allowing allies to soon pass unhindered.
Created initially by Gungis X Weapons, blaster carbine rifles have become very popular in recent years, helped by falling prices due to competition from other companies.
This is a modification on the blaster carbine rarely seen outside of Sith-controlled space.
This blaster rifle variant is one of many fine weapons produced by the factories of Cinnagar in their continued militarizing after the Great Hyperspace War a thousand years ago.
The Zabrak mercenary Jurgan Kalta commissioned this rifle, a weapon he liked to think of as "amusingly destructive."

Special:
Upgradeable, Ranged

This was the weapon of mercenary Jamoh Hogra, and was supposed to protect him against the many enemies he earned in his lifetime. Hogra's skill didn't match its potential, however.
The most common ranged weapon in the galaxy is the basic blaster pistol, firing a bolt of intense coherent light powered by a replaceable power pack.
The Mandalorian Blaster is a slightly more powerful version of the basic pistol common throughout the galaxy.
This is a versatile blaster variant, possibly of ancient Arkanian origin. The Arkanians are very proud that such early efforts continue to be prized among collectors and soldiers.
This blaster is the staple of the Zabrak mercenary, known for deadly accuracy and exceptional damage.

Special:
Upgradeable, Ranged

This blaster belonged to Bendak Starkiller, a duelist legendary on Taris. It is a highly adaptable weapon, and is definitely of better quality than any standard issue pistol.
More powerful than the commonly available pistol, the blaster rifle is favored by soldiers throughout the galaxy. Civilian ownership of these weapons is not generally encouraged.
Despite its effectiveness, these modified blaster rifles are not often employed by the Sith. They prefer to engage their enemies up close and personal.
These weapons are almost overpowered for their size, but the Mandalorians prefer them that way. They do not make a habit of being subtle in their war making.
These weapons are almost beginning to cross the line to light artillery. Armor is generally ineffective against such a weapon, unless it is of the highest quality.

Special:
Upgradeable, Ranged

Jurgan Kalta wanted to make a big noise in the galaxy. If it was the screams of his enemies, all the better. This weapon was his favorite because it shared his adaptability.
The bowcaster is an invention of the Wookiees of Kashyyyk. Also called a laser crossbow, it actually uses a magnetic accelerator to hurl an explosive energy quarrel at its target.

A CryoBan grenade releases a supercooled liquid that freezes on contact, causing intense pain and damage to victims caught in the effect.
Echani Firedancers use the double bladed Ritual Brand in a dodging and slicing pattern so graceful it looks more like a dance than combat.
Twisted by the dark side, the Krath favored weapons of fearsome appearance requiring brute strength to wield, and the blades of this weapon are certainly effective, if not elegant.
Held by the Dark Jedi even before he fell to the dark side, this may be one of the few truly personal items owned by Ajunta Pall, and remains as thoroughly corrupted as he.

These pistols are illegal in many planetary systems, being regarded as too powerful a weapon to be owned by civilians. Disruptors reduce solid matter to its constituent molecules. Unlike typical blasters, disruptors ignore most types of personal energy shields.

A weapon similar to this energy-propelled slug-thrower belonged to Jigger Wraith, a bounty hunter who plagued the Republic years ago. Thirty-seven Mandalorians were executed for being him until sightings declined. As a type of disruptor, this weapon ignores most personal energy shields.

This disruptor is even more destructive than its pistol counterpart, and is outlawed on just as many worlds. Disruptors reduce solid matter to its constituent molecules. Painfully. Unlike typical blasters, disruptors ignore most types of personal energy shields.

Zabrak always command respect, especially with the aid of weapons that are even more damaging than already-outlawed standard disruptors. Unlike typical blasters, disruptors ignore most types of personal energy shields.

Damage: Heat, 36pts
Area of Effect: 4m
Range: Long
Save:
DC15 for half damage

These grenades release a quick burst of an incendiary agent that ignites immediately, damaging all enemies within the area of effect.

Damage: Piercing, 20pts
Area of Effect: 4 meters
Range: Long
Save :
DC15 for half damage

Fragmentation grenades are very basic. They explode when thrown, showering the enemy in shrapnel. It's not elegant, but it's definitely effective.
Sometimes called a "sleeper," the hold out blaster is the preferred method of temporarily incapacitating an enemy.
An unconscious opponent is a quiet opponent. This weapon is a Bothan favorite, designed to "create opportunities."
These weapons are designed to incapacitate so death may be quick or lingered upon as desired. Droids are simply dispatched, as cruelty is best rationed among the living.
For serious espionage, this is the weapon of choice. Simple ownership can get you arrested in some systems, or invited to dine with royalty, depending on what it helped you learn.
This weapon again increases the firepower available to the foot soldier or mercenary, but it is not for the lightly armored who wish to be quick on their feet.
With this weapon, the Mandalorians again demonstrate a complete lack of subtlety. The only thing better than a big blaster, apparently, is one that shoots faster.
These resemble regular blasters in the same way Quoorian marshsuckers resemble mosquitoes. Sure, they both do damage, but the former definitely has the edge in kill-potential.
Arkanian designs of this kind predated mass acceptance of heavier pistols, but 2000 years later they are still superior performers.
The Zabrak killed many pirates who were attempting to seize shipments of these weapons and then sold them on the black market anyway. It's not a matter of where they end up, but of who gets paid.
Mandalorians boast that a shot from one of these pistols can take a starship out of commission. It's an obvious exaggeration, but for safety's sake, most listeners just smile and nod.

Special:
Upgradeable, Ranged

Cassus Fett was rarely seen without this adaptable blaster. Famous for killing the captain of a flagship Republic frigate at the Battle of Jaga's Cluster, he is presumed dead.
Unlike a typical blaster, this weapon fires a stream of energy very damaging to electrical systems, causing havoc on the internal components of droids.
Demonstrating this weapon, the insect-like Verpine destroyed legions of droids, doing nothing to quell the public's suspicions of what testing their stun guns must have been like.

Damage: Ion, 15pts
(45pts vs. droids)
Area of Effect: 4m
Range: Long
Save:
DC15 for half damage

These grenades emit an extremely strong burst of energy devastating to any droids or personal shields caught in the effect.
Any well-stocked militia usually has stores of ion rifles in reserve. They aren't much use against the living, but if the enemy has battle droids these weapons become essential.
Droids can be difficult obstacles for a spy, but these weapons take all the guesswork out of dealing with them while doing nominal damage against organics as well.
While they may have borrowed liberally from designs the Bothans initiated, the Verpine say you can't argue with results. These weapons are simply devastating against droids.
Traditionally associated with the Jedi, the lightsaber is a devastating weapon difficult to master. Properties can vary with the type of focusing crystal used in construction.
Twisted by the dark side, the Krath tempered swords with the power of the Force perhaps even before lightsabers became the weapon of the Jedi, both dark and light.
The mere presence of Dark Lord Naga Sadow would come to imbue his personal weapons with the taint he carried, poisoned as his spirit was.

Damage: Special

Secondary:
Poison, 4 pts every 3 sec
Duration: 30sec
Area of Effect: 4m

This grenade unleashes a blast of poison gas that affects the nervous system, lingering in the air to ensure that the effect is not escaped easily.
The Massassi were a proud race altered by the Sith millennia ago, and subsequently exterminated along with Exar Kun. This weapon was the symbol of a proven warrior.
This may have belonged to a Sand People warrior famous among his kind for killing a young Jedi, but the one tribe that kept the oral history of this event was wiped out long ago.
This weapon allows the user to fire more quickly than usual, increasing his chances of survival without drastically changing the amount of equipment he would normally carry.
The blaster cannon is a favorite among captains wealthy enough to hire experienced, dangerous crews and who might need a way to take them out quick if things go bad.
During the reign of Naga Sadow the Massassi were transformed into foot soldiers for the Sith. This was their traditional weapon, altered, as they were, to serve the dark side.
Attributed to Empress Teta, this blade speaks of her background as a warrior and her willingness to be on the frontline of the Great Hyperspace War a thousand years ago.

Damage: Sonic, 20pts
Secondary:
-6 Dexterity for 30 seconds
Area of Effect: 4m
Range: Long
Save:
DC15 for half damage,
negates dexterity penalty

These grenades explode loudly, but the majority of their effect is delivered in disorienting frequencies the ear can barely perceive, even as it is damaged.
Sometimes referred to as "squealers", these weapons deliver a high-frequency jolt to the senses that can damage and potentially disorient an opponent.
This is an improvement over the standard sonic pistol design that must seem doubly shrill to the large ears of the Bothans.
More powerful than the pistol, the sonic rifle fires a blast of sound that causes a great deal of sensory overload in addition to damage, disorienting the victim.
This was conceived as a "last resort" weapon should espionage fail and a quick retreat be called for. It is effective, but the Bothans would prefer that it not be needed.
The Arkanians pioneered many non-lethal weapons that could disorient opponents, but most were retrofitted to be superior damage dealers as well because the initial demand for them was so low.

A useful tool for espionage, this weapon is more effective than the standard stun baton, but is still available on most worlds. High-density discharge cells make this item unwieldy and unusable in the off-hand.

A very effective device used by Bothan elite. Some systems consider simple possession of one as grounds for execution as a spy. High-density discharge cells make this item unwieldy and unusable in the off-hand.

Special:
Upgradeable, Melee

Weighted to fit a Rakatan grip, this item is most like a stun baton. It seems more adaptable than one of Republic issue, though similar high-density cells make it unwieldy and unusable with weapons in the off-hand.

This type of grenade explodes in a concussive wave of force that disrupts the senses of both organic and inorganic targets in the area of effect.

DC15 for half damage

This Republic device contains a baradium compound that produces a small fusion energy explosion of great force. Civilian possession of these items is outlawed almost everywhere.

Ultrasonic vibrations make this double-bladed sword exceptionally deadly. A rare Echani cortosis weave protects it against lightsaber sparring damage, ensuring effectiveness even against Jedi and Sith. The double-bladed sword is capable of inflicting more damage - but is also less precise - than the single-bladed variant.
Though most favor lightsabers, some Sith prefer the more visceral feel of metal cutting flesh. These blades are usually impregnated with rare cortosis to protect against lightsaber sparring damage.
Excess energy from the generator in this vibrosword is conducted directly through the blades. Also possessing a rare lightsaber-deflecting cortosis weave, this weapon is a deadly Echani masterpiece.

Special:
Upgradeable, Melee

Yusanis was the most famous of Echani warriors, fighting against oppression and villainy until encountering Darth Revan. Discovering that Revan had killed an Echani senator, Yusanis attempted to tell authorities but fell to the powers of the Sith Lord despite his own impressive abilities and the cortosis weave inherent in all Echani vibroblades.

Small size makes this a good off hand weapon. Echani vibroblades use a rare cortosis weave to prevent lightsaber sparring damage, allowing traditional swordplay to continue in the time of Jedi and Sith.

Twisted by the dark side, this Krath weapon is as deadly as a modern vibroblade. It was meant for assassination, and a cortosis weave that prevents lightsaber sparring damage ensured that even Jedi must respect it.

These blades are typically used in the off hand. In addition to a cortosis weave that deflects lightsaber sparring damage, some Echani vibroblades are supercooled to keep them in alignment, giving them an icy sting.

Special:
Upgradeable, Melee

Sanasiki used this weapon to kill Nelinik, a Zabrak who assassinated the Echani High Protector with battle droids. Cortosis protects the blade against lightsaber sparring damage while energy cells disrupt droid opponents.
This was a weapon of distinction in the time of the Krath. Protected against lightsaber sparring damage, Sith would grant these cortosis-laced blades to only the most loyal underlings.
Traced to the Bladeborn, a Sith offshoot dedicated to sword mastery, these cortosis-laced weapons were given to "masterblades" who survived no less than ten lightsaber-wielding warriors in combat.
These swords were crafted to honor Raskta Fenni, the best Echani duelist of her time. Many were sold, but imperfections in the difficult lightsaber-deflecting cortosis weave caused few to survive.

Special:
Upgradeable, Melee

The great Bacca was hunting the Shadowlands ages ago when an alien ship crashed through the forest. He saw that first contact as a warning of the destruction outsiders could bring. Made from the debris, this sword is a reminder for his people that trust must be given cautiously, and only to those who have earned it.

Concerning demolitions, the Bothans prefer well-equipped droids for the task of explosives management, and invest research accordingly. A droid must have basic Demolitions software (paid points into the skill) to benefit from this item.

This basic probe improves a droid's demolitions capabilities, allowing for more sensitive adjustments of volatile substances. A droid must have basic Demolitions software (paid points into the skill) to benefit from this item.

Wartime contracts over the last forty years saw a great deal of money poured into Verpine droid modifications, particularly in the area of demolitions. A droid must have basic Demolitions software (paid points into the skill) to benefit from this item.
Gamorrean Battleaxes, much like their namesake species, are heavy, unsubtle, and generally a very damaging influence in almost any situation.
Though initially they might seem cumbersome, Wookiee Warblades are actually a very efficient design. Kept in continual motion, they can cut a swath through almost anything.

This modular projector can cause a melee weapon to do additional energy-based damage. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and a weapon of high quality marked as upgradeable.

A cell like this can stabilize a melee weapon allowing it to hit and damage better, and possibly gain other effects. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and a weapon of high quality marked as upgradeable.

Mesh underlay can have a variety of effects, depending on the nature of the armor it is applied to. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and armor of high quality marked as upgradeable.

Durasteel reinforcement is a complicated armor application that increases protective qualities. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and armor of high quality marked as upgradeable.

This item can broaden the beam of certain blaster types, increasing damage or possibly granting other effects. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and a weapon of high quality marked as upgradeable.

This unit regulates the firing mechanism of certain blaster types, improving the ability of a skilled user to fire rapidly. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and a weapon of high quality marked as upgradeable.

This cell increases the energy output of certain blaster types, allowing skilled users to better deliver powerful attacks. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and a weapon of high quality marked as upgradeable.

Special:

This scope increases the accuracy of certain blaster types, increasing the user's effectiveness with sniper attacks. The modifications require a workbench with adequate tools and a weapon of high quality marked as upgradeable.

The Star Forge is under assault from the entire Republic fleet! If I don't use my Battle Meditation to turn the tide, Admiral Dodonna's capital ships will destroy the Star Forge.
I have to stay here in the command center so that I can best use my Battle Meditation against our enemy. If I don't the Star Forge will be lost!
You must go to face Malak without me. Find him, kill him and reclaim the title of Dark Lord of the Sith!
That's all for now.
Do you know if anything can be done about all these gizka on board?

I... I idolized her and the stories they told of her. She was everything that I had dreamed a Jedi could be. I still believe she was that way.
